column1: question,result,context
What red wines would you suggest for someone who enjoys a velvety texture and soft tannins?,"
column3: Description

column2: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune)
column3: A smooth wine with a balance between red fruits and soft tannins. A smoky edge mingles with the berry-fruit acidity.
Very rich and smooth in texture, with lots of tannins that are soft, ripe and easy. Offers waves of blackberry, black currant, dark chocolate and caramelized oak flavors.
A Portuguese wine with minty, ripe, velvet textures, smooth and full-bodied. Very polished and classy, with soft acidity, tarry tannins, new wood and plum juice flavors.
Modern, soft and velvety in texture, with hints of Amaretto, soy sauce and pipe tobacco. The mouthfeel is exceptional with bright fruit tones, chewy consistency and long-lasting menthol freshness.
A generous, opulent wine with fine, velvet-smooth tannins, a background dryness that gives structure. Black fruits shine through, enhanced by the spice and toast of the wood aging.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: With the velvet texture typical of the appellation, this smooth wine offers a good balance between the red fruits and soft tannins. A smoky edge mingles with the berry-fruit acidity to give a wine ready to drink from 2018., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 89.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter 2014 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Jean-Luc and Paul Aegerter, Region: Savigny-lès-Beaune, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: US, Description: Very rich and smooth in texture, like pure velvet, this Bordeaux-style blend has lots of tannins that are soft, ripe and easy. It offers extraordinary waves of blackberry, black currant, dark chocolate and caramelized oak flavors. Drink soon for maximum enjoyment., Designation: Synthesis, Points: 93.0, Price: 75.0, Province: California, Title: Martin Ray 2009 Synthesis Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Martin Ray, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Velvety texture underlies dusty tannins and neutral oak in this light and lean wine from a vineyard in the heart of Pinot Noir country. Vanilla and cherry play off each other nicely, finding equal partnership with a buoyant acidity., Designation: Los Amigos Vineyard, Points: 86.0, Price: 28.0, Province: California, Title: Wait Cellars 2014 Los Amigos Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley), Variety: Cabernet Franc, Winery: Wait Cellars, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Cabernet Franc - California, Style2: Cabernet Franc - Russian River Valley, Style3: Cabernet Franc - Russian River Valley Country: Portugal, Description: Inspired by the two halves of the Douro (the other being Ribera del Duero in Spain), this Portuguese wine has minty, ripe, velvet textures, smooth and full-bodied. Very polished and classy, with soft acidity, tarry tannins, new wood and plum juice flavors., Designation: D + D, Points: 91.0, Price: 52.0, Province: Douro, Title: Sogevinus 2006 D + D Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Sogevinus, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: France, Description: 87-89 Smooth, poiished new wood along with sweet, soft tannins. A velvet textured, smoky wine., Designation: Barrel sample, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château la Tour de By 2010 Barrel sample  (Médoc), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château la Tour de By, Region: Médoc, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: Italy, Description: Modern, soft and velvety in texture, Veneroso is a chocolaty Sangiovese-Cab blend with hints of Amaretto, soy sauce and pipe tobacco. The mouthfeel is exceptional with bright fruit tones, chewy consistency and long-lasting menthol freshness., Designation: Veneroso, Points: 91.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Tenuta di Ghizzano 2004 Veneroso Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tenuta di Ghizzano, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Modus delivers velvety aromas of black cherry, chocolate, leather, exotic spice and pipe tobacco. This super Tuscan blend is comprised of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, and it does a very nice job of showing the soft side of those grape varieties, especially on the long finish., Designation: Modus, Points: 91.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Ruffino 2008 Modus Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Ruffino, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: As the name implies, this is a soft wine, with gentle tannins and acids. It's ripe in cherry and blackberry jam flavors that finish simple and sweet., Designation: Liquid Velvet, Points: 84.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Lockwood 2011 Liquid Velvet Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Lockwood, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: France, Description: Velvety textured and full in weight with moderate tannic presence, this wine is powerful while remaining immediately approachable. Black cherry, blueberry, menthol and iris aromas lead into the palate of stewed red berries, pepper and eucalyptus leaves. A lingering finish of muted thin mint closes beautifully., Designation: Cuvée Tradition, Points: 88.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Languedoc-Roussillon, Title: Château Les Palais 2004 Cuvée Tradition Red (Corbières), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Les Palais, Region: Corbières, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Languedoc-Roussillon, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Languedoc-Roussillon, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: Portugal, Description: This is an elegant wine, with balanced fruit and tannins that make for a soft texture. It is rich and laced with fresh, raspberry-like acidity. It can age for another year, but it is also ready to drink., Designation: Estate Bottled Vinho Tinto, Points: 89.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Tejo, Title: Quinta do Casal Monteiro 2009 Estate Bottled Vinho Tinto Red (Tejo), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Quinta do Casal Monteiro, Region: Tejo, Style1: Portuguese Red - Tejo, Style2: Portuguese Red - Tejo, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: Softly tannic, this Bordeaux blend features layers of mocha, blackberries, prunes and sweet oak. It's a rich wine to drink now. Try with a beef stew accented with fruit., Designation: Oonapais, Points: 88.0, Price: 55.0, Province: California, Title: Benziger 2010 Oonapais Red (Sonoma Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Benziger, Region: Sonoma Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma Valley Country: France, Description: A smooth, velvet textured wine. It has some weight, but the balance is what is most attractive about this wine. It has spice, crisp black currant fruits and intense freshness that tips over into final acidity., Designation: Clos des Verdots, Points: 88.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Château les Tours des Verdots 2007 Clos des Verdots Red (Bergerac), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château les Tours des Verdots, Region: Bergerac, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Southwest France, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Southwest France, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: Italy, Description: Here's a delightfully voluptuous and chewy Sangiovese from Montalcino in southern Tuscany that offers lavish layers of succulent cherry, plum, spice and natural rubber. Thick, ripe fruit aromas are elaborated by 15 months of oak aging that adds background dimension and renderings of vanilla, cinnamon and toasted almond. It's a soft, velvety wine with plush consistency and drying tannins that would pair beautifully with tender venison medallions, wild mushroom risotto or meat ragout., Designation: Il Leccio, Points: 88.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Tenuta Oliveto 2005 Il Leccio Sangiovese (Toscana), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Tenuta Oliveto, Region: Toscana, Style1: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style2: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style3: Sangiovese - Italy Country: France, Description: This wine's smooth texture is soft, velvety, needing tannins to give it a sense of shape. As it tastes in the mouth now, it shows pleasant sweet berry flavors and a dense mouthfeel. In the end, it is an easy-drinking, early maturing wine., Designation: Merlot, Points: 85.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Sainte Barbe 2005 Merlot  (Bordeaux), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Château Sainte Barbe, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Merlot - Bordeaux, Style2: Merlot - Bordeaux, Style3: Merlot - France Country: Portugal, Description: Six grapes are in the blend of this generous, opulent wine. It has fine, velvet-smooth tannins, with a background dryness that gives structure. Black fruits shine through, enhanced by the spice and toast of the wood aging. Drink from 2019., Designation: Rubrica Tinto, Points: 95.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Alentejano, Title: Luis Duarte 2014 Rubrica Tinto Red (Alentejano), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Luis Duarte, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style2: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal"

column1: Can you suggest a wine from Germany?,"
column3: Description

column2: Fritz Müller NV Perlwein Trocken Müller-Thurgau (Rheinhessen)
column3: A fun and refreshing lightly sparkling white wine with floral notes and a chalky, earthen tang.
A vibrant Pinot Noir with strawberry and raspberry fruit and slightly herbal nuances.
A sprightly Weissburgunder with crisp white peach and apricot flavor.
A red wine blend delivering black cherry fruit, medium body and soft tannins.
An intensely botrytized wine with dried apricot aromas and orange marmalade flavors.
column9: ,Country: Germany, Description: Delightfully fun and refreshing, this perlwein, or lightly sparkling white, is Germany's answer to Italian prosecco. Made from Müller-Thurgau grapes, it's gorgeously floral, but with a chalky, earthen tang. Sprightly acidity and a fresh, green touch lends vibrance to a moderately long finish., Designation: Perlwein Trocken, Points: 90.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Fritz Müller NV Perlwein Trocken Müller-Thurgau (Rheinhessen), Variety: Müller-Thurgau, Winery: Fritz Müller, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: Müller-Thurgau - Rheinhessen, Style2: Müller-Thurgau - Rheinhessen, Style3: Müller-Thurgau - Germany Country: Germany, Description: A pretty, vibrant Pinot Noir from southern Germany, featuring strawberry and raspberry fruit, some slightly herbal nuances and a bright, lively finish. Drink now–2013., Designation: Trocken, Points: 86.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Württemberg, Title: Grafen Neipperg 2008 Trocken Spätburgunder (Württemberg), Variety: Spätburgunder, Winery: Grafen Neipperg, Region: Württemberg, Style1: Spätburgunder - Württemberg, Style2: Spätburgunder - Württemberg, Style3: Spätburgunder - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Blossomy fresh with a bounty of crisp white peach and apricot flavor, this sprightly Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, is the embodiment of spring. Lively and light-footed, it's an invigorating thirst quencher finishing on a zesty spray of lime and mineral., Designation: Gutswein Trocken, Points: 91.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Wagner-Stempel 2014 Gutswein Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen), Variety: Weissburgunder, Winery: Wagner-Stempel, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: Weissburgunder - Rheinhessen, Style2: Weissburgunder - Rheinhessen, Style3: Weissburgunder - Germany Country: Germany, Description: A good if somewhat generic red wine, blended from Dornfelder, Cabernet Sauvignon and Dunkelfelder. It delivers black cherry fruit, medium body and soft tannins., Designation: Red, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Pfalz, Title: Flying Ace 2006 Red Red (Pfalz), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Flying Ace, Region: Pfalz, Style1: Red Blend - Pfalz, Style2: Red Blend - Pfalz, Style3: Red Blend - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Verging on orange in color, this intensely botrytized wine from one of Germany's unique grape varieties is thick, almost chewy with extract and sugar. Dried apricot aromas lead into orange marmalade flavors with an almost burnt, caramelized quality. Finishes long, with a hint of bitterness that helps balance some of the intense sweetness., Designation: Beerenauslese, Points: 90.0, Price: 47.0, Province: Pfalz, Title: Fitz-Ritter 2006 Beerenauslese Rieslaner (Pfalz), Variety: Rieslaner, Winery: Fitz-Ritter, Region: Pfalz, Style1: Rieslaner - Pfalz, Style2: Rieslaner - Pfalz, Style3: Rieslaner - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Muscat comes through loud and clear, offering up aromas redolent of oranges, citrus blossom and spice. It's light in body and off-dry, with refreshing fruit flavors of oranges and nectarines. This would make a fine summertime picnic wine., Designation: Neipperger Schlossberg Spätlese, Points: 89.0, Price: 34.0, Province: Württemberg, Title: Grafen Neipperg 2007 Neipperger Schlossberg Spätlese Muskateller (Württemberg), Variety: Muskateller, Winery: Grafen Neipperg, Region: Württemberg, Style1: Muskateller - Württemberg, Style2: Muskateller - Württemberg, Style3: Muskateller - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Sunny yellow peaches, apples and nuts perfume this bright lemon-fresh Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc. A whisper of herbs lends savoriness to crisp apple, pear and citrus flavors on the palate. It's a straightforward yet refreshing and elegant wine., Designation: Trocken, Points: 88.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Thörle 2013 Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen), Variety: Weissburgunder, Winery: Thörle, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: Weissburgunder - Rheinhessen, Style2: Weissburgunder - Rheinhessen, Style3: Weissburgunder - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Darker tones of spice and crushed minerals lend complexity to pretty white blossom, lemon and stone fruit flavors. A streak of lime and lemongrass adds refreshment and vibe to the midpalate, leaving the finish brisk and bright., Designation: Schwarzer Adler, Points: 88.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Baden, Title: Franz Keller 2013 Schwarzer Adler Pinot Blanc (Baden), Variety: Pinot Blanc, Winery: Franz Keller, Region: Baden, Style1: Pinot Blanc - Baden, Style2: Pinot Blanc - Baden, Style3: Pinot Blanc - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Intensely peachy from nose to finish, this sprightly semisweet sip offers loads of juicy fruity enjoyment. It's easy going and slightly candied on the palate but finishes crisply., Designation: Weinkellerei Kabinett, Points: 86.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Weinkellerei Kabinett White (Rheinhessen), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Leonard Kreusch, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: White Blend - Rheinhessen, Style2: White Blend - Rheinhessen, Style3: White Blend - Germany Country: Germany, Description: An intensely purple hue and whiffs of vanilla and cherry cola make this ruddy, rich wine stand out in a line-up of German red blends. The palate is unabashedly forward and fruity, with a slightly grapy tone, framed in soft, slightly bitter tannins., Designation: Mettenheimer Rheinhessen Red Estate Bottled, Points: 86.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Schäfer 2013 Mettenheimer Rheinhessen Red Estate Bottled Red (Rheinhessen), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Schäfer, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: Red Blend - Rheinhessen, Style2: Red Blend - Rheinhessen, Style3: Red Blend - Germany Country: Germany, Description: A surprising whiff of black currant on the nose of this elegant white points to Scheurebe—one of Germany's lesser-known grapes. Wittmann's version is particularly poised, offering loads of peach and grapefruit flavors, sharply contrasted by zesty lime and mineral tones. The finish is long and sleek, touched by a hint of bee pollen., Designation: Trocken, Points: 91.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Wittmann 2015 Trocken Scheurebe (Rheinhessen), Variety: Scheurebe, Winery: Wittmann, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: Scheurebe - Rheinhessen, Style2: Scheurebe - Rheinhessen, Style3: Scheurebe - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Offering buoyantly fresh fruit and mineral intensity, this Pinot Noir rosé is well worth finding in quantity to enjoy year-round, not just as a summer quaffer. Zesty acidity and a light, finely textured body are amplified by plump, fresh raspberry and peach flavors. Its briskly mineral finish is exhilarating., Designation: Schwarzer Adler, Points: 91.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Baden, Title: Franz Keller 2015 Schwarzer Adler Rosé (Baden), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Franz Keller, Region: Baden, Style1: Rosé - Baden, Style2: Rosé - Baden, Style3: Rosé - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Hints of summer strawberry and peach show prominently in this medium-sweet white blend. It's a touch confected in sweetness, but light bodied and easy drinking. The finish is brisk., Designation: Weinkellerei Auslese, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Leonard Kreusch 2016 Weinkellerei Auslese White (Rheinhessen), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Leonard Kreusch, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: White Blend - Rheinhessen, Style2: White Blend - Rheinhessen, Style3: White Blend - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Weissburgunder, or Pinot Blanc, can be a rather subdued grape. But it's delightfully bright and zippy here, boasting sunny shades of apricot, grapefruit and tangerine offset against dazzling lemon-lime acidity. It's brisk and cutting on the palate yet finishes with persistence., Designation: Trocken, Points: 92.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Thörle 2016 Trocken Weissburgunder (Rheinhessen), Variety: Weissburgunder, Winery: Thörle, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: Weissburgunder - Rheinhessen, Style2: Weissburgunder - Rheinhessen, Style3: Weissburgunder - Germany Country: Germany, Description: Delicate aromas of crisp green apples, pear and white peach abound on this lean but concentrated Pinot Gris. Dry and spry, the palate is honed on minerality and refreshment. Enjoy now for its vitality and youth., Designation: Schwarzer Adler, Points: 89.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Baden, Title: Franz Keller 2014 Schwarzer Adler Pinot Gris (Baden), Variety: Pinot Gris, Winery: Franz Keller, Region: Baden, Style1: Pinot Gris - Baden, Style2: Pinot Gris - Baden, Style3: Pinot Gris - Germany"

column1: I enjoy bold flavors, could you recommend a robust red wine?,"
column3: Description
A good, robust red wine with tobacco, cherry and spice flavors. Pairs well with tacos and burgers.

column2: Longoria 2007 Blues Cuvée Red (Santa Barbara County)
column3: A robust Bordeaux blend with berries, cherries, currants, leather and herbs. Pairs well with steak.
A robust and stylish choice with muscular spice, deep red berry and blackberry.

column2: Col d'Orcia 2010 Poggio al Vento Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino)
column3: A robust red with aromas of underbrush, scorched earth, truffle, grilled herb and a balsamic note.
A bold, powerful wine, showing smooth, mature black-fruit flavors and rich tannins.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Here's a good, robust red wine. It's made in a country-style, with tobacco, cherry and spice flavors and a jagged mouthfeel. Drink it with tacos and burgers., Designation: 4 Grape Blend, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Rare NV 4 Grape Blend Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Rare, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: Fire up the grill, or pan fry a juicy steak to eat with this robust red wine, a Bordeaux blend with 24% Syrah. It's bone dry and tannic and juicy in berries, cherries, currants, leather and herbs, and while it's an easy sipper, the structure was harder to achieve than you might think., Designation: Blues Cuvée, Points: 87.0, Price: 28.0, Province: California, Title: Longoria 2007 Blues Cuvée Red (Santa Barbara County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Longoria, Region: Santa Barbara, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Santa Barbara, Style3: Red Blend - Santa Barbara Country: US, Description: Robust and country-style, this is a nice wine for barbecue and beef stews. Very dry and tannic, it shows harmonious flavors of blackberries, currants and wild nettles. Buy this young wine for your full-bodied house red., Designation: Saxy, Points: 87.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: R & B Cellars 2006 Saxy Syrah (North Coast), Variety: Syrah, Winery: R & B Cellars, Region: North Coast, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - North Coast, Style3: Syrah - North Coast Country: South Africa, Description: Muscular spice, deep red berry and blackberry and sturdy tannins give this strength and elegance. The fruit is assertive and delicious, the mouthfeel fresh and the finish lingering. Could use a few years of aging for extra character, but today, a robust and stylish choice., Designation: Estate, Points: 90.0, Price: 27.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Rust en Vrede 2004 Estate Shiraz (Stellenbosch), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Rust en Vrede, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Shiraz - Stellenbosch, Style2: Shiraz - Stellenbosch, Style3: Shiraz - South Africa Country: US, Description: A robust, spicy wine that offers lots of bang for the buck. The flavors range from lush raspberries and red cherries up through blackberries and currants, veering into mocha, and there's lots of crushed black pepper. Easy to like with steak, lamb, Mexican food., Designation: The Slammer, Points: 88.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Big House 2008 The Slammer Syrah (Central Coast), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Big House, Region: Central Coast, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - Central Coast, Style3: Syrah - Central Coast Country: Italy, Description: You'll find aromas suggesting underbrush, scorched earth, truffle, grilled herb and a balsamic note on this robust red. The brawny palate evokes dried black cherry, prune, licorice and tobacco alongside chewy tannins and the heat of evident alcohol. Let the muscular tannins unwind for a few more years then drink sooner rather than later to capture the remaining fruit., Designation: Poggio al Vento Riserva, Points: 90.0, Price: 150.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Col d'Orcia 2010 Poggio al Vento Riserva  (Brunello di Montalcino), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Col d'Orcia, Region: Brunello di Montalcino, Style1: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style2: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style3: Sangiovese - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Appropriately named “Passion,” this hearty red wine expresses itself with opulence and generosity. Bold fruit layers of blackberry and cherry liqueur are framed by spice and chewy pipe tobacco. There's a ripe, syrupy feel in the mouth, with loads of jammy fruit on the close., Designation: Passione, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Vigne & Vini 2008 Passione  (Primitivo del Salento), Variety: Primitivo, Winery: Vigne & Vini, Region: Primitivo del Salento, Style1: Primitivo - Southern Italy, Style2: Primitivo - Southern Italy, Style3: Primitivo - Italy Country: US, Description: Bold and full bodied, packed with ripe blackberry, dark chocolate and spice flavors, this wine is also mouth-coating due to fine, soft tannins and a hint of sweetness. It will be fun for people who enjoy drama in their wine, but needs to be tamed by a juicy steak or the equivalent., Designation: Roadside, Points: 89.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Victor Vineyards 2013 Roadside Red (Lodi), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Victor Vineyards, Region: Lodi, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Lodi, Style3: Red Blend - Lodi Country: US, Description: Hints of spice and leather add a savory tone to red cherry and plum flavors in this bold but elegantly structured red wine. The palate is juicy with fruit, but accented with a spray of green herbs and brisk acidity that lend freshness., Designation: Jubilant Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 45.0, Province: New York, Title: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Jamesport, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: US, Description: Boldly flavored and slightly sweet, this blend of mostly Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon smells jammy, tastes ripe and juicy and has a fairly smooth texture with a touch of tannin. The flavors resemble black berry and sweet red cherry, the body is full and the finish is fruity., Designation: Wisdom of Wise, Points: 85.0, Price: 32.0, Province: California, Title: Wise Villa 2013 Wisdom of Wise Red (Placer County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Wise Villa, Region: Placer, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Placer, Style3: Red Blend - Placer Country: US, Description: Bold, concentrated and spiced with some new oak aromas, this shows opulent fruit flavors. It looks dark, smells ripe, and feels broad textured and full bodied. It is generously proportioned and easy to drink., Designation: Round Up Red, Points: 86.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Helwig 2012 Round Up Red Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Helwig, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: Portugal, Description: A bold, powerful wine, showing smooth, mature black-fruit flavors and rich tannins. It is soft, solid and powerfully built. Wood aging has given extra roundness and a touch of spice to the palate. Drink this wine now and until 2018., Designation: Reserva, Points: 91.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Alentejo, Title: Herdade dos Machados 2007 Reserva Red (Alentejo), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Herdade dos Machados, Region: Alentejo, Style1: Portuguese Red - Alentejo, Style2: Portuguese Red - Alentejo, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Spain, Description: Lusty aromas of black cherry and blackberry are powerful. Likewise, this Tempranillo from just outside the Ribera del Duero district tastes bullish, with blackberry, currant, mocha and rich oak flavors. Robust berry fruit along with spice and chocolate are the lead flavors on a strong, dense finish. This has the potential to age nicely for seven to 15 years. Drink through 2030., Designation: VS, Points: 96.0, Price: 100.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Mauro 2011 VS Tempranillo (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Mauro, Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla y León, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: US, Description: Not quite as bold as its name suggests, this wine is well-balanced and fun to sip. Fruity and medium-bodied, it smells like raspberries and rhubarb, tastes like red cherries and feels nicely full on the palate, bolstered by a hearty dose of fine tannins., Designation: Anthony's Hill Dark Bold, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: Fetzer NV Anthony's Hill Dark Bold Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Fetzer, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: Not at all shy, this bold, brash wine will be great to drink with equally bold food. A very dark color and a tempting aroma like grilled baguette slices leads to big, powerful berry flavors, full body, high alcohol, thick but soft tannins and a smoky, meaty finish., Designation: Farrah Grand Reserve, Points: 92.0, Price: 65.0, Province: California, Title: Klinker Brick 2013 Farrah Grand Reserve Syrah (Lodi), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Klinker Brick, Region: Lodi, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - Lodi, Style3: Syrah - Lodi"

column1: Can you suggest a red wine that's rich with blackberry or plum flavors?,"
column3: Description
A blend of mostly Malbec and Syrah, medium in body and somewhat juicy. Blackberry, plum and peppery flavors finish chocolaty and lightly herbal.
Voluptuous blackberry and plum flavors are edged by hints of bitter coffee and spice in this richly bodied wine.
Dense and saturated, with crushed blackberry and plum aromas that turn more jammy and granular as the wine breathes.
Ripe, rich blackberry and plum notes abound from nose to finish in this bold, deeply concentrated wine.

column2: Alto Moncayo 2011 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
column3: Full-bodied, ripe wine offers blackberry and spiced plum aromas on top of a minerally base.
column9: ,Country: Argentina, Description: Grapy aromas of black plum and blackberry are balsamic and a bit herbal. This blend of mostly Malbec and Syrah is medium in body and somewhat juicy. Blackberry, plum and peppery flavors finish chocolaty and lightly herbal., Designation: Gaia, Points: 88.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Domaine Bousquet 2014 Gaia Red (Tupungato), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Domaine Bousquet, Region: Tupungato, Style1: Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style2: Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style3: Red Blend - Argentina Country: US, Description: Lusty and robust, this Cab, Merlot and Syrah blend combines peppery, briary flavors with riper fruit notes of blackberries and plums. The texture is especially appealing, with its rich, complex tannins, from both the grapes and from oak. Good job in a dry red wine at a fair price., Designation: The Other, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Peirano 2006 The Other Red (Lodi), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Peirano, Region: Lodi, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Lodi, Style3: Red Blend - Lodi Country: Portugal, Description: Dark black fruits and a dense, almost black color are signs of the concentration of this concentrated wine. Nine months in wood have added to the richness of the wine while preserving the blackberry and black-plum flavors. It is just ready to drink, although it will be much better from 2017., Designation: Cabriz Reserva, Points: 91.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Dão, Title: Global Wines 2012 Cabriz Reserva Red (Dão), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Global Wines, Region: Dão, Style1: Portuguese Red - Dão, Style2: Portuguese Red - Dão, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: Voluptuous blackberry and plum flavors are edged by hints of bitter coffee and spice in this richly bodied wine. Fringed by a bare feather of tannins, it's luscious in mouthfeel, with an unctuousness that persists luxuriously on the palate., Designation: Caya, Points: 89.0, Price: 35.0, Province: New York, Title: Wölffer 2013 Caya Cabernet Franc (Long Island), Variety: Cabernet Franc, Winery: Wölffer, Region: Long Island, Style1: Cabernet Franc - New York, Style2: Cabernet Franc - New York, Style3: Cabernet Franc - New York Country: Spain, Description: This is dense and saturated, with crushed blackberry and plum aromas that turn more jammy and granular as the wine breathes. It's extracted and heavy on the palate, with candied black plum and berry flavors that lose steam on the finish. This could be too heavy for fans of leaner-bodied wines., Designation: Vespres, Points: 87.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Celler Dosterras 2009 Vespres Red (Montsant), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Celler Dosterras, Region: Montsant, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Ripe, rich blackberry and plum notes abound from nose to finish in this bold, deeply concentrated wine. The palate is velvety in texture, edged by a fine, chalky frame of tannins and lively cranberry acidity. Hints of pepper, dried herb and lavender lend nuance to a long finish., Designation: Lambardo, Points: 90.0, Price: 35.0, Province: New York, Title: Wölffer 2013 Lambardo Merlot (Long Island), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Wölffer, Region: Long Island, Style1: Merlot - New York, Style2: Merlot - New York, Style3: Merlot - New York Country: US, Description: Rich in plum, black cherry and blackberry, this wine is subtle in cinnamon and dried herb, with additional embellishments of leather and earth. Soft and subdued, it's approachable and versatile., Designation: Reserve, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Frei Brothers 2013 Reserve Merlot (Dry Creek Valley), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Frei Brothers, Region: Dry Creek Valley, Style1: Merlot - California, Style2: Merlot - Dry Creek Valley, Style3: Merlot - Dry Creek Valley Country: Spain, Description: This full-bodied, ripe wine  offers blackberry and spiced plum aromas on top of a minerally base. In the mouth, it's big but fresh and free-flowing. Flavors of black plum and black cherry are lively despite some creamy oak that rises on the finish. Drink through 2016., Designation: Veraton, Points: 92.0, Price: 27.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Alto Moncayo 2011 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja), Variety: Garnacha, Winery: Alto Moncayo, Region: Campo de Borja, Style1: Garnacha - Northern Spain, Style2: Garnacha - Northern Spain, Style3: Garnacha - Spain Country: US, Description: A can't-miss Cabernet with a rich nose of blackberry, plum, coffee and oak. It's so dense that the cassis, wood, and coffee flavors come across as being tarry. The smooth, stylish finish is packed full of woodiness, licorice and fine tannins. Simply put, it's full of style and a whole lot of fun to drink., Designation: Monte Rosso Vyd, Points: 93.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Louis M. Martini 1997 Monte Rosso Vyd Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Louis M. Martini, Region: Sonoma Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Sonoma Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Sonoma Valley Country: Chile, Description: Dark in color, with aromas of raisin, cassis, cough medicine and baked plum. More of a sweet, stocky style of Cab than your average linear, textbook version; but the blackberry and plum flavors, while chunky, are warm and well assembled. Richer than your average value-priced Cab, so drink now., Designation: Reserva, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Colchagua Valley, Title: Chilensis 2007 Reserva Cabernet Sauvignon (Colchagua Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Chilensis, Region: Colchagua Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Colchagua Valley, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Colchagua Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Chile Country: US, Description: Textbook Napa Petite Sirah—rich, smooth and insanely delicious. Chocolate blackberry jam, spiced plum pudding and toasty oak flavors, are wrapped into thick, velvety tannins. What a great summer barbecue wine, or with mid-winter short ribs of beef. Terrific now, and will age for a decade or more., Designation: S&J Vineyard Reserve, Points: 93.0, Price: 65.0, Province: California, Title: Frank Family 2010 S&J Vineyard Reserve Petite Sirah (Napa Valley), Variety: Petite Sirah, Winery: Frank Family, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Petite Sirah - California, Style2: Petite Sirah - Napa Valley, Style3: Petite Sirah - Napa Valley Country: South Africa, Description: Winemaker: Gary Jordan. This is rich and ripe from the start, with intense aromas of cassis, black plum and berry that mingle with notes of charred meat, bacon and cigar box. Thick and mouthfilling but not overdone, it offers structured but ripe tannins and dense black-fruit flavors that are graced with hits of espresso and bittersweet chocolate on the finish. It's approachable now, but should age well through 2023., Designation: Cape Winemakers Guild Sophia, Points: 90.0, Price: unknown, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Jordan Stellenbosch 2013 Cape Winemakers Guild Sophia Red (Stellenbosch), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Jordan Stellenbosch, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: Spain, Description: This young, massive Rioja smells of raspberry, plum, char and tar. The mouthfeel is chunky, rich and deep, with manageable tannins. Blackberry, mocha, char, clove and chocolate flavors announce generous oak, while the finish is spicy, peppery, toasty and ripe. Drink 2018–2034., Designation: Macán, Points: 94.0, Price: 90.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA 2012 Macán  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Benjamin de Rothschild & Vega Sicilia SA, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: US, Description: Dark toast and graphite contrast cheerful red-plum and cherry aromas on the nose. The palate is ripe with blackberry and plum flavors, but a tad lean in concentration. Hints of green herb, bramble and bright, zippy acidity lead to an elegant finish., Designation: Red, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: New York, Title: Suhru 2008 Red Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Suhru, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: Chile, Description: Heavy, raisiny, ripe aromas of prune and earthy blackberry set up a chewy, oaky, mildly tannic palate that's fully stuffed with woody, baked, almost malty flavors of blackberry, chocolate and toast. This is a rich, ripe number, with a loamy, toasty finish that shows black licorice and jammy cassis flavors. Drink through 2018., Designation: VSC, Points: 91.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Cachapoal Valley, Title: Santa Carolina 2011 VSC Red (Cachapoal Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Santa Carolina, Region: Cachapoal Valley, Style1: Red Blend - Cachapoal Valley, Style2: Red Blend - Cachapoal Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Chile"

column1: What's a good white wine with a luscious mouthfeel and a touch of sweetness?,"
column3: Description
A fragrant white wine with honey, white flower and stone fruit aromas. Creamy and rich mouthfeel with a touch of sweetness on the finish.
Full-bodied and plush-textured wine with honey, peach and almond flavors. A hint of sweetness to round out the mouthfeel.
A decadent wine with expressive aromas of apricot purée, tea and baking spice, plus a drizzle of caramel. Opulent and weighty, with a wash of zesty acidity and a zing of tangerine on the finish.
A luscious sweet wine, very honeyed and liquorous. Intense acidity that is the hallmark of Loire sweet wines.

A tasty, sweet and sour blend of Chardonnay, Riesling, Viognier and Pinot Gris, with bountiful fruit flavors of peach and pear. A big, forward, generous, though ultimately simple, white wine, with more than a touch of sweetness.
column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: Made with biodynamically grown Moscato grapes, this fragrant white wine opens with honey, white flower and stone fruit aromas. The mouthfeel is creamy and rich, with a touch of sweetness on the finish., Designation: Jalal, Points: 87.0, Price: 42.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Cefalicchio 2011 Jalal Moscato (Puglia), Variety: Moscato, Winery: Cefalicchio, Region: Puglia, Style1: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style2: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style3: Moscato - Italy Country: US, Description: While the aroma is a touch earthy, the flavors in this full-bodied and plush-textured wine resemble honey, peach and almond. With a hint of sweetness to round out the mouthfeel, this could be a good match for a wide variety of cheeses., Designation: Mamma Mia, Points: 85.0, Price: 23.0, Province: California, Title: Naggiar 2014 Mamma Mia White (Sierra Foothills), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Naggiar, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Sierra Foothills, Style3: White Blend - Sierra Foothills Country: US, Description: To make this luscious wine, Muscat Ottonel and the hybrid Vidal Blanc are air dried on open racks, causing the grapes to raisin, concentrating their sugars. The result is a decadent wine with expressive aromas of apricot purée, tea and baking spice, plus a drizzle of caramel. It feels opulent and weighty, with a wash of zesty acidity and a zing of tangerine on the finish., Designation: Malvaxia Passito, Points: 89.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Barboursville Vineyards 2007 Malvaxia Passito White (Virginia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Barboursville Vineyards, Region: Virginia, Style1: White Blend - Virginia, Style2: White Blend - Virginia, Style3: White Blend - Virginia Country: France, Description: A luscious sweet wine, very honeyed and liquorous. As a complete contrast, the wine has that intense acidity that is the hallmark of Loire sweet wines. The combination is a fragrant nectar that will benefit from aging., Designation: Réserve Personelle, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Château Gaudrelle 2009 Réserve Personelle  (Vouvray), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: Château Gaudrelle, Region: Vouvray, Style1: Chenin Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Chenin Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Chenin Blanc - France Country: US, Description: A tasty, sweet and sour blend of Chardonnay, Riesling, Viognier and Pinot Gris, this has bountiful fruit flavors of peach and pear. This dry white has creamy wood, spice and apricot flavors, making a delicious ripe wine, even with a touch of sweetness to the finish., Designation: Ygrec, Points: 91.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château d'Yquem 2006 Ygrec  (Bordeaux Blanc), Variety: Bordeaux-style White Blend, Winery: Château d'Yquem, Region: Bordeaux Blanc, Style1: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style White Blend - France Country: US, Description: Lush and full in texture, this wine has more spicy flavors than fruity ones, as a blend of vanilla, hazelnut and cream coat the palate. It has the rich feel of barrel fermentation and will win friends with the layering of subtleties on such a decadent mouthfeel., Designation: CA 4, Points: 92.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Locations NV CA 4 White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Locations, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: US, Description: Overtly sweet, like a sugary donut with pineapple cream and vanilla filling. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier., Designation: The Other, Points: 81.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: Peirano 2007 The Other White (Lodi), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Peirano, Region: Lodi, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Lodi, Style3: White Blend - Lodi Country: Italy, Description: Here is a quintessentially luminous and fragrant white wine from southern Italy (made with 100% Chardonnay, two thirds of which was aged in oak) that delivers food-friendly appeal, succulence and a sophisticated approach. The wine is thick and luscious on the palate and offers slightly sweet flavors of exotic fruit, mango and papaya., Designation: Grand Cru, Points: 88.0, Price: 38.0, Province: Sicily & Sardinia, Title: Tenuta Rapitalà 2006 Grand Cru Chardonnay (Sicilia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Tenuta Rapitalà, Region: Sicilia, Style1: Chardonnay - Sicily & Sardinia, Style2: Chardonnay - Sicily & Sardinia, Style3: Chardonnay - Italy Country: Spain, Description: After a waxy opening, the bouquet unveils honey and peach aromas that are totally inviting. It feels thick but not cloying, and the honeyed flavors of banana, peach and dulce de leche are a prelude to the creamy, thick and deeply layered finish. Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Albariño make the blend., Designation: Caligo Sweet White Wine, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Spain Other, Title: D.G. Viticultors NV Caligo Sweet White Wine White (Spain), Variety: White Blend, Winery: D.G. Viticultors, Region: Spain, Style1: White Blend - Spain Other, Style2: White Blend - Spain Other, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Italy, Description: This is a delightful white wine that opens with compelling aromas of peach, honeydew melon and Golden delicious apple. column1: What's a fruity red wine?,"
column3: Description
Enjoyable, informal red with fruity flavors of juicy red cherry and crushed raspberry. Fresh and easy drinking.

column2: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Tinto Red (Tejo)
column3: Fruity wine with juicy red fruits and a balance of light, dry tannins. Shows some earthy barnyard character.
Fresh and fruity, this simple red offers wild cherry, crushed raspberry and strawberry.
Fruity young wine with touches of weight and darkness but mostly simple, fresh, lightly candied berry aromas and flavors.
Fruity like grape jam and blackberry syrup, this is a rich, almost-sweet wine.
column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: This enjoyable, informal red delivers fruity flavors of juicy red cherry and crushed raspberry. Wait until 2019., Designation: Cuvée Prestige, Points: 87.0, Price: 32.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Tayet 2015 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Tayet, Region: Bordeaux Supérieur, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: This bold, fruity wine is all red berries and ripe cherry flavors. A bright wine, with great acidity at the end., Designation: Cuvée Tradition, Points: 88.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château de Lisennes 2011 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château de Lisennes, Region: Bordeaux Supérieur, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France"

column1: Are there any white wines with a strong presence of pear or apple flavors?,"
column3: Description

column2: Wind Rose 2015 Dry White Wine Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)
column3: Aromas of apple and pear are followed by dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors.
Pear and apple aromas with oak, toast, lemon, apple and spice flavors.
Ripe pear and tart apple with notes of dried peach and fresh apricot.
Full of apple and pear fruit with a touch of citrus.

column2: Tarara 2008 Charval White Table Wine White (Virginia)
column3: Apples and pears dominate the nose and palate of this blend.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Aromas of apple and pear are followed by dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors, dipping a bit in the middle before coming back together., Designation: Dry White Wine, Points: 88.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Washington, Title: Wind Rose 2015 Dry White Wine Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: Wind Rose, Region: Yakima Valley, Style1: Pinot Grigio - Washington, Style2: Pinot Grigio - Washington, Style3: Pinot Grigio - Washington Country: Spain, Description: Under control on the bouquet, this has pear and apple aromas. The wine feels round, juicy and pure, with oak, toast, lemon, apple and spice flavors. Barrel influence creates a peppery, dry and spicy finish, and overall this blend of Viura and Malvasia is on the money. Drink now., Designation: Allende, Points: 89.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Finca Allende 2010 Allende White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Finca Allende, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: France, Description: A high-toned pitch of ripe pear and tart apple is like a clarion call. Residual sweetness on the palate mollifies that distinct, primal acidity, lending life to notes of dried peach and fresh apricot. Layers of flavor shimmer and shift, with apple notes that last and last., Designation: Rotenberg, Points: 94.0, Price: 54.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Marcel Deiss 2011 Rotenberg White (Alsace), Variety: Alsace white blend, Winery: Domaine Marcel Deiss, Region: Alsace, Style1: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style2: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style3: Alsace white blend - France Country: Portugal, Description: This ripe wine is full of apple and pear fruit with a touch of citrus. It is full, the acidity just pointing up the richness. There are almond flavors as well as spice from the wood aging. Drink from 2018., Designation: Premium, Points: 86.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Douro, Title: Adega Vila Real 2016 Premium White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Adega Vila Real, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Hungary, Description: Concentrated apple and pear flavors are flecked with notes of honey and tangerine skin on this dry blend of traditional Tokaji and international grapes. There's a trace vein of green, vegetal notes, but it's refreshing and easy drinking., Designation: Cuvée 113, Points: 85.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Tokaj, Title: Sauska 2010 Cuvée 113 White (Tokaj), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Sauska, Region: Tokaj, Style1: White Blend - Tokaj, Style2: White Blend - Tokaj, Style3: White Blend - Hungary Country: Portugal, Description: Apple flavors dominate this attractive blend of seven grapes, including three aromatic varieties, that give the wine its perfumed character. So although it is young and with enough acidity, it is the hints of lychee and peppered pear that add interest to the wine. Drink now., Designation: Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: DFJ Vinhos 2016 Portada Winemaker's Selection Branco White (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: DFJ Vinhos, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: Falanghina  and Coda di Volpe are blended to produce a rich and creamy white with apple, pear and stone fruit. It only sees stainless steel and this helps maintain its fresh fruit flavors., Designation: Clarum, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: I Capitani 2011 Clarum White (Irpinia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: I Capitani, Region: Irpinia, Style1: White Blend - Southern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Southern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: This lightly perfumed wine is crisp and clear. Apple and pear flavors are attractively packaged in fresh acidity and an orange-peel tang. The wine is still young, with its tight aftertaste, so wait until later in 2015 to drink., Designation: Palha Canas, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: Casa Santos Lima 2013 Palha Canas White (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Casa Santos Lima, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Greece, Description: Apple, orange and pear aromas lead this distinctive white blend. On the palate, the wine has an appealing balance of chalkiness paired with exotic fruits. The finish offers complexity with a wash of lively acidity., Designation: Lefkos, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Atalanti Valley, Title: Hatzimichalis 2012 Lefkos White (Atalanti Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Hatzimichalis, Region: Atalanti Valley, Style1: White Blend - Atalanti Valley, Style2: White Blend - Atalanti Valley, Style3: White Blend - Greece Country: US, Description: Apples and pears dominate the nose and palate of this blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris. Full bodied and fermented in stainless steel, this slightly off-dry wine is rich in texture, but stays fresh with a vibrant lemon-lime acidity., Designation: Charval White Table Wine, Points: 85.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Tarara 2008 Charval White Table Wine White (Virginia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Tarara, Region: Virginia, Style1: White Blend - Virginia, Style2: White Blend - Virginia, Style3: White Blend - Virginia Country: Portugal, Description: A rounded wine, this gives pleasure with its pear and ripe apple flavors. Lightly touched with acidity, this has a soft finish., Designation: Point West, Points: 84.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Point West White (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: DFJ Vinhos, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: US, Description: This blend of Pinot Grigio, Tocai Friuliano and Pinot Blanc from three different vineyards made by winemaker Doug Margerum shows brilliantly juicy aromas of pressed pear, dried apples, apple blossoms and cantaloupe. Poached pears and boiled apples come with the sip, which allures with just a touch of sugariness., Designation: Bianco, Points: 91.0, Price: 32.0, Province: California, Title: Cent'Anni 2012 Bianco White (Santa Ynez Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Cent'Anni, Region: Santa Ynez Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Santa Ynez Valley, Style3: White Blend - Santa Ynez Valley Country: Portugal, Description: Crisp, round and spicy, this has dominating flavors of apples and pears. A green plum flavor and pure acidity complement the finish., Designation: Branco, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Alentejano, Title: Fitapreta Vinhos 2010 Branco White (Alentejano), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Fitapreta Vinhos, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Portuguese White - Alentejano, Style2: Portuguese White - Alentejano, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: France, Description: Tender notions of ripe pear make for an enticing nose. The palate has apple freshness and a rounded earthy aspect, despite its lightness. Drink soon., Designation: Les Natures, Points: 88.0, Price: 21.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Jean-Baptiste Adam 2015 Les Natures Pinot Blanc (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Blanc, Winery: Jean-Baptiste Adam, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Blanc - France Country: Portugal, Description: The blend of Fernão Pires and Arinto produces a rich and creamy wine with pear, ripe apple and apricot flavors. A floral character gives extra piquancy., Designation: Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Branco, Points: 87.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Tejo, Title: Wines & Winemakers 2010 Companhia das Lezírias Catapereiro Branco White (Tejo), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Wines & Winemakers, Region: Tejo, Style1: Portuguese White - Tejo, Style2: Portuguese White - Tejo, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal"

column1: I'm interested in a wine from the Barossa Valley region.,"
column3: Description

column2: Barossa Valley Estate 2002 Spires Chardonnay (Barossa Valley)
column3: Zippy citrus note with underlying aroma of cracker, or flour. A little creaminess rounds out the nose.
Medium-bodied Shiraz with vanilla, plum and black olive aromas and flavors, supple tannins and a lingering mocha finish.

column2: Hamilton's Ewell Vineyard 2000 Railway Chardonnay (Barossa Valley)
column3: Heavy, sweet fruit flavors with melon, guava and honey aromas.

column2: Grant Burge 2000 Barossa Vines Shiraz (Barossa Valley)
column3: Packed with grapey, plummy fruit, smoke and vanilla. Balanced and suitable for by-the-glass option or barbecue companion.
Offers layers of blueberry and blackberry fruit intermingled elegantly with hints of French vanilla. Long, subtle and complex on the finish.
column9: ,Country: Australia, Description: There's a zippy citrus note on the nose, though the underlying aroma is of cracker, or flour; the citrusy streak resurfaces on the palate and carries through to the finish. A little creaminess rounds out the nose. Quite a value for Barossa Chardonnay., Designation: Spires, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Barossa Valley Estate 2002 Spires Chardonnay (Barossa Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Barossa Valley Estate, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - South Australia, Style2: Chardonnay - South Australia, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: This medium-bodied Shiraz represents a solid value. Sourced from 80 growers, it's meant to present a “portrait” of the Barossa region, and it delivers vanilla, plum and black olive aromas and flavors, supple tannins and a lingering mocha finish., Designation: Portrait, Points: 89.0, Price: 16.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Peter Lehmann 2014 Portrait Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Peter Lehmann, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: The warm climate of the Barossa is reflected in the heavy, sweet fruit flavors. The melon, guava and honey aromas and flavors lack zip and definition but certainly don't lack for ripeness., Designation: Railway, Points: 83.0, Price: 13.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Hamilton's Ewell Vineyard 2000 Railway Chardonnay (Barossa Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Hamilton's Ewell Vineyard, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - South Australia, Style2: Chardonnay - South Australia, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Packed with grapey, plummy fruit, smoke and vanilla, this is solid entry-level stuff. It's not particularly rich or concentrated, but it is something that's uncommon at this price: balanced. That makes it an attractive by-the-glass option or barbecue companion. —J.C., Designation: Barossa Vines, Points: 85.0, Price: 11.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Grant Burge 2000 Barossa Vines Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Grant Burge, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: RWT (unromantically derived from “Red Wine Trial”) is 100% Barossa Valley Shiraz, aged in 100% French oak. In some vintages, like this one, the combination is incredibly sumptuous, offering layers of blueberry and blackberry fruit intermingled elegantly with hints of French vanilla. It's long, subtle and complex on the finish—a stunning effort. It's approachable now, but should age well through 2030 or so., Designation: RWT, Points: 96.0, Price: 150.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Penfolds 2009 RWT Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Penfolds, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Old-vine Shiraz from the valley floor imparts great richness and a creamy texture to this wine's tannins, framed easily by hints of vanilla. Yet it's not a simple fruit-and-oak concoction—with time in the glass it steadily unfurls to reveal herbal and spice complexities. Marries power and elegance;  drink now–2015., Designation: The Factor, Points: 92.0, Price: 105.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Torbreck 2006 The Factor Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Torbreck, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: This has gone up in price over the years, but it's still a solid, relatively affordable example of Barossa Valley Shiraz. This is youthful and edgy, with meaty, savory notes accenting mixed berries and a hint of mint. The finish is a bit chewy right now, but mouthcoating and long., Designation: Bishop, Points: 93.0, Price: 37.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Glaetzer 2013 Bishop Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Glaetzer, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Full bodied, creamy and lush, this is a prototypical Barossa Valley Shiraz from a longtime master of the variety. Smoke, cedar, mulberry and eucalyptus notes mingle easily on the nose, while savory notes of roasted meat and dried herb blend seamlessly into the fruit, ending long, velvety and rich., Designation: Eligo, Points: 94.0, Price: 100.0, Province: South Australia, Title: John Duval Wines 2013 Eligo Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: John Duval Wines, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: The flagship wine from a relatively new Barossa producer, the 2004 Benno features smoky, savory, spice- and meat-driven aromas that easily move into complex and well-integrated flavors of spice and dark berries. Despite its labeled 15% alcohol, the wine isn't heavy, instead offering medium body and a creamy smooth texture. Finishes long, with lingering dark fruit flavors. Drink now–2020., Designation: Benno Shiraz-Mataro, Points: 92.0, Price: 75.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Murray Street 2004 Benno Shiraz-Mataro Red (Barossa Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Murray Street, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Red Blend - South Australia, Style2: Red Blend - South Australia, Style3: Red Blend - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Blended from a patchwork of old vineyards throughout the Barossa, this is typical Barossa Shiraz, with plenty of weight and creamy tannins that support plummy, chocolaty fruit. There's a bit of spice for complexity and a crisp, fresh finish. Drink now–2014., Designation: Patchwork, Points: 88.0, Price: 18.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Yalumba 2006 Patchwork Shiraz (Barossa), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Yalumba, Region: Barossa, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Rich, dense and intense, this is a big, muscular rendering of Barossa Shiraz. Scents of maple syrup and menthol intertwine with flavors of ripe plums and grilled meat. It's mouthcoating and long on the tannic finish, so give it some time in the cellar; drink 2020–2030., Designation: The Family Tree, Points: 95.0, Price: 65.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Lambert 2013 The Family Tree Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Lambert, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Full bodied and richly textured, this is a terrific example of Barossa Shiraz. From its smoky aromas and intense, briary scents to its complex, earthy, spicy flavors with an undercurrent of blackberry, this is a complete package. The long finish is slightly chewy, suggesting that additional aging is warranted. Drink 2016–2025., Designation: Green's Vineyard, Points: 93.0, Price: 104.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Kilikanoon 2008 Green's Vineyard Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Kilikanoon, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Supple and velvety, with a ripe, creamy texture, this shows textbook Cab flavors: cassis, tobacco and some vanilla from new oak. It deftly avoids the common Barossa problem of excessive size and weight, just could use a touch more persistence on the finish. Imported by AUSA Pacific, LLC., Designation: Thoroughbred, Points: 87.0, Price: 28.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Stanley Lambert 2002 Thoroughbred Cabernet Sauvignon (Barossa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Stanley Lambert, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - South Australia, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - South Australia, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Australia Country: Australia, Description: How can a Barossa Shiraz be so green? Its flavors are herbal to the point of being close to cabbage or green bean, with just enough high-toned cherry fruit to be acceptable. —J.C., Designation: Sinner's, Points: 82.0, Price: 23.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Yunbar 2000 Sinner's Shiraz (Barossa Valley), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Yunbar, Region: Barossa Valley, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Shows greater fruit character and purity than the roasted 2003, with blackberry flavors nicely framed by vanilla oak and meaty, savory notes. Firm on the finish, suggesting an optimum drinking window of 2009–2016., Designation: Ebenezer, Points: 89.0, Price: 32.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Barossa Valley Estate 2004 Ebenezer Shiraz (Barossa), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Barossa Valley Estate, Region: Barossa, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia"

column1: I'd like a sparkling wine, excluding Merlot.,"

column3: An informal sparkler with a simple, fresh palate offering crunchy cherry, strawberry and pink grapefruit.

column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: Here's a rosé sparkler (made with Merlot and Incrocio Manzoni) with a healthy, floral bouquet of rose, raspberry and pomegranate. Multipe U.S. Importers., Designation: The Madam Sparkling, Points: 86.0, Price: 15.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Hugh Hamilton 2004 The Madam Sparkling Merlot (McLaren Vale), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Hugh Hamilton, Region: McLaren Vale, Style1: Merlot - South Australia, Style2: Merlot - South Australia, Style3: Merlot - Australia Country: Italy, Description: Here is an oak-aged sparkler from Italy's Lake Garda (made with Chardonnay) that boasts thick density and creamy aromas of almond, peach, butter and yellow rose. It makes for a well-priced alternative to more expensive metodo classico sparkling wines from France and Spain., Designation: Brut, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Lombardy, Title: Costaripa NV Brut  (Lugana), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Costaripa, Region: Lugana, Style1: Chardonnay - Lombardy, Style2: Chardonnay - Lombardy, Style3: Chardonnay - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Made entirely of the Alpine grape Prié Blanc, planted in the highest vineyards in Europe, this vibrant sparkler opens with aromas of green apple, white spring flowers and a hint of resin. The palate offers ripe Bartlett pear, creamy Granny Smith and Alpine herb alongside brisk acidity and persistent bubbles., Designation: Extra Brut Metodo Classico, Points: 87.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Italy Other, Title: Cave du Vin Blanc de Morgex et de la Salle 2011 Extra Brut Metodo Classico Prié Blanc (Vino Spumante), Variety: Prié Blanc, Winery: Cave du Vin Blanc de Morgex et de la Salle, Region: Vino Spumante, Style1: Prié Blanc - Italy Other, Style2: Prié Blanc - Italy Other, Style3: Prié Blanc - Italy Country: US, Description: Whiffs of exotic spice lend flair to berry and cherry aromas on this sparkling blend of Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. Exuberantly pétillant, it's fresh with cranberry  acidity and tart red-plum and cherry flavors., Designation: Sparkling Rosé, Points: 88.0, Price: 45.0, Province: New York, Title: Bedell 2013 Sparkling Rosé Sparkling (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: Bedell, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Sparkling Blend - New York, Style2: Sparkling Blend - New York, Style3: Sparkling Blend - New York Country: Italy, Description: Here's any easy sparkling wine that opens with a pretty pink color and lively aromas of cranberry, white almond, citrus and lemon curd. A slight hint of sweetness would make this a perfect pairing partner to insalata caprese with fresh mozzarella., Designation: Extra Dry Rosè, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Bacio della Luna NV Extra Dry Rosè Pinot Nero (Veneto), Variety: Pinot Nero, Winery: Bacio della Luna, Region: Veneto, Style1: Pinot Nero - Veneto, Style2: Pinot Nero - Veneto, Style3: Pinot Nero - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Made from organically farmed grapes, this sparkling wine from Central Italy has tangy citrus, apple and nutty sensations. Big, steely bubbles and vivacious acidity create a somewhat rough mouthfeel., Designation: Brut, Points: 85.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Italy Other, Title: Saladini Pilastri NV Brut Pecorino (Vino Spumante), Variety: Pecorino, Winery: Saladini Pilastri, Region: Vino Spumante, Style1: Pecorino - Italy Other, Style2: Pecorino - Italy Other, Style3: Pecorino - Italy Country: US, Description: This lightly sparkling, low-alcohol wine is off dry but with bracing acidity. It features a refreshing mix of apple, peach and citrus fruit, making it perfect as a chilled apéritif, or as a mixer for a wine punch or cocktail., Designation: Semi-Sparkling, Points: 90.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Noble Estate 2013 Semi-Sparkling Muscat (Willamette Valley), Variety: Muscat, Winery: Noble Estate, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Muscat - Oregon, Style2: Muscat - Willamette Valley, Style3: Muscat - Willamette Valley Country: US, Description: Soft bubbles and bracing acidity meld with sweet-tart wild-berry and red-cherry flavors in this cheeky, effervescent treat. A pétillant naturel fermented on it's own indigenous yeasts, there's a distinctly untamed, sauvage feel to this Merlot sparkler that's hard to resist., Designation: Pétillant Naturel Rosato, Points: 89.0, Price: 26.0, Province: New York, Title: Channing Daughters 2014 Pétillant Naturel Rosato Sparkling (Long Island), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: Channing Daughters, Region: Long Island, Style1: Sparkling Blend - New York, Style2: Sparkling Blend - New York, Style3: Sparkling Blend - New York Country: Italy, Description: This sparkling wine has a fragrance of honey, almond and banana peel. It has an elegant perlage and closes on an almond note., Designation: Comitissa Glod Gran Riserva, Points: 90.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Lorenz Martini 2002 Comitissa Glod Gran Riserva Sparkling (Alto Adige), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: Lorenz Martini, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Sparkling Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Sparkling Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Sparkling Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Made entirely from Sangiovese using the méthode Champenoise, this sparkling wine offers raspberry and walnut aromas and flavors. It has a simple structure and despite no dosage, doesn't finish bone dry., Designation: Dream, Points: 84.0, Price: unknown, Province: Italy Other, Title: Casalvento Radda 2008 Dream Sangiovese (Vino da Tavola), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Casalvento Radda, Region: Vino da Tavola, Style1: Sangiovese - Italy Other, Style2: Sangiovese - Italy Other, Style3: Sangiovese - Italy Country: France, Description: This fruity fizz majors on the aroma of freshly cut Golden Delicious apples, while the body is very light, slightly tart and pleasantly dry. The mousse is rather frothy but if refreshment is what you are after, this is your ticket., Designation: Prestige, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Willm NV Prestige Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: Willm, Region: Crémant d'Alsace, Style1: Sparkling Blend - Alsace, Style2: Sparkling Blend - Alsace, Style3: Sparkling Blend - France Country: France, Description: Lightly pink in color, this sweet sparkling wine is full of ripe strawberry fruit. And with its low alcohol, it's the perfect pairing for strawberries and cream. Acidity keeps it in balance., Designation: Caprice des Rocailles, Points: 86.0, Price: 22.0, Province: France Other, Title: Les Rocailles NV Caprice des Rocailles Gamay (Savoie), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Les Rocailles, Region: Savoie, Style1: Gamay - France Other, Style2: Gamay - France Other, Style3: Gamay - France"

column1: Are there any red wines with a touch of earthiness and cherry undertones?,"
column3: Description

column2: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Rosso Red (California)
column3: Gritty and dry, this rustic blend has earthy flavors of cherries and spices.

column2: Santa Alicia 2016 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Maipo Valley)
column3: Earthy cherry and berry aromas include a blackened note akin to asphalt.
Earthy, ripe cherry and berry aromas come with notes of baking spices and tobacco.
This earthy Meritage is dominated by notes of forest floor, strawberry and espresso.
This red-fruit-dominated Garnacha smells of earthy cherry and plum along with orange peel.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Gritty and dry, this rustic blend of Zin, Syrah and Cabernet has earthy flavors of cherries and spices. It's a fine everyday red to drink with everything from pasta or cold cuts to pizza and burgers., Designation: Presents Rosso, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Rosso Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Francis Ford Coppola, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: Chile, Description: Earthy cherry and berry aromas include a blackened note akin to asphalt. This feels fresh and wiry, with pointy acidity. Salty chippy red-fruit flavors end with pedestrian berry notes and a lasting dash of salt., Designation: Reserva Estate Bottled, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Maipo Valley, Title: Santa Alicia 2016 Reserva Estate Bottled Malbec (Maipo Valley), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Santa Alicia, Region: Maipo Valley, Style1: Malbec - Maipo Valley, Style2: Malbec - Maipo Valley, Style3: Malbec - Chile Country: Spain, Description: Earthy, ripe cherry and berry aromas come with notes of baking spices and tobacco. This is crisp in feel, albeit a touch jagged. Smoky, toasty plum and cherry flavors lead, while this is long, spicy and a tad bit hot on the finish., Designation: Crianza, Points: 90.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Eduardo Garrido García 2011 Crianza  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Eduardo Garrido García, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: This earthy Meritage is a standout of the Virginia wine scene. The nose is suave and subtle, dominated by notes of forest floor, strawberry and espresso. Gripping tannins frame the palate which is packed with fresh black cherry fruit. Finishes dense and black. Give it a few years in the cellar., Designation: Meritage, Points: 87.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Tarara 2007 Meritage Red (Virginia), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tarara, Region: Virginia, Style1: Red Blend - Virginia, Style2: Red Blend - Virginia, Style3: Red Blend - Virginia Country: Spain, Description: This red-fruit-dominated Garnacha smells of earthy cherry and plum along with orange peel. A racy, chewy, slightly rough palate of pie cherry, red plum, raisin and chocolate finish juicy and aggressive., Designation: Varietales, Points: 89.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Baron De Ley 2012 Varietales  (Rioja), Variety: Garnacha, Winery: Baron De Ley, Region: Rioja, Style1: Garnacha - Northern Spain, Style2: Garnacha - Northern Spain, Style3: Garnacha - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Earthy baked cherry aromas come across candied and minty. The palate is full-force in terms of acidity, with punchy flavors of strawberry and plum. This finishes light, with strong acidity pushing snappy tartness to the fore., Designation: 4M, Points: 84.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Taron 2008 4M  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Taron, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: Chile, Description: Earthy plum and cherry aromas are cool and lightly herbal. This feels juicy and tight, but clean. Flavors of herbal plum are a touch roasted, while this everyday Cab finishes spicy and the slightest bit green., Designation: U Estate Grown, Points: 87.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Rapel Valley, Title: Undurraga 2014 U Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Rapel Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Undurraga, Region: Rapel Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Rapel Valley, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Rapel Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Chile Country: Chile, Description: Earthy, lightly herbal cherry and plum aromas come with a whiff of smoke. The palate is round and feels well balanced, with blackberry, dark plum, chocolate and spice flavors. Long and slightly herbal on the finish. Contains 5% Syrah., Designation: Reserva, Points: 88.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Maule Valley, Title: Chilcas 2009 Reserva Merlot (Maule Valley), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Chilcas, Region: Maule Valley, Style1: Merlot - Maule Valley, Style2: Merlot - Maule Valley, Style3: Merlot - Chile Country: Argentina, Description: Earthy, rubbery red-berry aromas lead to a hard-drilling palate with fiery cherry flavors and an allotment of herbal mint. The hollow finish leaves a salty flavor and heat., Designation: Made With Organically Grown Grapes, Points: 84.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2013 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Malbec (Tupungato), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Domaine Jean Bousquet, Region: Tupungato, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: Spain, Description: Cherry and plum aromas are dry, earthy and direct. This is a straightforward aged Rioja with grabby tannins but enough body and fruit to absorb them. Baked cherry and plum flavors are a touch rustic and stalky, while a roasted aftertaste sends this on its way. Drink through 2019., Designation: Reserva, Points: 89.0, Price: 33.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Ysios 2008 Reserva  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Ysios, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: US, Description: An earthiness of forest floor wraps around a medley of bright berry and cherry in this wine that is also nicely balanced in acidity. Smooth on the palate, it takes on stronger currents of tannin and leathery oak on the finish., Designation: Estate Grown, Points: 90.0, Price: 36.0, Province: California, Title: WillowBrook Cellars 2012 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: WillowBrook Cellars, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley Country: Argentina, Description: Cherry and cassis aromas are earthy, with hints of green herbs and cheesy oak. This feels a bit raw and scratchy, but fresh.
