Red-fruit flavors of currant and plum finish with snappy acidity and clampy tannins., Designation: Trumpeter, Points: 87.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Rutini 2015 Trumpeter Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Rutini, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Argentina Country: Spain, Description: Earthy aromas of brick dust blend with spiced cherry and tomato notes. A chewy, solid palate registers as correct, while this tastes of ripe, candied berry fruits and chocolate. A long, warm, slightly oaky finish sends this on its way., Designation: Crianza, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Siglo 2012 Crianza  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Siglo, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Rooty/ berry aromas come with a big heaping of mature earth tones and cool cola accents. This is ripped with acidity, which makes sense since 2008 was a chilly, wet year. Bold berry, plum, cherry and tobacco flavors finish easy and smooth; drink through 2020., Designation: Vidau, Points: 91.0, Price: 88.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas Escudero 2008 Vidau  (Rioja), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Bodegas Escudero, Region: Rioja, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: There's a hint of a sweaty, earthy undertone in the nose, and this wine shows a fair amount of stem and earth flavors. Sour cherry fruit adds a lighter layer, with notes of cement and bark. It spent time in 11% new oak., Designation: Crowley Station Vineyards, Points: 86.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Day 2014 Crowley Station Vineyards Pinot Noir (Eola-Amity Hills), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Day, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Oregon Other, Style3: Pinot Noir - Oregon Other"

column1: Is there a wine that is not too oaky?,"
column3: Description

column2: Marqués de Cáceres 2006 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja)
column3: The winery has dialed back the time in oak for its barrel-fermented Viura to two months from five or six, and it's a decidedly less oaky wine than in years prior.
Purists might be inclined to say this wine is too oaky, but this reviewer believes there's ample substance to support the flash.

column2: Williams Selyem 2008 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
column3: Williams Selyem is now playing the unoaked game, and with their fruit sources, wow.

column2: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California)
column3: Touches of ginger and orange zest lighten up the ample fruit flavors of this well-balanced value-priced wine.
This soft wine is minimally oaky and combines quite ripe, figgy, almost honey-like fruit flavors with a vein of butter and almond.
column9: ,Country: Spain, Description: The winery has dialed back the time in oak for its barrel-fermented Viura to two months from five or six, and it's a decidedly less oaky wine than in years prior. Now it shows a controlled lees character along with lemon and apple flavors. Limited in what it offers, but made well., Designation: Blanco Fermentado en Barrica, Points: 85.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Marqués de Cáceres 2006 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Marqués de Cáceres, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: New Zealand, Description: Purists might be inclined to say this wine is too oaky, but this reviewer believes there's ample substance to support the flash. Cedar and vanilla are apparent, but the dominating characteristics of this wine are its ripe fruit and plush texture. Drink now–2020., Designation: OTQ, Points: 91.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Marlborough, Title: Jules Taylor 2013 OTQ Pinot Noir (Marlborough), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Jules Taylor, Region: Marlborough, Style1: Pinot Noir - Marlborough, Style2: Pinot Noir - Marlborough, Style3: Pinot Noir - New Zealand Country: Spain, Description: Oaky aromas of raspberry and currant come with notes of animal fur, lemon peel and shoe polish. This feels lively and not too heavy, with pointy, almost lemony raspberry and plum flavors that finish herbal, dry, medicinal and oaky. Drink this fresh, wiry Rioja through 2018., Designation: Crianza, Points: 88.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Burgo Viejo 2012 Crianza  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Burgo Viejo, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Williams Selyem is now playing the unoaked game, and with their fruit sources, wow. Most winemakers would kill to put oak onto these grapes. The wine is tremendous in pineapples, pears, papayas and kiwi fruit. It's so rich, you won't even notice the absence of caramel and all those oaky influences., Designation: Unoaked, Points: 93.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Williams Selyem 2008 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Williams Selyem, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Smells and tastes too oaky, with buttered toast and vanilla notes smothering everything else. Somewhere down in there is a pretty nice Chardonnay, with good acidity and fine pineapple, pear and apple flavors., Designation: Mitsuko's Vineyard, Points: 85.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Clos Pegase 2009 Mitsuko's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Clos Pegase, Region: Carneros, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Carneros, Style3: Chardonnay - Carneros Country: Spain, Description: If oaky whites are your thing, this barrel-aged Viura is a good choice. Waxy, floral aromas of gardenia, lilly, cured ham and resiny oak play against white-fruit scents. The palate is not blowsy or resiny, while woody flavors of spice and white pepper accent core flavors of peach and baked apple., Designation: Vetiver Vendimia, Points: 88.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas Ontañón 2012 Vetiver Vendimia Viura (Rioja), Variety: Viura, Winery: Bodegas Ontañón, Region: Rioja, Style1: Viura - Northern Spain, Style2: Viura - Northern Spain, Style3: Viura - Spain Country: US, Description: This is too oaky. The wine is just overwhelmed by charry toast and strong, spicy oak wood flavors. Some people confuse the taste of Chardonnay with the taste of oak, but they are not the same., Designation: Catherine's Vineyard, Points: 83.0, Price: 28.0, Province: California, Title: Bonneau 2005 Catherine's Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Bonneau, Region: Carneros, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Carneros, Style3: Chardonnay - Carneros Country: US, Description: Touches of ginger and orange zest lighten up the ample fruit flavors of this well-balanced value-priced wine. It has good acidity to match the ripeness of the Anjou pear and white peach flavors., Designation: Lightly Oaked, Points: 87.0, Price: 8.0, Province: California, Title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California Country: US, Description: This soft wine is minimally oaky and combines quite ripe, figgy, almost honey-like fruit flavors with a vein of butter and almond. Fermented 90% in steel vats and 10% in oak barrels, it has a creamy texture and full body., Designation: Yountville, Points: 88.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Hoopla 2013 Yountville Chardonnay (Yountville), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Hoopla, Region: Yountville, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Yountville, Style3: Chardonnay - Yountville Country: Spain, Description: Why this basic Garnacha is so oaky is a question that deserves to be asked. That said, it's still a healthy, balanced wine with grabby tannins and good energy. Dry, woody notes of spice and clove accent sappy plum flavors., Designation: Particular, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas San Valero 2014 Particular Garnacha (Cariñena), Variety: Garnacha, Winery: Bodegas San Valero, Region: Cariñena, Style1: Garnacha - Northern Spain, Style2: Garnacha - Northern Spain, Style3: Garnacha - Spain Country: US, Description: Green apple and honeydew melon aromas carry right through to the fresh, fruity flavors in this light-bodied and round-textured wine. It has touches of butter and vanilla as well as all that fruit, plus a good balance between crispness and ripeness., Designation: Lightly Oaked, Points: 86.0, Price: 8.0, Province: California, Title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2014 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California Country: US, Description: Tastes as sweet as Lifesaver lemon and pineapple candy, with low acidity., Designation: Lightly Oaked, Points: 81.0, Price: 8.0, Province: California, Title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2007 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California Country: US, Description: Way too oaky. Compromised by the clumsy, heavy application of wood. The caramel and roasted butterscotch aromas and flavors completely swamp whatever wine lies beneath., Designation: The Nth Degree, Points: 82.0, Price: 45.0, Province: California, Title: Wente 2006 The Nth Degree Chardonnay (Livermore Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Wente, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Livermore Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Livermore Valley Country: US, Description: Way too oaky. Like drinking toothpicks, with its charred, wood flavors and oak tannins. The wine is dry and the underlying blackberry and cherry sour candy fruit is just fine, but the oak dominance makes you wonder if the wine will ever age., Designation: Franklin Vineyard, Points: 86.0, Price: 75.0, Province: California, Title: Rutherford Ranch 2005 Franklin Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Rutherford Ranch, Region: Rutherford, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Rutherford, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Rutherford Country: Argentina, Description: An oily white-fruit aroma is overrun by a heavy oak scent, leaving notes of resin and toast on the bouquet. The wine feels fleshy, and the palate keeps that theme going with baked flavors of apple and peach. This is about as oaky as a wine can be and still be very good., Designation: Grande Reserve, Points: 87.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Domaine Jean Bousquet 2010 Grande Reserve Chardonnay (Tupungato), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Jean Bousquet, Region: Tupungato, Style1: Chardonnay - Mendoza Province, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendoza Province, Style3: Chardonnay - Argentina"

column1: I'm looking for a red wine with a good balance between oakiness and fruitiness. Any recommendations?,"
column3: Description
Oak aging brings out black fruits, juicy acidity, toast and vanilla flavors. Smooth, balanced, full of fruit and ready to drink.
Balanced wine with a nose of vanilla, cardamom and oaky red fruit. Herby note of radicchio clings from the nose to the cinnamon toast finish.
Lightly oaked wine full of fruit, ripe with red berries and crisp with acidity, hinting at Douro minerality. Balanced fruity wine with soft tannins.

column2: Masies d'Avinyo 2003 Abadal Selecció Red (Pla de Bages)
column3: Fully oaked wine with lively red fruit and a natural brambly character. Finish settles upon chocolate due to generous oaking.

column2: Tardieu-Laurent 2011 Guy Louis Red (Côtes du Rhône)
column3: Strongly marked by toasty, cedary oak, but enough fruit comes through on the midpalate and finish to suggest this is more than just another oaky red.
column9: ,Country: Portugal, Description: The oak aging is what makes this wine. It brings out the black fruits and juicy acidity as well as adding toast and vanilla flavors. The result is a wine that is smooth, balanced, full of fruit and ready to drink., Designation: Tarambola, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Tarambola Red (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Casa Santos Lima, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese Red - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese Red - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: South Africa, Description: This balanced wine has a nose of vanilla, cardamom that lingers on to the mouthful of simple, oaky red fruit. There is an herby note of radicchio that clings from the nose to the cinnamon toast finish., Designation: Troika, Points: 86.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Franschhoek, Title: Chamonix 2000 Troika Red (Franschhoek), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Chamonix, Region: Franschhoek, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Franschhoek, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Franschhoek, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: Portugal, Description: This lightly oaked wine is full of fruit, ripe with red berries and crisp with acidity, just hinting at Douro minerality. That makes for a balanced fruity wine that with its soft tannins is ready to drink., Designation: Tinto, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Douro, Title: Delaforce 2014 Tinto Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Delaforce, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Spain, Description: A bit of choppy wood announces a fully oaked wine, and yes, it's a touch hard-coated. But underneath the veneer of barrel there's lively red fruit and a natural brambly character. The palate is just acidic enough to be lively, and the finish is healthy and settles upon chocolate due to the wine's generous oaking. Very good mouthfeel and depth make this more than solid. Drink now–2011., Designation: Abadal Selecció, Points: 91.0, Price: 49.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Masies d'Avinyo 2003 Abadal Selecció Red (Pla de Bages), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Masies d'Avinyo, Region: Pla de Bages, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: France, Description: This is strongly marked by toasty, cedary oak, but enough fruit comes through on the midpalate and finish to suggest this is more than just another oaky red. It's rich and creamy through the midpalate, then finishes long, with mixed berry notes emerging at the end., Designation: Guy Louis, Points: 91.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Tardieu-Laurent 2011 Guy Louis Red (Côtes du Rhône), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Tardieu-Laurent, Region: Côtes du Rhône, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: Spain, Description: Oak is apparent on the front end, where milk chocolate and vanilla aromas vie with red berry scents. Feels full and forward, with standard, appealing berry fruit and cassis-like flavors. Toasty and a touch bitter on what amounts to a solid finish., Designation: Monte Castrillo, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Finca Torremilanos 2009 Monte Castrillo  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Finca Torremilanos, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: US, Description: Oak notes are pervasive on the nose of this Cabernet Sauvignon and Tannat blend, with roasted coffee, cinnamon toast and party shell aromas leading the way. The medium-bodied palate offers a bit more in the way of fruit, with dark cherry and cranberry flavors that lead to a green-herb finish., Designation: Tranquility, Points: 84.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Tarara 2012 Tranquility Red (Middleburg), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tarara, Region: Middleburg, Style1: Red Blend - Virginia, Style2: Red Blend - Virginia, Style3: Red Blend - Virginia Country: Spain, Description: Forced oak and modest red-fruit aromas are good enough to draw you in. This feels snappy, with cheek-puckering acidity. Tart red-fruit flavors of plum and currant are woody but honest, while the wine's initial forced oak character settles down on the finish., Designation: Varietales, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Baron De Ley 2014 Varietales  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Baron De Ley, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: Austria, Description: Oak, stone, and spicy moss appear on the nose before black fruits shimmer through. The palate boasts juicy but restrained black fruits, spicy cinnamon edges of oak and a little aromatic leafiness. There is a fine structure but the tannins are supple and smooth while the fruit flavors echo soft vanilla notes. Good now but this will get even better. Drink 2018–2025., Designation: Anna-Christina, Points: 92.0, Price: 59.0, Province: Carnuntum, Title: Netzl 2013 Anna-Christina Red (Carnuntum), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Netzl, Region: Carnuntum, Style1: Red Blend - Carnuntum, Style2: Red Blend - Carnuntum, Style3: Red Blend - Austria Country: France, Description: O.K., so it's a New World-ish blend of fruit and oak, but leaving stylistic prejudices aside, it's also a darn fine wine. Black cherry fruit balances the cedar and vanilla nicely, while the texture is rich yet supple and the finish lingers a good long time. Drink now–2018., Designation: La Reine des Bois, Points: 91.0, Price: 43.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Domaine de la Mordorée 2009 La Reine des Bois Red (Lirac), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Domaine de la Mordorée, Region: Lirac, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: Spain, Description: Oak is front and center on this high-priced affair from Freixenet. And that's the primary problem with what is otherwise a commendable and solid wine. Vanilla and resin aromas and flavors push the fruit to the side, and what's left is a slick of butter, sawdust and tannic astringency. Not a bust, but for nearly a hundred bucks we want more than just wood. Imported by Freixenet USA., Designation: Honoris de Valdubón, Points: 87.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Valdubón 2004 Honoris de Valdubón  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Valdubón, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Aromas of raw oak, related spice, vanilla and berry fruits lead to a fresh palate that's slightly choppy in feel. With its cherry, raspberry and oak flavors this blend of Garnacha, Tempranillo and Carignan blend finishes dry, spicy and steady., Designation: Reserva, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Monasterio de las Viñas 2012 Reserva Red (Cariñena), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Monasterio de las Viñas, Region: Cariñena, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Heavy oak gives off sawmill aromas, with only touches of apple and stone-fruit scents lurking below the surface. This feels creamy, heavy and striving for balance. With a ton of oak flavor leading the charge, it tastes woody, candied and spicy, but also jumbled and unfamiliar., Designation: Mirando al Sur, Points: 85.0, Price: 80.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Olivier Rivière 2015 Mirando al Sur Viura (Rioja), Variety: Viura, Winery: Olivier Rivière, Region: Rioja, Style1: Viura - Northern Spain, Style2: Viura - Northern Spain, Style3: Viura - Spain Country: Argentina, Description: With ripe yet oaky aromas, this is a basic Malbec to enjoy with simple foods. The palate is juicy but comes with a buttery, creamy feel. As for flavors, look for buttery oak riding on top of modest, quick-hitting berry. On the finish, it's oaky more than fruity., Designation: Organica, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Santa Julia 2012 Organica Malbec (Mendoza), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Santa Julia, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: France, Description: The red wine from this vineyard (which also produces a white) is firm with layers of toast from wood aging as well as the potential for ripe red fruits. It is going to need some time to lose that spicy flavor that currently dominates the wine. Give it until 2021. Although the oak imprints strong flavors in this wine, it's still young, so all the spice and toastiness will integrate. The fruit is there, showing a rich medley of apples, pears and citrus. As it matures, the texture will flesh out to result in a generous wine with a promising future. Drink from 2020., Designation: Les Gravières Premier Cru, Points: 89.5, Price: 45.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Jessiaume 2015 Les Gravières Premier Cru  (Santenay), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Domaine Jessiaume, Region: Santenay, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France"

column1: I'm interested in trying a red wine with a bold and peppery character. Any ideas?,"
column3: Description

column2: Saviah 2007 Une Vallée Red Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: A firm and polished wine with a peppery character, wild berry mountain-flavored fruit with earthy green tea and forest floor notes.
A lightly sweet wine with an intense oaky, peppery, smoky aroma.
A very peppery Syrah with intense blackberry jam flavors.
An interesting blend with concentrated aromas and flavors of dark forest berries and fleshy black plums.
A spicy and peppery wine with lots of body and richness.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Firm and polished, this peppery wine is dark and delicious, its wild berry mountain-flavored fruit dappled with earthy green tea and forest floor notes. The terroir comes through more than the varietal character; it fades gracefully into a light, herbal finish., Designation: Une Vallée Red, Points: 90.0, Price: 32.0, Province: Washington, Title: Saviah 2007 Une Vallée Red Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA)), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Saviah, Region: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: This lightly sweet wine has an intense oaky, peppery, smoky aroma and the flavors come out the same way. The beefy, liquid-smoke character should match ribs in barbecue sauce., Designation: Sultry, Points: 85.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: Hey Mambo 2013 Sultry Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Hey Mambo, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: Very peppery even for Syrah. Marked also by intense blackberry jam flavors, it's a full-bodied, tannic bruiser, but one with brooding depth. Decant it a few hours before serving., Designation: Bragger, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Wild Coyote 2009 Bragger Syrah (Paso Robles), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Wild Coyote, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - Paso Robles, Style3: Syrah - Paso Robles Country: South Africa, Description: An interesting blend of equal parts Syrah and Mourvèdre wiith 8% Tannat, The Pepper Pot offers concentrated aromas and flavors of dark forest berries and fleshy black plums. A hint of leather and game unfolds on the finish, while medium acidity keeps the flavors fresh on the palate., Designation: The Pepper Pot, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Edgebaston 2010 The Pepper Pot Red (Stellenbosch), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Edgebaston, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style2: Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style3: Red Blend - South Africa Country: Chile, Description: Spicy and peppery, with lots of body and richness. In a word, it's true Carmenère. The fruit here is ripe and lush, with plenty of herbal essence, and for every drop of plum or black cherry there's a balancing hint of green herb and bell pepper, which does not signal underripeness. The finish is tight and long, with some espresso flavor. If you're interested in trying a well-made Carmenère, give this a go., Designation: Reserva, Points: 87.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Colchagua Valley, Title: Undurraga 2001 Reserva Carmenère (Colchagua Valley), Variety: Carmenère, Winery: Undurraga, Region: Colchagua Valley, Style1: Carmenère - Colchagua Valley, Style2: Carmenère - Colchagua Valley, Style3: Carmenère - Chile Country: US, Description: Darker and more closed-up than the Ciel du Cheval bottling, this is a medium-bodied red wine with dusty cherry and cassis scents, and hints of tar, coffee, herb and leather. It's muscular and edgy, with tons of potential., Designation: Pepper Bridge, Points: 91.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Washington, Title: Andrew Will 1999 Pepper Bridge Sangiovese (Walla Walla Valley (WA)), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Andrew Will, Region: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Style1: Sangiovese - Washington, Style2: Sangiovese - Washington, Style3: Sangiovese - Washington Country: US, Description: An affordably priced wine brings meaty, peppery aromas, interesting fruit, spice and smoke flavors, and a mouthcoating texture. It is full bodied, complex and concentrated., Designation: Crimson Republica de'California, Points: 90.0, Price: 17.0, Province: California, Title: Stephen Vincent 2013 Crimson Republica de'California Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Stephen Vincent, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: Spain, Description: Starts with peppery, leafy aromas that morph toward dry and earthy. The palate, like with all of Torres' basic '07 wines, is crisp and acidic, which brings tang to the wine's red cherry and plum flavors. Spicy, peppery and fresh on the finish., Designation: Sangre de Toro, Points: 85.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Torres 2007 Sangre de Toro Red (Catalunya), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Torres, Region: Catalunya, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Lusty and robust, this Cab, Merlot and Syrah blend combines peppery, briary flavors with riper fruit notes of blackberries and plums. The texture is especially appealing, with its rich, complex tannins, from both the grapes and from oak. Good job in a dry red wine at a fair price., Designation: The Other, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Peirano 2006 The Other Red (Lodi), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Peirano, Region: Lodi, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Lodi, Style3: Red Blend - Lodi Country: US, Description: Extreme pepper elements, from peppercorn to bell pepper, carry through this entire experience. The nose also shows red berries, while the palate offers barely ripe strawberry notes. Fans of the peppery style, which often benefits from a slight chill, will be enthused. Those who hate pyrazines should stay away., Designation: Estate, Points: 88.0, Price: 32.0, Province: California, Title: Jason-Stephens 2012 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Clara Valley), Variety: Cabernet Franc, Winery: Jason-Stephens, Region: Santa Clara Valley, Style1: Cabernet Franc - California, Style2: Cabernet Franc - Santa Clara Valley, Style3: Cabernet Franc - Santa Clara Valley Country: US, Description: This red has a fruity, jammy nose with a peppery kick. On the palate it's a mixture of spicebox, cherry, coffee and pepper. Approachable and well made—a good everyday drinking red., Designation: Campania Rosso, Points: 86.0, Price: 30.0, Province: New York, Title: Waters Crest 2006 Campania Rosso Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Waters Crest, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: US, Description: Opens with a blast of freshly ground black peppercorns, and that peppery tastes travels into the flavor. A very unusual and distinctive wine, it's absolutely, refreshingly dry, with richer notes of cherries, currants and tangerine zest, finishing with a swirl of spicy anise, clove and cinnamon., Designation: Red Huerhuero, Points: 89.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Vina Robles 2006 Red Huerhuero Red (Paso Robles), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Vina Robles, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: Red Blend - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: Roughly two-thirds Cabernet Franc and the rest Gamay, this is a peppery, tartly acidic red wine. Its sharp-edged berry fruit is braced with lemony scents and acids. Tannins are drying and a bit edgy., Designation: Oregon Tour Rain Vin Rouge, Points: 88.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Leah Jørgensen Cellars 2014 Oregon Tour Rain Vin Rouge Red (Oregon), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Leah Jørgensen Cellars, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Red Blend - Oregon, Style2: Red Blend - Oregon Other, Style3: Red Blend - Oregon Other Country: Greece, Description: Cinnamon, pepper and spice lead this fun red from Greece. Flavors of cedar, pepper, tobacco and coffee give it a plucky edge. Savory notes round it out. Pair with grilled lamb, steak., Designation: Velvet Passion, Points: 83.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Crete, Title: Michalakis 2005 Velvet Passion Red (Crete), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Michalakis, Region: Crete, Style1: Red Blend - Crete, Style2: Red Blend - Crete, Style3: Red Blend - Greece Country: France, Description: A spicy wine, with nutmeg and allspice as well as peppered plums. Against this exotic background, the tannins are solid and concentrated, suggesting good aging potential., Designation: L'Iris de Laride  Vieilles Vignes, Points: 87.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Laride 2011 L'Iris de Laride  Vieilles Vignes  (Haut-Médoc), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Laride, Region: Haut-Médoc, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France"

column1: What's a light-bodied white wine?,"
column3: Description

column2: Fenestra NV True White Lot 4 White (California)
column3: A flinty aroma, racy texture and delicate apple and white-peach flavors make this wine seem agile like a dancer. It has great balance and a refreshing quality.
A light-bodied casual wine with subdued aromas suggesting white flower, orchard fruit and a hint of almond.
Assertive and delicious, this wine has dramatic aromas of wood smoke, wet stones and even diesel. Light peach and white pepper flavors ride an elegant texture.

column2: Rock Wall 2016 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Yolo County)
column3: A light-bodied, very fruity and soft-textured wine that smells like cherries, berries and melons and tastes fresh and a touch sweet.

column2: Murrieta's Well 2013 The Whip White (Livermore Valley)
column3: Fresh apple aromas and lively citrus flavors make a good combination in this light-bodied, tangy-textured wine.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: A flinty aroma, racy texture and delicate apple and white-peach flavors make this light-bodied wine seem agile like a dancer. It has great balance and a welcome refreshing quality., Designation: True White Lot 4, Points: 89.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Fenestra NV True White Lot 4 White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Fenestra, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: Italy, Description: Here's a light-bodied casual wine that has subdued aromas suggesting white flower, orchard fruit and a hint of almond. You can find traces of the nose on the extremely simple diluted palate., Designation: Singan, Points: 84.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Adalia 2015 Singan  (Soave), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Adalia, Region: Soave, Style1: White Blend - Veneto, Style2: White Blend - Veneto, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Assertive and delicious, this light-bodied and dry wine has dramatic aromas of wood smoke, wet stones and even diesel. Those are classic for the German grape varieties from which it was made, as are the light peach and white pepper flavors that ride an elegant texture and slightly sweet balance., Designation: Nativo, Points: 90.0, Price: 19.0, Province: California, Title: Markus Wine Co 2014 Nativo White (Lodi), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Markus Wine Co, Region: Lodi, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Lodi, Style3: White Blend - Lodi Country: US, Description: This is a light-bodied, very fruity and soft-textured wine that smells like cherries, berries and melons and tastes fresh and a touch sweet. The acidity is low and the bubbles are lively, so it's easy to sip., Designation: Blanc de Blancs, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Rock Wall 2016 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Yolo County), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Rock Wall, Region: Yolo, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Yolo, Style3: Chardonnay - Yolo Country: US, Description: Fresh apple aromas and lively citrus flavors make a good combination in this light-bodied, tangy-textured wine. It tastes slightly rounded with sweetness, but comes off clean, crisp and appetizing. The two main components are Sémillon and Chardonnay, with dashes of Sauvignon Blanc and Orange Muscat., Designation: The Whip, Points: 87.0, Price: 22.0, Province: California, Title: Murrieta's Well 2013 The Whip White (Livermore Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Murrieta's Well, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Livermore Valley, Style3: White Blend - Livermore Valley Country: US, Description: This wine is light in body, fruity and floral in flavor and smooth on the palate. Blended from seven varietals, it has peach and jasmine aromas, very generous fruit flavors that flirt with sweetness and a lush mouthfeel., Designation: Crisp White Winemaker's Blend, Points: 86.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: Seven Daughters 2015 Crisp White Winemaker's Blend White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Seven Daughters, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: US, Description: This light-bodied wine has tempting herb, peach and flower aromas and bright citrus flavors, plus a crisp texture and clean finish. It's a mouth-watering, appetizing wine that will be great before dinner or with a light first course., Designation: Clay Station Vineyard, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: California, Title: Onesta 2014 Clay Station Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Lodi), Variety: Grenache Blanc, Winery: Onesta, Region: Lodi, Style1: Grenache Blanc - California, Style2: Grenache Blanc - Lodi, Style3: Grenache Blanc - Lodi Country: US, Description: This light-bodied wine brings enjoyment at a very low price. Attractive grapefruit and dried herb aromas followed by citrus and savory flavors make it appetizing and enjoyable. It tastes dry, fairly crisp and well balanced., Designation: Willow Springs, Points: 86.0, Price: 7.0, Province: California, Title: CK Mondavi 2014 Willow Springs Pinot Grigio (California), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: CK Mondavi, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - California, Style3: Pinot Grigio - California Country: Portugal, Description: With the lightest, freshest tingle on the tongue, this is an off-dry wine that is crisp and fresh, combining citrus with sweetness. It is light-bodied, bright and ready to drink., Designation: Encostas do Lima, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima 2014 Encostas do Lima White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Adega Cooperativa Ponte de Lima, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: Light in approach and consistency, this is a fresh, easygoing white wine from central Italy that can be consumed at informal occasions such as with appetizers or at an outdoor barbecue. The aromas recall lime, green melon and sweet basil., Designation: Macrina, Points: 86.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Garofoli 2007 Macrina  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore), Variety: Verdicchio, Winery: Garofoli, Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico Superiore, Style1: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style2: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style3: Verdicchio - Italy Country: US, Description: Fruit-bowl aromas, fresh but neutral flavors and a fairly soft texture make this light-bodied wine pleasant and easy to drink., Designation: Estate, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Clos du Lac 2014 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Clos du Lac, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Sierra Foothills, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Sierra Foothills Country: Australia, Description: This fruit-driven wine doesn't show the complexity of much lees aging, but satisfies with its clean, refreshing flavors of pineapple, peach and melon. It's light in body and nearly dry., Designation: Lois Blanc de Blancs, Points: 85.0, Price: 20.0, Province: South Australia, Title: The Lane NV Lois Blanc de Blancs  (Adelaide Hills), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: The Lane, Region: Adelaide Hills, Style1: Champagne Blend - South Australia, Style2: Champagne Blend - South Australia, Style3: Champagne Blend - Australia Country: France, Description: A light touch is conveyed by aromas of honeysuckle, while the off-dry palate is balanced by fresh, citric verve. This wine has a dancing, easygoing nature marked by freshness and lightness in equal measure. Asian food flavors suggest themselves for this super-balanced, playful white., Designation: Gentil, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Hugel 2015 Gentil White (Alsace), Variety: Alsace white blend, Winery: Hugel, Region: Alsace, Style1: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style2: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style3: Alsace white blend - France Country: Spain, Description: Light and flowery, with apple aromas. The body and palate are lean and a little stripped, but the apple flavors are clean and quaffable. This is like a waif model, or maybe a scarecrow. It is good on the surface but has very little meat on the bones., Designation: Viura-Chardonnay, Points: 84.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: No Time 2007 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra), Variety: White Blend, Winery: No Time, Region: Navarra, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Italy, Description: This is a light and friendly white wine that would pair well with salads and vegetarian dishes. The wine has easygoing aromas of yellow fruit and some dusty mineral tones for extra dimension. A Marc de Grazia selection, various American importers., Designation: Gazza Ladra, Points: 85.0, Price: 21.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Santa Lucia 2007 Gazza Ladra Fiano (Puglia), Variety: Fiano, Winery: Santa Lucia, Region: Puglia, Style1: Fiano - Southern Italy, Style2: Fiano - Southern Italy, Style3: Fiano - Italy"

column1: What's a bold white wine?,"
column3: Description

column2: Steven Kent 2013 Lola Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)
column3: A bold white wine with smells and tastes of grapefruit, canteloupe and very crisp apples. It has a fresh, acidic texture that cleans the palate and makes the mouth water, but wraps in enough richness for good balance.

column2: Thousand Islands Winery NV Wellesley Island White (New York)
column3: Boldly grapey, this blend of Diamond, Cayuga White and Catawba grapes is a fun fruity sip with that characteristic “foxiness” of American grapes. It's simple and a bit sugary, but light footed and fresh.

column2: Imagery 2000 Artist Collection White Burgundy White (California)
column3: Explosively fruity, with big, bold flavors of peaches, pears, apples, tropical fruits. Drinks firmly dry, although oak brings a wood-sap sweetness. Lees aging was significant and adds a sour cream note.
A wood-aged wine, this shows Chardonnay's richness along with spicy wood and opulent fruit. Bold acidity and a citrus edge cuts the smoothness.

column2: Concha y Toro 2011 Terrunyo Costa Los Boldos Vineyard Block 5 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
column3: This is about as racy as Sauvignon Blanc from Chile gets. It's green and melon-like on the nose, with punchy asparagus and lime aromas. It is wide awake on the palate, where citrusy acids push lemon, lime, green herb and lemongrass flavors.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: A bold white wine, it smells and tastes like grapefruit, canteloupe and very crisp apples. It has a fresh, acidic texture that cleans the palate and makes the mouth water, but wraps in enough richness for good balance., Designation: Lola, Points: 87.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Steven Kent 2013 Lola Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Steven Kent, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Livermore Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Livermore Valley Country: US, Description: Boldly grapey, this blend of Diamond, Cayuga White and Catawba grapes is a fun fruity sip with that characteristic “foxiness” of American grapes. It's simple and a bit sugary, but light footed and fresh., Designation: Wellesley Island, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: New York, Title: Thousand Islands Winery NV Wellesley Island White (New York), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Thousand Islands Winery, Region: New York, Style1: White Blend - New York, Style2: White Blend - New York, Style3: White Blend - New York Country: US, Description: Explosively fruity, with big, bold flavors of peaches, pears, apples, tropical fruits, you name it. Drinks firmly dry, although oak brings a wood-sap sweetness. Lees aging was significant and adds a sour cream note. A blend of Chardonnay and Pinot Blanc., Designation: Artist Collection White Burgundy, Points: 86.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Imagery 2000 Artist Collection White Burgundy White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Imagery, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: Portugal, Description: A wood-aged wine, this shows Chardonnay's richness along with spicy wood and opulent fruit. Bold acidity and a citrus edge cuts the smoothness. It's for short-term aging over 2–4 years., Designation: Guru, Points: 89.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Douro, Title: Wine & Soul 2011 Guru White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Wine & Soul, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Chile, Description: This is about as racy as Sauvignon Blanc from Chile gets. It's green and melon-like on the nose, with punchy asparagus and lime aromas. It is wide awake on the palate, where citrusy acids push lemon, lime, green herb and lemongrass flavors. It cuts like a razor; drink with shellfish., Designation: Terrunyo Costa Los Boldos Vineyard Block 5, Points: 90.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Casablanca Valley, Title: Concha y Toro 2011 Terrunyo Costa Los Boldos Vineyard Block 5 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Concha y Toro, Region: Casablanca Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Chile Country: Spain, Description: Dry, almondy and mature, with oxidized aromas and a bold gold color. This is full-force white Garnacha with a lot of heft and body. It's arguably more bitter and sweet than outright fruity, with honey and white pepper accents. Finishes extra spicy, with heat. Rich and heady stuff to drink now., Designation: Flor de Garnatxa, Points: 88.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Celler La Bollidora 2007 Flor de Garnatxa Garnacha Blanca (Terra Alta), Variety: Garnacha Blanca, Winery: Celler La Bollidora, Region: Terra Alta, Style1: Garnacha Blanca - Catalonia, Style2: Garnacha Blanca - Catalonia, Style3: Garnacha Blanca - Spain Country: US, Description: Bright, forceful and slightly reductive, this white is aged less than a year in neutral French oak, allowing the fruit to speak and offer richness on the midpalate. Gingerbread and lemongrass flavors accent its essential core of green apple fruit., Designation: Estate, Points: 91.0, Price: 38.0, Province: California, Title: White Rock Vineyards 2014 Estate Chardonnay (Napa Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: White Rock Vineyards, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Napa Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: This powerfully textured white wine from Bien Nacido Vineyard will last for ages. Tightly wound on the nose with lime pith, limestone, Brie cheese rind and a touch of flint, the palate shows scorched Meyer lemon wedges and some seared orange pith. The mouthfeel is tremendously grippy. Drink 2017–2024., Designation: Bien Bien, Points: 93.0, Price: 64.0, Province: California, Title: Liquid Farm 2014 Bien Bien Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Liquid Farm, Region: Santa Maria Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Santa Maria Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Santa Maria Valley Country: Italy, Description: This spicy white wine offers incredibly intense aromas of candied fruit, chopped herbs and thick honey. The wine is fragrant and highly aromatic with a thick, creamy mouthfeel., Designation: Le Franette, Points: 85.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Bocelli 2007 Le Franette White (Toscana), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Bocelli, Region: Toscana, Style1: White Blend - Tuscany, Style2: White Blend - Tuscany, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Making wine since 1936, Marsuret's San Boldo Brut opens with sharp notes of white pepper and dried hay followed by citrus, peach and white flower. The wine shows thin lines with a watery consistency., Designation: San Boldo Brut, Points: 86.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Marsuret 2012 San Boldo Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore), Variety: Glera, Winery: Marsuret, Region: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Style1: Glera - Veneto, Style2: Glera - Veneto, Style3: Glera - Italy Country: Spain, Description: Heavy white-fruit aromas have an almost “canned” quality. This is more like citrus juice than defined white wine, with hugely ripe tropical and citrus flavors culminating in creamy weight. This is 80% Godello and 20% Doña Blanca., Designation: Godello-Doña Blanca, Points: 84.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Godelia 2012 Godello-Doña Blanca White (Bierzo), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Godelia, Region: Bierzo, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Portugal, Description: Rich and opulent, this is a big fruity, toasty white wine. The vanilla from the wood combines with ripe peach and pineapple flavors, the acidity a hint of tangerine zest. While it is definitely full-bodied, both the full fruit and the acidity give it  very drinkable balance., Designation: Branco Reserva, Points: 89.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Dão, Title: Casa de Santar 2007 Branco Reserva White (Dão), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Casa de Santar, Region: Dão, Style1: Portuguese White - Dão, Style2: Portuguese White - Dão, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: This sophisticated white wine from the homeland of Italy's most robust reds (Ripasso and Amarone) shows a full, generous appearance with a golden-amber color. Stone fruit, toasted almond and candied lemon give it heft and consistency., Designation: Terso, Points: 89.0, Price: 36.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Marchesi Fumanelli 2005 Terso White (Veneto), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Marchesi Fumanelli, Region: Veneto, Style1: White Blend - Veneto, Style2: White Blend - Veneto, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: A big, round and fuller-styled white wine, this comes entirely from estate-grown grapes.It offers lemongrass tartness complemented by melon and a taste of tangerine cream, a ready companion for the table or picnic basket., Designation: Estate Grown, Points: 90.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Kenefick Ranch 2014 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Calistoga), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Kenefick Ranch, Region: Calistoga, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Calistoga, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Calistoga Country: Italy, Description: This excellent blend of Chardonnay and Friulano offers a rich and reassuring feel in the mouth that would stand up to creamy artichoke risotto or white meat. Its beautiful aromas include melon, pear, apricot and a touch of butterscotch., Designation: Bianco, Points: 90.0, Price: 41.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Mario Schiopetto 2006 Bianco White (Venezia Giulia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Mario Schiopetto, Region: Venezia Giulia, Style1: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy"

column1: What would be a good wine for a tasting event?,"
column3: Description

column2: Vina Robles 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
column3: A crowd-pleasing Cabernet with black cherry, vanilla and crushed rock aromas. Cherry and dark strawberry juice flavors on the palate, jammy with a touch of baking spice and dill.

column2: Wise Villa 2012 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
column3: Bright, crisp red cherry and blackberry flavors. Touches of nutmeg and vanilla, not an oaky wine.
Ripe yellow plums, freshly cut apples, pears and melons. Easy and very fruit-driven, balanced, light.

column2: The Winemaker's Loft 2005 Red Table Wine Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: A spicy and toasty red wine with juicy and bursting with bright sweet berry flavors, and the generous oak adds cinnamon and butterscotch.
Butter and dill aromas with raw oak and lighter-weight fruit notes. Ample resin and wood notes along with pepper and spice.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: This is a crowd-pleasing style of Cabernet that's perfect for the winery's on-site outdoor amphitheater and has approachable black cherry, vanilla and crushed rock aromas. More cherry and dark strawberry juice flavors show on the palate, which is jammy with a touch of baking spice and dill to round it out., Designation: Estate, Points: 89.0, Price: 26.0, Province: California, Title: Vina Robles 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Vina Robles, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Paso Robles, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: Bright, crisp red cherry and blackberry flavors drive a refreshing, fruity personality. Touches of nutmeg and vanilla show through, but this is not an oaky wine by any means. It will please a crowd and pair well with a wide variety of foods., Designation: Estate, Points: 87.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Wise Villa 2012 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Wise Villa, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Sierra Foothills, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Sierra Foothills Country: US, Description: This winery produces luxuriously rich wines, and this blend of 47% Merlot, 30% Petit Verdot, 12% Malbec and 11% Cabernet Sauvignon fits right in. Aromas suggest vanilla-cherry cream, fresh cracked dark chocolate, mulberry extract and root beer. Cola, blackberries and woody herbs show once sipped., Designation: Party of Four, Points: 88.0, Price: 59.0, Province: California, Title: HammerSky 2010 Party of Four Red (Paso Robles), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: HammerSky, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: Red Blend - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: This blend of 35% Merlot, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Petite Sirah is actually a party of three, but the results are solid. Chocolate, black cherries, scarlet rose buds and toasted oak pop on the nose. The smooth and dense palate shows boysenberry, black pepper and a chalky tannic structure., Designation: Party of Four, Points: 90.0, Price: 45.0, Province: California, Title: HammerSky 2013 Party of Four Red (Paso Robles), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: HammerSky, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: This blend of 60% Petit Verdot, 15% Malbec, 15% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon offers a grape-driven nose, boosted by dried black cherry, licorice and baking spice, more playful than brooding. Bright flavors of blackberry and red cherry make for a juicy, tangy wine with decent tannic structure., Designation: Party of Four, Points: 88.0, Price: 49.0, Province: California, Title: HammerSky 2012 Party of Four Red (Paso Robles), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: HammerSky, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles Country: France, Description: Bounteous fruit flavors need a little air to wake up but soon you'll have a party in your glass of ripe yellow plums, freshly cut apples, pears and melons. This is easy and very fruit-driven, balanced, light and just the ticket for a party in the sunshine., Designation: Tradition, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Alsace, Title: W. Gisselbrecht 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Blanc, Winery: W. Gisselbrecht, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Blanc - France Country: US, Description: Break out the prosciutto-wrapped figs and stuffed mushroom appetizers for this light, silky rosé. It's crisp in acidity and delicate in the mouth, with assertive raspberry, orange tea and honey flavors. This is one of the more successful Pinot Noir rosés out there., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 88.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Festival and Feast 2012 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Festival and Feast, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Sonoma, Style3: Pinot Noir - Sonoma Country: US, Description: A blend of 60% Cabernet, 20% Merlot, 18% Syrah and splashes of Malbec, Zinfandel and Tempranillo, this spicy and toasty red wine shows the care that went into the original barrels, which were never intended for this inexpensive tasting room red. The fruit is juicy and bursting with bright sweet berry flavors, and the generous oak adds cinnamon and butterscotch., Designation: Red Table Wine, Points: 90.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Washington, Title: The Winemaker's Loft 2005 Red Table Wine Red (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: The Winemaker's Loft, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: Jolly Rancher-red in color, there's high-toned grapefruit and watermelon in this Rosé. Layers of tropical juiciness on the back of the tongue and a nice finish make this a refreshing wine before, during or after dinner., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 87.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Festival and Feast 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Festival and Feast, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Sonoma, Style3: Pinot Noir - Sonoma Country: US, Description: Soft and fruity, this easy-drinking Syrah has pleasant, jammy flavors of raspberries, blackberries, cola, bacon and peppery spices. It's a nice, full-bodied red wine to drink now with party food., Designation: Tribute Series, Points: 85.0, Price: 27.0, Province: California, Title: Ben Hogan 2008 Tribute Series Syrah (Paso Robles), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Ben Hogan, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - Paso Robles, Style3: Syrah - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: This wine sings in the glass, offering substantial aromas and flavors of charcuterie, dried herb and orange creamsicle, conjuring up visions of picnics in a glass. It will do well in such settings, but is also a worthy addition to the table, balanced and structured to pair memorably with a wide range of foods., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 91.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Lynmar 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Lynmar, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley Country: Argentina, Description: Butter and dill are the first aromas to make themselves noticed, and below that there's raw oak and lighter-weight fruit notes. The palate shows ample resin and wood notes along with pepper and spice. It's a good wine with serious intent, but it seems a little overwooded and a tiny bit green. Cabernet Sauvignon leads the blend, with Merlot and Cab Franc filling it out., Designation: Gala 2, Points: 87.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Luigi Bosca 2004 Gala 2 Red (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Blend, Winery: Luigi Bosca, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Blend - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Blend - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Blend - Argentina Country: US, Description: Quite dry yet intensely fruity, this has loads of fresh strawberry, red cherry and raspberry flavors. This finishes with a touch of sweet fruit and a subtle spray of cherry blossom perfume. It's an unabashedly quaffable rosé that's perfect for entertaining year round. Drink now., Designation: White, Points: 89.0, Price: 13.0, Province: New York, Title: Knapp 2011 White Cabernet Franc (Finger Lakes), Variety: Cabernet Franc, Winery: Knapp, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Cabernet Franc - New York, Style2: Cabernet Franc - New York, Style3: Cabernet Franc - New York Country: US, Description: This wine is a light red, but packaged like a rosé, and shows rich aromas of ripe black plum and red cherries, mouth-filling body and generous plummy, meaty flavors. It's very enjoyable to start an evening with and is full bodied enough to pair with big proteins., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 90.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Fifi 2014 Rosé of Sangiovese (California), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Fifi, Region: California, Style1: Sangiovese - California, Style2: Sangiovese - California, Style3: Sangiovese - California Country: US, Description: A little simple in citrus flavor, but for the price, a pretty nice wine. It's the kind of crisp, dry white I've had many times at gallery openings and such, inexpensive, but with enough panache to satisfy a picky crowd., Designation: Private Selection, Points: 85.0, Price: 11.0, Province: California, Title: Robert Mondavi 2006 Private Selection Sauvignon Blanc (California), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Robert Mondavi, Region: California, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - California"

column1: What's a good red wine that's both fruit-forward and has a spicy finish?,"
column3: Description

column2: Provenance Vineyards 2012 Winemaker's Reserve Red (Napa Valley)
column3: Spicy and fruity, with blueberry and cassis notes, rich tannins and oak. Finish includes chocolate, tobacco and coffee.

column2: Green & Red 1998 Chiles Mill Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
column3: Spicy black fruit, bell pepper, black pepper and toast. Lively mouthfeel, with some heat and lift to the finish.

column2: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2006 The Goatfather Red (Western Cape)
column3: Offers red currant, cinnamon, cherry and vanilla, with friendly fruit flavors finished with a blast of fiery spice.
Aromas of bramble fruits and strawberry, followed by red and black fruit and spice. Bursts of strawberry and red fruit mingle with rich spice and a dry finish.
Spicy, toasty black-fruit aromas with wrenching tannic grip. Spicy flavors of dark plum and blackberry. Peppery notes and herbal accents on the finish.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Spicy and fruity, this wine combines 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Malbec, 21% Cabernet Franc and 16% Petit Verdot. Blueberry and cassis make appearances, as do rich, full-bodied tannins and punches of oak. The finish delves into chocolate, tobacco and coffee in equal measure., Designation: Winemaker's Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Provenance Vineyards 2012 Winemaker's Reserve Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Provenance Vineyards, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Spicy black fruit, with bell pepper, black pepper and toast adding complexity. Partial whole-berry fermentation brings an element of spicy, forward fruitiness to the wine. Lively mouthfeel, with some heat and lift to the finish. If there were more depth and punch to the fruit, this would warrant an even higher rating., Designation: Chiles Mill Vineyard, Points: 89.0, Price: 22.0, Province: California, Title: Green & Red 1998 Chiles Mill Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley), Variety: Zinfandel, Winery: Green & Red, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Zinfandel - California, Style2: Zinfandel - Napa Valley, Style3: Zinfandel - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Forward and spicy, this puts some muscle into the Merlot with earthy, tongue-gripping tannins. The fruit has a sweet tomato flavor, with a streak of cherry candy. Though not entirely knit together, it's a pleasant drink best enjoyed young., Designation: Indian Wells, Points: 86.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Washington, Title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2008 Indian Wells Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Chateau Ste. Michelle, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Merlot - Washington, Style2: Merlot - Washington, Style3: Merlot - Washington Country: US, Description: Forward and fruity, this is a tight, tart wine with a jumble of berry and bramble flavors. It's peppery, spicy, but don't look for too much complexity. Gulp it down for the enjoyable quaffer that it's meant to be., Designation: The Vincent, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Washington, Title: Board Track Racer 2010 The Vincent Red (Washington), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Board Track Racer, Region: Washington, Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: Bright red fruits achieve a decent amount of ripeness, but unfortunately, there's not a lot of concentration. The spice-laced finish is long, aided by soft tannins and notes of leather, tobacco and earth., Designation: Category 5 Red Wine, Points: 84.0, Price: 18.0, Province: North Carolina, Title: RayLen 2008 Category 5 Red Wine Red (North Carolina), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: RayLen, Region: North Carolina, Style1: Red Blend - North Carolina, Style2: Red Blend - North Carolina, Style3: Red Blend - North Carolina Country: US, Description: A Bordeaux blend with a Right Bank inclination, this offers forward fruit aromas and flavors of bright, candied cherry. A puckery, peppery finish comes up quickly. Some 2007 Washington reds seem to be entering a dumb phase; this may need some extra bottle age to open up again., Designation: domenica, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Washington, Title: DiStefano 2007 domenica Red (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: DiStefano, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: An upscale hamburger wine, fruity and spicy. There's a bacony, smoked meat note to the raspberries and cherries that will play well against the char of grilled beef., Designation: Rock n Red, Points: 87.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Headbanger 2007 Rock n Red Red (Sonoma County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Headbanger, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Sonoma, Style3: Red Blend - Sonoma Country: South Africa, Description: The ever-creative Charles Back scores again with this blend of Shiraz, Cabernet, Merlot, Barbera and Primitivo. The nose offers red currant, cinnamon, cherry and vanilla, and on the palate, friendly fruit flavors are finished with a blast of fiery spice. The wine can age but is good today with spicy ribs, beef and assertive flavors., Designation: The Goatfather, Points: 89.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Western Cape, Title: Goats do Roam Wine Co. 2006 The Goatfather Red (Western Cape), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Goats do Roam Wine Co., Region: Western Cape, Style1: Red Blend - Western Cape, Style2: Red Blend - Western Cape, Style3: Red Blend - South Africa Country: Greece, Description: Aromas of bramble fruits and strawberry are followed by red and black fruit and spice in this easygoing red. Bursts of strawberry and red fruit mingle with rich spice and a dry finish. Pair with game, pasta dishes., Designation: Red Wine, Points: 84.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Greece, Title: Dionysos NV Red Wine Red (Greece), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Dionysos, Region: Greece, Style1: Red Blend - Greece, Style2: Red Blend - Greece, Style3: Red Blend - Greece Country: Spain, Description: Aromas of raw oak, related spice, vanilla and berry fruits lead to a fresh palate that's slightly choppy in feel. With its cherry, raspberry and oak flavors this blend of Garnacha, Tempranillo and Carignan blend finishes dry, spicy and steady., Designation: Reserva, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Monasterio de las Viñas 2012 Reserva Red (Cariñena), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Monasterio de las Viñas, Region: Cariñena, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Based on Merlot, this Bordeaux-style blend is very ripe and forward in blueberry, cherry and raspberry jam, and it finishes in a swirl of dusty baking spices. It's a good wine, if a bit rustic, with some edgy tannins and high alcohol., Designation: Bastille, Points: 86.0, Price: 38.0, Province: California, Title: De Novo 2009 Bastille Red (Sonoma County), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: De Novo, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma Country: South Africa, Description: Ripe fruit aromas mingle with pepper, leather, mocha and spice on the nose of this elegant red. Dry and balanced, the palate offers ripe berry and spicy notes, and a lingering finish. Good textured tannins add to the ageable appeal., Designation: Kevin Arnold, Points: 86.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Waterford 2004 Kevin Arnold Shiraz (Stellenbosch), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Waterford, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Shiraz - Stellenbosch, Style2: Shiraz - Stellenbosch, Style3: Shiraz - South Africa Country: Spain, Description: Spicy, toasty black-fruit aromas set up a firm palate with wrenching tannic grip. Spicy flavors of dark plum and blackberry are typical of this type of Monastrell blend. Peppery notes and herbal accents are up front on the finish., Designation: C, Points: 89.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Levante, Title: Bodegas Carchelo 2014 C Red (Jumilla), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Bodegas Carchelo, Region: Jumilla, Style1: Red Blend - Levante, Style2: Red Blend - Levante, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: With the scent of watermelon chapstick leading the way, this is a fruit-forward wine you want to kiss. Other aromas on the sweet-and-spicy nose include stewed plums and a dill-led herbal element. The flavors of red fruits and brown spice make for a completely delicious experience., Designation: Caverio, Points: 90.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Sextant 2011 Caverio G-S-M (Paso Robles), Variety: G-S-M, Winery: Sextant, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: G-S-M - California, Style2: G-S-M - Paso Robles, Style3: G-S-M - Paso Robles Country: Spain, Description: Spiced cherry and berry aromas are common but good. A bright, acidic palate feels perfectly healthy and lively, while flavors of plum and berry fruits get a dusting of dry spice. A slow-driving finish offers a steady ending., Designation: Crianza, Points: 89.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: La Greña 2011 Crianza  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: La Greña, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain"

column1: Suggest a wine from a winery known for its award-winning practices.,"I'm sorry, but the context does not provide information about a winery known for its award-winning practices.","Country: US, Description: The winery says it can't reveal the source of the grapes, which is odd, but we do know it's in Rutherford. Made from 100% Cab, and aged in 100% new French oak, it is, in a word, splendid. Rich in blackberries, cassis and dark chocolate, the fruit was clearly well grown, and the tannin-acid balance is utterly classic. This beautiful wine is a partnership between three well-known and high-scoring vintners from other brands. It is a winery worth following., Designation: The Treat, Points: 94.0, Price: 75.0, Province: California, Title: Tres Vinicultores 2007 The Treat Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Tres Vinicultores, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: The winery's annual showing of “minimal intervention techniques,” this wine offers lime peels, yellow grapefruit and cut grass on the expected and excellent nose. There is a nice pepperiness to the palate, from green pepper to chopped oregano, basil and thyme., Designation: Ex Anima, Points: 90.0, Price: 19.0, Province: California, Title: Wrath 2014 Ex Anima Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Wrath, Region: Monterey, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Monterey, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Monterey Country: Italy, Description: The celebrated Cerequio cru is known for its elegant and refined wines. However, in this hot vintage, you can taste the maturity of the fruit thanks to the wine's aromas of plum, prune and spice cake. Clay soils help shape the wine's natural density and structure., Designation: Cerequio, Points: 91.0, Price: 120.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: Contratto 2003 Cerequio  (Barolo), Variety: Nebbiolo, Winery: Contratto, Region: Barolo, Style1: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style2: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style3: Nebbiolo - Italy Country: Spain, Description: Given the limited sampling of what I've tried from Casa l'Angel, this is a winery to watch. This blend of Syrah and Tempranillo is fully ripe and clean, with blackberry, toast and minerally aromas. It's solidly built, ready to drink and offers satisfying flavors of cherry and blackberry in front of a warm, medicinal finish., Designation: Made with Organic Grapes, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Levante, Title: Casa L'Angel 2011 Made with Organic Grapes Red (Valencia), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Casa L'Angel, Region: Valencia, Style1: Red Blend - Levante, Style2: Red Blend - Levante, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: This big-bottled, wax-topped wine blends half Merlot with a quarter each of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. Thick and concentrated in red fruit, it holds back on body somewhat, making way for a soft, likable character with a touch of grit among the definitive red cherry., Designation: Highest Honor, Points: 88.0, Price: 89.0, Province: California, Title: Honor Winery 2012 Highest Honor Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Honor Winery, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: Italy, Description: The top range of wines from this highly rated cooperative is called Sanet Valentin, after the patron saint of lovers. This Sauvignon is crisp, herbaceous and very fresh, with light layers of mouth-watering acidity., Designation: Sanct Valentin, Points: 87.0, Price: 29.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: San Michele Eppan 2002 Sanct Valentin Sauvignon Blanc (Alto Adige), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: San Michele Eppan, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Italy Country: US, Description: This is a new, low-production designation, a selected barrel reserve, from Laurel Glen's new owners. The wine shows an exuberance resulting from the influence of consulting winemaker David Ramey. Massive blackberry, cassis and dark chocolate flavors, wrapped into Sonoma Mountain's strong tannins, make the wine an ideal cellar candidate. Drink 2018 and beyond., Designation: The Laureate, Points: 94.0, Price: 85.0, Province: California, Title: Laurel Glen 2010 The Laureate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Laurel Glen, Region: Sonoma Mountain, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Sonoma Mountain, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Sonoma Mountain Country: France, Description: Peppery and crisp, this is a ripe and fruity wine. A bite of spice and tangy orange zest adds character to the peach and red berry fruits. It's a rich wine that could age, so drink from 2015., Designation: L'Excellence, Points: 91.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Provence, Title: Château Saint-Maur 2014 L'Excellence Rosé (Côtes de Provence), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Château Saint-Maur, Region: Côtes de Provence, Style1: Rosé - Provence, Style2: Rosé - Provence, Style3: Rosé - France Country: US, Description: It's nice to find a well-balanced, fruity but structured wine that's dry and will be very versatile at meals. It has red cherry and cranberry flavors, firm acidity and tannins for grip in the mouth, and a clean finish., Designation: SERVE, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Honor Winery 2013 SERVE Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Honor Winery, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: France, Description: Perfumed, minty wine, very solidly structured, while also showing delicious red berry fruits. The tannins have a distinct mineral character, chewy although well integrated with the fruit., Designation: Prestige, Points: 90.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Château Saint-Sernin 2006 Prestige Malbec (Cahors), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Château Saint-Sernin, Region: Cahors, Style1: Malbec - Southwest France, Style2: Malbec - Southwest France, Style3: Malbec - France Country: Italy, Description: Made with organically farmed grapes, this pretty Tuscan blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot offers a deliciously succulent taste profile with aromas of smoked meat, leather, tobacco and loads of black fruit. It performs majestically in the mouth thanks to its smooth, rich texture., Designation: Ombrone, Points: 93.0, Price: 68.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Cupano 2007 Ombrone Red (Sant'Antimo), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Cupano, Region: Sant'Antimo, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: This Cab opens with soy and molasses and then moves seamlessly into a mouthful of blackberry jam. Dense, it's still young but should develop well., Designation: Garcia Family Vineyard, Points: 88.0, Price: 33.0, Province: California, Title: Most Wanted Winery 2008 Garcia Family Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (California), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Most Wanted Winery, Region: California, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - California Country: US, Description: From the winery's premier vineyard comes this inky, earthy wine with woodsy aromas. Flavors of plum and pie cherry dominate the fruit, along with a definite smoky, charred flavor, perhaps from overroasted barrels., Designation: Pompadour Vineyard, Points: 85.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Weisinger's of Ashland 1999 Pompadour Vineyard Merlot (Rogue Valley), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Weisinger's of Ashland, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Merlot - Oregon, Style2: Merlot - Oregon Other, Style3: Merlot - Oregon Other Country: Argentina, Description: Cola, plum and red-currant aromas set up a tight palate with clamping tannins. Flavors of black cherry, cassis, plum and chocolate are lasting across the finish. This needs hearty food, additional airing or both to show its best., Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled, Points: 88.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Zolo 2015 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Zolo, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Argentina Country: France, Description: This is a spicy wine with mint aromas and rich juicy fruits. It is dense, powerful and concentrated while preserving a sense of proportion and style. Dark wood-aging flavors are still showing and need time to integrate.
