Drink from 2018., Designation: L'Excellence, Points: 91.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Provence, Title: Château Saint-Maur 2013 L'Excellence Red (Côtes de Provence), Variety: Provence red blend, Winery: Château Saint-Maur, Region: Côtes de Provence, Style1: Provence red blend - Provence, Style2: Provence red blend - Provence, Style3: Provence red blend - France"
Can you recommend a red wine that's elegant and well-structured?,"
column3: Description

column2: Quinta de la Rosa 2005 Quinta la Rosa Red (Douro)
column3: A finely textured wine with black tarry fruit, sweet licorice and black currant flavors.

column2: Jean-Claude Boisset 2011 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny)
column3: A soft and opulent wine with a structured, mineral character. Ripe red cherry and black plum flavors pair well with firm, dry tannins.

column2: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island)
column3: A bold but elegantly structured red wine with hints of spice and leather.
A stunning red with alluring scents of blue flower, rose, wild berry and a whiff of new leather.

column2: Casa Ferreirinha 2014 Quinta da Leda Red (Douro)
column3: A very structured, solid wine with enough fruit to develop well.
column9: ,Country: Portugal, Description: A great structured, finely textured wine. The black tarry fruit, sweet licorice and black currant flavors all hang together well, leaving ripeness and feel of elegance., Designation: Quinta la Rosa, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Douro, Title: Quinta de la Rosa 2005 Quinta la Rosa Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Quinta de la Rosa, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: This attractive wine has a fine, dusty structure that balances well with the rich berry fruits. Sweet tannins and layers of acidity meld well. Ripe while also elegant, it needs a short period of aging. Drink from 2015., Designation: Vale das Donas, Points: 88.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Tejo, Title: Quinta do Cavalinho 2012 Vale das Donas Red (Tejo), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Quinta do Cavalinho, Region: Tejo, Style1: Portuguese Red - Tejo, Style2: Portuguese Red - Tejo, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: France, Description: While soft and opulent initially, this wine reveals a structured, mineral character on the palate. Ripe red cherry and black plum flavors pair well with firm, dry tannins and hints of wood aging. This is an elegant wine that needs aging. Don't drink before 2017., Designation: Les Charmes Premier Cru, Points: 93.0, Price: 140.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Jean-Claude Boisset 2011 Les Charmes Premier Cru  (Chambolle-Musigny), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Jean-Claude Boisset, Region: Chambolle-Musigny, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: US, Description: Hints of spice and leather add a savory tone to red cherry and plum flavors in this bold but elegantly structured red wine. The palate is juicy with fruit, but accented with a spray of green herbs and brisk acidity that lend freshness., Designation: Jubilant Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 45.0, Province: New York, Title: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Jamesport, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: Italy, Description: Delicately fragrant and incredibly refined, this stunning red boasts alluring scents of blue flower, rose, wild berry and a whiff of new leather. It's captivatingly ethereal and elegantly structured, offering crushed strawberry, red cherry, cinnamon and white pepper. It's also impeccably balanced thanks to firm polished tannins and bright acidity. While it's already extremely tempting, hold for even more complexity. Drink 2023–2043., Designation: Tre Tine, Points: 97.0, Price: 375.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: Giuseppe Rinaldi 2013 Tre Tine  (Barolo), Variety: Nebbiolo, Winery: Giuseppe Rinaldi, Region: Barolo, Style1: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style2: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style3: Nebbiolo - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: Very structured, this solid wine has enough fruit to develop well. It comes from the estate that also produces Barca Velha in the very top vintages. The wine is full, rich and concentrated. The tannins and structure will take time to soften, so wait until 2020., Designation: Quinta da Leda, Points: 91.0, Price: 65.0, Province: Douro, Title: Casa Ferreirinha 2014 Quinta da Leda Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Casa Ferreirinha, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: Yes, there is some elegance here as well as rich fruit and sweet perfumed juiciness. It's attractively fruity, uncomplex. Screwcap., Designation: Aya Elegant, Points: 84.0, Price: unknown, Province: Alentejano, Title: Logowines 2008 Aya Elegant Red (Alentejano), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Logowines, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style2: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: A lean, cool, initially austere wine, well balanced with red berry fruits and a poised elegant structure. The acidity gives great freshness to go with the structure, making a great food wine., Designation: Reserva, Points: 88.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Douro, Title: Poças 2007 Reserva Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Poças, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Hungary, Description: This Cab blend proves that Hungarian reds are becoming more of a contender on a global level. An enticing wave of pepper and wooded spice on the nose rolls into flavors of juicy red fruit, pepper, raspberry and wood on the tongue. The structure is solid but elegant, so though the wine can age, it's good to drink now. Balanced and stylish overall., Designation: Capella Cuvée, Points: 89.0, Price: 78.0, Province: Villány, Title: Bock 2003 Capella Cuvée Red (Villány), Variety: Cabernet Blend, Winery: Bock, Region: Villány, Style1: Cabernet Blend - Villány, Style2: Cabernet Blend - Villány, Style3: Cabernet Blend - Hungary Country: France, Description: A structured, firm wine showing a great balance of red fruits, dry Bordeaux-style tannins and a freshly jammy texture. For a branded Bordeaux, it has both quality and elegance., Designation: Réserve Spéciale, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite) 2005 Réserve Spéciale  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Domaines Barons de Rothschild (Lafite), Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: US, Description: This majority Merlot, with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, is elegant in sandalwood and cedar, offering a taste of cassis and dried herb atop integrated yet sizable tannins. French oak, half of it new, encased the wine for a little more than two years, adding to its power and structure. Drink now through 2021., Designation: Red, Points: 92.0, Price: 75.0, Province: California, Title: Vellum 2011 Red Merlot-Cabernet (Napa Valley), Variety: Merlot-Cabernet, Winery: Vellum, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Merlot-Cabernet - California, Style2: Merlot-Cabernet - Napa Valley, Style3: Merlot-Cabernet - Napa Valley Country: Italy, Description: This firmly structured velvety red opens with aromas of black currant, French oak, menthol, Asian spice and grilled herb. The full-bodied, elegant palate offers crushed blackberry, succulent morello cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside a backbone of taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2018 through 2027., Designation: La Poja, Points: 93.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Allegrini 2012 La Poja Corvina (Veronese), Variety: Corvina, Winery: Allegrini, Region: Veronese, Style1: Corvina - Veneto, Style2: Corvina - Veneto, Style3: Corvina - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: This structured wine is balanced with great fruit, firm tannins and ripe berry flavors. Drink this impressive wine from 2019., Designation: Cais da Ribeira Reserva, Points: 91.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Douro, Title: Barão de Vilar 2014 Cais da Ribeira Reserva Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Barão de Vilar, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: France, Description: The latest releases from Clos Triguedina aim to create wines for early drinking. Elegant is soft, juicy and fruity—perhaps so soft, it has lost any sense of Malbec character. Even so, it is a gentle red wine that is ready to drink., Designation: Elegant, Points: 84.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2012 Elegant Malbec (Cahors), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Jean-Luc Baldès, Region: Cahors, Style1: Malbec - Southwest France, Style2: Malbec - Southwest France, Style3: Malbec - France Country: US, Description: Very well structured and richly textured, this is a serious red for a special occasion. It has a deep, smoky red color, slightly herbaceous and mineral aromas, generous cherry and raspberry flavors, full body and lots of fine tannins to give a soft bite on the palate. Made from 50% Tinta Roriz, 35% Carmenère, 15% Cabernet Franc., Designation: Trigrammaton, Points: 90.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Rosa d'Oro 2012 Trigrammaton Red (Yolo County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Rosa d'Oro, Region: Yolo, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Yolo, Style3: Red Blend - Yolo"

column1: Can you recommend a red wine with velvety tannins and a long finish?,"
column3: Description
A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, with spicy aromas and a solid fruit core. Well balanced, with velvety tannins and a long, evolving finish.
Starts off a bit stern in texture, but by the long finish those tannins have turned velvety and plush, nicely framing intense flavors.
An elegant, mouthwatering red blend with ripe tannins and a long finish.
Almost entirely Merlot, this Howell Mountain red has a deep core of blackberries and currants, with velvety tannins.
This Bordeaux-style blend is oaky at first, but with a lush, mouthfilling palate and a texture like crushed velvet.
column9: ,Country: South Africa, Description: A blend of 52% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Malbec, 19% Merlot and 7% Cabernet Franc, spicy aromas of leather, black pepper, savory herbs, licorice and Mexican chocolate lead the nose. It's grounded by a solid fruit core of blackberry, boysenberry and mulberry fruit, lending a supporting spine to the toasted spice and earthy accents. Well balanced, with velvety tannins and a long, evolving finish, drink this lush, velvety red from 2018–2024., Designation: Series C, Points: 94.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Paarl, Title: Vilafonté 2012 Series C Red (Paarl), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Vilafonté, Region: Paarl, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: France, Description: Although this wine starts off a bit stern in texture, by the long finish those tannins have turned velvety and plush, nicely framing intense black olive, espresso, cherry and plum flavors. Drink now–2018., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 91.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Tardieu-Laurent 2010 Vieilles Vignes  (Gigondas), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Tardieu-Laurent, Region: Gigondas, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: South Africa, Description: An alluring nose of mint, mocha and blackberry leads into like flavors in this elegant, mouthwatering red blend from Zelma Long. Lush and unfolding, the wine offers ripe tannins and a long finish. Overall, balanced and confident., Designation: Series C, Points: 90.0, Price: 72.0, Province: Paarl, Title: Vilafonté 2005 Series C Red (Paarl), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Vilafonté, Region: Paarl, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: US, Description: Almost entirely Merlot, with a few drops of other Bordeaux varieties, this Howell Mountain red screams for time in the cellar. The tannins bite and dog the mouth through the long, astringent finish. But chew on it for a while and you hit a deep core of blackberries and currants, and the more the wine warms up in the glass, the more impressive it gets. Cellar until 2010, and it should reward for years after., Designation: Red Wine, Points: 95.0, Price: 75.0, Province: California, Title: Duckhorn 2004 Red Wine Red (Howell Mountain), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Duckhorn, Region: Howell Mountain, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Howell Mountain, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Howell Mountain Country: South Africa, Description: This Bordeaux-style blend is oaky at first, with aromas of vanilla, caramel and mocha that slowly mellow and marry with the berry compote, fig and black plum core. The lush, mouthfilling palate has a texture like crushed velvet: rich, seductive and fruity, but with some tannic edge. Nuances of mocha and anise grace the long finish. Drink now–2018., Designation: Signature, Points: 91.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Ernie Els 2009 Signature Red (Stellenbosch), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Ernie Els, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: South Africa, Description: This blend of 48% Merlot, 35% Malbec and 17% Cabernet Sauvignon is plush and accessible, with attractively ripe notes of brambly blackberry, raspberry and cherry on the nose and palate. Soft, spicy tannins lend the wine a crushed-velvet texture, while hints of licorice, vanilla bean, fruitcake spice and black tea add depth to the medium-weight mouthfeel and linger long through the finish. Drinkable now, but should hold well through 2020., Designation: Series M, Points: 92.0, Price: 79.0, Province: Paarl, Title: Vilafonté 2012 Series M Red (Paarl), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Vilafonté, Region: Paarl, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: Italy, Description: This thick, juicy, inky wine (with a large component of Petit Verdot) would pair with aged cheese or pecorino. The wine is still young (let it age five more years) with firm, sticky tannins and loads of blackberry and plum cake on the long finish., Designation: Monteti, Points: 92.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Tenuta Monteti 2006 Monteti Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tenuta Monteti, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Chile, Description: A blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Grande Vidure, 20% Petite Syrah and 10% Merlot, it is as if you can clearly account for each varietal's contribution. Ripe cassis, cherry, plum, and spice flavors are buttressed by well-integrated oak.  Beautifully balanced, it has good acidity and mature tannins, and closes with a long, satisfying finish. Great wine for tonight's grilled T-bone, and worthy of mid-term cellaring ., Designation: Winemaker's Reserve, Points: 91.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Maipo Valley, Title: Carmen 1997 Winemaker's Reserve Red (Maipo Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Carmen, Region: Maipo Valley, Style1: Red Blend - Maipo Valley, Style2: Red Blend - Maipo Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Chile Country: US, Description: A superb tannic-acid structure is allied with complex black currant, grilled meat bone and smoky oak flavors that finish dry, long and spicy. The cépage is Cabernet Sauvignon, Tempranillo, Syrah, Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cabernet Franc, making it one of the most compelling blends available today from Napa Valley. Give it until 2017–2018 in the cellar to begin to mellow., Designation: The Doctor, Points: 93.0, Price: 90.0, Province: California, Title: Krupp Brothers 2011 The Doctor Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Krupp Brothers, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: France, Description: Mainly Grenache (80%, the balance is Syrah) aged entirely in tank, this wine features loads of superripe dark cherries and plums, yet with a savory, olive-and meat-tinged aspect as well. Full-bodied, with a velvety texture and a long finish, it should drink well through at least 2016., Designation: Amadeus, Points: 92.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Vindemio 2009 Amadeus Red (Ventoux), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Vindemio, Region: Ventoux, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: US, Description: This impressively concentrated, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine will be a great match for the next juicy steak or lasagna. It has a thick, inky, red color, attractive cedar and spice aromas, and full flavors like blackberries and pomegranate juice. The thick, velvety tannic feel is perfect for adventurous tastes. It's made with Montepulciano, Sangiovese and Freisa grapes., Designation: Big & Beautiful, Points: 90.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Wargin Wines 2011 Big & Beautiful Red (Solano County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Wargin Wines, Region: Solano, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Solano, Style3: Red Blend - Solano Country: US, Description: Lots of voluptuous softness in the mouth, like velvet gliding over the palate. But you'll also experience serious tannins that hit midway, creating a lockdown astringency. Evidence of ageability lies in the massive core of blackberries and cassis, as well as the overall balance and tang of acidity on the finish. This Cabernet Sauvignon-based Bordeaux blend should hit its stride after 2012 and continue for many years., Designation: Padrone, Points: 94.0, Price: 110.0, Province: California, Title: Signorello 2006 Padrone Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Signorello, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Easy-drinking and elegant is the word on this appealing red blend. On the nose, raspberry, coffee, cedar and spice lead, with rounded flavors, smooth tannins and a long finish following. A versatile wine with food on its mind—think everything from grilled, herbed chicken to a hearty meat stew., Designation: Taste Red, Points: 86.0, Price: 35.0, Province: New York, Title: Bedell 2005 Taste Red Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Bedell, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: Italy, Description: This firmly structured velvety red opens with aromas of black currant, French oak, menthol, Asian spice and grilled herb. The full-bodied, elegant palate offers crushed blackberry, succulent morello cherry, licorice and tobacco alongside a backbone of taut, fine-grained tannins. Drink 2018 through 2027., Designation: La Poja, Points: 93.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Allegrini 2012 La Poja Corvina (Veronese), Variety: Corvina, Winery: Allegrini, Region: Veronese, Style1: Corvina - Veneto, Style2: Corvina - Veneto, Style3: Corvina - Italy Country: US, Description: As the name implies, this is a soft wine, with gentle tannins and acids. It's ripe in cherry and blackberry jam flavors that finish simple and sweet., Designation: Liquid Velvet, Points: 84.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Lockwood 2011 Liquid Velvet Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Lockwood, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California"

column9: ,Country: US, Description: A little too sweet and syrupy, with canned peach and apricot flavors that finish soft and simple., Designation: White Table Wine, Points: 81.0, Price: 9.0, Province: California, Title: Kenwood 2006 White Table Wine White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Kenwood, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: US, Description: Sweet, simple and fruity, with peach and apricot jam flavors. In the mouth, there are flavors of caramelized apple and wet river rock., Designation: Once Upon a Time, Points: 88.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Tokaj, Title: Basilicus 2012 Once Upon a Time White (Tokaj), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Basilicus, Region: Tokaj, Style1: White Blend - Tokaj, Style2: White Blend - Tokaj, Style3: White Blend - Hungary Country: Hungary, Description: A blend of 65% Furmint and 35% Hárslevelu, this Hungarian white has aromas of apricot, peach and pear. It's crisp and fragrant, a fine, ready-to-drink blend of Antão Vaz, Roupeiro and Arinto., Designation: Guadalupe Branco, Points: 86.0, Price: unknown, Province: Alentejano, Title: Quinta do Quetzal 2011 Guadalupe Branco White (Alentejano), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Quinta do Quetzal, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Portuguese White - Alentejano, Style2: Portuguese White - Alentejano, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Spain, Description: Peach and apricot aromas give way to vanilla and resiny oak notes. This blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca is full in body and has taken well to oak. Melon, green banana and wood spice flavors are dry and elegant on the finish. Drink through 2021., Designation: Selección Familia, Points: 90.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Fernández Gómez 2015 Selección Familia White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Fernández Gómez, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Italy, Description: Here's a Cortese-based white wine that rests on the lees for extra texture and richness. The wine is redolent of peach, apricot, honey and exotic fruit. It feels fresh and linear on the close., Designation: White Label, Points: 86.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: La Scolca 2007 White Label  (Gavi), Variety: Cortese, Winery: La Scolca, Region: Gavi, Style1: Cortese - Piedmont, Style2: Cortese - Piedmont, Style3: Cortese - Italy Country: France, Description: A broad, ripe wine, with peach and apricot flavors to go with a fine citrus tang. Full in the mouth, very fruity and attractively textured with green plum skin juiciness., Designation: Princesse de Cleves, Points: 87.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Clos d'Yvigne 2008 Princesse de Cleves White (Bergerac Sec), Variety: Bordeaux-style White Blend, Winery: Clos d'Yvigne, Region: Bergerac Sec, Style1: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Southwest France, Style2: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Southwest France, Style3: Bordeaux-style White Blend - France Country: France, Description: This soft, ripe wine has good apricot and peach flavors alongside the crisper citrus acidity. Drink this peach and apricot-flavored wine from 2019., Designation: Séduction, Points: 92.0, Price: 32.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Château de Jurque 2013 Séduction  (Jurançon), Variety: Petit Manseng, Winery: Château de Jurque, Region: Jurançon, Style1: Petit Manseng - Southwest France, Style2: Petit Manseng - Southwest France, Style3: Petit Manseng - France Country: South Africa, Description: From elegant white producer Paul Cluver, this wine starts with a beautiful nose of fragrant peach, honey and apricot, then unfolds into an enticing balance of lush peach, pineapple and apricot flavors. column1: Is there a wine that is not too dry?,"
column3: Description

column2: Vaeni NV Makedonikos Red Semi-Dry Wine Red (Macedonia)
column3: A fun, fresh Xinomavro from Greece with a balance between easygoing red fruit and a more serious, spicy backbone.
A wine with apricot and orange jam richness, citrus fruit notes and acidity from Sauvignon Blanc, and a lot of new oak.

column2: Willm 2012 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
column3: A ripe and perfumed wine with fruity acidity muted by almonds, ripe pear skins and a tight, mineral texture.
A Tokaji blend with loads of sweet, waxy honeycomb and yellow flower aromas, steely acidity and a tart tangerine flavor.

column2: Hubert Meyer 2011 Winzenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace)
column3: An impressively rich wine with a strong mineral element, currant flavors and intense acidity.
column9: ,Country: Greece, Description: This fun, fresh Xinomavro from Greece maintains poise between easygoing red fruit and a more serious, spicy backbone. Red cherry, strawberry, leather and pepper lead. A great everyday red with some exotic character., Designation: Makedonikos Red Semi-Dry Wine, Points: 88.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Macedonia, Title: Vaeni NV Makedonikos Red Semi-Dry Wine Red (Macedonia), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Vaeni, Region: Macedonia, Style1: Red Blend - Macedonia, Style2: Red Blend - Macedonia, Style3: Red Blend - Greece Country: US, Description: Not really dry, like the label says, but with apricot and orange jam richness. Sauvignon Blanc adds citrus fruit notes and acidity. There's also a lot of new oak. Drink this tasty wine now., Designation: Luvisi Vineyard Dry, Points: 87.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Vermeil 2010 Luvisi Vineyard Dry Sémillon (Calistoga), Variety: Sémillon, Winery: Vermeil, Region: Calistoga, Style1: Sémillon - California, Style2: Sémillon - Calistoga, Style3: Sémillon - Calistoga Country: France, Description: With its ripe and perfumed character, the wine is not quite dry. It's already maturing, with its fruity acidity muted by almonds, ripe pear skins and a tight, mineral texture. This intense wine will be ready by 2015., Designation: Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru, Points: 90.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Willm 2012 Kirchberg de Barr Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Willm, Region: Alsace, Style1: Riesling - Alsace, Style2: Riesling - Alsace, Style3: Riesling - France Country: Hungary, Description: A hefty dose of Muscat makes this Tokaji blend particularly flamboyant on the nose, with loads of sweet, waxy honeycomb and yellow flower aromas. Drink from 2015., Designation: Winzenberg Grand Cru, Points: 90.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Hubert Meyer 2011 Winzenberg Grand Cru Riesling (Alsace), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Hubert Meyer, Region: Alsace, Style1: Riesling - Alsace, Style2: Riesling - Alsace, Style3: Riesling - France Country: France, Description: Not quite dry, this is a creamy apple-flavored wine. Drink now., Designation: Gentil, Points: 84.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Willm 2012 Gentil White (Alsace), Variety: Alsace white blend, Winery: Willm, Region: Alsace, Style1: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style2: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style3: Alsace white blend - France Country: France, Description: Not quite dry, but certainly not medium dry, this is a hard wine to place. The moderately long finish carries a hint of honeysuckle perfume., Designation: Semi-Dry, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: New York, Title: Red Newt Cellars 2012 Semi-Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Red Newt Cellars, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Riesling - New York, Style2: Riesling - New York, Style3: Riesling - New York Country: US, Description: Though it's 100% varietal, this sports a strong floral streak, as if dominated by Gewürztraminer. column1: Looking for a wine that is hand-harvested.,"
column3: Description

column2: Avia 2014 Hand Harvested Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Primorska)
column3: Slovenian Chardonnay with aromas of orange, vanilla, toasted almonds and citrus blossom. Flavors of honeydew melon, pear and apple.

column2: Or Haganuz 2010 Har Sinai Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Galilee)
column3: Full-bodied wine with dusty tannins, dried berry, plum and black cherry fruit. Accents of crushed cocoa nib and balsamic.
Zesty lemon and wet stones on the nose, followed by a complex medley of citrus, passionfruit and carnations. Finishes with punchy notes of lime marmalade and dry chalk.

column2: Bergström 2014 Winery Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains)
column3: Savory notes around strawberry fruit with a slightly metallic minerality. Drying tannins.
Velvety mouthfeel with vibrant dark berry fruit. Hints of vanilla and mint accent the fruit, as does a subtle layer of mocha.
column9: ,Country: Slovenia, Description: This Slovenian Chardonnay has aromas of orange, vanilla, toasted almonds and citrus blossom. The mouth delivers flavors of honeydew melon, pear and apple before a crisp acidic finish., Designation: Hand Harvested Estate Bottled, Points: 87.0, Price: 7.0, Province: Primorska, Title: Avia 2014 Hand Harvested Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Primorska), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Avia, Region: Primorska, Style1: Chardonnay - Primorska, Style2: Chardonnay - Primorska, Style3: Chardonnay - Slovenia Country: Israel, Description: This interesting selection offers something different—after being harvested by hand, the grapes were frozen for three days and then heated on an open olive-wood fire before fermenting. The resulting wine is full-bodied yet soft all at once, with dusty tannins that frame the dried berry, plum and black cherry fruit. Accents of crushed cocoa nib and balsamic grace the medium-length finish., Designation: Har Sinai, Points: 86.0, Price: 39.0, Province: Galilee, Title: Or Haganuz 2010 Har Sinai Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Galilee), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot, Winery: Or Haganuz, Region: Galilee, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot - Galilee, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot - Galilee, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot - Israel Country: Australia, Description: Captivating, with zesty lemon and wet stones on the nose, followed by a complex medley of citrus, passionfruit and carnations on the palate. The wine finishes well, with punchy notes of lime marmalade and dry chalk. Try with smoked trout. Drink now for its vibrant fruit or lay down for a few years for more honeyed depth., Designation: Hand Picked, Points: 90.0, Price: 15.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Knappstein 2008 Hand Picked Riesling (Clare Valley), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Knappstein, Region: Clare Valley, Style1: Riesling - South Australia, Style2: Riesling - South Australia, Style3: Riesling - Australia Country: US, Description: This limited cuvée is made from the smallest block at the estate vineyard. It's entirely hand-farmed, with stem-driven savory notes around strawberry fruit. There's a sense of a slightly metallic minerality threading through, with drying tannins., Designation: Winery Block, Points: 91.0, Price: 75.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Bergström 2014 Winery Block Pinot Noir (Chehalem Mountains), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Bergström, Region: Chehalem Mountains, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Chehalem Mountains, Style3: Pinot Noir - Chehalem Mountains Country: Australia, Description: This wine's velvety mouthfeel sets it apart from the pack, as does the vibrancy of its dark berry fruit. Hints of vanilla and mint accent the fruit without detracting from it, as does a subtle layer of mocha. Long and layered on the finish; drink now–2020., Designation: Hand Picked, Points: 92.0, Price: 31.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Yalumba 2007 Hand Picked Shiraz-Viognier (Barossa), Variety: Shiraz-Viognier, Winery: Yalumba, Region: Barossa, Style1: Shiraz-Viognier - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz-Viognier - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz-Viognier - Australia Country: US, Description: A little sweet and simple, but with lots of charm in the ripe blackberry, cherry and chocolate-covered raisin flavors. The tannins are rich and smooth, the mouthfeel supple., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 86.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2009 Artisan Collection Petite Sirah (California), Variety: Petite Sirah, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Petite Sirah - California, Style2: Petite Sirah - California, Style3: Petite Sirah - California Country: US, Description: HandCraft has been consistently good with this grape, and this complex wine is another excellent example. Intriguing aromas of wood smoke and rosemary lead to concentrated fruit flavors like pomegranate and cranberry. The mouthfeel is layered and nicely tannic, and flavors seem to go deep., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 89.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2014 Artisan Collection Malbec (California), Variety: Malbec, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Malbec - California, Style2: Malbec - California, Style3: Malbec - California Country: US, Description: Looking for a bargain in a good, coastal Pinot Noir? This one is silky, crisp in acidity and pleasurably rich in raspberries, cranberries and herb tea flavors, sweetened with a little brown sugar., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 89.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2012 Artisan Collection Pinot Noir (California), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - California, Style3: Pinot Noir - California Country: US, Description: A rich texture and good, fruity flavors make this light-bodied, low-alcohol wine easy to enjoy. Apple and white peach aromas meet apple flavors and a soft mouthfeel., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2016 Artisan Collection Pinot Grigio (California), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - California, Style3: Pinot Grigio - California Country: US, Description: This is a generous, richly fruity and well-oaked wine that blends almost-jammy cherry and blackberry flavors with sweet-seeming accents like vanilla and cinnamon. It's relatively soft in texture and easy to sip., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 87.0, Price: 9.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2015 Artisan Collection Pinot Noir (California), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - California, Style3: Pinot Noir - California Country: US, Description: Light aromas like canteloupe and flavors like honeydew melon make this wine fruity and easy to enjoy. It's medium bodied, fruity and smooth., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 87.0, Price: 9.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2015 Artisan Collection Pinot Grigio (California), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - California, Style3: Pinot Grigio - California Country: US, Description: Aromas like black pepper, anise and grilled meat lead to nicely tart flavors and a mildly tannic mouthfeel. This spicy-tasting wine is relatively light bodied but has plenty of interesting flavors to explore., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 86.0, Price: 9.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2015 Artisan Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (California), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - California Country: US, Description: Light in body and silky in texture, this easy Pinot Noir offers plenty of varietal character. The raspberry and cherry flavors are spicy and sweet., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 87.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2010 Artisan Collection Pinot Noir (California), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - California, Style3: Pinot Noir - California Country: US, Description: Ripe, jammy, grapy aromas and flavors and a lush but firm texture make this medium-bodied wine instantly appealing and enjoyable to drink. It has nicely concentrated fruit flavors, a sense of depth and a beautiful, velvety texture., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 89.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2013 Artisan Collection Petite Sirah (California), Variety: Petite Sirah, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Petite Sirah - California, Style2: Petite Sirah - California, Style3: Petite Sirah - California Country: US, Description: Soft and buttery, this medium-bodied Chardonnay smells like lemon meringue and tastes lightly sweet like marshmallows and bananas., Designation: Artisan Collection, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: HandCraft 2014 Artisan Collection Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: HandCraft, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California"

column1: Recommend a wine with hints of citrus.,"
column3: Description

column2: Gordon Brothers 1999 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: A well-made wine with tangy citrus flavors, orange rind, grapefruit, good texture, bracing acids, and some spicy complexity in the finish.
A shy nose subtly hints at citrus zest. The palate is alive with fresh and very pure fruit: mirabelle plum and aromatic tangerine.

column2: Belisario 2015 Terre di Val Bona  (Verdicchio di Matelica)
column3: A vibrant, easygoing white wine with flavors of citrus, apple and a hint of bitter almond.
A citrus-laden wine showing fresh fruits right up front. It is bright, crisp and full of lime and lemon flavors.
Absolutely dry and tingly in acidity, this citrus-flavored wine is clean and zesty.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: This well-made wine features tangy flavors of citrus, nicely mingled with orange rind and a hint of grapefruit. Good texture, bracing acids, a food-friendly balance and some spicy complexity in the finish., Designation: Estate Grown, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Washington, Title: Gordon Brothers 1999 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Gordon Brothers, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Chardonnay - Washington, Style2: Chardonnay - Washington, Style3: Chardonnay - Washington Country: Spain, Description: The scent of citrus peel gets this wine started. There's a light spritz to the palate, then bland, salty flavors take over. It offers a hint of citrus on the finish but mostly brine and salt., Designation: Txakolin Gorria Hondarrbia, Points: 83.0, Price: 21.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Hiruzta 2015 Txakolin Gorria Hondarrbia Rosé (Getariako Txakolina), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Hiruzta, Region: Getariako Txakolina, Style1: Rosé - Northern Spain, Style2: Rosé - Northern Spain, Style3: Rosé - Spain Country: France, Description: The nose is shy but subtly hints at citrus zest. The palate comes alive with subtle, fresh and very pure fruit: exquisitely accurate notions of mirabelle plum and beautifully aromatic tangerine. This is pure, streamlined and richly fruited, but done in a subtle grown-up way. A real joy to savor and drink. Finishes dry., Designation: Cuvée 8, Points: 92.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Pfister 2015 Cuvée 8 White (Alsace), Variety: Alsace white blend, Winery: Domaine Pfister, Region: Alsace, Style1: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style2: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style3: Alsace white blend - France Country: Italy, Description: Here's a vibrant, easygoing white wine that offers flavors of citrus, apple and a hint of bitter almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish. It's straightforward but well made and refreshing., Designation: Terre di Val Bona, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Belisario 2015 Terre di Val Bona  (Verdicchio di Matelica), Variety: Verdicchio, Winery: Belisario, Region: Verdicchio di Matelica, Style1: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style2: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style3: Verdicchio - Italy Country: France, Description: Though the vineyard sits at 1,100 feet, hints of tropical fruits give this wine a ripe feel. Pineapple and mango mingle with crisper citrus flavors, yielding a wine that is both fresh and ripe. Drink now., Designation: Vielles Vignes, Points: 86.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Pierre Merguey 2014 Vielles Vignes  (Viré-Clessé), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Pierre Merguey, Region: Viré-Clessé, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: A flinty nose of citrus purity hints that this still requires bottle age, but all the elements of a great wine are present. It offers a bundled concentration of flavor and fruit, and a straight backbone of acidity pervades everything with a sense of purity. Right now, fresh citrus notes of lemon pith, peel and flesh dominate aromatically, but this will blossom. There are already inklings of honey and orange in the background but only time will reveal what cabinet of wonders is hidden here. Drink 2017–2025., Designation: Calcaire, Points: 93.0, Price: 55.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht 2013 Calcaire Riesling (Alsace), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Domaine Zind-Humbrecht, Region: Alsace, Style1: Riesling - Alsace, Style2: Riesling - Alsace, Style3: Riesling - France Country: France, Description: This citrus-laden wine shows its fresh fruits right up front. It is bright, crisp and full of lime and lemon flavors. Spiciness adds extra interest. Drink now., Designation: Terroirs, Points: 86.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot 2014 Terroirs  (Pouilly-Fuissé), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Sangouard-Guyot, Region: Pouilly-Fuissé, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: This crisp, tangy wine is packed with citrus flavors. Brightly textured with a mineral edge, it is fruity, hinting at spice along with a floral, fresh character., Designation: Domaine des Chenevières, Points: 87.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Georges Duboeuf 2014 Domaine des Chenevières  (Mâcon-Villages), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Georges Duboeuf, Region: Mâcon-Villages, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: US, Description: Absolutely dry and tingly in acidity, this citrus-flavored wine is clean and zesty. It's a fine appetizer sipper for cleansing the palate. Serve it with little munchies, like grilled veggies, goat cheese and crackers with crab salad., Designation: Reserve, Points: 84.0, Price: 8.0, Province: California, Title: Oak Grove 2009 Reserve Pinot Grigio (California), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: Oak Grove, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - California, Style3: Pinot Grigio - California Country: France, Description: Hints of dried pear and apple appear on the nose and suggest subtlety but the palate does otherwise: it comes in with bright citrus freshness, recalling lemon oil and candied lemon peel. This is absolutely dry and very sprightly, lively and even exuberant. There is great depth of fruit here that will just evolve. Drink 2017—2030., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 93.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Jean Sipp 2013 Vieilles Vignes Riesling (Alsace), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Domaine Jean Sipp, Region: Alsace, Style1: Riesling - Alsace, Style2: Riesling - Alsace, Style3: Riesling - France Country: France, Description: A bright, citrus flavored wine thart is very crisp and fruity. There is a wonderful shock of acidity that brings out freshness and the herbaceous Sauvignon Blanc flavors. Drink now., Designation: L'Orangerie de Carignan, Points: 85.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Carignan 2012 L'Orangerie de Carignan  (Bordeaux Blanc), Variety: Bordeaux-style White Blend, Winery: Château Carignan, Region: Bordeaux Blanc, Style1: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style White Blend - France Country: France, Description: Citrus and orange zest flavors and bright acids characterize this wine. It's a refreshing selection, and it has a tight texture and pear juice flavor. Age it for 1–2 years., Designation: Les Combottes, Points: 90.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Champy 2010 Les Combottes  (Pernand-Vergelesses), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Champy, Region: Pernand-Vergelesses, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: Youthful lemony color with bright citrusy aromas and hints of smoke, honey and spice. Fresh, juicy, vibrant flavors of moderate intensity leading to a moderately long, soft finish. Good, easy drinking every-day wine., Designation: Gentil, Points: 89.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Hugel 2008 Gentil White (Alsace), Variety: Alsace white blend, Winery: Hugel, Region: Alsace, Style1: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style2: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style3: Alsace white blend - France Country: Chile, Description: Citrus aromas are familiar. Lively and zesty in the mouth, with refreshing acidity. Orange and passion fruit lead the palate, which transitions to grapefruit. Crisp on the finish. Good for an everyday white wine., Designation: Cefiro Reserva, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Casablanca Valley, Title: Viña Casablanca 2010 Cefiro Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Viña Casablanca, Region: Casablanca Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Chile Country: Australia, Description: On the lean, citrusy side, but the flavors of pineapple and lemon are married to hints of vanilla and smoke for added complexity. Could use a touch more flesh, but some will enjoy the crispness., Designation: Citrine, Points: 86.0, Price: 17.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Gemtree 2008 Citrine Chardonnay (McLaren Vale), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Gemtree, Region: McLaren Vale, Style1: Chardonnay - South Australia, Style2: Chardonnay - South Australia, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia"

column1: Recommend a wine with hints of cherry.,"
column3: Description
Aromatic tart cherry with astonishing purity, concentrated and rich texture.

column2: Pascal Aufranc 2012 Les Cerisiers Vieilles Vignes (Juliénas)
column3: Cherry aroma with spice, juicy, forward fruity character, tang of acidity and soft tannins.
Soft, juicy wine with warm, red cherry flavors.
Light and subtle, offers tart cherry fruit with hints of mushroom.
Cherry flavors with tannins and structure that allow the fruit to develop slowly.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: Faint hints of aromatic tart cherry try to burst through the closed nose. The fruit is present on the fresh palate with astonishing purity. There is real concentration and a richer, almost plush texture at the core despite the svelte nature of this wine. A real triumph that expresses pure aromatic red cherry with real elegance. This has beauty, charm, length and authenticity., Designation: Rahn, Points: 92.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Pfister 2013 Rahn Pinot Noir (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Domaine Pfister, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Noir - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Noir - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: France, Description: A slightly confected cherry note on the nose is balanced by hints of crushed stone in this medium-bodied rosé. On the palate, cherries blend with citrus and peppery spice, then finish with mouthwatering flavors and refreshing acidity. Drink now., Designation: Cuvée Royale, Points: 90.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Les Vignerons de Tavel 2016 Cuvée Royale  (Tavel), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Les Vignerons de Tavel, Region: Tavel, Style1: Rosé - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rosé - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rosé - France Country: France, Description: This wine's name translates to “cherry,” and cherries are in its aroma along with spice. The palate shows a juicy, forward fruity character, a tang of acidity and soft tannins. It's a fine wine, but not for long-term aging so drink now and over the next few months., Designation: Les Cerisiers Vieilles  Vignes, Points: 89.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Pascal Aufranc 2012 Les Cerisiers Vieilles  Vignes  (Juliénas), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Pascal Aufranc, Region: Juliénas, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: US, Description: Front-loaded with cherries, watermelons and pomegranates, with hints of violets, vanilla and spices, this is one of the richer, more full-bodied blush wines out there. Great picnic or beach wine., Designation: Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of Syrah, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Gustafson Family 2012 Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of Syrah Rosé (Dry Creek Valley), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Gustafson Family, Region: Dry Creek Valley, Style1: Rosé - California, Style2: Rosé - Dry Creek Valley, Style3: Rosé - Dry Creek Valley Country: US, Description: Cherries and strawberries abound in this elegant wine. Old-vine fruit was fermented and briefly aged in neutral barrels that somehow lend a subtle hint of apple-pie spices to the wine. A perfect late summer sipper., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Oregon, Title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: The Eyrie Vineyards, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: Germany, Description: Hints of umami richness lend savoriness to primary red-cherry and cranberry flavors on this nuanced wine. Supple like silk yet refreshingly mineral, it finishes crisp and clean with lingering wet-granite notes., Designation: Sommerhalde Erste Lage R GG, Points: 90.0, Price: 103.0, Province: Baden, Title: Bernhard Huber 2011 Sommerhalde Erste Lage R GG Spätburgunder (Baden), Variety: Spätburgunder, Winery: Bernhard Huber, Region: Baden, Style1: Spätburgunder - Baden, Style2: Spätburgunder - Baden, Style3: Spätburgunder - Germany Country: US, Description: Hints of spice and leather add a savory tone to red cherry and plum flavors in this bold but elegantly structured red wine. The palate is juicy with fruit, but accented with a spray of green herbs and brisk acidity that lend freshness., Designation: Jubilant Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 45.0, Province: New York, Title: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Jamesport, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: France, Description: Ripe and round, this soft, juicy wine shows just a hint of a more serious tannic structure. It has plenty of acidity to go with its warm, red cherry flavors. Drink now, or better from 2015., Designation: Domaine de la Conseillère, Points: 88.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Vincent 2012 Domaine de la Conseillère  (Juliénas), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Vincent, Region: Juliénas, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: US, Description: Light and subtle, this offers tart cherry fruit with hints of mushroom. The texture and definition somewhat compensate for the overall lightness and lack of depth. It's a graceful, elegant wine best enjoyed young., Designation: Emery, Points: 88.0, Price: 48.0, Province: Oregon, Title: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Emery Pinot Noir, Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: WillaKenzie Estate, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: France, Description: Lightly tannic, this wine is about red cherry and blueberry fruits, along with hints of banana. Fresh and fruity, it offers a balance of acidity and tannins at the end. Drink now., Designation: Grande QV, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Grande QV  (Coteaux Bourguignons), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Vignerons de Bel Air, Region: Coteaux Bourguignons, Style1: Gamay - Burgundy, Style2: Gamay - Burgundy, Style3: Gamay - France Country: France, Description: This wine is all about fresh cherries with only the lightest structure. It would be delicious drunk lightly chilled on a summer day., Designation: Cuvée Rochebonne, Points: 84.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Trenel Fils 2014 Cuvée Rochebonne  (Beaujolais), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Trenel Fils, Region: Beaujolais, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: France, Description: Cherry trees surround the vineyard and it is easy to find those fruit flavors in this wine. Other strong elements are the tannins and structure that allow the fruit to develop slowly. Acidity, black cherries and a layer of spice all go with the dry core. Drink from 2017., Designation: Les Cerisiers, Points: 90.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Pascal Aufranc 2014 Les Cerisiers  (Juliénas), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Pascal Aufranc, Region: Juliénas, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: US, Description: Notes of fresh cherry and raspberry are peppered with hints of tomato leaf and bramble on this savory wine. It's full bodied on the palate, but touches of cranberry give it a brisk, refreshing feel. It finishes with soft, yet slightly astringent tannins., Designation: Reserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 30.0, Province: New York, Title: Lakewood 2010 Reserve Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Lakewood, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Pinot Noir - New York, Style2: Pinot Noir - New York, Style3: Pinot Noir - New York Country: US, Description: Light, tart cherry fruit beckons for further exploration. The ripeness is there, and the wine comes across as clean and elegant in its modest proportions. As it breathes open there is a slight hint of volatility which, for most tasters, will be a plus., Designation: Holstein Vineyard, Points: 89.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Purple Hands 2013 Holstein Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Purple Hands, Region: Dundee Hills, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Dundee Hills, Style3: Pinot Noir - Dundee Hills Country: Spain, Description: Fiery berry and cherry aromas emerge with a hint of milk chocolate. This wine feels high in acidity, with raspberry, tart red plum and spice flavors that finish with citrusy snap and grittiness., Designation: Bordón Reserva, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2007 Bordón Reserva  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Bodegas Franco-Españolas, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain"

column1: Can you suggest a wine from Argentina?,"
column3: Description
Patio/terrace wine with lychee, acacia and green melon aromas and flavors. Plump but refreshing.

column2: Pascual Toso 2006 Magdalena Toso Limited 28 Barrels Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
column3: Stout, dark and rich with aromas of coconut and mint. Blackberry and plum fruit flavors.
Round and simple, with oaky, rustic berry flavors accented by pepper, herbs and tomato.
Smells like a bowl full of berries touched up with spice, vanilla and leather. Flavors of blackberry jam and nutmeg.

column2: Cave Extrême NV South Extrême Extra Brut Sparkling (Argentina)
column3: Chenin Blanc-based bubbly, a touch yeasty and dry. Tastes like a Loire Valley sparkler, with baked apple, apricot and peach pit flavors.
column9: ,Country: Argentina, Description: The ultimate patio/terrace wine has been found, and it's Urban from O. Fournier. True as can be, with lychee, acacia and green melon aromas and flavors, this wine is plump but refreshing, with honest Cafayate character. Maybe the best under-$10 white wine being made in Argentina., Designation: Urban, Points: 87.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Other, Title: O. Fournier 2007 Urban Torrontés (Cafayate), Variety: Torrontés, Winery: O. Fournier, Region: Cafayate, Style1: Torrontés - Other, Style2: Torrontés - Other, Style3: Torrontés - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Bargain hunters need not apply, but if you're looking for a pricey but serious Argentine red, the '06 Magdalena Toso is a fine place to begin. At 70% Malbec and 30% Cab, it's stout, dark and rich. Aromas of coconut and mint announce new French oak, while the density and purity of the blackberry and plum fruit is commendable. Finishes long and ripe, with spice, prune and leather. Good acidity ensures that it will age well for three to five years., Designation: Magdalena Toso Limited 28 Barrels, Points: 92.0, Price: 117.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Pascual Toso 2006 Magdalena Toso Limited 28 Barrels Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza), Variety: Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Pascual Toso, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec-Cabernet Sauvignon - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Roasted on the nose, and also a bit flat and stalky smelling. Feels round and simple, with oaky, rustic berry flavors accented by pepper, herbs and tomato. Falls off to basic on the finish, with leafiness. Cabernet Sauvignon with Merlot, Malbec and Pinot Noir., Designation: Picada 15, Points: 85.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Other, Title: Bodega NQN 2010 Picada 15 Red (Patagonia), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Bodega NQN, Region: Patagonia, Style1: Red Blend - Other, Style2: Red Blend - Other, Style3: Red Blend - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: A good value Cabernet from Argentina? You bet. This one smells like a bowl full of berries touched up with spice, vanilla and leather. It's fresh and ripe in the mouth, with flavors of blackberry jam and nutmeg. Smooth on the finish, it gets things right without pushing the envelope., Designation: Select, Points: 87.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Trivento 2007 Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Trivento, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: If you're looking for a pedestrian but true sparkling wine for under $10, this Chenin Blanc-based bubbly from Argentina is solid, a touch yeasty and dry. It tastes much like a Loire Valley sparkler, with baked apple, apricot and peach pit flavors. On the negative side, it's fairly foamy across the tongue and doesn't have a top-grade mouthfeel., Designation: South Extrême Extra Brut, Points: 84.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Other, Title: Cave Extrême NV South Extrême Extra Brut Sparkling (Argentina), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: Cave Extrême, Region: Argentina, Style1: Sparkling Blend - Other, Style2: Sparkling Blend - Other, Style3: Sparkling Blend - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Rubbery aromas of asphalt vie with berry fruits and hints of green herbs, particularly mint. The palate is big, soupy and round in feel, with herbal flavors of baked plum and raspberry. On the finish, things turn salty and herbal, with roasted overtones., Designation: Felino, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Viña Cobos 2012 Felino Merlot (Mendoza), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Viña Cobos, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Merlot - Mendoza Province, Style2: Merlot - Mendoza Province, Style3: Merlot - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: The Alta Vista single-vineyard wines are among the best in Argentina. This offers a soft, deep, alluring nose with plum, berry, minerality and a hint of rubber and bacon. It's rich, pure and a bit jammy in feel, with saturated blueberry, blackberry, molasses and caramel flavors. A cuddly, long finish confirms this Malbec's outstanding status. Drink through 2018., Designation: Temis Single Vineyard, Points: 94.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Alta Vista 2010 Temis Single Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Alta Vista, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Dry, spicy red-fruit aromas are solid and standard, while the palate is lean but comfortable, with dry, simple cherry flavors accented by a spot of oak-driven vanilla. Good but as regular as they come. Easy to drink., Designation: Saurus Patagonia, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Other, Title: Familia Schroeder 2007 Saurus Patagonia Merlot (Neuquén), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Familia Schroeder, Region: Neuquén, Style1: Merlot - Other, Style2: Merlot - Other, Style3: Merlot - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Tight, snappy aromas of citric red fruit and lemon peel set up a driving, tight palate with brambly berry, spice and herbal flavors. This shows chocolaty oak on the finish and juicy acidity that ensures freshness and long-lasting flavor., Designation: [+], Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Santa Julia 2013 [+] Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Santa Julia, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Quite creamy and sweet on the nose, with marshmallow and candy aromas that are not that convincing. Solid in the mouth, with herbal fruit, chocolate and plump tannins, body and extract. Better in terms of mouthfeel and concentration than flavor. Malbec, with Cabernet, Syrah and Petit Verdot., Designation: Atemporal, Points: 86.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Alta Vista 2007 Atemporal Red (Mendoza), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Alta Vista, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style2: Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style3: Red Blend - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: A mix of floral, tropical and citrus aromas is more than fine. A snappy citric palate is racy and high in cleansing acidity. Citrus flavors are plain and simple, while this is entirely clean and fresh on the finish., Designation: [+], Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Santa Julia 2016 [+] Pinot Grigio (Mendoza), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: Santa Julia, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Pinot Grigio - Mendoza Province, Style2: Pinot Grigio - Mendoza Province, Style3: Pinot Grigio - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Solid and broad on the nose, with black cherry, berry and controlled rubbery aromas. Fresh, juicy and healthy on the palate, with good drive and dark, toasty flavors of black fruits, spice and chocolate. Spicy, warm and a bit complex on the finish. Malbec with Cab Sauvignon and Syrah; drink now., Designation: Finca, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Qaramy 2005 Finca Red (Mendoza), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Qaramy, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style2: Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style3: Red Blend - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Horsey plum and pie cherry aromas include a whiff of latex gloves and Band-Aid. This feels rather raw and acidic, with bite. Salty sharp red-fruit flavors finish herbal, with tartaric shear., Designation: [+], Points: 84.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Santa Julia 2016 [+] Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Santa Julia, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Compact dark-fruit aromas turn more jammy with airing. This is gripping in feel, with firm tannins. Flavors of spice, herbs and  black fruits finish with pronounced acidity, leftover tannins and a leathery accent., Designation: [+], Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Santa Julia 2012 [+] Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Santa Julia, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: Opens with mildly baked aromas but there's enough fresh fruit, fine herbs and lavender to make it inviting. The palate is narrow and tight but clean and lively, with herbal berry flavors and plenty of power. Finishes long but lean, with cleansing acids. Will go well with an array of foods., Designation: Dos Fincas, Points: 88.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Carlos Basso 2009 Dos Fincas Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec, Winery: Carlos Basso, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon-Malbec - Argentina"

column1: Suggest a wine from a winery known for its sustainable practices.,"
column3: Description

column2: Barker's Marque 2015 Arona Certified Sustainable Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
column3: Certified Sustainable wine with “good green” notes of snow pea, a hint of struck flint and tart pineapple flavors. Light in body, but concentrated in flavor.

column2: Zolo 2015 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
column3: Cola, plum and red-currant aromas with flavors of black cherry, cassis, plum and chocolate. Needs hearty food, additional airing or both to show its best.

column2: Clos La Chance 2013 The Vegan Vine Chardonnay (Central Coast)
column3: Offers aromas of wet granite and fermenting apples. The flavors are similar, showing pear, slate and green-apple skins.

column2: Makulu NV Sustainable Agriculture Perlè Moscato (Western Cape)
column3: A spritzy and effervescent selection, with inherent sweet fruit aromas and flavors of guava, peach and mushy pear. Ideal for a warm summer day by the pool, served very cold.

column2: Cono Sur 2008 Sustainable Agriculture Pinot Noir (Colchagua Valley)
column3: Strawberry and tomato aromas are hot and edgy. The palate is snappy and not short on acid, while it tastes of spiced red plum, tea and herbs.
column9: ,Country: New Zealand, Description: Certified Sustainable applies to almost all New Zealand wines these days, so it's a bit of a gimmick to place it so prominently on the label, but what's in the bottle is very good. It's got those “good green” notes of snow pea, a hint of struck flint and tart pineapple flavors that linger on the finish. It's only light in body, but concentrated in flavor., Designation: Arona Certified Sustainable, Points: 89.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Marlborough, Title: Barker's Marque 2015 Arona Certified Sustainable Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Barker's Marque, Region: Marlborough, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Marlborough, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Marlborough, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - New Zealand Country: New Zealand, Description: This is clearly labeled as ""Certified Sustainable,"" although, to be fair, a lot of other New Zealand wines are also sustainably produced. Once past the labeling, 's a light- to medium-bodied wine, with slightly vegetal notes of nettles and garden peas that add nuance to refreshing citrus flavors., Designation: Three Brooms Single Vineyard Certified Sustainable, Points: 89.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Marlborough, Title: Barker's Marque 2014 Three Brooms Single Vineyard Certified Sustainable Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Barker's Marque, Region: Marlborough, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Marlborough, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Marlborough, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - New Zealand Country: Argentina, Description: Cola, plum and red-currant aromas set up a tight palate with clamping tannins. Flavors of black cherry, cassis, plum and chocolate are lasting across the finish. This needs hearty food, additional airing or both to show its best., Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled, Points: 88.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Zolo 2015 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Zolo, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Argentina Country: Argentina, Description: After rubbery, dark-fruit aromas set things up, the palate feels racy and forward, with dark berry, spice and peppery flavors. It feels solid on the finish, while the fruit character holds on for a good while. Readily available, with 300,000 cases made., Designation: Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled, Points: 87.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Zolo 2012 Sustainably Farmed Estate Grown and Bottled Malbec (Mendoza), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Zolo, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: US, Description: Basketball star John Salley is the spokesman for this eco-minded project by Clos La Chance. The wine offers aromas of wet granite and fermenting apples. The flavors are similar, showing pear, slate and green-apple skins., Designation: The Vegan Vine, Points: 85.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Clos La Chance 2013 The Vegan Vine Chardonnay (Central Coast), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Clos La Chance, Region: Central Coast, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Central Coast, Style3: Chardonnay - Central Coast Country: South Africa, Description: A spritzy and effervescent selection, the carbonation helps to lift the inherent sweet fruit aromas and flavors of guava, peach and mushy pear. An ideal choice for a warm summer day by the pool, served very cold., Designation: Sustainable Agriculture Perlè, Points: 84.0, Price: 7.0, Province: Western Cape, Title: Makulu NV Sustainable Agriculture Perlè Moscato (Western Cape), Variety: Moscato, Winery: Makulu, Region: Western Cape, Style1: Moscato - Western Cape, Style2: Moscato - Western Cape, Style3: Moscato - South Africa Country: US, Description: A brisk, brusque, tannic wine whose rusticity calls for easy fare, like backyard barbecue or even fast-food burgers. It's dry and full-bodied, a country-style blend with deep flavors of blackberries and tobacco. The price is fair., Designation: Sustainable White, Points: 84.0, Price: 11.0, Province: California, Title: Parducci 2006 Sustainable White Red (Mendocino County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Parducci, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Mendocino, Style3: Red Blend - Mendocino Country: Chile, Description: Strawberry and tomato aromas are hot and edgy. The palate is snappy and not short on acid, while it tastes of spiced red plum, tea and herbs. Peppery and herbal on the finish, and zesty all the way through., Designation: Sustainable Agriculture, Points: 84.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Colchagua Valley, Title: Cono Sur 2008 Sustainable Agriculture Pinot Noir (Colchagua Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Cono Sur, Region: Colchagua Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Colchagua Valley, Style2: Pinot Noir - Colchagua Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Chile Country: US, Description: Unbelievable that there's no oak on this Chardonnay. It's so rich and creamy in vanilla, tangerine, peach and apricot flavors, you won't miss that hit of buttered toast. The acidity is marvelous., Designation: Un-Oaked Sustainable Farming, Points: 91.0, Price: 16.0, Province: California, Title: Sorelle Per Sempre 2010 Un-Oaked Sustainable Farming Chardonnay (Central Coast), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Sorelle Per Sempre, Region: Central Coast, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Central Coast, Style3: Chardonnay - Central Coast Country: US, Description: Bonterra sources organically grown grapes from both Mendocino and Lake counties to craft this light, slightly sour white generous in kiwi and a pronounced aroma and taste of honeydew., Designation: Made With Organic Grapes, Points: 86.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Bonterra 2013 Made With Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino-Lake), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Bonterra, Region: Lake-Mendocino, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Lake-Mendocino, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Lake-Mendocino Country: Chile, Description: A little sweet and easy up front, with aromas of air freshener and tropical fruits. The palate is round, lightly spritzy and endowed with flavors of apple, lime and kiwi. Long and quite fresh on the finish, with a hint of lasting sweetness., Designation: Sustainable Agriculture, Points: 87.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Casablanca Valley, Title: Cono Sur 2008 Sustainable Agriculture Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Cono Sur, Region: Casablanca Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Chile Country: France, Description: From a vineyard run on biodynamic principles, this wine boasts good, fresh fruit, with great green, crisp acidity and green plum intensity. It's very lively and fresh, but full-bodied., Designation: Domaine de la Boissoneuse, Points: 87.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Jean-Marc Brocard 2005 Domaine de la Boissoneuse  (Chablis), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Jean-Marc Brocard, Region: Chablis, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Australia, Description: Sold in 1-liter Tetra Prisma packaging meant to reduce greenhouse emissions, this is an ecofriendly wine that tastes good. Its bouquet is its strongest asset, offering floral, perfumy notes of white pepper and rhubarb, while the palate is on the light side for Shiraz, but clean and supple. Drink now., Designation: Organic, Points: 85.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Australia Other, Title: Green Path 2006 Organic Shiraz (South Eastern Australia), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Green Path, Region: South Eastern Australia, Style1: Shiraz - Australia Other, Style2: Shiraz - Australia Other, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Spain, Description: Ripe blackberry aromas combat raisin and prune scents in this concentrated four-grape blend. Its black fruit flavors include black tea and savory spice notes, finishing with medium-hard tannins and distinct oak characteristics. Drink through 2019., Designation: Viticultura Ecológica, Points: 89.0, Price: 37.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Roque Colás 2012 Viticultura Ecológica Red (Calatayud), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Roque Colás, Region: Calatayud, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: A rich Chardonnay, with plenty to offer. It's creamy and smooth in the mouth, with dry flavors of citrus, tropical fruit, vanilla and buttered toast, and brisk, clean acidity., Designation: Sustainably Grown, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Hill Wine Company 2010 Sustainably Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Hill Wine Company, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Napa Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Napa Valley"

column1: I'm searching for a white wine that's zesty with grapefruit or lemon zest notes. Any suggestions?,"
column3: Description
Zesty grapefruit and other citrus aromas. Citric and juicy palate with flavors of orange and tangerine.
Dry blend with zesty grapefruit and lemon flavors edged with white tea leaves.

column2: Macari 2013 Dos Aguas White (North Fork of Long Island)
column3: Zesty and fragrant with notes of grapefruit and citrus blossom. Juicy and fresh with a focused edge of acidity.

column2: Buttonwood Farm 2007 Zingy Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
column3: Zingy, dry, crisp Sauvignon Blanc. The lemon, lime, grapefruit and spice flavors cleanse the palate.
Pale straw-colored with aromas of lemon zest and grapefruit. Flavors recall lemon, grapefruit and white peach.
column9: ,Country: Spain, Description: Grapefruit and other citrus aromas are zesty but standard. That's also how the palate comes across: citric and juicy, but average. Flavors of orange and tangerine finish fresh but continue the one-note theme., Designation: Rosa Nautica, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: La Gitana 2014 Rosa Nautica White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: La Gitana, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: This dry light-footed blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Blanc and Pinot Gris offers zesty grapefruit and lemon flavors edged with white tea leaves. This hints at sour lemon and grapefruit flavors while bringing in sweeter lime and melon notes. It is well balanced and there's a nice zest to the finish., Designation: 1827, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Moldova, Title: Purcari 2015 1827 Sauvignon Blanc (Moldova), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Purcari, Region: Moldova, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Moldova, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Moldova, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Moldova Country: Spain, Description: Aromas of citrus, especially white grapefruit and lime, are spunky and sweaty like Sauvignon Blanc or Verdejo. This is Macabeo, Garnacha Blanca and Pedro Ximénez., Designation: Òlbia, Points: 88.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Marco Abella 2014 Òlbia White (Priorat), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Marco Abella, Region: Priorat, Style1: White Blend - Catalonia, Style2: White Blend - Catalonia, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Moldova, Description: Aromas of lemon zest, lemongrass and lime juice prepare the palate for flavors of freshly squeezed grapefruit juice, tart apple and white peach.
