Drink now through 2020., Designation: Spätlese, Points: 88.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Dr. Volkmar 2015 Spätlese Riesling (Rheinhessen), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Dr. Volkmar, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: Riesling - Rheinhessen, Style2: Riesling - Rheinhessen, Style3: Riesling - Germany"

column1: Can you recommend a red wine that's velvety with a hint of mocha or coffee notes?,"
column3: Description
Sweet berry jam and mocha flavors, dessert-like.
Blend of Sangiovese and Cabernet Sauvignon with black berries, cedar, spice, and hint of meat juices. Dense black cherry and black berry flavors along with vanilla, espresso and chocolate notes.
Mocha notes with supporting fruit elements of raspberry and cherry flesh. Medium weight with a touch of bitter fruit-skin flavors.
Modern, soft and velvety in texture, chocolaty Sangiovese-Cab blend with hints of Amaretto, soy sauce and pipe tobacco. Bright fruit tones, chewy consistency and long-lasting menthol freshness.

column2: Januik 2013 Ciel du Cheval Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
column3: Aromas of cocoa, vanilla, coffee bean and dark cherry. The coffee and cherry flavors show exquisite polish and depth, with fruit and barrel flavors playing off each other on the finish.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: So sweet in berry jam and mocha flavors, it's basically a dessert wine. Drink now., Designation: Le Volte, Points: 87.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Ornellaia 2014 Le Volte Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Ornellaia, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Aromas of Mediterranean herb, espresso, mocha and a balsamic note slowly take shape. Drink 2020–2028., Designation: Lupi e Sirene, Points: 90.0, Price: 100.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Podere Le Ripi 2012 Lupi e Sirene  (Brunello di Montalcino), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Podere Le Ripi, Region: Brunello di Montalcino, Style1: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style2: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style3: Sangiovese - Italy Country: Italy, Description: A 50-50 blend of Sangiovese and Merlot, this dense, extracted wine opens with aromas of vanilla, new oak, ripe black fruit, mocha and roasted coffee beans. It's still resting heavily on its oak so give it a few years to integrate., Designation: Siepi, Points: 91.0, Price: 120.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Mazzei 2012 Siepi Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Mazzei, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: This red blend from Umbria offers a decadent bouquet that consists of rich chocolate and bright cherry intensity. column3: Description
A clean and pristine white wine with bright fruit notes of peach, pear and citrus, and a very attractive mineral tone.

Made Sancerre-style, it leaves behind a spicy, fruity aftertaste., Designation: Selections, Points: 87.0, Price: 19.0, Province: California, Title: Andretti 2006 Selections Fumé Blanc (North Coast), Variety: Fumé Blanc, Winery: Andretti, Region: North Coast, Style1: Fumé Blanc - California, Style2: Fumé Blanc - North Coast, Style3: Fumé Blanc - North Coast Country: US, Description: Lots of fresh apple flavors, a crisp balance and smooth mouthfeel make this light-bodied wine refreshing and fun to drink. It has some richness on the midpalate and finish, but basically keeps its lively, tangy personality going., Designation: Fresh Crisp Clean, Points: 89.0, Price: 17.0, Province: California, Title: Avant 2014 Fresh Crisp Clean Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Avant, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California Country: Portugal, Description: The merest prickle on the tongue adds to the freshness of this crisp, clean, lightly sweet wine. Very fruity, it conveys apples and citrus, with a soft, fragrant aftertaste., Designation: Salsus, Points: 85.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Salsus White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Wines & Winemakers, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: Pinot Grigio and Verduzzo are blended to shape a fresh and luminous white wine that would pair with seafood or light chicken dishes. The wine is clean and sharp on the palate with zesty acidity on the close., Designation: Masianco, Points: 87.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Masi 2009 Masianco White (Delle Venezie), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Masi, Region: Delle Venezie, Style1: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Clean and crisp, this Sauvignon Blanc-Sémillon blend has flavors of lemons, limes, pineapples and spices. It's technically dry, but finishes with honeysuckle sweetness., Designation: Virtú, Points: 87.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: St. Supéry 2007 Virtú White (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style White Blend, Winery: St. Supéry, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style White Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Napa Valley Country: Italy, Description: Made from a blend of native grapes Insolia and Grecanico, this is a light-bodied but refreshing wine that recalls lemon zest, peach and green apple. Fresh acidity gives it a clean, bright finish. Pair this with vegetarian appetizers., Designation: Bianco, Points: 85.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Sicily & Sardinia, Title: Corvo 2013 Bianco White (Terre Siciliane), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Corvo, Region: Terre Siciliane, Style1: White Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style2: White Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: South Africa, Description: Clean, minerally, but with a spin of spice, the nose on this Chenin suggests fun. On the palate, a good balance of acid and body showcases the wine's citrus and honey flavors. Over all, a great everyday white., Designation: Cape White, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Coastal Region, Title: The Yellow Cellar 2007 Cape White Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: The Yellow Cellar, Region: Coastal Region, Style1: Chenin Blanc - Coastal Region, Style2: Chenin Blanc - Coastal Region, Style3: Chenin Blanc - South Africa Country: Spain, Description: Clean, minerally and subtle on the nose, with apple notes. The palate is crisp and honest, with normal, likable apple and citrus flavors. Just fleshy enough on the finish, with good length and acidity., Designation: Blanco, Points: 88.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Real Compañia de Vinos 2010 Blanco White (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Real Compañia de Vinos, Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Style1: White Blend - Central Spain, Style2: White Blend - Central Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Portugal, Description: It takes a while for the taste of this light, fresh white to come through. Then, it is soft, creamy textured, flavored with pear juice and lemon zest. It is simple, easy, cleanly made., Designation: Portada Branco, Points: 84.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Estremadura, Title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Portada Branco White (Estremadura), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: DFJ Vinhos, Region: Estremadura, Style1: Portuguese White - Estremadura, Style2: Portuguese White - Estremadura, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: Deliciously crisp and fruity, this is a bright, clean style of wine not showing much terroir character but is fresh and full of citrus fruits. The acidity gives a refreshing lift at the end., Designation: Contraste Branco, Points: 85.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Douro, Title: Conceito Vinhos 2013 Contraste Branco White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Conceito Vinhos, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: US, Description: If you like a little sugary sweetness in your white wines, this is a good one. It's crisp in acidity and very clean, with pie-filling flavors of pineapples, apricots, green apples, vanilla and honeysuckles., Designation: High Serenity Ranch, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Brassfield 2007 High Serenity Ranch Pinot Grigio (High Valley), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: Brassfield, Region: High Valley, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - High Valley, Style3: Pinot Grigio - High Valley Country: South Africa, Description: Fresh meets floral in this elegant blend. On the nose, there's perky citrus and delicate flowers. The flavors are an excellent balance of minerality and fruit, with a rich, round but delicate overall character that's intriguing and unfolds on the tongue. The finish is clean and cool. A versatile, sophisticated white., Designation: White Wine, Points: 91.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Swartland, Title: Sequillo 2006 White Wine White (Swartland), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Sequillo, Region: Swartland, Style1: White Blend - Swartland, Style2: White Blend - Swartland, Style3: White Blend - South Africa"

column1: What's a red wine that's complex with layers of dark fruit and spices?,"Title: Château de Chambert 2010 Grand Vin Malbec (Cahors)
Summary: A rich, complex wine with dark fruits, rich tannins, and layers of berries. It exudes power and density with a sense of fine tannin suspended in the texture of the wine.
Variety: Malbec
Country: France
Region: Cahors
Winery: Château de Chambert

Province: Southwest France","Country: France, Description: A very rich wine, spicy and complex. Dark fruits, rich tannins and layers of berries, exuding power and density. There is a sense of fine tannin as well, suspended in the texture of the wine. Firm and solid and with a great aging potential. Drink from 2019., Designation: Grand Vin, Points: 93.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Château de Chambert 2010 Grand Vin Malbec (Cahors), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Château de Chambert, Region: Cahors, Style1: Malbec - Southwest France, Style2: Malbec - Southwest France, Style3: Malbec - France Country: South Africa, Description: A stunning wine loaded with nuance and complexity, Fusion V is a blend of 56% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Cabernet Franc, 12% Malbec, 7% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot. Spicy accents of leather, tobacco and cured meat add intrigue to the dark fruit core, while pepper and sweet licorice spice infuse the long finish. It's textured like crushed velvet with a firm structure of dusty tannins that linger. Drink now–2014., Designation: Fusion V, Points: 93.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: De Toren 2008 Fusion V Red (Stellenbosch), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: De Toren, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: Israel, Description: A delicious vintage of Grand Vin, this wine shows great depth and drinkability now with the promise to age gracefully for at least another five years thanks to a ripe fruit center, medium acidity, structured tannins and superb overall balance. Black fruit and leathery spice dominate, with additional notes of black tea, licorice root, cassis and espresso grinds all fleshing out the complex and layered palate., Designation: Grand Vin, Points: 91.0, Price: 70.0, Province: Haut-Judeé, Title: Domaine du Castel 2007 Grand Vin Red (Haut-Judeé), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Domaine du Castel, Region: Haut-Judeé, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Haut-Judeé, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Haut-Judeé, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Israel Country: Spain, Description: Complex and showing so much of what we love about Ribera del Duero. Baking spices, mature fruit and leather grace the stately bouquet, while the palate sings a pretty tune of berries, plum and brown sugar. There's thrust and potency to the mouthfeel but also a toasty, rich, mocha character. Drinking good now but should hold in there for another five to eight years., Designation: Gran Reserva, Points: 92.0, Price: 75.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Alidis 2001 Gran Reserva  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Alidis, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: South Africa, Description: A layered and complex wine, the 2009 Fusion V is one remarkable selection that's delicious now, although it certainly shows the stuffing to age well for another three to five years, at least. Forward sweet-oak notes marry harmoniously with black-fruit aromas on the nose. The robust, dense palate offers ripe flavors of cassis, blackberry and plum, with accents of leather, tobacco and licorice that linger long into the finish. Chewy, gripping tannins provide a firm structure, framing the full fruit flavors., Designation: Fusion V, Points: 94.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: De Toren 2009 Fusion V Red (Stellenbosch), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: De Toren, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: Italy, Description: This is elegant and layered, with notes of savory smoked meat, spice, dark fruit, blackberry and leather. It shows a very dark, brooding and masculine personality with polished tannins and impressive length., Designation: Farnito, Points: 92.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Carpineto 2007 Farnito Cabernet Sauvignon (Toscana), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Carpineto, Region: Toscana, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Tuscany, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Tuscany, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: Dark, brooding and still tough, this powerful wine has layers of spice, black plum skins and dense tannins. Wood aging has added further tannins to this already dry and tough wine. Give it at least two years and drink from 2017., Designation: Vila Santa, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Alentejano, Title: J. Portugal Ramos 2013 Vila Santa Syrah (Alentejano), Variety: Syrah, Winery: J. Portugal Ramos, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Syrah - Alentejano, Style2: Syrah - Alentejano, Style3: Syrah - Portugal Country: France, Description: Big, spicy wine with its dark tannins and black fruit. Dark chocolate flavors go with the fruit, a rich and complex array of flavors that bring in herbs and spices as well as wood. Age for another 1–2 years., Designation: Les Clos, Points: 90.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Provence, Title: Henri Milan 2006 Les Clos Red (Les Baux de Provence), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Henri Milan, Region: Les Baux de Provence, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Provence, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Provence, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: Spain, Description: Loamy berry and saucy notes make for a complex bouquet, while the mouthfeel on this Catalonian blend is smooth, round, precise and structured. Flavors of ripe plum, herbs, licorice and savory spices finish dark, chunky and deep, with lasting cocoa and cherry notes that suggest warmth and richness. Drink through 2019., Designation: Grans Muralles, Points: 93.0, Price: 150.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Torres 2008 Grans Muralles Red (Conca de Barberà), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Torres, Region: Conca de Barberà, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Greece, Description: The nose on this layered Merlot offers dark cherry, cocoa and spice aromas. Cedar, cigarbox, cherry and chocolate on the palate are balanced with a clean, chalky mouthfeel. The wine can age but has appeal now, and a serious focus., Designation: Château Julia, Points: 88.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Drama, Title: Domaine Costa Lazaridi 2008 Château Julia Merlot (Drama), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Domaine Costa Lazaridi, Region: Drama, Style1: Merlot - Drama, Style2: Merlot - Drama, Style3: Merlot - Greece Country: France, Description: With the concentration that comes from old vines, this is a rich wine intense with black-fruit flavors. It offers layers of wood and spice, with tannins and a dense texture that mean it is only just ready to drink. Rich and dark, it will be better from 2017., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 89.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Pierre Labet 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Bourgogne), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Domaine Pierre Labet, Region: Bourgogne, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: US, Description: This wine forms a beautiful union of sweet, spicy oak with dark, brooding fruit and black-pepper flavors from the grapes. It smells complex and spicy, like cinnamon, clove and cedar backed by concentrated flavors of black cherry, pepper and clove. Built to age, this will drink best after 2019., Designation: The Unknown, Points: 93.0, Price: 34.0, Province: California, Title: Shane Wines 2012 The Unknown Syrah (Sonoma County), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Shane Wines, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - Sonoma, Style3: Syrah - Sonoma Country: Argentina, Description: This wine needs air in order to get at its dark-fruit aromas. In the mouth, this blend of Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cab Franc is ripe but smacks down hard with tannins. Flavors of blackberry, cassis and herbs end with complex notes of graphite and chalk. This gets better the more time you spend with it. Drink through 2024., Designation: Legado IV Siglos, Points: 92.0, Price: 39.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Don Manuel Villafañe 2009 Legado IV Siglos Red (Mendoza), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Don Manuel Villafañe, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Argentina Country: Austria, Description: Inky, floral depth with the spice of French oak leads to a fullish but toned body full of dark elderberry and plum fruits. There's a dark, brooding subtext despite the obviously mellowing oak flavors and a core of spice that will fulfil its promise with some further time in bottle. The concentrated power here comes from partially dried grapes. The tannins are pliable and supple. Enjoy as of 2016., Designation: Tricata, Points: 90.0, Price: 89.0, Province: Weinland Österreich, Title: Juris 2011 Tricata Red (Weinland Österreich), Variety: Austrian Red Blend, Winery: Juris, Region: Weinland Österreich, Style1: Austrian Red Blend - Weinland Österreich, Style2: Austrian Red Blend - Weinland Österreich, Style3: Austrian Red Blend - Austria Country: US, Description: Lots of pepper and spice in this dry, briary red blend. Could be Zinfandel, except it's not. The components are Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. A good value for a wine this complex and delicious., Designation: Lo Scuro, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Barber 2009 Lo Scuro Red (Sonoma County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Barber, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Sonoma, Style3: Red Blend - Sonoma"
Can you suggest a wine from Italy?,"
column3: Description

column2: Terredora 2009 Loggia della Serra  (Greco di Tufo)
column3: A cool Italian white with aromas of pear and peach with a crisp, lemony finish.
A well structured and creamy rosé with enticing aromas of raspberry and cranberry jelly.
An easy-to-drink red that pairs well with pizza and simple pasta dishes.
A very aromatic dessert wine with rich and extremely fragrant flavors.
A white wine with excellent structure and softness for easy food pairing.
column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: If you're itching to spend an afternoon sipping a cool Italian white by the pool or on your back porch with friends, here is your wine. Southern Italy's answer to quality Pinot Grigio, this luminous Greco offers aromas of pear and peach with a crisp, lemony finish., Designation: Loggia della Serra, Points: 87.0, Price: unknown, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Terredora 2009 Loggia della Serra  (Greco di Tufo), Variety: Greco, Winery: Terredora, Region: Greco di Tufo, Style1: Greco - Southern Italy, Style2: Greco - Southern Italy, Style3: Greco - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Here's a well structured and creamy rosé from Calabria, southern Italy, that opens with a bright pink color and enticing aromas of raspberry and cranberry jelly. Thanks to that extra density, you could pair this wine with roast chicken or pork chops., Designation: Rosato, Points: 85.0, Price: unknown, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Librandi 2009 Rosato Rosé (Cirò), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Librandi, Region: Cirò, Style1: Rosé - Southern Italy, Style2: Rosé - Southern Italy, Style3: Rosé - Italy Country: Italy, Description: This Calabrian rosé made from the native Gaglioppo grape exhibits fine notes of sweet berry, raspberry and blueberry. Bright in color and density, this is very nice wine from southern Italy that is clean and bright, but not banal., Designation: Ronco dei Quattroventi, Points: 86.0, Price: unknown, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Fattoria San Francesco 2007 Ronco dei Quattroventi Rosé (Cirò), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Fattoria San Francesco, Region: Cirò, Style1: Rosé - Southern Italy, Style2: Rosé - Southern Italy, Style3: Rosé - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Bardolino is an easy-to-drink red from northern Italy that pairs well with pizza and simple pasta dishes. This example offers medium intensity of red fruit aromas and has a light, watery feel in the mouth., Designation: Prunea, Points: 84.0, Price: unknown, Province: Veneto, Title: Aldegheri 2006 Prunea  (Bardolino Classico), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Aldegheri, Region: Bardolino Classico, Style1: Red Blend - Veneto, Style2: Red Blend - Veneto, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Here's a very aromatic dessert wine (made from dried grapes) from the Marche region of central Italy with soapy aromas of scented candle and florists' shop. It has very rich and extremely fragrant flavors that last a long time., Designation: Dorato, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Central Italy, Title: Garofoli 2006 Dorato White (Marche), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Garofoli, Region: Marche, Style1: White Blend - Central Italy, Style2: White Blend - Central Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: American wine lovers should definitely make an effort to seek and taste Pinot Bianco, a white wine from northern Italy. The variety has excellent structure and softness for easy food pairing and offers measured tones of peach and melon that won't interfere with delicate seafood dishes., Designation: Weisshaus, Points: 87.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Colterenzio 2007 Weisshaus Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige), Variety: Pinot Bianco, Winery: Colterenzio, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Pinot Bianco - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Pinot Bianco - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Pinot Bianco - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Forget Pinot Grigio and try this wonderful white wine from central Italy. Passerina, a little-known native grape, offers crisp sassiness and bright aromas of kiwi, citrus and passion fruit. There's loads of fresh personality here., Designation: Villa Prandone Cavaceppo, Points: 87.0, Price: unknown, Province: Central Italy, Title: Il Conte 2009 Villa Prandone Cavaceppo Passerina (Marche), Variety: Passerina, Winery: Il Conte, Region: Marche, Style1: Passerina - Central Italy, Style2: Passerina - Central Italy, Style3: Passerina - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Here's a fresh and bright rosé from Central Italy with a delicate bouquet of wild flowers and forest berry. The wine is luminous, pristine and would pair with appetizers or light summer pasta or chicken curry salad. In the mouth, the wine tastes fresh, crisp and clean., Designation: Cerasuolo, Points: 87.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Talamonti 2009 Cerasuolo  (Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Cerasuolo), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Talamonti, Region: Montepulciano d'Abruzzo Cerasuolo, Style1: Rosé - Central Italy, Style2: Rosé - Central Italy, Style3: Rosé - Italy Country: Italy, Description: This screwcap red blend from northern Italy offers a fantastic little package at a very attractive low price. Pristine aromas of red berry and white cherry are offset by subtle shadings of sweet spice and crushed mineral. The wine drinks very well., Designation: Intaglio, Points: 88.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: La Vis 2009 Intaglio Red (Trentino), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: La Vis, Region: Trentino, Style1: Red Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Red Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Here's a great deal from central Italy. Dark with mature fruit and spice, this easy red wine would pair with pork or white meat. It offers a pleasing touch of rich sweetness on the close., Designation: Dorian, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Torre Fornello 2011 Dorian Red (Emilia), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Torre Fornello, Region: Emilia, Style1: Red Blend - Central Italy, Style2: Red Blend - Central Italy, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: A wood-aged Chardonnay from the hills above Soave, this is rich, honeyed from the malolactic fermentation and full of tropical fruit flavors. It is rich and delicious, but also well structured., Designation: Sorai, Points: 89.0, Price: 24.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Gini 2000 Sorai Chardonnay (Delle Venezie), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Gini, Region: Delle Venezie, Style1: Chardonnay - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Chardonnay - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Chardonnay - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Here's a pretty Italian rosé from the Abruzzo region with a full and generous bouquet of wild berries, white cherry, pomegranate and cranberry. The wine is smooth and soft in the mouth with more pretty berry nuances on the close: Pair it with smoked salmon., Designation: Valle d'Oro, Points: 87.0, Price: unknown, Province: Central Italy, Title: Cantina Tollo 2008 Valle d'Oro  (Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Cantina Tollo, Region: Cerasuolo d'Abruzzo, Style1: Rosé - Central Italy, Style2: Rosé - Central Italy, Style3: Rosé - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Here's a Kosher, sweet white wine from Puglia that opens with playful aromas of spring flower, honeysuckle, almond blossom and lemon mousse. The wine feels and tastes similar to Moscato d'Asti, but is a hair sweeter., Designation: Sara Bee, Points: 84.0, Price: 6.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Santero NV Sara Bee Moscato (Puglia), Variety: Moscato, Winery: Santero, Region: Puglia, Style1: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style2: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style3: Moscato - Italy Country: Italy, Description: This sophisticated white wine from the homeland of Italy's most robust reds (Ripasso and Amarone) shows a full, generous appearance with a golden-amber color. Stone fruit, toasted almond and candied lemon give it heft and consistency., Designation: Terso, Points: 89.0, Price: 36.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Marchesi Fumanelli 2005 Terso White (Veneto), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Marchesi Fumanelli, Region: Veneto, Style1: White Blend - Veneto, Style2: White Blend - Veneto, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Here's an easy Italian wine (made with the native Corvina grape) that occupies a space somewhere between red wine and rosé. You could easily serve Re Midas chilled and pair it with hamburger or pizza., Designation: Re Midas, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Cantina di Soave 2010 Re Midas Corvina (Venezie), Variety: Corvina, Winery: Cantina di Soave, Region: Venezie, Style1: Corvina - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Corvina - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Corvina - Italy"

column1: What would be a good wine for a quiet evening?,"
column3: Description
Aromatically floral with lemon zest and grapefruit on a robust body of stony minerality and touches of spicy lemongrass.
Quiet on the nose, delivers melon, pear and citrus flavors. Balanced and clean, a light, refreshing white.
Floral, pretty and light, offers a medium body and vibrant acidity around the rose-petaled texture.

column2: Martin Ray 2014 Dark Star Hill Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
column3: Exotic perfumey-ness with an inviting layering of black cherry and stemmy earthiness, riddled in white pepper as it finishes.

column2: Spicy Vines 2014 Joie de Vivre Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)
column3: Subtle, well-balanced and rich in texture, with mild Bosc pear and toasted-almond aromas, then richer pear, honey and hazelnut flavors.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Quiet and aromatically floral, this is a wine given time in both stainless steel and concrete, as well as a sizable percentage of neutral French oak. Lemon zest and grapefruit adorn a robust body of stony minerality and touches of spicy lemongrass., Designation: Equitem, Points: 93.0, Price: 30.0, Province: California, Title: Galerie 2016 Equitem Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Galerie, Region: Knights Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Knights Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Knights Valley Country: US, Description: This veers on the lower side of aromatic intensity, with notes of dark raspberry and plum, raw meat, melted chocolate and underbrush. Lively acids define the light- to medium-bodied palate, while powdery tannins lend traction., Designation: Deep Silence, Points: 85.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Attimo 2010 Deep Silence Cabernet Franc (Virginia), Variety: Cabernet Franc, Winery: Attimo, Region: Virginia, Style1: Cabernet Franc - Virginia, Style2: Cabernet Franc - Virginia, Style3: Cabernet Franc - Virginia Country: Germany, Description: Quiet on the nose, this wine speaks louder on the palate, where it delivers melon, pear and citrus flavors. It's balanced and clean, a light, refreshing white to serve as an apéritif or alongside mild fish dishes., Designation: Trocken, Points: 86.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Franken, Title: Castell 2010 Trocken Silvaner (Franken), Variety: Silvaner, Winery: Castell, Region: Franken, Style1: Silvaner - Franken, Style2: Silvaner - Franken, Style3: Silvaner - Germany Country: US, Description: Floral, pretty and light, this wine was made for porch sitting and all-around relaxing. It never gives up on fruit and complexity, offering a medium body and vibrant acidity around the rose-petaled texture. This is a lovely sipper., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 91.0, Price: 19.0, Province: California, Title: Starmont 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Starmont, Region: Carneros, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Carneros, Style3: Pinot Noir - Carneros Country: US, Description: There's an exotic perfumey-ness to this wine that almost suggests patchouli, so relaxed and complex it is. Medium-bodied with an inviting layering of black cherry and stemmy earthiness, it's curiously riddled in white pepper as it finishes., Designation: Dark Star Hill, Points: 91.0, Price: 55.0, Province: California, Title: Martin Ray 2014 Dark Star Hill Pinot Noir (Green Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Martin Ray, Region: Green Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Green Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Green Valley Country: Italy, Description: This Riserva Roero is a low-key wine with subtle fruit and spice characteristics wrapped around a thin, streamlined mouthfeel. The best thing to do with a wine like this is pair it with a sweetish, fatty food such as oil roasted tomatoes stuffed with herbs and breadcrumbs., Designation: Riserva, Points: 86.0, Price: unknown, Province: Piedmont, Title: Fratelli Casetta 2007 Riserva  (Roero), Variety: Nebbiolo, Winery: Fratelli Casetta, Region: Roero, Style1: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style2: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style3: Nebbiolo - Italy Country: Chile, Description: A very dry, crisp white wine with a neutral color and equally neutral aromas and flavors. It's lean, green apple-driven and fresh, but not what you'd call loaded with personality. Cleanses the palate and washes things down, but does so quietly., Designation: Vinas Viejas, Points: 84.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Elqui Valley, Title: Elki 2009 Vinas Viejas Pedro Ximénez (Elqui Valley), Variety: Pedro Ximénez, Winery: Elki, Region: Elqui Valley, Style1: Pedro Ximénez - Elqui Valley, Style2: Pedro Ximénez - Elqui Valley, Style3: Pedro Ximénez - Chile Country: US, Description: Subtle, well-balanced and rich in texture, this full-bodied wine sneaks up on the taste buds, starting with mild Bosc pear and toasted-almond aromas, then pouring richer pear, honey and hazelnut flavors onto the palate. A slight reserve in the flavors is more than offset by a quiet complexity and lingering finish., Designation: Joie de Vivre, Points: 92.0, Price: 38.0, Province: California, Title: Spicy Vines 2014 Joie de Vivre Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Spicy Vines, Region: Mendocino Ridge, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendocino Ridge, Style3: Chardonnay - Mendocino Ridge Country: Italy, Description: Mille e Una Notte is one of a handful of wines that defines the very best of Sicilian enology. Dark, luscious and penetrating, this sophisticated red blend shows deep layers of chocolate, cherry liqueur, dried sage, tobacco and leather. It's soft and silky rich on the long, delicious finish., Designation: Mille e Una Notte, Points: 93.0, Price: 80.0, Province: Sicily & Sardinia, Title: Donnafugata 2007 Mille e Una Notte  (Contessa Entellina), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Donnafugata, Region: Contessa Entellina, Style1: Red Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style2: Red Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Thick as molasses and dark as caramelized brown sugar, the wine oozes out of the bottle releasing concentrated aromas of butterscotch, toffee, honey, licorice, coffee, resin and maple syrup. Grapes from the Montepulciano area are dried in a ventilated room and the wine ages over 10 years in tiny oak barrels resulting in thick, dark concentration. Don't pair it with food: Vin Santo as good as this deserves to be enjoyed alone, as a so-called “meditation wine.”, Designation: Occhio di Pernice, Points: 100.0, Price: 210.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Avignonesi 1995 Occhio di Pernice  (Vin Santo di Montepulciano), Variety: Prugnolo Gentile, Winery: Avignonesi, Region: Vin Santo di Montepulciano, Style1: Prugnolo Gentile - Tuscany, Style2: Prugnolo Gentile - Tuscany, Style3: Prugnolo Gentile - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Aromas of baked dark-skinned fruit, cedar, cooking spice and a balsamic note unfold in the glass. A blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Sangiovese, and 5% Cabernet Franc, the firmly structured palate delivers ripe black currants, dried black cherries, clove, mint, tobacco and anise alongside tightly woven but fine-grained tannins. Give this time to unwind and fully develop. Drink 2017–2023., Designation: Solaia, Points: 94.0, Price: 325.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Marchesi Antinori 2011 Solaia Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Marchesi Antinori, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Very sweet and supple, this red dessert wine has a light perfume of roses and prunes. Rich, ripe fruit flavors come with a full body and soothing, wrap-around texture. The finish is long and sweet, too., Designation: Compassion, Points: 89.0, Price: 45.0, Province: California, Title: Vermeil 2013 Compassion Red (California), Variety: Tinta Madeira, Winery: Vermeil, Region: California, Style1: Tinta Madeira - California, Style2: Tinta Madeira - California, Style3: Tinta Madeira - California Country: Italy, Description: On first impact, the wine is earthy smelling with dim tones of Brie and Camembert. Wait a few minutes, and spicy blueberry notes to appear. Overall, this is a simple, no-fuss wine that would pair well with risotto or pasta., Designation: Intenso, Points: 87.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Podere la Marronaia 2005 Intenso Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Podere la Marronaia, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Lush, spicy aromas of apricot, honey and vanilla are followed by unfolding layers of the same in this elegant dessert wine. Luscious and pretty, with a slightly spicy finish. Pair with fresh fruit or sip alone., Designation: Night Watch Late Harvest Wine, Points: 86.0, Price: 45.0, Province: New York, Title: Waters Crest 2006 Night Watch Late Harvest Wine White (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Waters Crest, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: White Blend - New York, Style2: White Blend - New York, Style3: White Blend - New York Country: Italy, Description: This is a very informal and easygoing red table wine that would taste great with pizza. It opens with a bright ruby color and shows aromas of cherry, raspberry and toasted almond., Designation: VYD, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Bellini 2008 VYD Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Bellini, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy"

column1: Can you recommend a white wine with a smooth, buttery texture?,"
column3: Description

column2: Loring Wine Company 2014 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
column3: A buttery, luscious and creamy wine with a soft, gentle texture and rich, smooth taste.
A smooth, full-bodied wine with mild aromas of almond and butter, and a subtle honey-like finish.
A rich, smooth blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Pinot Grigio and Riesling Italico with a velvety texture.

column2: Kivelstadt Cellars 2016 Mother of Invention White (Sierra Foothills)
column3: A subtly delicious wine with a creamy, luxurious texture and light marzipan and vanilla flavors.

column2: Patz & Hall 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)
column3: A full-bodied and extremely flavorful wine with a buttery texture and layers of richness.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Wine doesn't come much more buttery, luscious and creamy than this! It smells like melted butter and butterscotch, tastes rich, smooth and almost candylike, with a soft, gentle texture, apparently low acidity and lots of creamy viscosity., Designation: Durell Vineyard, Points: 92.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Loring Wine Company 2014 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Loring Wine Company, Region: Sonoma Coast, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Sonoma Coast, Style3: Chardonnay - Sonoma Coast Country: US, Description: This dry white wine seems to be all about smooth texture and reserved flavors rather than overt fruitiness. It has a gold, Chardonnay-like color, mild aromas of almond and butter, a rather full body and a lingering but subtle honey-like finish., Designation: Charles Vineyard, Points: 89.0, Price: 28.0, Province: California, Title: Foursight 2013 Charles Vineyard Semillon (Anderson Valley), Variety: Sémillon, Winery: Foursight, Region: Anderson Valley, Style1: Sémillon - California, Style2: Sémillon - Anderson Valley, Style3: Sémillon - Anderson Valley Country: US, Description: Smooth and fat in texture, this wine has pear and butterscotch aromas, candied apple and butter flavors, and an almost sweet finish. It's a big, soft wine with low acidity and a short finish., Designation: Lot 92 Reserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: Michael Sullberg 2014 Lot 92 Reserve Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Michael Sullberg, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California Country: Italy, Description: Rich and smooth, this amber-colored wine is a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon, Pinot Grigio and Riesling Italico. Fermented in amphorae and aged for six years in oak casks, it boasts a fascinating assortment of flavors, ranging from mature apricot to ginger. Its structure and velvety texture make it a perfect mediation wine. Drink through 2022., Designation: Bianco Breg, Points: 93.0, Price: 80.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Gravner 2007 Bianco Breg White (Venezia Giulia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Gravner, Region: Venezia Giulia, Style1: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Subtly delicious flavors merge with a creamy, luxurious texture in this deceptively light-bodied and graceful wine blended from Marsanne, Roussanne and Viognier. It starts with butter and almond aromas then doles out light marzipan and vanilla flavors. While rich in mouthfeel, it has enough crispness for balance., Designation: Mother of Invention, Points: 91.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Kivelstadt Cellars 2016 Mother of Invention White (Sierra Foothills), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Kivelstadt Cellars, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Sierra Foothills, Style3: White Blend - Sierra Foothills Country: US, Description: Almost as buttery as a croissant, this full-bodied and extremely flavorful wine has an aroma like butterscotch, flavor like melted butter and vanilla, and a lingering pastry-like accent on the finish. The texture is buttery, too, coating the palate and revealing layers of richness., Designation: Alder Springs Vineyard, Points: 91.0, Price: 60.0, Province: California, Title: Patz & Hall 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Patz & Hall, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendocino, Style3: Chardonnay - Mendocino Country: Portugal, Description: Smooth, oily-textured ripe wine, stylish and flavorsome. The melon and apple flavors are counterbalanced by a rich acidity, a dense structure and a vanilla hint., Designation: Oscar's Branco, Points: 87.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Douro, Title: Quevedo 2010 Oscar's Branco White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Quevedo, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: France, Description: Smooth and soft, this creamy textured wine has warm pear and apple flavors. It's ripe, lightly spicy and very soft on the finish., Designation: Tradition, Points: 85.0, Price: unknown, Province: Alsace, Title: Dopff & Irion 2010 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Blanc, Winery: Dopff & Irion, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Blanc - France Country: US, Description: An unusual and inviting lemongrass aroma and flavor go well with a buttery and vibrant texture in this medium-bodied and almost sweet wine. Blended from Sémillon, Chardonnay and four other grapes, it makes a nice change of pace., Designation: The Whip, Points: 89.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Murrieta's Well 2014 The Whip White (Livermore Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Murrieta's Well, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Livermore Valley, Style3: White Blend - Livermore Valley Country: US, Description: Overt butter in the aroma and flavor give this medium-bodied wine a lavish personality, while light fruit nuances take a back seat. The texture is smooth, almost thick; and buttery, vanillin notes keep going on the finish., Designation: Manchester Ridge Vineyard, Points: 86.0, Price: 58.0, Province: California, Title: Red Car 2013 Manchester Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Red Car, Region: Mendocino Ridge, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendocino Ridge, Style3: Chardonnay - Mendocino Ridge Country: US, Description: Richness in the texture and a buttery vanilla-like flavor make this wine easy to dive into. It has lots of ripe apple, peach and white cherry flavor and an energetic complexity due to those pastry spices, plus a lingering, creamy finish., Designation: Blanc de Gris, Points: 90.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Lichen Estate 2013 Blanc de Gris Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley), Variety: Pinot Gris, Winery: Lichen Estate, Region: Anderson Valley, Style1: Pinot Gris - California, Style2: Pinot Gris - Anderson Valley, Style3: Pinot Gris - Anderson Valley Country: US, Description: Smooth and full bodied, this wine smells like melted butter, tastes like butterscotch, and feels big and rich on the palate. Apple and pear elements contribute a juicy quality, while the acidity is soft., Designation: Hopland Ranches Estate Bottled, Points: 89.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Brutocao 2014 Hopland Ranches Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Brutocao, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendocino, Style3: Chardonnay - Mendocino Country: US, Description: This is a big powerful overtly flavorful wine that demands attention. A vivid toasty savory aroma leads to rich spicy buttery nutty flavors that are mouth filling and a smooth, rather soft texture., Designation: Blanc de Blancs, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: LVVR NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Lodi), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: LVVR, Region: Lodi, Style1: Sparkling Blend - California, Style2: Sparkling Blend - Lodi, Style3: Sparkling Blend - Lodi Country: South Africa, Description: Surprisingly, this blend of 65% Chenin Blanc and 35% Sémillon is quite rich and oaky with prominent aromas of butter, wood-grilled red apple and walnut skin. The mouth offers more creamy nutty flavors of buttered popcorn and peach pit, but a bit lacking in the fruit department., Designation: Donatus White, Points: 86.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Dornier 2008 Donatus White White (Stellenbosch), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Dornier, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: White Blend - Stellenbosch, Style2: White Blend - Stellenbosch, Style3: White Blend - South Africa Country: Portugal, Description: Smooth and oily in texture, this is round and full of pear juice flavor. There is just a touch of green legume, adding piquancy to this ripe wine. Screwcap., Designation: Paxis Branco, Points: 86.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: DFJ Vinhos 2011 Paxis Branco Arinto (Lisboa), Variety: Arinto, Winery: DFJ Vinhos, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Arinto - Lisboa, Style2: Arinto - Lisboa, Style3: Arinto - Portugal"

column1: I'm looking for a red wine that's both robust and elegant at the same time. Any recommendations?,"
column3: Description
A robust and elegant wine with notes of cigarbox, cinnamon spice, and minerals. It has a lingering finish and is approachable.
A gentle red wine that is soft, juicy, and fruity. It is ready to drink.
A bold and structured red wine with notes of dark fruit, prune, spice, and tobacco. It has a fine and silky texture.

column2: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island)
column3: A bold but elegantly structured red wine with notes of spice, leather, red cherry, and plum. It has a juicy palate with a spray of green herbs and brisk acidity.

column2: Misiones de Rengo 2007 Cuvée Carmenère (Rapel Valley)
column3: A lush, stylish, and nearly flawless Carmenère with notes of toast, mineral, herbs, olive, and berry fruit. It has a smooth and elegant feel.
column9: ,Country: South Africa, Description: A robust nose of cigarbox, cinnamon spice and minerals introduces this elegant wine from Meerlust. On the palate, it's integrated and serious, with blackberry, anise and pepper. With its firm tannins and lingering finish, the wine is a classic red with character, and is approachable., Designation: Rubicon, Points: 88.0, Price: 27.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Meerlust 2003 Rubicon Red (Stellenbosch), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Meerlust, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: France, Description: The latest releases from Clos Triguedina aim to create wines for early drinking. Elegant is soft, juicy and fruity—perhaps so soft, it has lost any sense of Malbec character. Even so, it is a gentle red wine that is ready to drink., Designation: Elegant, Points: 84.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2012 Elegant Malbec (Cahors), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Jean-Luc Baldès, Region: Cahors, Style1: Malbec - Southwest France, Style2: Malbec - Southwest France, Style3: Malbec - France Country: Portugal, Description: Yes, there is some elegance here as well as rich fruit and sweet perfumed juiciness. It's attractively fruity, uncomplex. Screwcap., Designation: Aya Elegant, Points: 84.0, Price: unknown, Province: Alentejano, Title: Logowines 2008 Aya Elegant Red (Alentejano), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Logowines, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style2: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: You can't go wrong with a beautifully bold and structured red wine like this. Meant for cold winter nights and hearty meat dishes, this elegant Taurasi opens with luscious dark fruit, prune, spice and tobacco notes. The wine's texture is fine and silky, with polished, dusty tannins., Designation: Riserva, Points: 91.0, Price: 55.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Di Meo 2004 Riserva  (Taurasi), Variety: Aglianico, Winery: Di Meo, Region: Taurasi, Style1: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style2: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style3: Aglianico - Italy Country: US, Description: Hints of spice and leather add a savory tone to red cherry and plum flavors in this bold but elegantly structured red wine. The palate is juicy with fruit, but accented with a spray of green herbs and brisk acidity that lend freshness., Designation: Jubilant Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 45.0, Province: New York, Title: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Jamesport, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: Chile, Description: Looking for a juggernaut red that cries out for steak? Give this lush, stylish, nearly flawless Carmenère a shot and you won't be disappointed. The nose opens with toast, mineral, herbs, olive and berry fruit, and the palate is more of the same. In terms of feel, it's smooth and elegant, yet ripe and forceful. Finishes crusty and long. A winner from a winery that up until now hasn't shown much., Designation: Cuvée, Points: 91.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Rapel Valley, Title: Misiones de Rengo 2007 Cuvée Carmenère (Rapel Valley), Variety: Carmenère, Winery: Misiones de Rengo, Region: Rapel Valley, Style1: Carmenère - Rapel Valley, Style2: Carmenère - Rapel Valley, Style3: Carmenère - Chile Country: South Africa, Description: Ripe fruit aromas mingle with pepper, leather, mocha and spice on the nose of this elegant red. Dry and balanced, the palate offers ripe berry and spicy notes, and a lingering finish. Good textured tannins add to the ageable appeal., Designation: Kevin Arnold, Points: 86.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Waterford 2004 Kevin Arnold Shiraz (Stellenbosch), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Waterford, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Shiraz - Stellenbosch, Style2: Shiraz - Stellenbosch, Style3: Shiraz - South Africa Country: Portugal, Description: A fine, ripe wine, very elegant, with its red plum and berry fruits rounded out with smooth wood flavors. The tannins, obviously here, are in a supporting role to this delicious fruit. And the aftertaste is long, rounded and soft., Designation: Reserva, Points: 91.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Douro, Title: CARM 2005 Reserva Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: CARM, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: Without doubt a wine that needs aging. The tannins from both wood and fruit are dense, concentrated, layering over the delicious fruit. When it is balanced out—give it a year—then this is going to be a powerful, but impressively elegant wine, a real step forward in Churchill's table wines., Designation: Churchill Estates Grande Reserva, Points: 91.0, Price: unknown, Province: Douro, Title: Churchill's 2007 Churchill Estates Grande Reserva Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Churchill's, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: This Cab-based Bordeaux blend is harsh and tannic, with baked berry and currant flavors. May be technically dry, but tastes sugary sweet., Designation: Eleganten, Points: 83.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Rezonja 2005 Eleganten Red (Alexander Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Rezonja, Region: Alexander Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Alexander Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Alexander Valley Country: Italy, Description: Sangiovese (50%) is blended with equal parts Merlot and Cabernet to produce a simple red wine with thin berry fruit aromas, forest berry, floral nuances and some sharp points of bright acidity. Elegance and harmony are the objective and the wine reaches it nicely. It's also an easy wine with good length that would pair easily with all Mediterranean foods., Designation: Red Blend, Points: 87.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Castello di Corbara 2004 Red Blend Red (Lago di Corbara), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Castello di Corbara, Region: Lago di Corbara, Style1: Red Blend - Central Italy, Style2: Red Blend - Central Italy, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Italy, Description: A bright and elegant red wine with a crisp, silky mouthfeel. The bouquet is redolent of wild berry, white almond, chopped mint and spice. This should pair with honey roasted ham or wild turkey., Designation: Maso delle Rose, Points: 90.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Josef Weger 2007 Maso delle Rose Pinot Nero (Alto Adige), Variety: Pinot Nero, Winery: Josef Weger, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Pinot Nero - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Pinot Nero - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Pinot Nero - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: A generous wine that still manages to keep elegance and style. It offers black, juicy fruits that are blended with the spice from wood aging. There are blackberries, plenty of acidity and a dry but always fruity aftertaste. Drink from 2016., Designation: Reserva, Points: 91.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Douro, Title: Vilalva 2013 Reserva Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Vilalva, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: This tightly-wound effort is built from 40% Malbec, 40% Tempranillo and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's forceful and elegant, with streaks of black tea, anise and iron filings set in tangy red fruits that play out vertically through a lingering finish., Designation: Saros 154, Points: 91.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Washington, Title: Syzygy 2007 Saros 154 Red (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Syzygy, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: Lusty and robust, this Cab, Merlot and Syrah blend combines peppery, briary flavors with riper fruit notes of blackberries and plums. The texture is especially appealing, with its rich, complex tannins, from both the grapes and from oak. Good job in a dry red wine at a fair price., Designation: The Other, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Peirano 2006 The Other Red (Lodi), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Peirano, Region: Lodi, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Lodi, Style3: Red Blend - Lodi"

column1: I'd like a white wine, excluding Sauvignon Blanc.,"
column3: Description
An easy, no-fuss white wine with citrus, almond blossom and stone fruit flavors.

column2: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Bianco Pinot Grigio (California)
column3: A dry, tart white wine with fresh grapefruit, lime and spicy flavors.

column2: Qupé 2012 Sawyer Lindquist Vineyard Viognier (Edna Valley)
column3: A lean, dry, elegant white wine with rich but subtle tropical fruit, white flower and mineral flavors.
A fresh and easy-drinking white with scents of soft talcum powder, pink peony and orange blossom.
A white wine with aromas of citrus, especially white grapefruit and lime.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: This is a juicy, fruity white blend, with more than a hint of honeyed sweetness. Ripe fruit captures flavors of peach flesh and skin, along with tropical suggestions of guava and papaya. In short, this is not your typical, grassy, herbaceous style of Sauv Blanc/Sémillon. I'd serve it as an aperitif, well-chilled., Designation: Bliss White Wine, Points: 86.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Washington, Title: Adamant Cellars 2007 Bliss White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Adamant Cellars, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: White Blend - Washington, Style2: White Blend - Washington, Style3: White Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: This mélange of mostly Viognier and Chardonnay also holds smaller percentages of Sauvignon Blanc, Symphony and Muscat. Incognito spent no time in oak. With a lively taste of orange blossom, it could almost be mistaken for Gewürztraminer because of its distinct mixture of floral and spice., Designation: Incognito, Points: 86.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Michael David 2012 Incognito White (Lodi), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Michael David, Region: Lodi, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Lodi, Style3: White Blend - Lodi Country: US, Description: Here's a fruit-packed white wine bursting with flavors of peach and pear. The blend of 62% Muscat and 38% Viognier works beautifully. If you want plenty of fruit, a bit of sweetness, but enough acid to support a food-friendly white wine, this is your bottle., Designation: White Wine, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Rock Point NV White Wine White (Oregon), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Rock Point, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: White Blend - Oregon, Style2: White Blend - Oregon Other, Style3: White Blend - Oregon Other Country: Italy, Description: Here's an easy, no-fuss white wine to pair with rice salad or grilled vegetables. Citrus, almond blossom and stone fruit are capped by a slightly sweet feel in the mouth., Designation: Fiore, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Sicily & Sardinia, Title: Corvo 2010 Fiore White (Sicilia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Corvo, Region: Sicilia, Style1: White Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style2: White Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Everybody needs a dry, tart white wine and Coppola has provided us with one in this crisply citric bottling. It's fresh and uplifting in grapefruit, lime and spicy flavors, at a good price., Designation: Presents Bianco, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Bianco Pinot Grigio (California), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: Francis Ford Coppola, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - California, Style3: Pinot Grigio - California Country: US, Description: This is a nonvintage blend of Chenin Blanc and Sauvignon Blanc, with additions of Viognier and Muscat. Its Chenin-like nose is floral and rich, and its lychee, lime and kiwi flavors swirl about before coming to a refined, perfectly crisp finish., Designation: Simply White, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Testa Vineyards NV Simply White White (Mendocino County), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Testa Vineyards, Region: Mendocino, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Mendocino, Style3: White Blend - Mendocino Country: US, Description: A full-bodied white blend composed largely of Chardonnay with smaller percentages of Gewürztraminer, Sauvignon Blanc, Orange Muscat, Viognier, Pinot Blanc, Sémillon and Muscat Canelli. The aromas and flavors lean tropical, ensconced in crisp vanilla and lemon-lime. A versatile wine for a myriad of foods. Rich seafood dishes will work particularly well., Designation: The Whip, Points: 88.0, Price: 21.0, Province: California, Title: Murrieta's Well 2012 The Whip White (Livermore Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Murrieta's Well, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Livermore Valley, Style3: White Blend - Livermore Valley Country: France, Description: Produced at the largest family-owned vineyard in France, this is a simple, fruity, immediately attractive wine. There are both citrus and more tropical fruit flavors in the wine, alongside a herbal, grassy touch from the Sauvignon Blanc and Colombard in the blend. The wine is ready to drink., Designation: Classic, Points: 85.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Domaine du Tariquet 2015 Classic White (Côtes de Gascogne), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Domaine du Tariquet, Region: Côtes de Gascogne, Style1: White Blend - Southwest France, Style2: White Blend - Southwest France, Style3: White Blend - France Country: US, Description: Avoids the variety's opulent, often sweet side in favor of a leaner, drier, more elegant style. It has the weight and texture of a Sauvignon Blanc, yet offers rich but subtle tropical fruit, white flower and mineral flavors, with a smack of sweet oak. This is a complex wine, and you don't want to drink it too cold., Designation: Sawyer Lindquist Vineyard, Points: 91.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Qupé 2012 Sawyer Lindquist Vineyard Viognier (Edna Valley), Variety: Viognier, Winery: Qupé, Region: Edna Valley, Style1: Viognier - California, Style2: Viognier - Edna Valley, Style3: Viognier - Edna Valley Country: Israel, Description: A fresh and easy-drinking white made from Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay, the Blanc boasts scents of soft talcum powder, pink peony and orange blossom against a gooseberry and white strawberry fruit backbone. Zippy and prickly in the mouth with a mouthwatering, grassy finish., Designation: Unoaked Blanc, Points: 86.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Judean Hills, Title: Flam 2010 Unoaked Blanc White (Judean Hills), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Flam, Region: Judean Hills, Style1: White Blend - Judean Hills, Style2: White Blend - Judean Hills, Style3: White Blend - Israel Country: US, Description: Composed mainly of Sémillon, with some Sauvignon Blanc blended in, this is a nice wine for drinking now. It's full-bodied and tastes dryish to semi-sweet, with apricot, peach and citrus fruit flavors., Designation: White Table Wine, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Ehret 2011 White Table Wine Meritage (Knights Valley), Variety: Meritage, Winery: Ehret, Region: Knights Valley, Style1: Meritage - California, Style2: Meritage - Knights Valley, Style3: Meritage - Knights Valley Country: US, Description: The Muscat Canelli in the blend really stands out, offering tangerine aromas and flavors. But additional fruit and spice complexities are offered by Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier, among other varieties. Crisply acidic and dry, this is an outstanding white wine, and a versatile one at the table. Sommeliers, buy this by the case., Designation: White, Points: 89.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Big House 2007 White White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Big House, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: Spain, Description: Aromas of citrus, especially white grapefruit and lime, are spunky and sweaty like Sauvignon Blanc or Verdejo. A solid, fleshy palate is home to a mix of citric and tropical flavors, while the finish reverts back to grapefruit, with a monotone feel. This is Macabeo, Garnacha Blanca and Pedro Ximénez., Designation: Òlbia, Points: 88.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Marco Abella 2014 Òlbia White (Priorat), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Marco Abella, Region: Priorat, Style1: White Blend - Catalonia, Style2: White Blend - Catalonia, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Ceylon tea, fresh pineapple and tangerines perfume this off-dry blend of predominantly Vidal, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier grapes. Simple yet fresh, with pretty white floral and peach notes, this wine would be a lovely companion to lemongrass accented Thai and Vietnamese dishes., Designation: Bowhaus White Table Wine, Points: 86.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Barrel Oak 2009 Bowhaus White Table Wine White (Virginia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Barrel Oak, Region: Virginia, Style1: White Blend - Virginia, Style2: White Blend - Virginia, Style3: White Blend - Virginia Country: US, Description: This simple, rich white wine features a cheesecake graphic on the label, hence the name. The blend is a mix of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Riesling and Gewürztraminer. Fine for sipping cold if you're in the mood for a more luscious white., Designation: Buxom Blonde, Points: 84.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Washington, Title: Calendar Girl 2011 Buxom Blonde White (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Calendar Girl, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: White Blend - Washington, Style2: White Blend - Washington, Style3: White Blend - Washington"

column1: What's a full-bodied red wine?,"
column3: Description
Full-bodied wine with mellow, ripe fruit flavors, light oaky accents and a warm sense of ripeness.
Full-bodied wine packed with fruit and spice notes, generous ripe plum, macerated cherry and black pepper flavors.

column2: Eruption 2013 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Red (High Valley)
column3: Full-bodied wine with flavors resembling dark chocolate, black cherries and baking spices.

column2: Quinta da Rede 2011 Rede Reserva Tinto Red (Douro)
column3: Full-bodied wine with a balance of fresh berries, vibrant acidity and structured tannins.
Full-bodied red with aromas of ripe plum, vanilla, coconut and a whiff of exotic spice.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Welcoming and easy to drink, this full-bodied wine has mellow, ripe fruit flavors, light oaky accents and a warm sense of ripeness that doesn't go over the top. Subtle tannins support the texture while keeping it smooth. The blend includes Zinfandel, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah., Designation: Essential, Points: 89.0, Price: 11.0, Province: California, Title: Bogle 2013 Essential Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Bogle, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: This full-bodied wine is packed with fruit and spice notes and is especially broad and mouth-filling. Made from mostly Grenache and Mourvèdre, with a dash of Syrah, it has generous ripe plum, macerated cherry and black pepper flavors that spread across the palate and linger on the finish., Designation: Tête-à-Tête, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Terre Rouge 2014 Tête-à-Tête Red (Sierra Foothills), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Terre Rouge, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Sierra Foothills, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - Sierra Foothills Country: US, Description: This full-bodied wine packs a lot of punch in terms of mouthfeel and flavor. The color is extremely dark, and the flavors resemble dark chocolate, black cherries and baking spices. It is dry in style, with lip-smacking, nicely astringent tannins that counterbalance all that richness., Designation: Volcano Ridge Vineyard, Points: 92.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Eruption 2013 Volcano Ridge Vineyard Red (High Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Eruption, Region: High Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - High Valley, Style3: Red Blend - High Valley Country: Portugal, Description: With a rich palate and dense spicy black fruits, this is a full-bodied wine. Showing a balance of fresh berries, vibrant acidity and structured tannins, this is a classic Douro blend of Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now., Designation: Rede Reserva Tinto, Points: 90.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Douro, Title: Quinta da Rede 2011 Rede Reserva Tinto Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Quinta da Rede, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of ripe plum, vanilla, coconut and a whiff of exotic spice. A note of spiced black fruit adds interest to the medium-to-long finish. This would pair well with softly spiced chili or barbecue., Designation: New World Red, Points: 85.0, Price: 34.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Kluge Estate 2009 New World Red Red (Monticello), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Kluge Estate, Region: Monticello, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Virginia, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Virginia, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Virginia Country: US, Description: Full bodied, very flavorful and well balanced, this wine offers concentrated plummy aromas that lead to dense, ripe blackberry and strawberry flavors. Along with the tangy, lightly tannic mouthfeel and lingering finish, it keeps bringing on delicious fruit notes., Designation: GPS, Points: 90.0, Price: unknown, Province: California, Title: Page Mill Winery 2012 GPS Red (Livermore Valley), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Page Mill Winery, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Livermore Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - Livermore Valley Country: Portugal, Description: It's rare to find such a full-bodied red from the same region as Vinho Verde. This ripe and juicy wine is packed with delicious velvet plum flavors. There is acidity, but the wine is so sweet and soft. Drink over the next year., Designation: Homenagem Reserva, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Minho, Title: Casa do Valle 2009 Homenagem Reserva Red (Minho), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Casa do Valle, Region: Minho, Style1: Portuguese Red - Minho, Style2: Portuguese Red - Minho, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: This full-bodied, dry and quite tannic wine follows the classic form of California Cabernet Sauvignon, which forms 65% of the blend. The aroma is full of ripe black fruit shaded by nutmeg, cedar and cinnamon, while black currant and dark chocolate drive the concentrated and deeply rooted flavors. Best after 2020., Designation: Conjugation, Points: 91.0, Price: 39.0, Province: California, Title: Fenestra 2012 Conjugation Red (Livermore Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Fenestra, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Livermore Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Livermore Valley Country: US, Description: This impressively concentrated, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine will be a great match for the next juicy steak or lasagna. It has a thick, inky, red color, attractive cedar and spice aromas, and full flavors like blackberries and pomegranate juice. The thick, velvety tannic feel is perfect for adventurous tastes. It's made with Montepulciano, Sangiovese and Freisa grapes., Designation: Big & Beautiful, Points: 90.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Wargin Wines 2011 Big & Beautiful Red (Solano County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Wargin Wines, Region: Solano, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Solano, Style3: Red Blend - Solano Country: US, Description: Full-bodied, tannic, juicy-fruity and dry, this red blend has flavors of blackberries, plums, dark chocolate and anise, with spicy, earthy notes of tobacco. Made from Primitivo, Zinfandel and Teroldego., Designation: Prindelo, Points: 86.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Viansa 2006 Prindelo Red (Sonoma County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Viansa, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Sonoma, Style3: Red Blend - Sonoma Country: US, Description: This full-bodied Bordeaux-style blend is hardly simple and fruity. It's rustic but fun to taste., Designation: True Red Lot 30, Points: 86.0, Price: 16.0, Province: California, Title: Fenestra NV True Red Lot 30 Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Fenestra, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: This full-bodied wine has a dark red color with purple rim, very grapy, cherrylike aromas, rich fruit flavors and an almost thick texture. The lingering, jammy finish goes to dried plums and raisins because it's so ripe. column1: Is there a wine that is not too acidic?,"
column3: Description

column2: Foursight 2012 Charles Vineyard Zero Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
column3: Not too deep in color or overly effusive in aroma, this nevertheless full-bodied wine has fresh red cherry and plum flavors backed by firm acidity and tannins. Its relative restraint and balance will make a great accompaniment to grilled quail or chicken or even roast venison.

column2: Airfield Estates 2009 Aviator Red Red (Yakima Valley)
column3: Light and balanced, this five grape Bordeaux-style blend does not try to overreach. The fruit is clean and delicate, pale cherry set amidst dried leaves, tobacco, and muted tannins. Plenty of acid keeps it lively, but everything is in focus and proportionate.

While oak can commonly overwhelm Chardonnay, this is a perfect example of an appropriate balance. Toasted notes of almond and peach pit intertwine with red apple and underripe pear; crisp acidity shines through on the finish.

89-91 A balanced and structured wine that shows fine acidity, berry fruits and dashing acidity. With the balance already there, it is developing well in barrel, promising a stylish wine down the road.

column2: Domaine de Pontefract 2010 Domaine du Vieux Moulin Rosé (Vin de Pays Var)
column3: There is light acidity on this fresh, gently fruity wine. It does have a textured edge with plum skin acidity and a fresh aftertaste.
column9: ,Country: Spain, Description: Baked-apple aromas are not in accordance with an acidic palate that's stalky yet oxidized in flavor. column1: What's a dry white wine?,"
column3: Description

column2: My Big Fat Greek Wine 2012 Dry White Moschofilero (Peloponnese)
column3: A rounded white with aromas of lemon peel, orange jam, spice and flowers, followed by appealing flavors of citrus and white fruit. Pairs well with spicy food.
A mature, dry wine with attractive wood acidity. Dark gold in color, it has just enough sweetness, but the style is certainly a sipping Port.

column2: Woodward Canyon 2001 Dry White Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: A limited-production wine, made in a bone-dry style. It is at once searingly tart and loaded with fresh, tangy lemon and citrus and green apple fruit. Pairs well with spicy food.

column2: Wind Rose 2015 Dry White Wine Pinot Grigio (Yakima Valley)
column3: Aromas of apple and pear are followed by dry, medium-bodied fruit flavors.

column2: Bisceglia 2011 Terra di Vulcano Dry Moscato (Basilicata)
column3: This dry white wine opens with aromas of acacia flower, honey and stone fruit. The wine is easy, fresh and zesty on the finish. Pairs well with fried cocktail shrimp.

column1: I'd like a dessert wine, excluding Riesling.,"
column3: Description
A delicious dessert wine with an intense fragrance of orange blossoms, citrus and herbs. The dense palate delivers honey, lemon drop, sage and mint.

column2: Klein Constantia 2005 Vin de Constance Muscat (Constantia)
column3: A lovely dessert wine, concentrated and quite intense with full-bodied flavors of orange rind, clementine and dried apricot fruit spiced with notes of crushed yellow florals, roasted nut skin, toasted egg bread and pure honeycomb.
A bright gold colored dessert wine, combining the sweetness and intense acidity with just the lightest touch of tannin.
A toasty yet balanced selection with decadent aromas and flavors of buttered brioche, honeydew, baked apple, lemon curd and vanilla cream pie.

column2: Elkhorn Peak NV Dessert Wine White (California)
column3: A high-alcohol wine, made from Muscat and Verdelho, aged for ten years in barrels. It has a floral, Sherry taste, with that distinctive yeasty flavor undergirding quite sweet pineapples, oranges, apricots and white chocolate.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: This is an absolutely stunning wine, thick and dense with an array of candied fruits, caramel, marmalade, butterscotch and more. column1: Is there a wine that is not too tannic?,"
column3: Description
Light tannins accompany crisp red fruits. It lacks in weight and complexity, but makes up for with a smooth texture, good acidity and a structure that will allow it age for another year.

column2: Château Coutinel 2015 Il est des nôôôtres! Gamay
column3: This softly fruity wine has the lightest of tannins and plenty of simple red-berry fruits. There is an earthy edge to the young wine as well as plenty of acidity at the end.
This perfumed wine offers plenty (perhaps too much) acidity and red fruits, with only light tannins. That makes for a fruity wine, fresh and ready to drink now and until 2018.
A wine that is soft and fruity. The tannins are light, spiked with acidity and some bitter chocolate. The final character is fruity, rich and soft.

column2: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa)
column3: With its dark color and rich fruit, this is instantly approachable. Tannins are well integrated into the ripe plum and black cherry fruits. With fresh acidity and a core of dry tannins at the end, the wine could age.
