The tannins are light, spiked with acidity and some bitter chocolate. The final character is fruity, rich and soft., Designation: Terra Bella Reserve, Points: 86.0, Price: unknown, Province: Port, Title: Fonseca NV Terra Bella Reserve  (Port), Variety: Port, Winery: Fonseca, Region: Port, Style1: Port - Port, Style2: Port - Port, Style3: Port - Portugal Country: France, Description: Light tannins accompany crisp red fruits. What it lacks in weight and complexity, it makes up for with a smooth texture, good acidity and a structure that will allow it age for another year., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 85.0, Price: 32.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Derey Frères 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Fixin), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Derey Frères, Region: Fixin, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: Portugal, Description: This dark wine is still packed with tannins that give a dense, solid character. The acidity brings out the natural juiciness of the fruit but it does need a few more months to soften and round out. Wait until 2015., Designation: Quinta de S João Batista Reserva, Points: 89.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Tejo, Title: Caves Dom Teodosio 2010 Quinta de S João Batista Reserva Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Tejo), Variety: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Caves Dom Teodosio, Region: Tejo, Style1: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon - Tejo, Style2: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon - Tejo, Style3: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon - Portugal Country: France, Description: 92-94 Great dusty tannins, almost too powerful, very solid in character. The wine is chunky, allowing juicy fruits to show. It is a dry wine, certainly not hard., Designation: Barrel sample Le Petit Cheval, Points: 93.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Cheval Blanc 2010 Barrel sample Le Petit Cheval  (Saint-Émilion), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Cheval Blanc, Region: Saint-Émilion, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: Uruguay, Description: Jammy aromas of floral berry fruits, lavender and violets are savory and stir interest. Drying tannins are the roughest part of a mostly balanced palate, while blue-fruit flavors are backed by chocolaty oak. A finish with manageable tannins is the close., Designation: Varietals, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Uruguay, Title: Garzón 2014 Varietals Tannat (Uruguay), Variety: Tannat, Winery: Garzón, Region: Uruguay, Style1: Tannat - Uruguay, Style2: Tannat - Uruguay, Style3: Tannat - Uruguay Country: France, Description: This softly fruity wine has the lightest of tannins and plenty of simple red-berry fruits. There is an earthy edge to the young wine as well as plenty of acidity at the end. Drink now., Designation: Il est des nôôôtres!, Points: 86.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Château Coutinel 2015 Il est des nôôôtres! Gamay, Variety: Gamay, Winery: Château Coutinel, Region: Southwest France, Style1: Gamay - Southwest France, Style2: Gamay - Southwest France, Style3: Gamay - France Country: Italy, Description: It's hard to imagine naturally tannic Sagrantino as a dessert wine but indeed this native Umbrian red grape was traditionally made in a sweet style to soften its firm astringency. Deeply red and richly concentrated, it shows chocolate, savory spice and blackberry. Drying tannins keep the palate clean., Designation: Passito, Points: 88.0, Price: 49.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Còlpetrone 2007 Passito  (Montefalco Sagrantino), Variety: Sagrantino, Winery: Còlpetrone, Region: Montefalco Sagrantino, Style1: Sagrantino - Central Italy, Style2: Sagrantino - Central Italy, Style3: Sagrantino - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Vintner Marco Caprai is the man who has tamed the tannic, unruly beast that is Sagrantino. Having carefully aged for two years in oak, this has become deeply elegant and sophisticated. Aromas of chocolate, exotic spice, dark berry, leather, tobacco and dried prune leave a lasting impression. Age for 10 years or more., Designation: 25 Anni, Points: 94.0, Price: 100.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Arnaldo Caprai 2006 25 Anni  (Sagrantino di Montefalco), Variety: Sagrantino, Winery: Arnaldo Caprai, Region: Sagrantino di Montefalco, Style1: Sagrantino - Central Italy, Style2: Sagrantino - Central Italy, Style3: Sagrantino - Italy Country: Spain, Description: Expect no shortage of power and pounding tannins from this modern-styled, heavily extracted Tempranillo. The nose is dark, sweet and jammy, but all pleasantries cease there; the palate is tannic as nails, with baked plum and other roasted dark-fruit flavors. To this taster, it's a hard, tough wine. Others may find it more appealing., Designation: M2 de Matallana, Points: 85.0, Price: 39.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Telmo Rodríguez 2004 M2 de Matallana  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Telmo Rodríguez, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: Portugal, Description: With its dark color and rich fruit, this is instantly approachable. Tannins are well integrated into the ripe plum and black cherry fruits. With fresh acidity and a core of dry tannins at the end, the wine could age. Drink from 2016., Designation: Casa do Lago Tinto, Points: 87.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Casa do Lago Tinto Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon (Lisboa), Variety: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: DFJ Vinhos, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon - Lisboa, Style2: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon - Lisboa, Style3: Touriga Nacional-Cabernet Sauvignon - Portugal Country: France, Description: Although full of fruit, this no-sulfur-added wine is structured and concentrated. Big tannins back up the ripe character and generous fruit flavors. It's likely to be ready to drink from 2021., Designation: Cuvée Non-Sulfité, Points: 91.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château les Petits Arnauds 2015 Cuvée Non-Sulfité  (Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château les Petits Arnauds, Region: Blaye Côtes de Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: Portugal, Description: This is a smooth, rich wine. It has just the right amount of tannin to give structure and add to the ripe black fruits. A blend of classic Douro grapes gives a wine that is dense, firm and also generously ripe. Drink this fine wine now., Designation: Golpe Tinto, Points: 91.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Douro, Title: Manuel Carvalho Martins 2014 Golpe Tinto Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Manuel Carvalho Martins, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: France, Description: This perfumed wine offers plenty (perhaps too much) acidity and red fruits, with only light tannins. That makes for a fruity wine, fresh and ready to drink now and until 2018., Designation: Les Vignes Marie, Points: 85.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Derey Frères 2012 Les Vignes Marie  (Marsannay), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Derey Frères, Region: Marsannay, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: Argentina, Description: There's more good to this rough and rugged varietal than there is bad. It's hugely fruity, perfectly ripe, colorful and full of cola, coffee, black fruit, rubber and length. It'll definitely last in a cellar, and that can only help soften the punishing tannins and mouthfeel that dominate the current state., Designation: Don David Reserve, Points: 87.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Other, Title: Michel Torino 2008 Don David Reserve Tannat (Cafayate), Variety: Tannat, Winery: Michel Torino, Region: Cafayate, Style1: Tannat - Other, Style2: Tannat - Other, Style3: Tannat - Argentina"

column1: Can you suggest a white wine with a bright acidity and a touch of minerality?,"
column3: Description
Simple, bright white and citrus fruits with a smooth, vanilla texture and a touch of minerality. Finishes with bright acidity.
Fruity, crisp with citrus acidity and light minerality. Has an attractive sliced apple and melon aftertaste.
A blend of white grapes with citrus and stone fruit notes, plus drying aromas of talcum powder and crushed mineral.

column2: Nominé-Renard NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne)
column3: Crisp, steely and fresh, this pure Chardonnay wine has a touch of minerality and a soft aftertaste.
Cleansing minerality defines this brilliant and luminous Gavi. It's food-friendly with fresh floral aromas and crisp acidity.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: Simple, bright white and citrus fruits give this wine a great lift from the start. There is a smooth, vanilla texture as well as a touch of minerality giving texture. The wine finishes with bright acidity., Designation: JJ Bourgogne Blanc, Points: 85.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Vincent 2011 JJ Bourgogne Blanc  (Bourgogne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Vincent, Region: Bourgogne, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Portugal, Description: This is a fruity wine, crisp with citrus acidity and bright with light minerality and zest. It is a refreshing wine with an attractive sliced apple and melon aftertaste. Drink this lively wine now., Designation: Contraste Branco, Points: 88.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Douro, Title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Contraste Branco White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Conceito Vinhos, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: A blend of white grapes indigenous to Sicily, this bright wine opens with citrus and stone fruit notes, plus drying aromas of talcum powder and crushed mineral. It is an easygoing wine with fresh acidity that would pair with trout or poached salmon., Designation: Anthìlia, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Sicily & Sardinia, Title: Donnafugata 2011 Anthìlia White (Sicilia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Donnafugata, Region: Sicilia, Style1: White Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style2: White Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: France, Description: Crisp, steely and fresh, this pure Chardonnay wine has a touch of minerality, signs of attractive bottle aging and a soft aftertaste. Balanced and fruity, it's ready to drink now., Designation: Brut Blanc de Blancs, Points: 89.0, Price: unknown, Province: Champagne, Title: Nominé-Renard NV Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Nominé-Renard, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Italy, Description: Cleansing minerality defines this brilliant and luminous Gavi from Northern Italy. It's food-friendly to the core with fresh floral aromas and crisp acidity. Try this beautiful wine with sushi or Mediterranean fish., Designation: La Luciana, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: Araldica 2008 La Luciana  (Gavi), Variety: Cortese, Winery: Araldica, Region: Gavi, Style1: Cortese - Piedmont, Style2: Cortese - Piedmont, Style3: Cortese - Italy Country: US, Description: Zesty acidity shines a spotlight on fresh citrus and mineral tones in this blend of Riesling and Gewürztraminer. It's not deeply concentrated on the palate, but a kiss of white blossom lends elegance to the finish., Designation: Fathom 107, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: New York, Title: Wagner 2013 Fathom 107 White (Seneca Lake), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Wagner, Region: Seneca Lake, Style1: White Blend - New York, Style2: White Blend - New York, Style3: White Blend - New York Country: France, Description: A beautifully crisp wine, very mineral, with its citrus and green apple flavors given a fine texture of bright acidity. It is still so young, with just a hint of toast to show some maturity. The finish is shockingly fresh., Designation: Brut Blanc de Blancs, Points: 94.0, Price: 120.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Billecart-Salmon 1999 Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Billecart-Salmon, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: The minerality is a reminder that the grapes come from an area near Chablis. It has a tangy, zingy character, with a nervy edge that promises aging, but it also provides fruity, apple-driven pleasure now., Designation: Vive-la-Joie Brut, Points: 91.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Bailly-Lapierre 2007 Vive-la-Joie Brut  (Crémant de Bourgogne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Bailly-Lapierre, Region: Crémant de Bourgogne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Burgundy, Style2: Champagne Blend - Burgundy, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: This is an aromatic blend of Colombard, Gros Manseng and Sauvignon Blanc. Fresh, crisp and fruity, it is the ideal apéritif wine with its mineral texture and bright acidity. It is a lively wine, with just a hint of yellow fruit to go with the intense citrus. Drink now., Designation: Cuvée Marine, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Domaine de Ménard 2015 Cuvée Marine White (Côtes de Gascogne), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Domaine de Ménard, Region: Côtes de Gascogne, Style1: White Blend - Southwest France, Style2: White Blend - Southwest France, Style3: White Blend - France Country: US, Description: A brilliant white wine, very tart in acidity, with mineral flavors that make your mouth water. The flavors veer toward bright, tart citrus fruits, with suggestions of Chinese five-spice. The grapes were biodynamically farmed, which may partially be why the wine is so pure., Designation: Ca' del Solo Vineyard, Points: 89.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Ca' del Solo 2007 Ca' del Solo Vineyard Albariño (Monterey County), Variety: Albariño, Winery: Ca' del Solo, Region: Monterey, Style1: Albariño - California, Style2: Albariño - Monterey, Style3: Albariño - Monterey Country: France, Description: This off-dry wine is fresh, light and fruity. Bright pear and quince flavors are given a boost by great acidity, spice and a light touch of mineral texture. Drink now., Designation: One, Points: 85.0, Price: unknown, Province: Alsace, Title: Pierre Sparr 2012 One White (Alsace), Variety: Alsace white blend, Winery: Pierre Sparr, Region: Alsace, Style1: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style2: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style3: Alsace white blend - France Country: Italy, Description: White flower, honeydew melon and lemon aromas meld together on this lively white. The savory, juicy palate doles out green apple, white peach and a white almond note alongside flinty mineral and bright acidity., Designation: Fossili del Comune di Gavi, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: San Silvestro 2015 Fossili del Comune di Gavi  (Gavi), Variety: Cortese, Winery: San Silvestro, Region: Gavi, Style1: Cortese - Piedmont, Style2: Cortese - Piedmont, Style3: Cortese - Italy Country: Italy, Description: This dazzling white is a lesson in finesse and balance. It opens with alluring, delicate scents of white wild flowers, chopped herbs, almonds and orchard fruits. The elegant palate offers layers of crisp apple and creamy pear, and radiant acidity brightens the intense flavors while a mineral note closes the lingering finish. Drink through 2023., Designation: Calvarino, Points: 94.0, Price: 31.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Pieropan 2013 Calvarino  (Soave Classico), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Pieropan, Region: Soave Classico, Style1: White Blend - Veneto, Style2: White Blend - Veneto, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: This chalky-textured wine has bright, citrusy acidity to contrast its warmer tropical fruit character. Balanced and fruity, it will be ready to drink from late 2017., Designation: Vinho Branco, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Douro, Title: Quinta Dona Matilde 2015 Vinho Branco White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Quinta Dona Matilde, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: This unusual blend of 50% Viognier and 50% Grechetto opens with aromas of white spring flower, ripe stone fruit, flint and a whiff of pine sap. The linear palate delivers layers of white peach, juicy pear, green apple, spice and minerality brightened by fresh acidity. It finishes on a note of white almond. Hold a few years for complexity. Drink through 2020., Designation: Fiorano Bianco, Points: 91.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Italy Other, Title: Tenuta di Fiorano 2012 Fiorano Bianco White (Vino da Tavola), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Tenuta di Fiorano, Region: Vino da Tavola, Style1: White Blend - Italy Other, Style2: White Blend - Italy Other, Style3: White Blend - Italy"

column1: Is there a wine that is not too sweet?,"Yes, there are several wines that are not too sweet. Here are five recommendations:

column3: Description

column2: Rosa d'Oro 2012 Slightly Sweet Muscat (Yolo County)
column3: A fragrant and inviting wine, slightly sweet in honeysuckle, citrus and crisp texture.
Labeled late harvest, but not terribly sweet, this includes small amounts of Muscat, Gewürztraminer and Chenin Blanc in the blend.

column2: Keuka Spring 2009 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)
column3: Tart acidity and a kick of apple pie spice meld playfully with the semisweet palate.
Not really sweet, and not entirely Riesling, this off-dry wine tastes like fresh squeezed apple juice, lightly sweetened.

column2: Brutocao 2013 Slow Lope'n Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
column3: Almost like liquid cherry pie—but not sweet—this medium-bodied wine smells like the red fruit and baking spices, and tastes fresh and juicy with both red and sour cherries.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: From both Muscat Canelli (65%) and Muscat Giallo (35%), this fragrant and inviting wine is exactly what it proclaims to be, slightly sweet in honeysuckle, citrus and crisp texture. It offers lightness and lingering acidity in a moderate-alcohol package., Designation: Slightly Sweet, Points: 90.0, Price: 16.0, Province: California, Title: Rosa d'Oro 2012 Slightly Sweet Muscat (Yolo County), Variety: Muscat, Winery: Rosa d'Oro, Region: Yolo, Style1: Muscat - California, Style2: Muscat - Yolo, Style3: Muscat - Yolo Country: US, Description: Sweet but not too sweet for some entrées, such as spicy Thai food, this brings a fruity mix of pear, pineapple and orange-creamsickle flavors. It's smooth and soft, not at all sugary, and framed with fresh acids., Designation: Sweet, Points: 89.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Washington, Title: Pacific Rim 2012 Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Pacific Rim, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: US, Description: Labeled late harvest, but not terribly sweet, this includes small amounts of Muscat, Gewürztraminer and Chenin Blanc in the blend. Lemony with both citrus rind and sweet candy flavors, it's a useful, off-dry wine with a slightly sugary finish., Designation: Late Harvest, Points: 87.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Washington, Title: Hogue 2010 Late Harvest Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Hogue, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: US, Description: Mulled apple cider, ginger and candied orange peel aromas perfume this easy-drinking Riesling. Tart acidity and a kick of apple pie spice meld playfully with the semisweet palate. A nice wine for casual autumn entertaining., Designation: Semi Sweet, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: New York, Title: Keuka Spring 2009 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Keuka Spring, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Riesling - New York, Style2: Riesling - New York, Style3: Riesling - New York Country: US, Description: Not really sweet, and not entirely Riesling (the blend includes 13% Gewürztraminer and 10% Pinot Gris), this off-dry wine tastes like fresh squeezed apple juice, lightly sweetened., Designation: Sweet, Points: 84.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Washington, Title: Lake Chelan 2010 Sweet Riesling (Lake Chelan), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Lake Chelan, Region: Lake Chelan, Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: Hungary, Description: This semisweet late harvest Hungarian wine has aromas of apricot, caramelized pear and pear tart. There are lovely flavors of canned apricots, sweet ripe pear, white flowers and honeycomb. The finish is sweet but has balanced acidity., Designation: Once Upon a Time Szamorodni Sweet, Points: 90.0, Price: 33.0, Province: Tokaj, Title: Basilicus 2012 Once Upon a Time Szamorodni Sweet Furmint (Tokaj), Variety: Furmint, Winery: Basilicus, Region: Tokaj, Style1: Furmint - Tokaj, Style2: Furmint - Tokaj, Style3: Furmint - Hungary Country: Romania, Description: This medium-sweet wine brings aromas of acacia flowers and lemon lime zest to the fore. In the mouth there are flavors of honeycomb, lemon and acacia flower. The finish is delightful and slightly sweet., Designation: Treasure of Transylvania Medium Sweet, Points: 86.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Tarnave, Title: Jidvei 2016 Treasure of Transylvania Medium Sweet Gewurztraminer (Tarnave), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Jidvei, Region: Tarnave, Style1: Gewürztraminer - Tarnave, Style2: Gewürztraminer - Tarnave, Style3: Gewürztraminer - Romania Country: Argentina, Description: Sweet it is, but given the price it is good wine with mass appeal. Apple, pear and mellow citrus aromas and flavors feature zero funk or mealy character, and the finish offers a dab of butterscotch. Shows mild residual sugar but many consumers will like that., Designation: Elsa, Points: 85.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Valentin Bianchi 2008 Elsa Chardonnay, Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Valentin Bianchi, Region: Mendoza Province, Style1: Chardonnay - Mendoza Province, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendoza Province, Style3: Chardonnay - Argentina Country: US, Description: Semisweet it is, with 12.2% alcohol and 30 g/L residual sugar. Lightly scented with bath powder, lavender and rose petal aromas, this brings on citrus and peach fruit, with a bit of phenolic bite carrying the finish., Designation: Semi-Sweet, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Oak Knoll 2011 Semi-Sweet Riesling (Oregon), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Oak Knoll, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Riesling - Oregon, Style2: Riesling - Oregon Other, Style3: Riesling - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: Almost like liquid cherry pie—but not sweet—this medium-bodied wine smells like the red fruit and baking spices, and tastes fresh and juicy with both red and sour cherries. It has good heft on the palate due to firm but light tannins and supportive acidity for balance., Designation: Slow Lope'n Vineyard, Points: 90.0, Price: 32.0, Province: California, Title: Brutocao 2013 Slow Lope'n Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Brutocao, Region: Anderson Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Anderson Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Anderson Valley Country: US, Description: Rich, ripe yellow cherries and honeysuckle waft from this luxuriously honeyed off-dry Riesling. A sweet tangerine flavor is densely concentrated on the palate, yet the wine is sprightly and zesty in mouthfeel. An elegant floral spray extends the long, lingering finish., Designation: Semi Sweet, Points: 90.0, Price: 15.0, Province: New York, Title: Keuka Spring 2013 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Keuka Spring, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Riesling - New York, Style2: Riesling - New York, Style3: Riesling - New York Country: Chile, Description: Made in a semisweet style, this smells almost dry, with notes of cheese and vanilla. On the palate, it's simple, where the sugary flavors quickly emerge before fading away to almost nothing., Designation: Semi Sweet, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Molina, Title: Floria 2010 Semi Sweet Cabernet Sauvignon (Molina), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Floria, Region: Molina, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Molina, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Molina, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Chile Country: US, Description: This Beaver State answer to Moscato d'Asti is sweet, sweet and more sweet. Who knows what the actual residual sugar reading is? That said, the lemon-lime aromas with notes of basil and tarragon are nice, and the wine is currently quite fresh (although it likely won't last long). Not too bubbly or aggressive, and pretty in the mouth due to fairly snappy acids. Drink now with fruit-based desserts or frosted cake., Designation: Early Muscat - Semi Sparkling, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Silvan Ridge 2002 Early Muscat - Semi Sparkling Muscat (Oregon), Variety: Muscat, Winery: Silvan Ridge, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Muscat - Oregon, Style2: Muscat - Oregon Other, Style3: Muscat - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: This is an excellent Harvest Select bottling, with bright, sappy flavors that seem not all that sweet. The residual sugar, listed at 47 g/L, is an asset, but doesn't dominate. Flavors remain as crisp as a fresh Macintosh apple, juicy, forward and delicious., Designation: Harvest Select Sweet, Points: 90.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Washington, Title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Harvest Select Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Chateau Ste. Michelle, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: Portugal, Description: A balanced wine that has both fresh red fruits and some tawny maturity. It has acidity, hints of wood aging and a spirit of freshness. The aftertaste is soft, smooth and toffee-like. Smooth-textured Port, with sweet red fruits under the brown sugar, nut and spirit flavors. This is certainly on the sweet side, with a velvet feel to it., Designation: Special Reserve Tawny, Points: 87.5, Price: 17.5, Province: Port, Title: Poças NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port), Variety: Port, Winery: Poças, Region: Port, Style1: Port - Port, Style2: Port - Port, Style3: Port - Portugal"

column1: Can you recommend a white wine that's creamy with a hint of vanilla or oak?,"
column3: Description

column2: Jack Nicklaus Wines 2012 Private Reserve White (Napa Valley)
column3: Creamy vanilla and spritzy acidity surround a ripe core of baked apple and pear. Full-bodied and touched by oak.
A blend of Chardonnay and Manzoni, this creamy white wine is redolent of yellow rose, stone fruit and vanilla cream.

column2: Milbrandt 2014 The Estates Clifton Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope)
column3: Bright aromas of vanilla, custard, flowers and peach lead to a creamy palate, filled with vanilla notes.

column2: Save Me San Francisco 2016 Bulletproof Picasso Sauvignon Blanc (California)
column3: Vanilla and butter touches give this medium-bodied, rather oaky wine extra richness.
Dusty and leesy on the nose, this blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca smells of peach pits and oak.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Creamy vanilla and spritzy acidity surround a ripe core of baked apple and pear in this white. Full-bodied and touched by oak, it finishes clean and concentrated., Designation: Private Reserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 46.0, Province: California, Title: Jack Nicklaus Wines 2012 Private Reserve White (Napa Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Jack Nicklaus Wines, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: White Blend - Napa Valley Country: Italy, Description: A blend of Chardonnay (70%) and Manzoni, this creamy white wine is redolent of yellow rose, stone fruit and vanilla cream. Pair it with spicy chicken curry or shellfish in butter sauce., Designation: Dedalo, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Vettori 2009 Dedalo White (Colli Trevigiani), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Vettori, Region: Colli Trevigiani, Style1: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Bright aromas of vanilla, custard, flowers and peach lead to a creamy palate, filled with vanilla notes. The oak plays a bit too prominent of a fiddle but there are lots of good things going on., Designation: The Estates Clifton Vineyard, Points: 88.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Washington, Title: Milbrandt 2014 The Estates Clifton Vineyard Viognier (Wahluke Slope), Variety: Viognier, Winery: Milbrandt, Region: Wahluke Slope, Style1: Viognier - Washington, Style2: Viognier - Washington, Style3: Viognier - Washington Country: US, Description: Vanilla and butter touches give this medium-bodied, rather oaky wine extra richness. Its soft, creamy texture and muted fruit flavors are a bit unusual for the type, but it's still quite enjoyable to sip., Designation: Bulletproof Picasso, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Save Me San Francisco 2016 Bulletproof Picasso Sauvignon Blanc (California), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Save Me San Francisco, Region: California, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - California Country: Spain, Description: Dusty and leesy on the nose, this blend of Viura, Malvasia and Garnacha Blanca smells of peach pits and oak. Creamy on the palate, this is a touch flat but not flabby. Banana, melon, vanilla and pecan flavors end with a barrel-heavy mix of vanilla and butter., Designation: Organza, Points: 88.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Sierra Cantabria 2012 Organza White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Sierra Cantabria, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: This rich cream-textured blend of Chardonnay and Viognier evokes warming pastry notes of vanilla, caramel and crème brûlée. It's a dry full-bodied wine with soft acidity and accents of toast, smoke and orange peel., Designation: Anemometer, Points: 88.0, Price: 35.0, Province: New York, Title: Kontokosta 2013 Anemometer White (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Kontokosta, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: White Blend - New York, Style2: White Blend - New York, Style3: White Blend - New York Country: US, Description: Tempting vanilla and nutmeg aromas and ripe pear and pineapple flavors animate this full-bodied, smooth and delicious wine made with 75% Chardonnay plus Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. The generous fruit and oak components are layered and creamy in texture., Designation: The Other, Points: 91.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Peirano 2014 The Other White (Lodi), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Peirano, Region: Lodi, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Lodi, Style3: White Blend - Lodi Country: US, Description: Pronounced notes of vanilla, spice and toast extend from nose to finish on this creamy, silk-edged Chardonnay. The palate is marked by soft peach, apple and pear flavors lifted by sunny lemon acidity. It's overtly oaky, but elegantly composed., Designation: Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 18.0, Province: New York, Title: Whitecliff Vineyard 2013 Reserve Chardonnay (Hudson River Region), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Whitecliff Vineyard, Region: Hudson River Region, Style1: Chardonnay - New York, Style2: Chardonnay - New York, Style3: Chardonnay - New York Country: Italy, Description: Creamy and generous with notes of soft vanilla and stone fruit, this Chardonnay-Sauvignon blend has a beautifully aromatic nose and a light, compact texture in the mouth. Pair it with lightly fried seafood or fritto misto., Designation: Vespa, Points: 89.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Bastianich 2006 Vespa White (Venezia Giulia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Bastianich, Region: Venezia Giulia, Style1: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: South Africa, Description: Seductive and forward, the Avec Chêne (with wood) boasts intense aromas of vanilla, butter and cream that frame the superripe peach and guava fruits. A touch of honey and sweet spice add depth to the round, creamy-textured palate. Rich but not overdone, with a sweet orange oil lift to the long, evolving finish. Drink 2013-2015., Designation: Avec Chêne, Points: 91.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Simonsig 2010 Avec Chêne Chenin Blanc (Stellenbosch), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: Simonsig, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Chenin Blanc - Stellenbosch, Style2: Chenin Blanc - Stellenbosch, Style3: Chenin Blanc - South Africa Country: Mexico, Description: This is a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Moscato that's yeasty and oaky on the nose. The mouth is creamy and home to apple, vanilla and oxidized afterflavors. There's enough solid pear and melon involved to make it worthwhile, but you can't miss the mature nature of the wine., Designation: Nuva, Points: 84.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Valle de Guadalupe, Title: Vinicola Fraternidad 2011 Nuva White (Valle de Guadalupe), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Vinicola Fraternidad, Region: Valle de Guadalupe, Style1: White Blend - Valle de Guadalupe, Style2: White Blend - Valle de Guadalupe, Style3: White Blend - Mexico Country: France, Description: This soft, although food friendly wine has a creamy character and touch of vanilla. The ripe melon and apricot fruit are balanced with the acidity and the warm texture. This is an enticing ripe wine that is ready to drink., Designation: Les Gourmets, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: La Confrérie de Oisly et Thésée 2015 Les Gourmets Sauvignon Blanc (Touraine), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: La Confrérie de Oisly et Thésée, Region: Touraine, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France Country: Spain, Description: Aromas of wood grain, vanilla, butter and fino Sherry are elegant and attractive for this style of white Rioja. On the palate, this oak-aged Viura is smooth, while creamy flavors of oak, apricot and peach excel. A smooth finish with plenty of vanilla and core acidity indicates this will age well for another 10 years., Designation: Capellanía, Points: 92.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Marqués de Murrieta 2010 Capellanía Viura (Rioja), Variety: Viura, Winery: Marqués de Murrieta, Region: Rioja, Style1: Viura - Northern Spain, Style2: Viura - Northern Spain, Style3: Viura - Spain Country: US, Description: Textured vanilla-cream and green apple appear initially in this wine, which offers plenty of weight and structure around a core of balanced acidity and fresh lemon zest. Cardamom and vanilla play at the edges alongside elements of savory brine and white flowers. The oak presence is subtle., Designation: Olivet Lane Vineyard, Points: 92.0, Price: 58.0, Province: California, Title: Williams Selyem 2013 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Williams Selyem, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Aromatically intense, with notes of dried peach, orange cream and vanilla, this blend of Chardonnay, Gewürztraminer and Malvasia aims to push the envelope with its rich, almost-fluffy texture, and its penetrating red-berry, stone-fruit and citrus flavors. The grapes were crushed by foot, and skin contact was employed during fermentation. This is a decadent, unusual, oak-aged orange wine., Designation: Envelope, Points: 90.0, Price: 42.0, Province: New York, Title: Channing Daughters 2009 Envelope White (Long Island), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Channing Daughters, Region: Long Island, Style1: White Blend - New York, Style2: White Blend - New York, Style3: White Blend - New York"

column1: I'd like a red wine, excluding Chardonnay.,"

A fine red wine, full-bodied, tannic and spicy, with juicy berry and tobacco flavors.

column2: Peter Franus 2006 Red Wine Red (Napa Valley)

A modern cult style of fruity ripeness, softness and rich oak shadings, this inaugural red from Gary Heck is a Cab-based Bordeaux blend with a splash of Sangiovese.
Dark and minerally, with black fruits, char and power on the nose. The palate is fresh and grippy, with integrated cassis, berry and herb flavors.

column2: Josef Weger 2007 Maso delle Rose Pinot Nero (Alto Adige)
column3: A bright and elegant red wine with a crisp, silky mouthfeel. The bouquet is redolent of wild berry, white almond, chopped mint and spice.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: A fine red wine, full-bodied, tannic and spicy, with juicy berry and tobacco flavors. Give it two or three years in the cellar to soften and mellow., Designation: Red Wine, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Peter Franus 2006 Red Wine Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Peter Franus, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Showing a flavor concentration unusual in California Chardonnay, this mountain wine is massive in baked tropical mango, guava and peach flavors, even a decadent taste of ripe bananas sautéed in butter and spiced with cinnamon, cloves and gingersnap cookie. It's also rich in smoky, caramelized oak, yet there's a firm backbone of minerals that, together with crisp acids, gives the wine structure., Designation: Red Point, Points: 94.0, Price: 42.0, Province: California, Title: Stonestreet 2006 Red Point Chardonnay (Alexander Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Stonestreet, Region: Alexander Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Alexander Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Alexander Valley Country: US, Description: Made solidly in the modern cult style of fruity ripeness, softness and rich oak shadings, this inaugural red from Gary Heck is a Cab-based Bordeaux blend with a splash of Sangiovese. It has complicated layers of blackberries, cherries, currants and milk chocolate. Quite delicious in primary fruit flavors, it could well be an ager., Designation: Vino Rosso, Points: 90.0, Price: 95.0, Province: California, Title: Pininfarina 2005 Vino Rosso Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Pininfarina, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: Chile, Description: Dark and minerally, with black fruits, char and power on the nose. It's not for everybody, but adventurous drinkers will appreciate the originality and personality., Designation: California, Points: 89.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: All About Red NV California Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: All About Red, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: Chile, Description: Offers varietally correct flavors of black currants and hints of tobacco, but where's the structure and depth? The contrast with fresher acidity gives this wine its balance. Drink now., Designation: Mariana, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Alentejano, Title: Herdade do Rocim 2013 Mariana Red (Alentejano), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Herdade do Rocim, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style2: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: With a rich palate and dense spicy black fruits, this is a full-bodied wine. Showing a balance of fresh berries, vibrant acidity and structured tannins, this is a classic Douro blend of Tinta Roriz, Touriga Nacional and Touriga Franca. Drink now., Designation: Rede Reserva Tinto, Points: 90.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Douro, Title: Quinta da Rede 2011 Rede Reserva Tinto Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Quinta da Rede, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: This is a useful red wine for everyday drinking. Full-bodied and spicy, it offers plenty of berry, plum sauce and toasted wood flavors., Designation: Showtime, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Bowtie 2010 Showtime Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Bowtie, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: A fine red wine, full-bodied, tannic and spicy, with juicy berry and tobacco flavors. The jug-shaped bottle is one of the cutest in California., Designation: Red, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Martin Ray 2009 Red Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Martin Ray, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: Enticing spicy, toasty aromas and robust, dry fruit flavors are matched by very firm, fine-grained tannins in this full-bodied wine. Based on 65% Zinfandel, it has lots to offer, but at this stage an oaky sensation and the astringent mouthfeel indicate that it needs to mellow. Best to drink after 2018., Designation: Coro Mendocino, Points: 89.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Barra of Mendocino 2012 Coro Mendocino Red (Mendocino), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Barra of Mendocino, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Mendocino, Style3: Red Blend - Mendocino Country: US, Description: Spicy oak nuances and maturity give this full-bodied wine a broad range of peppery, leathery, cedary aromas and mellow flavors reminiscent of milk chocolate and tamarind. It's rustic but fun to taste., Designation: True Red Lot 30, Points: 86.0, Price: 16.0, Province: California, Title: Fenestra NV True Red Lot 30 Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Fenestra, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: Lively, spicy and warm, this full-bodied wine wraps firm tannins around flavors like mulled berries and preserved cherries, though it's also surprisingly fresh and vibrant. After baking spices, mellow fruit comes through on the palate, while the firm texture really keeps it going on the finish., Designation: Pinot Grande, Points: 92.0, Price: 26.0, Province: California, Title: Boeger 2014 Pinot Grande Pinot Noir (El Dorado), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Boeger, Region: El Dorado, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - El Dorado, Style3: Pinot Noir - El Dorado Country: Italy, Description: Baked plum, grilled mushroom and a potpourri of spicy aromas emerge on this firmly structured red. The concentrated, full-bodied palate delivers ripe black cherry, tobacco, fig, ground pepper and a licorice note. Firm, ripe tannins provide support., Designation: Radici, Points: 92.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Mastroberardino 2009 Radici  (Taurasi), Variety: Aglianico, Winery: Mastroberardino, Region: Taurasi, Style1: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style2: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style3: Aglianico - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: This big, spicy wine is dominated by licorice and heavy toast wood flavors. It is rich and full of black plum skins with only a hint of acidity. The aftertaste is sharp and bitter., Designation: Terraços do Tejo, Points: 84.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Tejo, Title: Casal da Coelheira 2010 Terraços do Tejo Red (Tejo), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Casal da Coelheira, Region: Tejo, Style1: Portuguese Red - Tejo, Style2: Portuguese Red - Tejo, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: This full-bodied wine is packed with fruit and spice notes and is especially broad and mouth-filling. Made from mostly Grenache and Mourvèdre, with a dash of Syrah, it has generous ripe plum, macerated cherry and black pepper flavors that spread across the palate and linger on the finish., Designation: Tête-à-Tête, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Terre Rouge 2014 Tête-à-Tête Red (Sierra Foothills), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Terre Rouge, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Sierra Foothills, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - Sierra Foothills Country: Portugal, Description: Spanish producer Vicente Gandia continues its venture into Portugal with this ripe, spicy and toasty wine. Wood flavors mingle with the red fruits and bright acidity. It is rich, full and ready to drink., Designation: Boâbrisa, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Alentejo, Title: Vicente Gandia 2013 Boâbrisa Red (Alentejo), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Vicente Gandia, Region: Alentejo, Style1: Portuguese Red - Alentejo, Style2: Portuguese Red - Alentejo, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: A dramatic spiciness infuses this full-bodied wine with complexity from the aroma through the flavors and lingering finish. It has a dominant streak of smoky oak, a generous mouthfeel, mild tannins and plenty of blackberry and black plum notes., Designation: Old Vine, Points: 90.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Zinderella 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi), Variety: Zinfandel, Winery: Zinderella, Region: Lodi, Style1: Zinfandel - California, Style2: Zinfandel - Lodi, Style3: Zinfandel - Lodi Country: Italy, Description: Made entirely with Merlot, this full-bodied red opens with aromas of menthol, dark berries and cooking spices. The firm, savory palate offers ripe plum, juicy black cherry, cinnamon, clove and dark chocolate alongside velvety tannins. Drink through 2020., Designation: Casalferro, Points: 92.0, Price: 65.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Barone Ricasoli 2011 Casalferro Merlot (Toscana), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Barone Ricasoli, Region: Toscana, Style1: Merlot - Tuscany, Style2: Merlot - Tuscany, Style3: Merlot - Italy Country: US, Description: Spicy and fruity, this wine combines 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Malbec, 21% Cabernet Franc and 16% Petit Verdot. Blueberry and cassis make appearances, as do rich, full-bodied tannins and punches of oak. The finish delves into chocolate, tobacco and coffee in equal measure., Designation: Winemaker's Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Provenance Vineyards 2012 Winemaker's Reserve Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Provenance Vineyards, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: Italy, Description: This full-bodied red opens with aromas of ripe plum, vanilla, coconut and a whiff of exotic spice. The palate delivers oak extract, anise, dried blackberry and oak-driven spice alongside rather raspy tannins that leave an astringent finish., Designation: Riserva, Points: 87.0, Price: 42.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Setriolo 2010 Riserva  (Chianti Classico), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Setriolo, Region: Chianti Classico, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy"

column1: I'm curious about trying a red wine with smoky or toasty flavors. Any suggestions?,"
column3: Description

column2: García Figuero 2012 Tinto 15 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero)
column3: Smoky, dark aromas of minty blackberry, tobacco, black coffee and toast. Dark, toasty flavors of black fruits and dark chocolate finish.

column2: Luis Cañas 2009 Reserva Selección de la Familia  (Rioja)
column3: Smoky, toasty oak aromas are dominant on a black-fruit bouquet that also shows graphite. Savory, meaty, spicy blackberry flavors.
Smoky and toasty. It tastes sweet and black peppery, and is very full bodied.

column2: Sobon Estate 2014 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County)
column3: Smoky, toasty oak aromas and flavors give a flamboyant personality to this full-bodied wine.
The wine is smoky with plenty of toastiness. Bright red fruits are right up-front to give the wine its crispness and acidity.
column9: ,Country: Spain, Description: Smoky, dark aromas of minty blackberry, tobacco, black coffee and toast are complex and lead to a tight bullish palate with fierce tannins. Dark, toasty flavors of black fruits and dark chocolate finish grabby but with freshness and a sense of purity. Drink 2018–2034., Designation: Tinto 15 Reserva, Points: 93.0, Price: 66.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: García Figuero 2012 Tinto 15 Reserva  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: García Figuero, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Smoky, toasty oak aromas are dominant on a black-fruit bouquet that also shows graphite. This is saturated and tight, with complexity and outright deliciousness of savory, meaty, spicy blackberry flavors. Toast, cured beef and cocoa flavors prove that there's more to this than just heft and oak. Best from 2019 through 2032., Designation: Reserva Selección de la Familia, Points: 93.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Luis Cañas 2009 Reserva Selección de la Familia  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Luis Cañas, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: One of the few red dessert wines with obvious new-oak flavors, this wine smells smoky and toasty. It tastes sweet and black peppery, and is very full bodied., Designation: USB, Points: 88.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Peltier NV USB Red (Lodi), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Peltier, Region: Lodi, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Lodi, Style3: Red Blend - Lodi Country: US, Description: Smoky, toasty oak aromas and flavors give a flamboyant personality to this full-bodied wine. It smells literally like wood smoke and toasted French bread, while flavors recall jam spiced with cloves and cinnamon. These are all tasty elements, and this wine will be a hit with oak lovers., Designation: Cougar Hill, Points: 88.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Sobon Estate 2014 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County), Variety: Zinfandel, Winery: Sobon Estate, Region: Amador, Style1: Zinfandel - California, Style2: Zinfandel - Amador, Style3: Zinfandel - Amador Country: France, Description: The wine is smoky with plenty of toastiness. At the same time, the bright red fruits are right up-front to give the wine its crispness and acidity. Drink this wine from 2018., Designation: Cuvée Sarah, Points: 88.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Petit-Freylon 2015 Cuvée Sarah  (Bordeaux Supérieur), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Petit-Freylon, Region: Bordeaux Supérieur, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: US, Description: A heavy smoke aroma and similar smoky, toasty flavors dominate this medium-bodied wine. The mouthfeel is velvety and a modest amount of cherry flavor bolsters the oaky, smoky character., Designation: Borderline, Points: 86.0, Price: 36.0, Province: California, Title: Bailiwick 2013 Borderline Pinot Noir (Marin County), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Bailiwick, Region: Marin, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Marin, Style3: Pinot Noir - Marin Country: France, Description: A smoky spicy wine that is full of berry fruits and with some toasty wood-aging flavors. With its tannic structure it will need to age, although already the bright berry fruits are generous and ripe. Drink from 2022., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Pierre Guillemot 2015 Vieilles Vignes  (Savigny-lès-Beaune), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Domaine Pierre Guillemot, Region: Savigny-lès-Beaune, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: Argentina, Description: Charred, smoky, herbal aromas of blackberry trend in the direction of exotic before showing barrel-driven scents of vanilla and clove. This exhibits plenty of depth and sponginess along with toasty, herbal flavors of plum and blackberry. Pepper, burnt toast, clove and blueberry flavors carry the finish on this hefty Malbec; drink through 2021., Designation: Gran Reserva by Richard Bonvin, Points: 90.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Mendoza Vineyards 2012 Gran Reserva by Richard Bonvin Malbec (Mendoza), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Mendoza Vineyards, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: Spain, Description: Deep, smoky aromas of black fruits are muscular and full. This is well structured and strong, with toast and dark-fruit flavors of blackberry and plum. Spicy, peppery flavors and mild heat drive the finish., Designation: Red, Points: 88.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Gran Vinaio 2010 Red Grenache (Montsant), Variety: Grenache, Winery: Gran Vinaio, Region: Montsant, Style1: Grenache - Catalonia, Style2: Grenache - Catalonia, Style3: Grenache - Spain Country: US, Description: Billowy tannins star in this blend of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Petit Verdot, 11% Malbec, 10% Merlot and 4% Cabernet Franc. Smoky toast and tobacco form a foundation of prominent oak and tannin, softened by ripe layers of black cherry, blueberry and mocha., Designation: Tresor, Points: 86.0, Price: 55.0, Province: California, Title: Ferrari-Carano 2014 Tresor Red (Sonoma County), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Ferrari-Carano, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma Country: Spain, Description: This Monastrell-led blend opens with a smoky blast of toasty oak on top of forest floor and herbal tones. The palate feels massive and extracted, showing ripe cassis and blackberry. Chocolate, herb, toast, berry and black currant flavors ride through the ripe finish. Drink through 2017., Designation: Triga, Points: 91.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Levante, Title: Volver 2011 Triga Red (Alicante), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Volver, Region: Alicante, Style1: Red Blend - Levante, Style2: Red Blend - Levante, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Charred and smoky on first take, this has plenty of upfront oak that adds a toasty quality to the core plum and berry aromas. It feels full, round and pure, with dark, slightly balsamic-like flavors of baked berry and earth. It's smooth, mild and unobtrusive on the finish. Drink now–2016., Designation: Reserva Edición Limitada, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Ysios 2007 Reserva Edición Limitada  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Ysios, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Smoky, heavily charred aromas of burnt wood and shoe polish outweigh black-fruit scents. This feels crisp and tannic to the point of being grating, while woody, toasty black-plum flavors finish spicy, peppery and hot., Designation: Tarima Organic, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Levante, Title: Volver 2014 Tarima Organic Monastrell (Alicante), Variety: Monastrell, Winery: Volver, Region: Alicante, Style1: Monastrell - Levante, Style2: Monastrell - Levante, Style3: Monastrell - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Burnt toast, hickory smoke, barrel char and baking-spice aromas are woody and a bit cheesy. This is an intense old-vines wine with a deep palate and bulky tannins. Flavors of charred oak, savory spices and black fruits end with lushness, toasty notes, black-pepper spice and heady weight. Drink through 2024., Designation: Viñas Viejas, Points: 93.0, Price: 69.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: García Figuero 2011 Viñas Viejas  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: García Figuero, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: France, Description: This balanced wine is full of dusty, dry tannins as well as ripe red fruits. A smokiness gives a dense, toasty character to the wine. With good acidity, typical of the vintage, the wine is well placed to develop. Drink from 2020., Designation: Les Longeroies, Points: 92.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Jean Fournier 2014 Les Longeroies  (Marsannay), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Domaine Jean Fournier, Region: Marsannay, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France"

column1: What would be a good wine for a celebration?,"
column3: Description

column2: Armstrong Family 2012 Celebration Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Aromas of black tea, cinnamon, herbs, licorice and dried cherry. Full in feel, layered and rich with a lingering fruit- and herb-filled finish.

column2: MontGras 2014 XX Celebration Series Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Chile)
column3: Earthy, leathery plum aromas are dense and stewy. Blackened, peppery flavors of lightly stewed berry fruits and plum.

column2: Armstrong Family 2012 Celebration Series Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
column3: Offers aromas of vanilla, cranberry, cinnamon and raisinated red fruit. The palate has tart acids and good flavor concentration.
Bracingly tart, and seems to have zero dosage. Flavors are simple, fruity and fresh.

column2: Iron Horse 2012 Wedding Cuvée Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)
column3: Dry and beautifully floral, it opens in a bouquet of marzipan, peach and honey.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: This aromatically brooding wine offers aromas of black tea, cinnamon, herbs, licorice and dried cherry. It's full in feel, layered and rich with a lingering fruit- and herb-filled finish, and a good sense of tannic structure holding it all together., Designation: Celebration Series, Points: 91.0, Price: 32.0, Province: Washington, Title: Armstrong Family 2012 Celebration Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Armstrong Family, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington Country: Chile, Description: Earthy, leathery plum aromas are dense and stewy more than bright. This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Carmenère feels soft, jammy and saturated. Blackened, peppery flavors of lightly stewed berry fruits and plum taste of resiny oak, graphite and pepper on a plump finish., Designation: XX Celebration Series, Points: 86.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Chile, Title: MontGras 2014 XX Celebration Series Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère (Chile), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère, Winery: MontGras, Region: Chile, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère - Chile, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère - Chile, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon-Carmenère - Chile Country: US, Description: This 100% varietal wine, barrel-aged in French and American oak, offers aromas of vanilla, cranberry, cinnamon and raisinated red fruit, seeming a bit advanced for its age. The palate has tart acids and good flavor concentration, backed by somewhat blocky tannins., Designation: Celebration Series, Points: 88.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Washington, Title: Armstrong Family 2012 Celebration Series Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Cabernet Franc, Winery: Armstrong Family, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Cabernet Franc - Washington, Style2: Cabernet Franc - Washington, Style3: Cabernet Franc - Washington Country: US, Description: This young sparkler is bracingly tart, and seems to have zero dosage. Flavors are simple, fruity and fresh, and the wine works well as a base for cocktails., Designation: Celebrate, Points: 85.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Kramer 2013 Celebrate Pinot Gris, Variety: Pinot Gris, Winery: Kramer, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Gris - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Gris - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Gris - Willamette Valley Country: US, Description: An offering meant to toast all manner of celebrations, this wine wows, blending 78% Pinot Noir with 22% Chardonnay in a near-perfect union. Dry and beautifully floral, it opens in a bouquet of marzipan, peach and honey. The mousse is fine, while supporting acidity lends a lemon peel and grapefruit lift. The memory imprinted on the palate will linger long after all the toasts to the happy couple—or whatever else you're celebrating—have been made., Designation: Wedding Cuvée Estate Bottled, Points: 96.0, Price: 44.0, Province: California, Title: Iron Horse 2012 Wedding Cuvée Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: Iron Horse, Region: Green Valley, Style1: Sparkling Blend - California, Style2: Sparkling Blend - Green Valley, Style3: Sparkling Blend - Green Valley Country: France, Description: Bounteous fruit flavors need a little air to wake up but soon you'll have a party in your glass of ripe yellow plums, freshly cut apples, pears and melons. This is easy and very fruit-driven, balanced, light and just the ticket for a party in the sunshine., Designation: Tradition, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Alsace, Title: W. Gisselbrecht 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Blanc, Winery: W. Gisselbrecht, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Blanc - France Country: Italy, Description: This Moscato is a great value, a perfect opening for a big party. Made in a subtle, lightly sweet style, with sophisticated gardenia and white flower scents on the nose. A jazzy midpalate mineral note contributes some edge, while the elegant finish trails off into intriguing notes of fresh ginger and roasted pineapple. Drink up, no reason to age., Designation: Pitulé, Points: 86.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: Neirano 2008 Pitulé  (Moscato d'Asti), Variety: Moscato, Winery: Neirano, Region: Moscato d'Asti, Style1: Moscato - Piedmont, Style2: Moscato - Piedmont, Style3: Moscato - Italy Country: Argentina, Description: Boisterous black plum and blackberry aromas properly announce an extra grabby palate with rock-hard tannins. This tastes like roasted plum, cassis and blackened spices. Tannic and dry as a bone on the finish, with a savory note., Designation: Festivo, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Monteviejo 2014 Festivo Malbec (Mendoza), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Monteviejo, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: US, Description: This celebration of legendary Jerry Lohr's 80th birthday is a winner on all fronts. A zesty, uplifting nose of blackberry, cola, licorice, leather and clay leads into a cohesively woven palate of soy, shiitake dust, roast beef and dark chocolate. The acidity is well-measured, the tannins are chalky and grippy and it's powerful without being flashy., Designation: Signature, Points: 93.0, Price: 100.0, Province: California, Title: J. Lohr 2013 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: J. Lohr, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Paso Robles, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: Made from 100% Chardonnay, this wine is marketed to celebrate wedding anniversaries. It's as light as a feather, with a fine, silky mousse framing orange, lime, vanilla, honey and yeasty sourdough flavors. Delicious and elegant, it's a wine to toast with almost anything, including wedding cake., Designation: Anniversary Cuvée, Points: 90.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Gloria Ferrer 2008 Anniversary Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: Gloria Ferrer, Region: Carneros, Style1: Sparkling Blend - California, Style2: Sparkling Blend - Carneros, Style3: Sparkling Blend - Carneros Country: Italy, Description: In homage to the 150th anniversary of Italian unification, this elegantly designed bottle sports a bright Italian flag on the label. That celebratory spirit continues thanks to the wine's aromas of sweet cherry, cola and raspberry. Its light consistency means it could be consumed slightly chilled with cod or fish soup., Designation: 150 Anniversario, Points: 87.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: Il Vino dei Padri 2009 150 Anniversario Ruché (Monferrato), Variety: Ruché, Winery: Il Vino dei Padri, Region: Monferrato, Style1: Ruché - Piedmont, Style2: Ruché - Piedmont, Style3: Ruché - Italy Country: US, Description: This small-production, nouveau-style wine was made without oak or filtering. Simple and juicy, it's festive, with effusive dried cranberry and cola spice notes that are soft and easygoing., Designation: Nouveau, Points: 88.0, Price: 30.0, Province: California, Title: Spicy Vines 2016 Nouveau Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Spicy Vines, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Soft and fruity, this easy-drinking Syrah has pleasant, jammy flavors of raspberries, blackberries, cola, bacon and peppery spices. It's a nice, full-bodied red wine to drink now with party food., Designation: Tribute Series, Points: 85.0, Price: 27.0, Province: California, Title: Ben Hogan 2008 Tribute Series Syrah (Paso Robles), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Ben Hogan, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - Paso Robles, Style3: Syrah - Paso Robles Country: Argentina, Description: Monteviejo, one of the Clos de los Siete wineries, has entered the unofficial “fun Malbec” category with Festivo, which has a stemmy, slightly burnt character that is present from start to finish. Along the way there are leathery black fruit flavors, herbal qualities and a good mouthfeel. Decent wine but decidedly herbal and stemmy., Designation: Festivo, Points: 84.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Monteviejo 2009 Festivo Malbec (Uco Valley), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Monteviejo, Region: Uco Valley, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: US, Description: A well-made relatively large production Cabernet, fruity in black cherry with a smoky edge of cinnamon toast and soft vanilla. Pour at your next party., Designation: Estate Grown, Points: 86.0, Price: 15.0, Province: California, Title: James Mitchell 2010 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: James Mitchell, Region: Lodi, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Lodi, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Lodi"

column1: Are there any red wines with a hint of chocolate or cocoa notes?,"
column3: Description
Strong extraction with hints of bitter chocolate and licorice flavors.

column2: Andrew Will 2005 Sheridan Vineyard Red Wine Red (Yakima Valley)
column3: Aromatic, chocolaty and deliciously smooth, with sweet scents of ground coffee and chocolate.
Light on fruit but loaded with mocha and milk chocolate aromas.

column2: Sartori 2008 Rerum 500 ml  (Recioto della Valpolicella Classico)
column3: Red dessert wine with layers of fudge, smoke, roasted almond and exotic spice.

column1: Can you recommend a red wine with a balanced acidity and red fruit flavors?,"
column3: Description
Balanced wine, its acidity marking the red berry fruits. It has a dry, tough core, while the fruit rolls easily through the structure.
This balanced wine is full of dusty, dry tannins as well as ripe red fruits. A smokiness gives a dense, toasty character to the wine.
Ripe fruit and balanced acidity allow this wine to make room for touches of wood aging. It has spice, a smoky character and attractive finishing freshness.

column2: Ruhlmann NV Harmonie Rosé Pinot Noir (Crémant d'Alsace)

column2: Château Donjon de Bruignac 2014 Premium  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
column3: The wine is ripe and smooth with a fine balance between acidity and the red fruits. It is light on tannins, concentrating on the fruitiness.

column1: I prefer white wines that are aromatic with floral or honeysuckle notes. Any suggestions?,"
column3: Description
A light, subtly refreshing classic Alsace blend with notes of honeysuckle, pear, and wet earth.

column2: Principi di Porcìa 2008 Ca' Bembo Pinot Grigio (Friuli Grave)

column2: The Williamsburg Winery 2015 Petite Fleur White (Virginia)

column1: Could you suggest a white wine with a creamy texture and tropical fruit notes?,"
column3: Description

column2: J. Portugal Ramos 2012 Marquês de Borba Branco White (Alentejo)
column3: A smooth, creamy textured wine that has both citrus and richer tropical fruits. Pineapple and lemon mingle with a more zesty acidity.
Tropical-fruit aromas and lavish flavors go well with the richness and full body of this creamy-textured wine. Toasted almond, nutmeg and vanilla all come out on the palate.

column2: Allée Bleue 2008 Starlette Blanc White (Western Cape)
column3: This blend of Sauvignon Blanc, Chenin Blanc and Garnacha Blanc is a good-to-go white with fruity, spicy aromas and creamy flavors of pineapple, pear and tropical fruit.

column2: Herdade do Esporão 2008 Esporão Private Selection White (Alentejo)
column3: A ripe, creamy Chardonnay-like wine, the tropical orange and lychee fruits pointed up with new French wood. The fresh lime acidity cuts through the richness.
column9: ,Country: Portugal, Description: A smooth, creamy textured wine that has both citrus and richer tropical fruits. column1: Can you suggest a white wine that's crisp and has a hint of grassiness or herbaceousness?,"
column3: Description

column2: Espaço Rural 2014 Alves Vieira Branco White (Alentejano)
column3: Grassy, green aromas with a herbal, crisp taste. Tight and tangy, with green fruit aromas and a fresh aftertaste.
A grassy hint of freshness accents this wine's ripe green and red apple-inflected nose. Fruit-driven and slender in body, it finishes refreshing and dry.
This grassy, very herbaceous wine is all crisp green fruits. Touched by a creamy texture under a layer of freshness, it shows some good weight and structure.
Grassy, slightly green aromas are fresh and suggest cactus pad. This is easy on the palate, with flavors of citrus fruits and green herbs.

column2: Cline 2013 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)
column3: Grassy aromatically, this is a crisp, refreshing white that's slightly undefined in pear and melon. Light bodied and easy to quaff.
column9: ,Country: Portugal, Description: Grassy, green aromas give this a herbal, crisp taste. It is tight and tangy, with green fruit aromas and a fresh aftertaste. column1: What's a good white wine with a bright acidity and stone fruit flavors?,"
column3: Description
Bright, fresh and pristine. Bright acidity is backed by flavors of stone fruit, citrus and Golden Delicious apple.
Combines ripe fruit and freshness, with aromas of yellow flower and yellow stone fruit.
A blend of white grapes with citrus and stone fruit notes, plus drying aromas of talcum powder and crushed mineral.
Alluring white flower and yellow stone fruit scents. The palate delivers white peach, mature pear, ginger and lemon drop flavors.
Delicate aromas of yellow flower and stone fruit. The bright palate displays tart apple and Bartlett pear alongside bitter almond.
column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: The aromatic delivery is bright, fresh and pristine. Bright acidity is backed by flavors of stone fruit, citrus and Golden Delicious apple. It's the kind of white to serve with summer salad lunches by the pool., Designation: Intaglio, Points: 87.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: La Vis 2010 Intaglio Pinot Grigio (Trentino), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: La Vis, Region: Trentino, Style1: Pinot Grigio - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Pinot Grigio - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Pinot Grigio - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Combining ripe fruit and freshness, this sunny white delivers aromas of yellow flower and yellow stone fruit. Bright acidity lifts the rich flavors while a hint of almond closes the finish., Designation: I Croppi, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Celli 2015 I Croppi Albana (Romagna), Variety: Albana, Winery: Celli, Region: Romagna, Style1: Albana - Central Italy, Style2: Albana - Central Italy, Style3: Albana - Italy Country: Italy, Description: A blend of white grapes indigenous to Sicily, this bright wine opens with citrus and stone fruit notes, plus drying aromas of talcum powder and crushed mineral. For barrel-fermented Viura, this is not oaky in any overt way., Designation: Barrel Fermented, Points: 89.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Muga 2015 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Muga, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Italy, Description: Delicately scented, this offers yellow stone-fruit and citrus aromas. The wine performs beautifully in the mouth thanks to its soft texture., Designation: Stoan, Points: 90.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Tramin 2011 Stoan White (Alto Adige), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Tramin, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: Spain, Description: Waxy, dusty aromas of stone fruits and honey are typical of Garnatxa Blanca, although this contains 30% Viognier as well. Only on the finish does this taste mildly yeasty and slightly buttery., Designation: Via Edetana, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Edetària 2013 Via Edetana White (Terra Alta), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Edetària, Region: Terra Alta, Style1: White Blend - Catalonia, Style2: White Blend - Catalonia, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Apple and stone-fruit aromas are basic, mild and good. Flavors of apple, green herbs and nectarine finish smooth., Designation: Made with Organic Grapes, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Paso a Paso 2012 Made with Organic Grapes White (La Mancha), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Paso a Paso, Region: La Mancha, Style1: White Blend - Central Spain, Style2: White Blend - Central Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Sugary and fruity, this Viognier-based Rhône blend is almost as sweet as a dessert wine. On the crisp palate, bright acidity balances green apple, Williams pear and a hint of citrus while a mineral note closes the finish., Designation: Plattenriegl, Points: 89.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Girlan 2014 Plattenriegl Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige), Variety: Pinot Bianco, Winery: Girlan, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Pinot Bianco - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Pinot Bianco - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Pinot Bianco - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Floral scents of honeysuckle and citrus blossom mingle with white stone fruit aromas. The lively weightless palate doles out white peach and green apple framed in bright acidity and a polished perlage. It has a clean, refreshing finish. Bright and fragrant, this offers scents of acacia, herbs and stone fruit accented by a hint of nuts. The bright palate offers white peach, green apple and citrus framed in vibrant acidity together with a frothy mousse. Simple lines, bright fruit flavors, creamy bubbles and fresh acids are what make good Prosecco Superiore. This wine has all these qualities and delivers them in a clean and determined manner., Designation: Brut, Points: 88.0, Price: 18.33333333333333, Province: Veneto, Title: Sommariva NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore), Variety: Glera, Winery: Sommariva, Region: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Style1: Glera - Veneto, Style2: Glera - Veneto, Style3: Glera - Italy Country: Spain, Description: Dusty stone-fruit aromas suggest yeast and nectarine. Overall, this is linear and fairly basic for white wine., Designation: XIC, Points: 87.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Agustí Torelló Mata 2015 XIC Xarel-lo (Penedès), Variety: Xarel-lo, Winery: Agustí Torelló Mata, Region: Penedès, Style1: Xarel-lo - Catalonia, Style2: Xarel-lo - Catalonia, Style3: Xarel-lo - Spain Country: Argentina, Description: Stony, minerally aromas show a pinch of toast on top of white peach and apple cider scents.
