column1: Recommend a wine with hints of berry.,"
column3: Description
Inviting hints of crushed blueberry and blackberry with overtones of smoke. Smooth palate with ripe tannins and refreshing berry fruit.
Blackberry, black cherry and blueberry aromas with complex hints of dark chocolate and nutmeg. Firm tannins with black plums, vanilla, caramel, dill and dried mint flavors.

column2: Red Rock 2012 Winemaker's Blend Reserve Red (California)
column3: Extroverted wine with blackberry jam smells and tastes of boysenberry and blackberry with hints of chocolate and cherry.
Berry aromas with a hint of pine and juniper. Quick wash of red plum and raspberry flavors with an herbal leaning and minty notes.
Blueberry and blackberry aromas with a little earthiness. Juicy, jammy palate with raspberry, tart red plum and spice flavors.
column9: ,Country: Austria, Description: The merest hint of red currant berries plays on the nose and then relaxes into a fresh but fruit-filled palate. It's a light, dry rosé that is simple but very refreshing. Drink soon., Designation: Jerry & Barry, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Weinland Österreich, Title: Markus Altenburger 2013 Jerry & Barry Rosé (Weinland Österreich), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Markus Altenburger, Region: Weinland Österreich, Style1: Rosé - Weinland Österreich, Style2: Rosé - Weinland Österreich, Style3: Rosé - Austria Country: Austria, Description: Inviting hints of crushed blueberry and blackberry show the slightest overtones of smoke. The palate is smooth, with still slightly crunchy but ripe tannins that provide a pleasant framework for the refreshing berry fruit. A ripe, appetizing medium-bodied red with a welcome streak of freshness., Designation: Rosenberg, Points: 89.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Carnuntum, Title: Markowitsch 2012 Rosenberg Red (Carnuntum), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Markowitsch, Region: Carnuntum, Style1: Red Blend - Carnuntum, Style2: Red Blend - Carnuntum, Style3: Red Blend - Austria Country: US, Description: Blackberry, black cherry and blueberry aromas are cut by complex hints of dark chocolate and nutmeg on this Cabernet Franc and Merlot blend. The tannins are quite firm on the palate, framing black plums, vanilla, caramel, dill and dried mint flavors. Drinking 2018–2030 will allow more black cherry and blueberry character to evolve on the sip., Designation: Justification, Points: 93.0, Price: 55.0, Province: California, Title: Justin 2012 Justification Red (Paso Robles), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Justin, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles Country: Australia, Description: This wine starts off a bit tarry or rubbery, but decanting allows the bright berry fruit to come forward. Raspberries are limned with hints of mint and other herbs and framed by vanilla. It's medium-bodied, with a tangy finish and a crisp, satiny texture. Drink now., Designation: Benchmark, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Grant Burge 2010 Benchmark Shiraz (South Australia), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Grant Burge, Region: South Australia, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: US, Description: This extroverted and very yummy wine is dark and deep in color. It smells like it's drenched in blackberry jam and tastes almost as thick. Gobs of boysenberry and blackberry flavors carry hints of chocolate and cherry. It's not too full bodied, just full flavored., Designation: Winemaker's Blend Reserve, Points: 90.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Red Rock 2012 Winemaker's Blend Reserve Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Red Rock, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: Spain, Description: Berry aromas with a hint of pine and juniper form the opening on this fresh-style Rioja. A quick wash of red plum and raspberry flavors comes with an herbal leaning and minty notes. This finishes firm but light in weight, with a minty aftertaste., Designation: Tinto, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Viña Bujanda 2011 Tinto  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Viña Bujanda, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Pure, deep berry aromas are accented by quality oak and a hint of earthy prune. Chewy, dense and concentrated on the palate, this tastes ripe, chocolaty and earthy, with blackberry and pepper flavors that stay the course and finish peppery and dark, with a mild note of rubber. Drink through 2019., Designation: Embruix, Points: 90.0, Price: 27.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Vall Llach 2013 Embruix Red (Priorat), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Vall Llach, Region: Priorat, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Hints of earth and mushroom, soy sauce and brine add umami to succulent blackberry and cherry flavors in this Merlot-based Bordeaux blend. The palate is crisp with sour-cherry acidity, and finishes with bold, chunky tannins that linger. It's showing quite a bit of maturity already, so drink now with a quick decant., Designation: La Tavola, Points: 86.0, Price: 14.0, Province: New York, Title: Raphael 2010 La Tavola Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Raphael, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - New York, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - New York, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - New York Country: Italy, Description: If you can accept a slight hint of jamminess, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot is for you. Beyond the ripe cherry and blackberry is a beautiful blast of pleasure and opulence. Pair this wine with succulent cuts of red meat., Designation: San Martino, Points: 91.0, Price: unknown, Province: Tuscany, Title: Cipriana 2007 San Martino  (Bolgheri Superiore), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Cipriana, Region: Bolgheri Superiore, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Spain, Description: Jumpy, punchy berry aromas are high-toned. This blend feels creamy, candied and syrupy. Sweet flavors of baked fruits and Boston baked beans finish with hints of berry syrup., Designation: Made With Organically Grown Grapes, Points: 83.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Spain Other, Title: Earth Wise 2015 Made With Organically Grown Grapes Red (Spain), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Earth Wise, Region: Spain, Style1: Red Blend - Spain Other, Style2: Red Blend - Spain Other, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Blueberry and blackberry aromas are spunky and a little earthy. A juicy, jammy palate is angular and fairly sharp. Wild berry flavors seem right off the bush, while this wine is tight and narrow on an acidic finish. Drink through 2023., Designation: Rayos Uvas, Points: 90.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Olivier Rivière 2016 Rayos Uvas  (Rioja), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Olivier Rivière, Region: Rioja, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Fiery berry and cherry aromas emerge with a hint of milk chocolate. This wine feels high in acidity, with raspberry, tart red plum and spice flavors that finish with citrusy snap and grittiness., Designation: Bordón Reserva, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2007 Bordón Reserva  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Bodegas Franco-Españolas, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: This is floral on the nose, but also candied smelling. So don't be surprised that the palate, while friendly and fruity, is also sticky in feel with a syrupy core flavor that's suggestive of residual sugar. That said, this jellybean is an easy drinker., Designation: Berry Smooth, Points: 85.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Jellybean Wines 2011 Berry Smooth Red (Catalunya), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Jellybean Wines, Region: Catalunya, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Wiry berry aromas come with a touch of sweet plastic. This feels hard and tannic as well as fleshy. Herbal, lightly weedy and salty plum and berry flavors finish with lively acidity and foxy, jammy berry notes., Designation: Tinto Niño Jesús, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Figaro 2015 Tinto Niño Jesús Garnacha (Calatayud), Variety: Garnacha, Winery: Figaro, Region: Calatayud, Style1: Garnacha - Northern Spain, Style2: Garnacha - Northern Spain, Style3: Garnacha - Spain Country: Portugal, Description: Packed with ripe blackberry fruits, this is a dense, concentrated wine. It has a powerful structure that is filled out with delicious jammy fruits. The wine is perfumed and fresh with acidity while keeping its solid, dark character that is at its heart. Drink now, although the wine will be even better from 2018., Designation: Statement, Points: 91.0, Price: unknown, Province: Port, Title: Barão de Vilar 2011 Statement  (Port), Variety: Port, Winery: Barão de Vilar, Region: Port, Style1: Port - Port, Style2: Port - Port, Style3: Port - Portugal"

column1: Is there a wine that is not too sweet?,"Yes, there are several wines that are not too sweet. Here are some recommendations:

column3: Description

column2: Brutocao 2013 Slow Lope'n Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
column3: Almost like liquid cherry pie—but not sweet—this medium-bodied wine smells like the red fruit and baking spices, and tastes fresh and juicy with both red and sour cherries.

column2: Rosa d'Oro 2012 Slightly Sweet Muscat (Yolo County)
column3: This fragrant and inviting wine is exactly what it proclaims to be, slightly sweet in honeysuckle, citrus and crisp texture.
Labeled late harvest, but not terribly sweet, this includes small amounts of Muscat, Gewürztraminer and Chenin Blanc in the blend.

column2: Keuka Spring 2009 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes)
column3: Mulled apple cider, ginger and candied orange peel aromas perfume this easy-drinking Riesling.
Not really sweet, and not entirely Riesling (the blend includes 13% Gewürztraminer and 10% Pinot Gris), this off-dry wine tastes like fresh squeezed apple juice, lightly sweetened.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: From both Muscat Canelli (65%) and Muscat Giallo (35%), this fragrant and inviting wine is exactly what it proclaims to be, slightly sweet in honeysuckle, citrus and crisp texture. It offers lightness and lingering acidity in a moderate-alcohol package., Designation: Slightly Sweet, Points: 90.0, Price: 16.0, Province: California, Title: Rosa d'Oro 2012 Slightly Sweet Muscat (Yolo County), Variety: Muscat, Winery: Rosa d'Oro, Region: Yolo, Style1: Muscat - California, Style2: Muscat - Yolo, Style3: Muscat - Yolo Country: US, Description: Sweet but not too sweet for some entrées, such as spicy Thai food, this brings a fruity mix of pear, pineapple and orange-creamsickle flavors. It's smooth and soft, not at all sugary, and framed with fresh acids., Designation: Sweet, Points: 89.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Washington, Title: Pacific Rim 2012 Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Pacific Rim, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: US, Description: Labeled late harvest, but not terribly sweet, this includes small amounts of Muscat, Gewürztraminer and Chenin Blanc in the blend. Lemony with both citrus rind and sweet candy flavors, it's a useful, off-dry wine with a slightly sugary finish., Designation: Late Harvest, Points: 87.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Washington, Title: Hogue 2010 Late Harvest Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Hogue, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: US, Description: Mulled apple cider, ginger and candied orange peel aromas perfume this easy-drinking Riesling. Tart acidity and a kick of apple pie spice meld playfully with the semisweet palate. A nice wine for casual autumn entertaining., Designation: Semi Sweet, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: New York, Title: Keuka Spring 2009 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Keuka Spring, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Riesling - New York, Style2: Riesling - New York, Style3: Riesling - New York Country: US, Description: Not really sweet, and not entirely Riesling (the blend includes 13% Gewürztraminer and 10% Pinot Gris), this off-dry wine tastes like fresh squeezed apple juice, lightly sweetened., Designation: Sweet, Points: 84.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Washington, Title: Lake Chelan 2010 Sweet Riesling (Lake Chelan), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Lake Chelan, Region: Lake Chelan, Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: Hungary, Description: This semisweet late harvest Hungarian wine has aromas of apricot, caramelized pear and pear tart. There are lovely flavors of canned apricots, sweet ripe pear, white flowers and honeycomb. The finish is sweet but has balanced acidity., Designation: Once Upon a Time Szamorodni Sweet, Points: 90.0, Price: 33.0, Province: Tokaj, Title: Basilicus 2012 Once Upon a Time Szamorodni Sweet Furmint (Tokaj), Variety: Furmint, Winery: Basilicus, Region: Tokaj, Style1: Furmint - Tokaj, Style2: Furmint - Tokaj, Style3: Furmint - Hungary Country: Romania, Description: This medium-sweet wine brings aromas of acacia flowers and lemon lime zest to the fore. In the mouth there are flavors of honeycomb, lemon and acacia flower. The finish is delightful and slightly sweet., Designation: Treasure of Transylvania Medium Sweet, Points: 86.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Tarnave, Title: Jidvei 2016 Treasure of Transylvania Medium Sweet Gewurztraminer (Tarnave), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Jidvei, Region: Tarnave, Style1: Gewürztraminer - Tarnave, Style2: Gewürztraminer - Tarnave, Style3: Gewürztraminer - Romania Country: Argentina, Description: Sweet it is, but given the price it is good wine with mass appeal. Apple, pear and mellow citrus aromas and flavors feature zero funk or mealy character, and the finish offers a dab of butterscotch. Shows mild residual sugar but many consumers will like that., Designation: Elsa, Points: 85.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Valentin Bianchi 2008 Elsa Chardonnay, Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Valentin Bianchi, Region: Mendoza Province, Style1: Chardonnay - Mendoza Province, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendoza Province, Style3: Chardonnay - Argentina Country: US, Description: Semisweet it is, with 12.2% alcohol and 30 g/L residual sugar. Lightly scented with bath powder, lavender and rose petal aromas, this brings on citrus and peach fruit, with a bit of phenolic bite carrying the finish., Designation: Semi-Sweet, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Oak Knoll 2011 Semi-Sweet Riesling (Oregon), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Oak Knoll, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Riesling - Oregon, Style2: Riesling - Oregon Other, Style3: Riesling - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: Almost like liquid cherry pie—but not sweet—this medium-bodied wine smells like the red fruit and baking spices, and tastes fresh and juicy with both red and sour cherries. It has good heft on the palate due to firm but light tannins and supportive acidity for balance., Designation: Slow Lope'n Vineyard, Points: 90.0, Price: 32.0, Province: California, Title: Brutocao 2013 Slow Lope'n Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Brutocao, Region: Anderson Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Anderson Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Anderson Valley Country: US, Description: Rich, ripe yellow cherries and honeysuckle waft from this luxuriously honeyed off-dry Riesling. A sweet tangerine flavor is densely concentrated on the palate, yet the wine is sprightly and zesty in mouthfeel. An elegant floral spray extends the long, lingering finish., Designation: Semi Sweet, Points: 90.0, Price: 15.0, Province: New York, Title: Keuka Spring 2013 Semi Sweet Riesling (Finger Lakes), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Keuka Spring, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Riesling - New York, Style2: Riesling - New York, Style3: Riesling - New York Country: Chile, Description: Made in a semisweet style, this smells almost dry, with notes of cheese and vanilla. On the palate, it's simple, where the sugary flavors quickly emerge before fading away to almost nothing., Designation: Semi Sweet, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Molina, Title: Floria 2010 Semi Sweet Cabernet Sauvignon (Molina), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Floria, Region: Molina, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Molina, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Molina, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Chile Country: US, Description: This Beaver State answer to Moscato d'Asti is sweet, sweet and more sweet. Who knows what the actual residual sugar reading is? That said, the lemon-lime aromas with notes of basil and tarragon are nice, and the wine is currently quite fresh (although it likely won't last long). Not too bubbly or aggressive, and pretty in the mouth due to fairly snappy acids. Drink now with fruit-based desserts or frosted cake., Designation: Early Muscat - Semi Sparkling, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Silvan Ridge 2002 Early Muscat - Semi Sparkling Muscat (Oregon), Variety: Muscat, Winery: Silvan Ridge, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Muscat - Oregon, Style2: Muscat - Oregon Other, Style3: Muscat - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: This is an excellent Harvest Select bottling, with bright, sappy flavors that seem not all that sweet. The residual sugar, listed at 47 g/L, is an asset, but doesn't dominate. Flavors remain as crisp as a fresh Macintosh apple, juicy, forward and delicious., Designation: Harvest Select Sweet, Points: 90.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Washington, Title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2012 Harvest Select Sweet Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Chateau Ste. Michelle, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: Portugal, Description: A balanced wine that has both fresh red fruits and some tawny maturity. It has acidity, hints of wood aging and a spirit of freshness. The aftertaste is soft, smooth and toffee-like. Smooth-textured Port, with sweet red fruits under the brown sugar, nut and spirit flavors. This is certainly on the sweet side, with a velvet feel to it., Designation: Special Reserve Tawny, Points: 87.5, Price: 17.5, Province: Port, Title: Poças NV Special Reserve Tawny  (Port), Variety: Port, Winery: Poças, Region: Port, Style1: Port - Port, Style2: Port - Port, Style3: Port - Portugal"

column1: Recommend a wine with hints of oak.,"
column3: Description

column2: Terroirs et Talents 2006 Château de la Terrière  (Beaujolais-Villages)
column3: A hint of wood is a good sign of the richness and balance of this wine. There is some dryness and tautness to go with its black cherry and plum-skin flavors.
This wine exhibits an assertive oak-driven character throughout that produces an overall sweet red cherry and berry profile.
Hints of freshly pressed apples and pears in a darkly toasted oak barrel come through.

column2: Valdubón 2004 Honoris de Valdubón  (Ribera del Duero)
column3: Oak is front and center on this high-priced affair from Freixenet.
Oak-driven aromas are strong on the nose, with buttered popcorn dominating.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: A hint of wood is a good sign of the richness and balance of this wine. There is some dryness and tautness to go with its black cherry and plum-skin flavors. There is a big and bold fruity aftertaste., Designation: Château de la Terrière, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Terroirs et Talents 2006 Château de la Terrière  (Beaujolais-Villages), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Terroirs et Talents, Region: Beaujolais-Villages, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: South Africa, Description: Although the label reads “Touch of Oak,” this wine exhibits an assertive oak-driven character throughout that produces an overall sweet red cherry and berry profile. Medium weight with light tannins, it's easy to drink now., Designation: Touch of Oak, Points: 86.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Tulbagh, Title: Rijk's 2009 Touch of Oak Shiraz (Tulbagh), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Rijk's, Region: Tulbagh, Style1: Shiraz - Tulbagh, Style2: Shiraz - Tulbagh, Style3: Shiraz - South Africa Country: US, Description: Hints of freshly pressed apples and pears in a darkly toasted oak barrel come through. Deft use of new French oak results in a full-bodied wine with a lush, buttered toast richness that highlights sweet apple and lemon flavors. The finish is clean and lemony with a slight saline touch., Designation: Barrel Fermented, Points: 85.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Barrel Oak 2008 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Virginia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Barrel Oak, Region: Virginia, Style1: Chardonnay - Virginia, Style2: Chardonnay - Virginia, Style3: Chardonnay - Virginia Country: Spain, Description: Oak is front and center on this high-priced affair from Freixenet. And that's the primary problem with what is otherwise a commendable and solid wine. Vanilla and resin aromas and flavors push the fruit to the side, and what's left is a slick of butter, sawdust and tannic astringency. Not a bust, but for nearly a hundred bucks we want more than just wood. Imported by Freixenet USA., Designation: Honoris de Valdubón, Points: 87.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Valdubón 2004 Honoris de Valdubón  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Valdubón, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Oak-driven aromas are strong on the nose, with buttered popcorn dominating. Full and rich, notes of cedar and toast pervade over a hint of green apple. A bit lazy on the palate, this oaked style is for those who enjoy rich and creamy Chardonnay., Designation: Barrel Fermented, Points: 85.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Veramar 2013 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Virginia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Veramar, Region: Virginia, Style1: Chardonnay - Virginia, Style2: Chardonnay - Virginia, Style3: Chardonnay - Virginia Country: Spain, Description: Smoky oak and dark cherry fruit with herb accents complement each other well in this medium-weight, even red. Leathery hints add complexity, and this tasty, straightforward Rioja never get harsh or astringent. Drink now–2004. —M.M., Designation: Crianza, Points: 85.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: El Coto 1998 Crianza  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: El Coto, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: US, Description: Smoky, toasty oak aromas and flavors give a flamboyant personality to this full-bodied wine. It smells literally like wood smoke and toasted French bread, while flavors recall jam spiced with cloves and cinnamon. These are all tasty elements, and this wine will be a hit with oak lovers., Designation: Cougar Hill, Points: 88.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Sobon Estate 2014 Cougar Hill Zinfandel (Amador County), Variety: Zinfandel, Winery: Sobon Estate, Region: Amador, Style1: Zinfandel - California, Style2: Zinfandel - Amador, Style3: Zinfandel - Amador Country: France, Description: Some oak aging shows in the smoothness of the wine, which has good concentration as well as young fruitiness. It is tangy with a mineral texture and richness that come from the lees aging in barrel. The wine should mature a little longer, so drink from 2017., Designation: Les Vieilles Vignes, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Pascal Bouchard 2014 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Pascal Bouchard, Region: Chablis, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Italy, Description: This shows very evident oak aromas along with toast, coffee, vanilla and incense notes. The palate reflects the heavy wood influence that muffles the dark fruit just below the surface. Drying wood tannins cut the finish short., Designation: Castelvecchi, Points: 85.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Vèscine 2010 Castelvecchi  (Chianti Classico), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Vèscine, Region: Chianti Classico, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: Argentina, Description: Oak is front and center on the bouquet, and with that come accents of dried cheese and sawdust. Feels saturated, layered and tannic in the mouth, with roasted berry, black plum, herb and spice flavors. Feels and tastes a touch resiny on the finish, more evidence of the wine's barrel influence., Designation: Reserva, Points: 88.0, Price: 29.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Altocedro 2010 Reserva Malbec (La Consulta), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Altocedro, Region: La Consulta, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: Spain, Description: A staunch, almost severe level of oak controls the nose on this barrel-fermented Viura that's narrow on the palate, with high acidity. Oak stays around as the lead flavor, with a hint of sour apple, while texturally this feels solid and not too resiny., Designation: Barrel Fermented, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Taron 2015 Barrel Fermented Viura (Rioja), Variety: Viura, Winery: Taron, Region: Rioja, Style1: Viura - Northern Spain, Style2: Viura - Northern Spain, Style3: Viura - Spain Country: US, Description: A light wine with a hit of oak midpalate, this offers bright red cherry and black currant fruit with a suggestion of thyme and toffee on the finish. Smooth to drink, it's a fine choice for red-meat dishes like beef lasagne., Designation: Estate, Points: 87.0, Price: 28.0, Province: California, Title: Jason-Stephens 2010 Estate Mourvèdre (Santa Clara Valley), Variety: Mourvèdre, Winery: Jason-Stephens, Region: Santa Clara Valley, Style1: Mourvèdre - California, Style2: Mourvèdre - Santa Clara Valley, Style3: Mourvèdre - Santa Clara Valley Country: Argentina, Description: Char, sawdust and black cherry aromas confirm the wine's “oak cask” labeling. Full bodied and ripe, it conveys meaty thickness and bold flavors of berry and spiced plum. A toasty, charred finish is lifted by bright acidity and fresh black-fruit flavors. This will go well with just about anything off the grill., Designation: Oak Cask, Points: 88.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Trapiche 2012 Oak Cask Syrah (Mendoza), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Trapiche, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Syrah - Mendoza Province, Style2: Syrah - Mendoza Province, Style3: Syrah - Argentina Country: France, Description: The oak aging, implicit in the name of the wine, is present in its smooth character. This bottling is in the elegant style typical of Famaey wines and also has weight and firm, concentrated black fruit with acidity and a dry core. Drink from 2019., Designation: Fût de Chêne, Points: 91.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Château Famaey 2011 Fût de Chêne Malbec (Cahors), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Château Famaey, Region: Cahors, Style1: Malbec - Southwest France, Style2: Malbec - Southwest France, Style3: Malbec - France Country: France, Description: A touch of wood helps the wine's light fruit to deepen and become richer. The wine is well balanced, with fresh acidity giving a good lift., Designation: Elevé en Fûts de Chêne, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Grand Jean 2009 Elevé en Fûts de Chêne  (Bordeaux Supérieur), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Grand Jean, Region: Bordeaux Supérieur, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France"

column1: I'd like a rose wine, excluding Pinot Noir.,"
column3: Description

column2: Noviello 2015 Rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain)
column3: Pale color, blunt aromas of cherry and spice, dry, seemingly watered-down fruit flavors.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: Rosé from Pinot Noir is a new concept in Alsace (normally it is made into red wine). As here, it can give an attractive crisp and fruity wine that is fresh and ready to be drunk young. LIvely acidity and red fruits complete an attractive wine., Designation: Pfaff, Points: 85.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Alsace, Title: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim 2013 Pfaff Rosé (Alsace), Variety: Rosé, Winery: La Cave des Vignerons de Pfaffenheim, Region: Alsace, Style1: Rosé - Alsace, Style2: Rosé - Alsace, Style3: Rosé - France Country: US, Description: Dark cherry and cola aromas meld with composting rose scents on the nose of this pleasing wine that will satisfy any lover of Pinot Noir. The palate exudes nutmeg, iron and rose flavors galore, adding spice to its core of plump raspberry and ripe cranberry fruit. Lively acidity and tannic depth complete the experience., Designation: Ventana Vineyard, Points: 92.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Joyce 2015 Ventana Vineyard Grenache (Arroyo Seco), Variety: Grenache, Winery: Joyce, Region: Arroyo Seco, Style1: Grenache - California, Style2: Grenache - Arroyo Seco, Style3: Grenache - Arroyo Seco Country: US, Description: Blush wines from Pinot Noir can be all over the map. But this one lands squarely on the dry, balanced side, offering crisp flavors of cherries, rose petals, orange tea, cloves and cinnamon. Superversatile with a wide range of foods, it's a good by-the-glass wine for restaurants., Designation: Pinot Noir Rosé, Points: 87.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: Kenwood 2007 Pinot Noir Rosé Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Kenwood, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Lightly fruity, this all-Pinot Noir rosé just hints at strawberry, but seems overloaded with flavors and scents of pastry crust and vanilla cookie., Designation: Dry, Points: 85.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Winter's Hill 2014 Dry Rosé (Dundee Hills), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Winter's Hill, Region: Dundee Hills, Style1: Rosé - Oregon, Style2: Rosé - Dundee Hills, Style3: Rosé - Dundee Hills Country: US, Description: Production has increased six-fold in this vintage, good news for rosé lovers. Dry and flavorful, this all-Pinot wine deftly incorporates floral (rose petals), botanical (gin-like), citrus (orange peel) and peach-skin components. It's fresh and penetrating., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 90.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Acrobat 2015 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Acrobat, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: US, Description: What's so refreshing about this blush wine is its crisp acidity and the slight bitterness that makes it almost like a digestif. It has a wealth of fresh, green herb flavors, like sage and thyme, along with red cherryskin and white pepper. Complex and full-bodied, it can replace a red Pinot on hot summer nights., Designation: Sofia Pinot Noir, Points: 87.0, Price: 17.0, Province: California, Title: Francis Coppola 2007 Sofia Pinot Noir Rosé (Sonoma Coast), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Francis Coppola, Region: Sonoma Coast, Style1: Rosé - California, Style2: Rosé - Sonoma Coast, Style3: Rosé - Sonoma Coast Country: US, Description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir, this is a light, thin rosé with simple flavors of watermelon and strawberry., Designation: Dry, Points: 85.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Winter's Hill 2013 Dry Rosé (Dundee Hills), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Winter's Hill, Region: Dundee Hills, Style1: Rosé - Oregon, Style2: Rosé - Dundee Hills, Style3: Rosé - Dundee Hills Country: US, Description: This wine does a good job of transforming ripe Pinot grapes, with all their raspberry and cherry fruit, into a rosé that's ethereal and delicate. The wine is dry and the alcohol level is moderate, making it delicate and crisp in the mouth., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 88.0, Price: 21.0, Province: California, Title: Cartograph 2012 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Cartograph, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: A terrific California blush wine, rich and compelling, with a gorgeous color, sort of a salmon-koi gold. It's bone dry and crisply clean in acidity, with strong, but not heavy, flavors of strawberries and raspberries. There's a dusting of tannins that give the wine a solid structure., Designation: Rose of Pinot Noir, Points: 92.0, Price: 22.0, Province: California, Title: Lynmar 2009 Rose of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Lynmar, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Rosé - California, Style2: Rosé - Russian River Valley, Style3: Rosé - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: A very pretty wine, in scent and flavor, this estate-grown effort offers aromas of rose petals and cherry blossoms. Those floral notes continue into the palate, with light cherry fruit and citrusy acids., Designation: White Rose Vineyard, Points: 90.0, Price: 125.0, Province: Oregon, Title: White Rose 2014 White Rose Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: White Rose, Region: Dundee Hills, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Dundee Hills, Style3: Pinot Noir - Dundee Hills Country: France, Description: A delicious, crisp wine, with great bitter cherry and wild strawberry flavors and a high-definition streak of acidity. A great summer drink, but also for food., Designation: Rosé, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Roger et Didier Raimbault 2008 Rosé Pinot Noir (Sancerre), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Roger et Didier Raimbault, Region: Sancerre, Style1: Pinot Noir - Loire Valley, Style2: Pinot Noir - Loire Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: US, Description: Strikes just the right balance between Pinot Noir's cherried richness and the sauve elegance you want in a rosé. It's dry and crisp in acidity, with rich notes of orange peel, vanilla and toast., Designation: Wood's Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir, Points: 88.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Ousterhout 2012 Wood's Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir Rosé (Russian River Valley), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Ousterhout, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Rosé - California, Style2: Rosé - Russian River Valley, Style3: Rosé - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Fresh strawberry fruit with a bit of spice makes this an easy choice for warm-weather sipping. Tart, with lemony acidity, it's young and lively. Good as it is on its own, it would make an awesome punch., Designation: Pinot Noir, Points: 89.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Stoller 2014 Pinot Noir Rosé (Dundee Hills), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Stoller, Region: Dundee Hills, Style1: Rosé - Oregon, Style2: Rosé - Dundee Hills, Style3: Rosé - Dundee Hills Country: US, Description: A light mauve in color, this Pinot Noir-based wine shows boisterous plum fruit, macerated strawberries and a hint of clove on the ripe nose, making it more entrée-ready than apéritif-aimed. The palate offers strawberry and bubble-gum notes deftly hidden behind a veil of sour cherry and plum-skin tartness., Designation: Rosé, Points: 89.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Scratch 2014 Rosé Pinot Noir (Monterey County), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Scratch, Region: Monterey, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Monterey, Style3: Pinot Noir - Monterey Country: US, Description: This wine is colored like a pale Pinot Noir and also shows some bricking. It brings blunt aromas of cherry and spice that lead to dry,seemingly watered-down fruit flavors. It falls flat., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 84.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Washington, Title: Noviello 2015 Rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Mountain), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Noviello, Region: Red Mountain, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington"

column1: What red wines would you suggest for someone who enjoys a well-integrated oak influence?,"
column3: Description

column2: One Leaf 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
column3: A well-integrated wine, bright in crisp cranberry and mellowed oak and tannin.
Rich flavors of red and black cherry jam, cherry liqueur and tobacco. The oak influence shows in the form of toastiness and wood spiciness.
Full of toasted coconut and vanilla. There's some dark cherry fruit and savory herbs in support, but the oak dominates.
This bold, spicy wine has thick concentration and lingering oak-driven flavors. Black cherry, prune and ripe blueberry do come into view, but the protagonist here is the oak.
The wood dominates the nose and mouth of this lush, creamy wine. It's brimming with notes of cedar, sweet spice and bittersweet cocoa powder that ride atop the baked cherry and raspberry fruit.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: A healthy 20% of Merlot provides additional softness in this food-friendly, well-integrated wine, bright in crisp cranberry and mellowed oak and tannin. Well-made at a fair price, it's well worth the seek., Designation: Reserve, Points: 89.0, Price: 26.0, Province: California, Title: One Leaf 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: One Leaf, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: This Cabernet Franc-based blend has rich flavors of red and black cherry jam, cherry liqueur and tobacco. The oak influence shows in the form of toastiness and wood spiciness. With its smooth tannins, this wine will drink well now with a great steak., Designation: Devils' Peak, Points: 90.0, Price: 48.0, Province: California, Title: Terlato 2009 Devils' Peak Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Terlato, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: Uruguay, Description: Spicy oak aromas suggest sandalwood, while this Tannat blend also deals scents of plum, cherry and rose petal. A snappy palate has the right grip and balance, while generous flavors of oaky plum and berry fruits finish with firm acidity and loud barrel notes. Drink through 2021., Designation: Primo, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Uruguay, Title: Pizzorno 2011 Primo Red (Uruguay), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Pizzorno, Region: Uruguay, Style1: Red Blend - Uruguay, Style2: Red Blend - Uruguay, Style3: Red Blend - Uruguay Country: Chile, Description: A blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Grande Vidure, 20% Petite Syrah and 10% Merlot, it is as if you can clearly account for each varietal's contribution. Ripe cassis, cherry, plum, and spice flavors are buttressed by well-integrated oak.  Beautifully balanced, it has good acidity and mature tannins, and closes with a long, satisfying finish. Great wine for tonight's grilled T-bone, and worthy of mid-term cellaring ., Designation: Winemaker's Reserve, Points: 91.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Maipo Valley, Title: Carmen 1997 Winemaker's Reserve Red (Maipo Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Carmen, Region: Maipo Valley, Style1: Red Blend - Maipo Valley, Style2: Red Blend - Maipo Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Chile Country: Spain, Description: Strong classy oak aromas lead blackberry and baking-spice scents on a potent but textbook RDD nose. This old-vines wine from a benchmark year is tight-fisted and linear in feel, with lemony acidity. Fully oaked flavors of blackberry and cassis sit comfortably on a bed of herb and spice notes, while this is oaky, spicy, steady and integrated on the finish. Drink through 2027., Designation: VS, Points: 92.0, Price: 125.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Alidis 2010 VS  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Alidis, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: Portugal, Description: The oak aging is what makes this wine. It brings out the black fruits and juicy acidity as well as adding toast and vanilla flavors. The result is a wine that is smooth, balanced, full of fruit and ready to drink., Designation: Tarambola, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Tarambola Red (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Casa Santos Lima, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese Red - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese Red - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: With its well-integrated scents of cedar, plum and tobacco, this is a medium-weight wine whose hallmark is its balance. Vanilla and dried spices meld nicely with cherry and plum fruit, finishing smooth, with modest tannins. Drink now-2008., Designation: Cado, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Douro, Title: Companhia das Quintas 2000 Cado Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Companhia das Quintas, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: France, Description: While some cuvées seem to handle the oak better than others, this wine comes across as full of toasted coconut and vanilla. There's some dark cherry fruit and savory herbs in support, but the oak dominates, albeit it in a popular, user-friendly way., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 89.0, Price: 51.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Tardieu-Laurent 2012 Vieilles Vignes  (Gigondas), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Tardieu-Laurent, Region: Gigondas, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: Italy, Description: This bold, spicy wine will appeal to those who love modern reds with thick concentration and lingering oak-driven flavors. Black cherry, prune and ripe blueberry do come into view, but the protagonist here is the oak. The wine has chewy tannins, good length on the finish and would pair with grilled meats or aged cheeses., Designation: Aquabona, Points: 90.0, Price: 49.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Tassi 2004 Aquabona Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tassi, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: South Africa, Description: At present, the wood dominates the nose and mouth of this lush, creamy wine. It's brimming with notes of cedar, sweet spice and bittersweet cocoa powder that ride atop the baked cherry and raspberry fruit. The mouthfeel is smooth and plush, with velvety tannins and lingering dry, spicy notes that grace the finish. An infant now, give it some time to further harmonize and the oak to integrate; try after 2019., Designation: Series C, Points: 91.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Paarl, Title: Vilafonté 2014 Series C Red (Paarl), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Vilafonté, Region: Paarl, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: US, Description: Oak notes persist on the nose and palate of this Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec blend. Heavy roast coffee, burnt toast and charred black-fruit flavors mark the full-bodied palate, while a zip of red currant acidity tries to shine through., Designation: Yash-Vir, Points: 86.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Narmada 2010 Yash-Vir Red (Virginia), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Narmada, Region: Virginia, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Virginia, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Virginia, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Virginia Country: South Africa, Description: Although the label reads “Touch of Oak,” this wine exhibits an assertive oak-driven character throughout that produces an overall sweet red cherry and berry profile. Medium weight with light tannins, it's easy to drink now., Designation: Touch of Oak, Points: 86.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Tulbagh, Title: Rijk's 2009 Touch of Oak Shiraz (Tulbagh), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Rijk's, Region: Tulbagh, Style1: Shiraz - Tulbagh, Style2: Shiraz - Tulbagh, Style3: Shiraz - South Africa Country: US, Description: The numbers represent the grapes within: 75% Merlot, 23% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Petit Verdot. High in acidity, it shows a crispness of red berry, its core juicy and easy to like. Integrated oak keeps things simple and round, with leather and tobacco poking their heads on the finish., Designation: Connect 75.23.2, Points: 90.0, Price: 62.0, Province: California, Title: Passaggio 2014 Connect 75.23.2 Red (Sonoma County), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Passaggio, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma Country: Italy, Description: The oak note is still a bit pungent here and the wine needs three or four more years of cellaring before reaching harmony. Beyond that, however, this super Tuscan blend offers a solid base of blackberry, spice, leather and tobacco., Designation: Nearco, Points: 91.0, Price: 68.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Col d'Orcia 2005 Nearco Red (Sant'Antimo), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Col d'Orcia, Region: Sant'Antimo, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: France, Description: Oak aging remains a hallmark of the Tardieu-Laurent style, but it seems to fit with the 2010s from Châteauneuf-du-Pape. Toasted coconut, vanilla and plum pudding notes work together to give almost the impression of dessert in a glass, despite the wine's dry nature. It's full bodied, richly textured and slightly warm on the finish yet surprisingly elegant. Drink now–2020., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 92.0, Price: 75.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Tardieu-Laurent 2010 Vieilles Vignes Red (Châteauneuf-du-Pape), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Tardieu-Laurent, Region: Châteauneuf-du-Pape, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France"

column1: I prefer white wines with a hint of honey or floral sweetness. Any recommendations?,"
column3: Description

column2: Domaine de Grange Neuve 2015 La Fleur Lily Semi-Sweet White (Côtes de Bergerac)
column3: Soft and fruity with hints of honey, mango and peach flavors. Lightly perfumed with a crisp aftertaste.
Floral aromas of acacia and honey with a smooth, creamy texture.
Sweet white wine with compelling notes of honey, acacia flower, peach and yellow candy.
Light and floral, fresh apricot and honey on the palate.
Rich dessert Vouvray with a marvelous tension between acidity and honeyed sweetness.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: The wine is soft and fruity with hints of honey as well as mango and peach flavors. It is lightly perfumed leaving room for a crisp aftertaste. Drink now., Designation: La Fleur Lily Semi-Sweet, Points: 84.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Domaine de Grange Neuve 2015 La Fleur Lily Semi-Sweet White (Côtes de Bergerac), Variety: Bordeaux-style White Blend, Winery: Domaine de Grange Neuve, Region: Côtes de Bergerac, Style1: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Southwest France, Style2: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Southwest France, Style3: Bordeaux-style White Blend - France Country: Italy, Description: Pretty golden hues set the tone and segue into floral aromas of acacia and honey. There are some soapy, Moscato-like qualities to this aromatic white and its floral fragrances transfer to the mouth where there's a smooth, creamy texture., Designation: Aimé, Points: 87.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Girlan 2006 Aimé Gewürztraminer (Alto Adige), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Girlan, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Gewürztraminer - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Gewürztraminer - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Gewürztraminer - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Here's a sweet white wine (the term Amabile refers to the high sugar content) that opens with compelling notes of honey, acacia flower, peach and yellow candy. It's hard to imagine what to pair it with: It could either go with fruit salad or salty crackers with cheese., Designation: Amabile, Points: 83.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Bigi 2009 Amabile  (Orvieto Classico), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Bigi, Region: Orvieto Classico, Style1: White Blend - Central Italy, Style2: White Blend - Central Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Light and floral, this subtle dessert wine is made from Scheurebe grapes, more often found in Austria than California. It provides this wine with fresh apricot and honey on the palate, lingering yet low enough in alcohol and power to be enjoyed as either apéritif or digestif, its sweetness greatly restrained., Designation: Eisrébe, Points: 94.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Joseph Phelps 2013 Eisrébe White (Napa Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Joseph Phelps, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: White Blend - Napa Valley Country: France, Description: A rich dessert Vouvray with a marvelous tension between acidity and honeyed sweetness. There is a floral character, offering a contrast and bringing out a fresher side to the wine. With the tension and texture, the wine will age. Drink from 2017., Designation: Le Marigny, Points: 91.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Domaine Pichot 2011 Le Marigny  (Vouvray), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: Domaine Pichot, Region: Vouvray, Style1: Chenin Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Chenin Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Chenin Blanc - France Country: Greece, Description: This white blend offers floral aromas and a medium-bodied array of honey, spice and citrus. Big enough to pair with richer seafood dishes., Designation: Agioritikos Regional Dry White Wine, Points: 83.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Greece, Title: Protopapas 2005 Agioritikos Regional Dry White Wine White (Greece), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Protopapas, Region: Greece, Style1: White Blend - Greece, Style2: White Blend - Greece, Style3: White Blend - Greece Country: US, Description: Made in small amounts, this floral, tangy and richly textured white wine offers a depth of honey and caramel that overpowers the prettier, more mineral-driven aspects lurking in the underbelly of body. Youthful, it should come around., Designation: Leveroni Vineyards, Points: 90.0, Price: 42.0, Province: California, Title: Jeff Gordon 2014 Leveroni Vineyards Chardonnay (Carneros), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Jeff Gordon, Region: Carneros, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Carneros, Style3: Chardonnay - Carneros Country: US, Description: Fruity, floral and honeylike flavors give a lot of oomph to this wonderfully expressive, medium-bodied wine. It's as if honeysuckle and orange blossoms were soaked in fresh pear juice., Designation: Dry, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: California, Title: Graziano 2014 Dry Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: Graziano, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Chenin Blanc - California, Style2: Chenin Blanc - Mendocino, Style3: Chenin Blanc - Mendocino Country: Italy, Description: Made with biodynamically grown Moscato grapes, this fragrant white wine opens with honey, white flower and stone fruit aromas. The mouthfeel is creamy and rich, with a touch of sweetness on the finish., Designation: Jalal, Points: 87.0, Price: 42.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Cefalicchio 2011 Jalal Moscato (Puglia), Variety: Moscato, Winery: Cefalicchio, Region: Puglia, Style1: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style2: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style3: Moscato - Italy Country: France, Description: Ripe, with a touch of honey as if the botrytis for the sweet wine landed on these grapes as well. This dry white has creamy wood, spice and apricot flavors, making a delicious ripe wine, even with a touch of sweetness to the finish., Designation: Ygrec, Points: 91.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château d'Yquem 2006 Ygrec  (Bordeaux Blanc), Variety: Bordeaux-style White Blend, Winery: Château d'Yquem, Region: Bordeaux Blanc, Style1: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style White Blend - France Country: France, Description: Summer flower aromas with touches of honey give an immediately attractive, fresh character. To taste, it's a crisp and steely wine, full of white fruits and a delicious juicy character. Drink now., Designation: Réserve, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Willm 2013 Réserve Riesling (Alsace), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Willm, Region: Alsace, Style1: Riesling - Alsace, Style2: Riesling - Alsace, Style3: Riesling - France Country: US, Description: This is a juicy, fruity white blend, with more than a hint of honeyed sweetness. Ripe fruit captures flavors of peach flesh and skin, along with tropical suggestions of guava and papaya. In short, this is not your typical, grassy, herbaceous style of Sauv Blanc/Sémillon. I'd serve it as an aperitif, well-chilled., Designation: Bliss White Wine, Points: 86.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Washington, Title: Adamant Cellars 2007 Bliss White Wine White (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Adamant Cellars, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: White Blend - Washington, Style2: White Blend - Washington, Style3: White Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: This blended white—a sweetish mix of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc, Gewürztraminer and Riesling—has a honeyed character that suggests that at least some of the grapes may have been touched with botrytis. Regardless, look for that sugary, honeyed flavor to dominate., Designation: Windust, Points: 84.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Washington, Title: Kamiak 2011 Windust White (Washington), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Kamiak, Region: Washington, Style1: White Blend - Washington, Style2: White Blend - Washington, Style3: White Blend - Washington Country: Italy, Description: This extremely elegant sweet wine from Umbria has a distinctive element to its nose that recalls honey tea and dried spring flowers that is achieved thanks to naturally occurring noble rot. The wine tastes creamy and luscious and has long-lasting sweetness with honey and lemon meringue flavors., Designation: Calcaia, Points: 92.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Barberani 2005 Calcaia  (Orvieto Classico Superiore), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Barberani, Region: Orvieto Classico Superiore, Style1: White Blend - Central Italy, Style2: White Blend - Central Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Honeycomb and a fruit basket of melon and berry ride a wave of medium acidity and mellowed sweetness, with a touch of green apple. This is a good call for morning Mimosas., Designation: Blanc de Blancs, Points: 88.0, Price: 55.0, Province: California, Title: Frank Family 2012 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Carneros), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Frank Family, Region: Carneros, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Carneros, Style3: Chardonnay - Carneros"

column1: I'm looking for a white wine that's vibrant and citrusy with a crisp finish.,"
column3: Description

column2: Belisario 2015 Terre di Val Bona  (Verdicchio di Matelica)
column3: Vibrant, easygoing white wine with flavors of citrus, apple and a hint of bitter almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish.

Vibrant white with aromas suggesting elderflower, chopped herb, citrus and a whiff of tomato leaf. Tangy palate, zesty acidity underscores grapefruit, apricot and nectarine zest with a flinty note sealing the crisp finish.
Clean, snappy aromas of apple and citrus. Fresh, healthy white offers tangerine, nectarine and stony flavors before a crisp, refreshing finish.

column2: Viña Casablanca 2010 Cefiro Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
column3: Citrus aromas, lively and zesty in the mouth, with refreshing acidity. Orange and passion fruit lead the palate, which transitions to grapefruit. Crisp on the finish.
Alluring bouquet of fresh-cut jasmine and citrus, light, vibrant wine, bristling in acidity that's fruity and briny in equal measure. Clean, crisp and fermented in stainless steel.
column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: Here's a vibrant, easygoing white wine that offers flavors of citrus, apple and a hint of bitter almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish. It's straightforward but well made and refreshing., Designation: Terre di Val Bona, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Belisario 2015 Terre di Val Bona  (Verdicchio di Matelica), Variety: Verdicchio, Winery: Belisario, Region: Verdicchio di Matelica, Style1: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style2: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style3: Verdicchio - Italy Country: Italy, Description: This vibrant white offers aromas suggesting elderflower, chopped herb, citrus and a whiff of tomato leaf. On the tangy palate, zesty acidity underscores grapefruit, apricot and nectarine zest while a flinty note seals the crisp finish., Designation: Andrius, Points: 89.0, Price: 51.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Andriano 2014 Andrius Sauvignon (Alto Adige), Variety: Sauvignon, Winery: Andriano, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Sauvignon - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Sauvignon - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Sauvignon - Italy Country: Spain, Description: Clean, snappy aromas of apple and citrus are sharp but appealing. This fresh, healthy white offers tangerine, nectarine and stony flavors before a crisp, refreshing finish., Designation: Nivei, Points: 87.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Nivarius 2015 Nivei White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Nivarius, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Two of the crispest and most savory white varieties in California are Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris/Grigio, and this blend of both shows the best qualities of each. It's just slightly off-dry and vibrant in citrus, fig, melon and vanilla flavors, with beautiful acidity., Designation: Blanc Gris, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Vision Cellars 2006 Blanc Gris White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Vision Cellars, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: US, Description: Everybody needs a dry, tart white wine and Coppola has provided us with one in this crisply citric bottling. It's fresh and uplifting in grapefruit, lime and spicy flavors, at a good price., Designation: Presents Bianco, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Bianco Pinot Grigio (California), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: Francis Ford Coppola, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - California, Style3: Pinot Grigio - California Country: Chile, Description: Citrus aromas are familiar. Lively and zesty in the mouth, with refreshing acidity. Orange and passion fruit lead the palate, which transitions to grapefruit. Crisp on the finish. Good for an everyday white wine., Designation: Cefiro Reserva, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Casablanca Valley, Title: Viña Casablanca 2010 Cefiro Reserva Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Viña Casablanca, Region: Casablanca Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Chile Country: Portugal, Description: On the dry side, this deliciously crisp Vinho Verde has all the right citrus acidity. It's bursting with lively fruits, just petillant in the mouth, with a crisp apple finish. Screwcap., Designation: Twin Vines, Points: 86.0, Price: 7.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: José Maria da Fonseca 2010 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: José Maria da Fonseca, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: US, Description: Briny, with a hint of salted caramel, this is a high-toned white wine, refreshing in lemon and pear notes, with a slight suggestion of orange peel that's entirely welcoming. Focused and crisp throughout, it remains vibrant amid a creaminess to the mouthfeel, finishing with the right balance of both., Designation: Destination Series Sustainably Farmed and Estate Grown, Points: 90.0, Price: 22.0, Province: California, Title: Kunde 2013 Destination Series Sustainably Farmed and Estate Grown Viognier (Sonoma Valley), Variety: Viognier, Winery: Kunde, Region: Sonoma Valley, Style1: Viognier - California, Style2: Viognier - Sonoma Valley, Style3: Viognier - Sonoma Valley Country: Italy, Description: Scents of chamomile, tropical fruit and citrus zest lead the nose on this vibrant blend of Friulano, Chardonnay and Sauvignon. It's light and very bright, finishing with citrus and orange zest flavors., Designation: Dory, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: Adega Mãe 2014 Dory White (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Adega Mãe, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: US, Description: With an alluring bouquet of fresh-cut jasmine and citrus, this is a light, vibrant wine, bristling in acidity that's fruity and briny in equal measure. This Viura has a standard, fresh, zesty mouthfeel and common flavors of white grapefruit and lime. A minerally, citric finish is crisp and appropriate., Designation: Vendimia Seleccionada Blanco, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas Muriel 2014 Vendimia Seleccionada Blanco Viura (Rioja), Variety: Viura, Winery: Bodegas Muriel, Region: Rioja, Style1: Viura - Northern Spain, Style2: Viura - Northern Spain, Style3: Viura - Spain Country: France, Description: A beautifully crisp wine, very mineral, with its citrus and green apple flavors given a fine texture of bright acidity. It is still so young, with just a hint of toast to show some maturity. The finish is shockingly fresh., Designation: Brut Blanc de Blancs, Points: 94.0, Price: 120.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Billecart-Salmon 1999 Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Billecart-Salmon, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: South Africa, Description: Bright and light on its feet, this is a pleasant and sunny wine that's loaded with crisp citrus and green apple aromas and flavors. There's a subtle, surprising smoothness to the palate, though zippy acidity picks up on the midpalate and through the clean finish. Drink now., Designation: Citrus Grove, Points: 88.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Coastal Region, Title: Bellingham 2015 Citrus Grove Chenin Blanc (Coastal Region), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: Bellingham, Region: Coastal Region, Style1: Chenin Blanc - Coastal Region, Style2: Chenin Blanc - Coastal Region, Style3: Chenin Blanc - South Africa Country: Portugal, Description: This is an off-dry and lightly structured wine that has a crisp, mineral texture. column10: ,Country: Italy, Description: Aragosta is one of those wonderfully light and crisp Italian whites that would pair so well with the seafood dishes we love most (fried calamari and crab cakes, for example). column1: What's a bold white wine?,"
column3: Description

column2: Steven Kent 2013 Lola Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)
column3: A bold white wine with smells and tastes of grapefruit, canteloupe and very crisp apples. It has a fresh, acidic texture that cleans the palate and makes the mouth water, but wraps in enough richness for good balance.

column2: Thousand Islands Winery NV Wellesley Island White (New York)
column3: Boldly grapey, this blend of Diamond, Cayuga White and Catawba grapes is a fun fruity sip with that characteristic “foxiness” of American grapes. It's simple and a bit sugary, but light footed and fresh.

column2: Imagery 2000 Artist Collection White Burgundy White (California)
column3: Explosively fruity, with big, bold flavors of peaches, pears, apples, tropical fruits. Drinks firmly dry, although oak brings a wood-sap sweetness. Lees aging was significant and adds a sour cream note.
A wood-aged wine, this shows Chardonnay's richness along with spicy wood and opulent fruit. Bold acidity and a citrus edge cuts the smoothness.

column2: Concha y Toro 2011 Terrunyo Costa Los Boldos Vineyard Block 5 Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley)
column3: This is about as racy as Sauvignon Blanc from Chile gets. It's green and melon-like on the nose, with punchy asparagus and lime aromas. It is wide awake on the palate, where citrusy acids push lemon, lime, green herb and lemongrass flavors.
