column1: Are there any white wines with a distinctive mineral or chalky quality?,"
column3: Description

column2: Stephen Ross 2011 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
column3: Chardonnay with a taste of chalky stone, pineapple, orange and Meyer lemon fruit. Finishes dry and spicy.
Fresh and fragrant white wine with mineral notes of chalk and dusty ash. Not much fruit, but crisp acidity.

column2: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Champs Gains Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet)
column3: Steely, mineral, structured wine with a chalk soil influence. Firm and crisp, with white fruits and mandarin orange zest.

column2: Bisol NV Desiderio Jeio Brut  (Prosecco del Veneto)
column3: Distinctly mineral, almost ashen quality wine that recalls talcum powder and schoolroom chalkboard. Linear and defined with sharp effervescence.

column2: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas White (Tejo)
column3: Ultrayoung wine with a textured minerality and a chalky character. Fresh green fruits in balance.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: It's hard to define minerality in a wine, but this Chardonnay has it. It tastes and feels like a lick of chalky stone. That's on top of and below the intricate pineapple, orange and Meyer lemon fruit that's so delicious, and finishes so dry and spicy., Designation: Bien Nacido Vineyard, Points: 92.0, Price: 30.0, Province: California, Title: Stephen Ross 2011 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Stephen Ross, Region: Santa Maria Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Santa Maria Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Santa Maria Valley Country: Italy, Description: Pretty mineral notes recall chalk and dusty ash and provide depth and dimension to this fresh and fragrant white wine. There's not much fruit, but the wine pulls its own thanks to those mineral nuances and its crisp acidity., Designation: Cubìa, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Sicily & Sardinia, Title: Cusumano 2007 Cubìa Insolia (Sicilia), Variety: Insolia, Winery: Cusumano, Region: Sicilia, Style1: Insolia - Sicily & Sardinia, Style2: Insolia - Sicily & Sardinia, Style3: Insolia - Italy Country: France, Description: This steely, mineral, structured wine speaks of the chalk soil of Puligny. It is firm and crisp, even though the fruit is rich. The wine layers the white fruits and mandarin orange zest with some judicious toast from the wood, leaving spice and ripe acidity on the finish., Designation: Champs Gains Premier Cru, Points: 93.0, Price: 115.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Chanson Père et Fils 2005 Champs Gains Premier Cru  (Puligny-Montrachet), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Chanson Père et Fils, Region: Puligny-Montrachet, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Italy, Description: There's a distinctly mineral, almost ashen quality to this wine that recalls talcum powder and schoolroom chalkboard. The wine is linear and defined and has very pungent, almost sharp, effervescence with drying minerals on the close and will keep the palate polished and clean., Designation: Desiderio Jeio Brut, Points: 86.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Bisol NV Desiderio Jeio Brut  (Prosecco del Veneto), Variety: Prosecco, Winery: Bisol, Region: Prosecco del Veneto, Style1: Prosecco - Veneto, Style2: Prosecco - Veneto, Style3: Prosecco - Italy Country: France, Description: This is a wine that shows strong minerality but not much fruitiness. It has acidity, and is textured with a chalky mouthfeel, but the fruit character is subdued, making this a wine that is very crisp and tight., Designation: Cuvée des Lys Brut Blanc de Blancs, Points: 87.0, Price: 85.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Philippe Fontaine NV Cuvée des Lys Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Philippe Fontaine, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: With its highly mineral aroma, this is almost like smelling chalk. It's an austere wine, with high acidity, crystal clear on the palate, full of grapefruit flavors and flint texture. Age this wine at least 4 years., Designation: Blanc de Blancs, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Delamotte NV Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Delamotte, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: The vines go right into a layer of chalk, giving this wine a strongly mineral character. It is tight, nervy and steely in character. It's very textured and sophisticated, with crisp lemon and green apple flavors. Drink from 2018., Designation: Montmains Premier Cru, Points: 94.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Laroche 2012 Montmains Premier Cru  (Chablis), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Laroche, Region: Chablis, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Portugal, Description: This ultrayoung wine is all fruit. It is textured with minerality and a chalky character that is keeping the fresh green fruits in balance. The wine is delicious, although really not ready. Better to wait until 2016., Designation: Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Tejo, Title: Wines & Winemakers 2014 Companhia das Lezírias Tyto Alba Vinhas Protegidas White (Tejo), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Wines & Winemakers, Region: Tejo, Style1: Portuguese White - Tejo, Style2: Portuguese White - Tejo, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: France, Description: Among the range of Jolivet's 2000 Sancerres, Les Cailottes is the winner, hands down. It's zesty, with chalk and mineral qualities. The nose is clean, stony and pungent, while the flavors that come next are pure and ripe citrus and melon, with just a nip of honey. It closes out firm, round and full, and with elegance., Designation: Les Caillottes, Points: 90.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Pascal Jolivet 2000 Les Caillottes  (Sancerre), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Pascal Jolivet, Region: Sancerre, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France Country: South Africa, Description: Chalky, mineral tones infuse the clean apple, Asian pear, white peach and melon rind aromas on the nose of this wine. It's pure and focused, with ample acidity that cuts through the ripe fruit flavors on the palate. Hints of orange blossom and clove-spiked citrus unfold on the finish. Drink now–2017., Designation: Five Soldiers, Points: 90.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Rustenberg 2011 Five Soldiers Chardonnay (Stellenbosch), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Rustenberg, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Chardonnay - Stellenbosch, Style2: Chardonnay - Stellenbosch, Style3: Chardonnay - South Africa Country: France, Description: Bringing out all the minerality of the chalk soils, this rounded wine is also packed with rich fruits. The wine is just approaching its peak, showing wonderful lemon and white stone fruits., Designation: Blanc de Blancs Brut, Points: 94.0, Price: 130.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Pol Roger 2000 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Pol Roger, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: This is pure mineral, chalk and lean austerity initially, but opens up with apples,  lime and green plums. It is intense, concentrated and structured; needs time. Wait 4–5 years., Designation: Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Clos Grand Cru, Points: 93.0, Price: 65.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Albert Bichot 2005 Domaine Long-Depaquit Les Clos Grand Cru  (Chablis), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Albert Bichot, Region: Chablis, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: A chalky textured and mineral-driven wine, it's crisp while also smooth and rich. It is full of white fruits, softly textured herbaceousness and lively final acidity. A wine to age for a few months or even a year or two. Screwcap., Designation: Le Chant des Vignes, Points: 89.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Joseph Mellot 2012 Le Chant des Vignes  (Pouilly-Fumé), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Joseph Mellot, Region: Pouilly-Fumé, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France Country: US, Description: This bottling screams white earth, with a chalk- and riverstone-like minerality and clotted cream and lemon scents. That minerality carries through to the palate, where a chalky note blends with Asian pear and marshmallow. It's a study in how to present delicate flavors with pizzazz, which the Talley family has been known to do., Designation: Oliver's Vineyard, Points: 94.0, Price: 38.0, Province: California, Title: Talley 2014 Oliver's Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Talley, Region: Edna Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Edna Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Edna Valley Country: Portugal, Description: This ripe, wood-aged wine comes from the plateau above the Douro Valley. It has a cool, mineral character that suits it well. Fresh with acidity and tight with its chalky texture, it's a delicious wine to drink now, fruity, tangy and complex., Designation: Vertice Grande Reserva Branco, Points: 89.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Douro, Title: Caves Transmontanas 2013 Vertice Grande Reserva Branco White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Caves Transmontanas, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal"

column1: Can you suggest a white wine with a crisp acidity and citrus notes?,"
column3: Description

column2: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Escolha White (Vinho Verde)
column3: Crisp, dry and fruity with a light touch of citrus and fresh acidity. Fruity with a slight sparkle.
Crisp and savory blend of Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris/Grigio, vibrant in citrus, fig, melon and vanilla flavors.

column2: Jacquart 2009 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne)
column3: Crisp, mineral-driven wine with intense acidity, citrus flavors and a tight, steely texture.
Fruity wine, crisp with citrus acidity and bright with light minerality and zest.

column2: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Bianco Pinot Grigio (California)
column3: Dry, tart white wine, fresh and uplifting in grapefruit, lime and spicy flavors.
column9: ,Country: Portugal, Description: Crisp. dry and fruity, this wine has a light touch of citrus and fresh acidity. Fruity with a slight sparkle, it's an ideal apéritif., Designation: Azul Portugal Escolha, Points: 85.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: Wines & Winemakers 2012 Azul Portugal Escolha White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Wines & Winemakers, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: US, Description: Two of the crispest and most savory white varieties in California are Sauvignon Blanc and Pinot Gris/Grigio, and this blend of both shows the best qualities of each. It's just slightly off-dry and vibrant in citrus, fig, melon and vanilla flavors, with beautiful acidity., Designation: Blanc Gris, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Vision Cellars 2006 Blanc Gris White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Vision Cellars, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: France, Description: Produced from Grand and Premier Cru vines in the Côte des Blancs, this crisp, mineral-driven wine has intense acidity, citrus flavors and a tight, steely texture. Still young, it needs to age and will be best from 2018., Designation: Blanc de Blancs Brut, Points: 91.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Jacquart 2009 Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Jacquart, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Portugal, Description: This is a fruity wine, crisp with citrus acidity and bright with light minerality and zest. It is a refreshing wine with an attractive sliced apple and melon aftertaste. Drink this lively wine now., Designation: Contraste Branco, Points: 88.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Douro, Title: Conceito Vinhos 2016 Contraste Branco White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Conceito Vinhos, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: US, Description: Everybody needs a dry, tart white wine and Coppola has provided us with one in this crisply citric bottling. It's fresh and uplifting in grapefruit, lime and spicy flavors, at a good price., Designation: Presents Bianco, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Bianco Pinot Grigio (California), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: Francis Ford Coppola, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - California, Style3: Pinot Grigio - California Country: Portugal, Description: This juicy wine boasts lemon aromas and bright citrusy acidity, resulting in a light, crisp and bright sip. It has a frest lilt, with an attractive zesty texture. Drink now., Designation: Oscar's Branco, Points: 85.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Douro, Title: Quevedo 2014 Oscar's Branco White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Quevedo, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: This crisp, straightforward white has delicate orchard fruit and white spring flower aromas, while the simple palate offers Bartlett pear and citrus flavors. Bright acidity gives it a clean finish., Designation: Le Volpare, Points: 86.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Tommasi 2016 Le Volpare  (Soave Classico), Variety: Garganega, Winery: Tommasi, Region: Soave Classico, Style1: Garganega - Veneto, Style2: Garganega - Veneto, Style3: Garganega - Italy Country: France, Description: This crisp wine is packed with acidity and fruitiness. It is tangy, tight, full of attractive acidity as well as lively citrus and white fruits. It is ready to drink., Designation: Les Gennievrières, Points: 87.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Guillot-Broux 2013 Les Gennievrières  (Mâcon-Cruzille), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Guillot-Broux, Region: Mâcon-Cruzille, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: US, Description: This unusual blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier combines the attributes of crisp acidity and fruitiness. The result is a delicious, fine wine, rich in citrus, apricot and pear flavors that are a little sweet in white sugar., Designation: Blend 23, Points: 86.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: B Cellars 2010 Blend 23 White (Napa Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: B Cellars, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: White Blend - Napa Valley Country: Portugal, Description: Toast, spice and juicy citrus flavors blend together in this crisp wine. Its acidity is prominent, giving plenty of freshness to a wine that is also tangy. With the toastiness now well integrated, the wine is ready to drink., Designation: Grande Reserva, Points: 85.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Douro, Title: Adega Vila Real 2015 Grande Reserva White (Douro), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Adega Vila Real, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese White - Douro, Style2: Portuguese White - Douro, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: US, Description: Crisp starfruit and citrus notes shine brightly throughout this refreshingly spry white. It's delicate in concentration but irresistibly quaffable, marked by a spray of salinity on the finish., Designation: Unoaked, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: New York, Title: Lamoreaux Landing 2014 Unoaked Chardonnay (Finger Lakes), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Lamoreaux Landing, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Chardonnay - New York, Style2: Chardonnay - New York, Style3: Chardonnay - New York Country: US, Description: Sometimes, you just want a white that's dry, crisp and mouth-cleansing, to wash down that chicken salad sandwich or drink with savory hors d'oeuvres. This Sauvignon Blanc-Chardonnay blend fills that need admirably. It's dry and rich in citrus fruits, with stimulating acidity. Sommeliers, buy this one up., Designation: Beachfront, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Bedarra 2008 Beachfront White (Dry Creek Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Bedarra, Region: Dry Creek Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Dry Creek Valley, Style3: White Blend - Dry Creek Valley Country: Italy, Description: Here's a vibrant, easygoing white wine that offers flavors of citrus, apple and a hint of bitter almond. Bright acidity gives it a crisp finish. It's straightforward but well made and refreshing., Designation: Terre di Val Bona, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Belisario 2015 Terre di Val Bona  (Verdicchio di Matelica), Variety: Verdicchio, Winery: Belisario, Region: Verdicchio di Matelica, Style1: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style2: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style3: Verdicchio - Italy Country: France, Description: A fruity wine, refreshing and crisp with just the right balance between acidity and citrus flavors and a youthful mineral texture. The wine is certainly crisp, although it is the fruitiness and the tangy character that comes through most strongly. Drink now., Designation: Alexandrine Brut Blanc de Blancs, Points: 91.0, Price: 42.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Marie Copinet NV Alexandrine Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Marie Copinet, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Israel, Description: An extremely crisp Sauvignon Blanc with fresh lemony citrus aromas and flavors combined with subtle nuances of grass and underripe pineapple. A smooth texture and bracing acidity follow through to a slightly sour but clean, lingering finish., Designation: Kosher, Points: 84.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Shomron, Title: Recanati 2006 Kosher Sauvignon Blanc (Shomron), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Recanati, Region: Shomron, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Shomron, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Shomron, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Israel"

column1: What red wines would you suggest for someone who enjoys a long, lingering finish?,"
column3: Description
A must-have for Rivesaltes fans with aromas of dried apricot, toasted hazelnut, fig, ginger, sweet spice and candied orange rind. Silky and balanced with a mouthwatering finish.
A Howell Mountain red that needs time to reveal its deep core of blackberries and currants. The more it warms up, the more impressive it gets.

column2: Donnafugata 2007 Mille e Una Notte  (Contessa Entellina)
column3: A sophisticated red blend with deep layers of chocolate, cherry liqueur, dried sage, tobacco and leather. Soft and silky rich on the long, delicious finish.
An elegant, mouthwatering red blend with ripe tannins and a long finish. Balanced and confident.
A beautifully balanced blend with ripe cassis, cherry, plum, and spice flavors. Good acidity, mature tannins, and a long, satisfying finish.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: For any serious fan of Rivesaltes, this is a must-have example. Aromas of dried apricot, toasted hazelnut, fig, ginger, sweet spice and candied orange rind fill the bouquet, while the mouth is silky and balanced—sweet and heady without being cloying. All of the aromas transition onto the palate alongside accents of walnut skins and shiitake mushroom. Soft salinity makes the long finish even more mouthwatering. Drink now, or continue to age. There are 869 bottles produced., Designation: Legend Vintage, Points: 95.0, Price: 350.0, Province: Languedoc-Roussillon, Title: Gérard Bertrand 1945 Legend Vintage Red (Rivesaltes), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Gérard Bertrand, Region: Rivesaltes, Style1: Red Blend - Languedoc-Roussillon, Style2: Red Blend - Languedoc-Roussillon, Style3: Red Blend - France Country: US, Description: Almost entirely Merlot, with a few drops of other Bordeaux varieties, this Howell Mountain red screams for time in the cellar. The tannins bite and dog the mouth through the long, astringent finish. But chew on it for a while and you hit a deep core of blackberries and currants, and the more the wine warms up in the glass, the more impressive it gets. Cellar until 2010, and it should reward for years after., Designation: Red Wine, Points: 95.0, Price: 75.0, Province: California, Title: Duckhorn 2004 Red Wine Red (Howell Mountain), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Duckhorn, Region: Howell Mountain, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Howell Mountain, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Howell Mountain Country: US, Description: This easy-drinking Merlot has enough cherry, spice and smoky oak flavors to satisfy wine drinkers looking for a decent red. Earns extra points for the long finish., Designation: Vintner's Collection, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: California, Title: Sterling 2009 Vintner's Collection Merlot (Central Coast), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Sterling, Region: Central Coast, Style1: Merlot - California, Style2: Merlot - Central Coast, Style3: Merlot - Central Coast Country: Italy, Description: Mille e Una Notte is one of a handful of wines that defines the very best of Sicilian enology. Dark, luscious and penetrating, this sophisticated red blend shows deep layers of chocolate, cherry liqueur, dried sage, tobacco and leather. It's soft and silky rich on the long, delicious finish., Designation: Mille e Una Notte, Points: 93.0, Price: 80.0, Province: Sicily & Sardinia, Title: Donnafugata 2007 Mille e Una Notte  (Contessa Entellina), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Donnafugata, Region: Contessa Entellina, Style1: Red Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style2: Red Blend - Sicily & Sardinia, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Smooth, polished and suave describes this tenor of a wine that ranges from high notes to dark plum and fig baritone flavors that resonate through the lingering finish. It's a deft blend of Syrah, Grenache and Mourvèdre., Designation: Dante's Inferno, Points: 91.0, Price: 38.0, Province: California, Title: Dante Robere 2014 Dante's Inferno Red (California), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Dante Robere, Region: California, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - California, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: Made mostly with Bordeaux varieties based on Cabernet Sauvignon, with a dash of Syrah, this is a fine wine. It's dry, full-bodied and packed with blackberry, cassis, bacon and spice flavors, leading to a long, impressive finish. Give it a decant and enjoy as it warms in the glass., Designation: Secolo, Points: 92.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Sebastiani 2008 Secolo Red (Sonoma County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Sebastiani, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Sonoma, Style3: Red Blend - Sonoma Country: Portugal, Description: One of Portugal's priciest table wines, this vintage boasts cherry and plum aromas that just don't seem all that intense, followed by bright cherry flavors accented by modest cedar. The long finish is evidence of its quality, but it turns astringent and one wonders whether the fruit will outlast the tannins., Designation: Fojo, Points: 87.0, Price: 84.0, Province: Douro, Title: Quinta do Fojo 2000 Fojo Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Quinta do Fojo, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: Coming from older vine plantings at Dionysus, Red Willow, Boushey and Bacchus vineyards, Cabernet Sauvignon (70%) takes the lead, with the rest Merlot (20%) and Cabernet Franc. Aromas of graphite, savory herb and red and black fruit are followed by refined fruit flavors. It shows a sophisticated sensibility, bringing a sense of texture and vibrancy, along with a lingering finish., Designation: Sestina, Points: 91.0, Price: 65.0, Province: Washington, Title: Avennia 2014 Sestina Red (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Avennia, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington Country: France, Description: This wine epitomizes the lush ripeness of the 2009 vintage, yet does so without going over the top into dried fruit. Instead, it delivers brandied cherries spiced with cinnamon and clove, plus a touch of chocolate. It's full bodied and maybe just a bit warm, but the long finish is textured like fine suede. Drink now–2020., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 92.0, Price: 42.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Tardieu-Laurent 2009 Vieilles Vignes Red (Vacqueyras), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Tardieu-Laurent, Region: Vacqueyras, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: Italy, Description: Terra Rossa Riserva shows structure, concentration and chewy fruit flavors that last long on the finish. This is the kind of wine you'll want to pair with succulent steak or pork chops on an open grill., Designation: Terra Rossa Riserva, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Tuscany, Title: Tenuta di Trecciano 2007 Terra Rossa Riserva  (Chianti Colli Senesi), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Tenuta di Trecciano, Region: Chianti Colli Senesi, Style1: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style2: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style3: Sangiovese - Italy Country: Italy, Description: This thick, juicy, inky wine (with a large component of Petit Verdot) would pair with aged cheese or pecorino. The wine is still young (let it age five more years) with firm, sticky tannins and loads of blackberry and plum cake on the long finish., Designation: Monteti, Points: 92.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Tenuta Monteti 2006 Monteti Red (Toscana), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tenuta Monteti, Region: Toscana, Style1: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style2: Red Blend - Tuscany, Style3: Red Blend - Italy Country: South Africa, Description: An alluring nose of mint, mocha and blackberry leads into like flavors in this elegant, mouthwatering red blend from Zelma Long. Lush and unfolding, the wine offers ripe tannins and a long finish. Overall, balanced and confident., Designation: Series C, Points: 90.0, Price: 72.0, Province: Paarl, Title: Vilafonté 2005 Series C Red (Paarl), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Vilafonté, Region: Paarl, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paarl, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa Country: Spain, Description: Full, heavy, chunky wine with a powerful bouquet of black fruit and chocolate. The palate is about as full and concentrated as they come, but there's good balance and aging potential along with cassis, blackberry and mild herbal shadings. Savory and strong as it is long on the finish. Drinkable now but better from 2011–2014., Designation: VS Reserva, Points: 91.0, Price: 100.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Val Sotillo 2004 VS Reserva  (Ribera del Duero), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Val Sotillo, Region: Ribera del Duero, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: South Africa, Description: This Bordeaux-style blend is oaky at first, with aromas of vanilla, caramel and mocha that slowly mellow and marry with the berry compote, fig and black plum core. The lush, mouthfilling palate has a texture like crushed velvet: rich, seductive and fruity, but with some tannic edge. Nuances of mocha and anise grace the long finish. Give it a couple years in the cellar and see how it evolves., Designation: Strata Estate Grown, Points: 93.0, Price: 45.0, Province: California, Title: J Vineyards & Winery 2010 Strata Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: J Vineyards & Winery, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Made in an interesting way, with no oak but aged on the lees and put through malolactic fermentation. The result is crisp, clean and tasty, if a little sweet, with citrus, fig, green melon, vanilla and spice flavors., Designation: Rutherford Bench, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Rutherford Grove 2006 Rutherford Bench Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Rutherford Grove, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Napa Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Napa Valley Country: Italy, Description: The work of award-winning winemaker Renzo Cotarella shows through in this wine's modern, bright purple color, its new wood and ripe fruit aromas and in the juicy blackberry and berry fruit flavors. Yet it is certainly not just modern glitz: Lurking behind is the real heart of a tough, ageworthy, tannic Brunello, which promises a good 10 years at least before being ready to drink., Designation: Pian Delle Vigne, Points: 93.0, Price: 70.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Antinori 1997 Pian Delle Vigne  (Brunello di Montalcino), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Antinori, Region: Brunello di Montalcino, Style1: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style2: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style3: Sangiovese - Italy"

column1: What's a good red wine with a good balance between acidity and richness?,"
column3: Description
A balanced wine with richness and great freshness. The acidity is almost sweet, giving a spicy wine with a great green aftertaste.
A wine for those who like their reds big, bold and super rich. It's a full-on palate blaster that keeps its balance with moderate acidity.
A ripe, balanced and full of bold, rich fruit wine. Solid tannins under the opulent black plums and black currants fit well with the acidity.
A rich, spicy and deliciously fruity wine, it has tannins well cushioned by the ample blackberry flavors. Acidity preserves the wine's easy freshness.

column2: Château Margaux 2007 Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux  (Margaux)
column3: A wine that has richness, with acidity, layers of spice and black currant fruit flavors. The dominant cassis gives elegance, and already a forward balance of fruit and wood.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: 90-92 Barrel sample. Good balance between richness and great freshness. The acidity is almost sweet, giving a wine that is spicy, but with a great green aftertaste. 93-95 Barrel sample. A fine, fresh, berry flavored wine, delicious acidity, ripe final fruits. Great balance here, the year's freshness in firm focus., Designation: Barrel sample, Points: 92.5, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Picque Caillou 2009 Barrel sample  (Pessac-Léognan), Variety: Bordeaux-style White Blend, Winery: Château Picque Caillou, Region: Pessac-Léognan, Style1: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style White Blend - France Country: US, Description: Justice is a wine for those who like their reds big, bold and super rich. It's a full-on palate blaster that keeps its balance with moderate acidity and a generous (60%) amount of new French oak. Syrah-dominated, with 21% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Merlot, it's a fine steakhouse wine that should be consumed now., Designation: Justice, Points: 89.0, Price: 55.0, Province: Washington, Title: Two Vintners 2009 Justice Red (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Two Vintners, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: Portugal, Description: This wine is ripe, balanced and full of bold, rich fruit. Solid tannins under the opulent black plums and black currants fit well with the acidity and the structure. Give it a little time and drink from 2018., Designation: Reserva Tinto, Points: 91.0, Price: unknown, Province: Alentejano, Title: Santos & Seixo 2015 Reserva Tinto Red (Alentejano), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Santos & Seixo, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style2: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: Rich, spicy and deliciously fruity, it has tannins well cushioned by the ample blackberry flavors. Acidity preserves the wine's easy freshness, while it also has a dense texture. Drink now, but the wine will be richer in late 2014., Designation: Paxis, Points: 90.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: DFJ Vinhos 2012 Paxis Red (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: DFJ Vinhos, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese Red - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese Red - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: France, Description: A wine that has richness, with acidity, layers of spice and black currant fruit flavors. The dominant cassis gives elegance, and already a forward balance of fruit and wood., Designation: Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux, Points: 89.0, Price: 70.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Margaux 2007 Pavillon Rouge de Château Margaux  (Margaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Margaux, Region: Margaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: Portugal, Description: Rich and dense, a spicy wine, dominated by a smooth, concentrated character. The acidity is present and gives an essential antidote to the ripe black fruits, leaving a wine that is powerful without being excessive., Designation: Carlos Reynolds, Points: 87.0, Price: unknown, Province: Alentejano, Title: Julian Reynolds 2006 Carlos Reynolds Red (Alentejano), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Julian Reynolds, Region: Alentejano, Style1: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style2: Portuguese Red - Alentejano, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: Equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon, this Bordeaux blend is very delicious and very young. It combines ripe, plush cassis and cocoa fruit flavor with rich, fine tannins and fine acidity to produce a wine of extraordinary balance. Should develop effortlessly over the next decade., Designation: Fifty/Fifty Red Wine, Points: 92.0, Price: 85.0, Province: California, Title: Peju 2005 Fifty/Fifty Red Wine Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Peju, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: France, Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. A ripe and fruity wine, this exhibits an well-structured balance of acidity and sweet tannins. It has weight, richness, and a fine fruitiness., Designation: Barrel Sample, Points: 92.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Petit-Village 2012 Barrel Sample  (Pomerol), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Petit-Village, Region: Pomerol, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: Portugal, Description: Wood-aged wine, smooth and rich. Spice and toast combine with elegant soft tannins, sweet stone fruits and tight acidity. It feels rich, not heavy, its velvet texture gliding over the palate., Designation: Vinha Grande, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Douro, Title: Casa Ferreirinha 2007 Vinha Grande Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Casa Ferreirinha, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: France, Description: This is a superbly rich wine that is packed with generous black fruits and balanced acidity. It has structure and concentrated plum and damson fruits. The wood aging still shows in what is young wine, although this will go. Drink this impressive wine from 2019., Designation: Cuvée G, Points: 92.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Provence, Title: Les Vignobles Gueissard 2015 Cuvée G Red (Côtes de Provence), Variety: Provence red blend, Winery: Les Vignobles Gueissard, Region: Côtes de Provence, Style1: Provence red blend - Provence, Style2: Provence red blend - Provence, Style3: Provence red blend - France Country: France, Description: With some richness, red fruits over wood and a full-bodied structure, this is a solid, dense wine. Acidity is present, while the ripe juicy fruits more than balance it. The tannins offer a firm structure and suggest aging., Designation: Servoisine Premier Cru, Points: 90.0, Price: 34.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine de la Ferté 2008 Servoisine Premier Cru  (Givry), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Domaine de la Ferté, Region: Givry, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: France, Description: Rich, intense red-fruited wine, soft and voluptuous. The tannins are folded into the ripe fruits, giving a very approachable feel. The acidity is prominent at this stage but should soften in a year or two, and the wine is certainly worth aging., Designation: En Chevret, Points: 91.0, Price: 55.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Pierre André 2009 En Chevret  (Volnay), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Pierre André, Region: Volnay, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: US, Description: Lots of rich delights in this fruity blend of Syrah, Mourvèdre, Zinfandel and Grenache. It's a bit rustic, with zingy acidity, but beautifully layered, with flavors of wild berries, cherries, tobacco, crisp smoky bacon and sweet oak., Designation: Red X, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: California, Title: X 2009 Red X Red (North Coast), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: X, Region: North Coast, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - North Coast, Style3: Red Blend - North Coast Country: France, Description: A rich, sweetly fruity wine, its ripe black plum fruit balanced by fine acidity and layered with wood. It is a solid and dense wine, firm and with great juiciness. Likely to age well for 4–5 years., Designation: Réserve, Points: 89.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Jean-Michel Cazes 2011 Réserve  (Médoc), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Jean-Michel Cazes, Region: Médoc, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: This is a structured rich wine. It has great ripe fruit, generous with red berry and acidity in fine balance. It has a solid backbone of tannins although these are already well integrated into the opulent wine. Drink from 2021., Designation: Montée Rouge Premier Cru, Points: 93.0, Price: 65.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Château de Santenay 2015 Montée Rouge Premier Cru  (Beaune), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Château de Santenay, Region: Beaune, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France"

column1: Can you suggest a wine from Spain?,"
column3: Description

column2: Finca Albret 2007 La Viña de Mi Madre Reserva Red (Navarra)
column3: Lush, composed and fresh with blackberry and prune aromas. Mouthfilling and smooth, with a firm tannic structure and flavors of coconut, lemon rind, and herbal black fruit.

column2: Tagonius 2011 Tinto Roble Red (Vinos de Madrid)
column3: Ripe aromas with raisin, tobacco notes and baked berry warmth. Layered and welcoming with earthy cherry, plum and baking spice flavors.

column2: Marques de Griñon 2005 Emeritus Red (Dominio de Valdepusa)
column3: Huge, tannic but aromatic and flavor packed. Toasted oak, mint, cola, maple, marzipan work the potent nose, with massive black-fruit flavors and coffee, fudge and light herb accents.

column2: Suertes del Marqués 2015 Los Pasitos Babosa Negro
column3: Cherry and plum aromas, crisp and fresh, with edge. Salty raspberry and plum flavors end with racy snap. Versatile and elegant food wine.

column2: Masies d'Avinyo 2004 Abadal Red (Pla de Bages)
column3: Herbal, leafy aromas with berry fruit and oak. The palate is slightly crisp and racy, but its lightweight character is welcome.
column9: ,Country: Spain, Description: Lush, composed and fresh on the bouquet, with blackberry and perfect prune aromas. This is mouthfilling and smooth, with a firm, flush tannic structure and flavors of coconut, lemon rind, herbal black fruit and red berry. It's long and supple late, and it's arguably one of the best Cabernet Sauvignons you'll find from Spain and Navarra., Designation: La Viña de Mi Madre Reserva, Points: 92.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Finca Albret 2007 La Viña de Mi Madre Reserva Red (Navarra), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Finca Albret, Region: Navarra, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Ripe aromas start with raisin, while tobacco notes and baked berry warmth reel you in. This blend of Tempranillo, Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon from the Vinos de Madrid region feels layered and welcoming. Earthy cherry, plum and baking spice flavors finish long, complex and slightly toasty. Drink through 2018., Designation: Tinto Roble, Points: 90.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Tagonius 2011 Tinto Roble Red (Vinos de Madrid), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tagonius, Region: Vinos de Madrid, Style1: Red Blend - Central Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Central Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: A huge wine that's tannic as nails but so aromatic and flavor packed. Toasted oak, mint, cola, maple, marzipan work the potent nose, while the saturated palate thumps along with massive black-fruit flavors and coffee, fudge and light herb accents. This is one of the most powerful wines from Spain or anywhere. Drink or hold., Designation: Emeritus, Points: 94.0, Price: 100.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Marques de Griñon 2005 Emeritus Red (Dominio de Valdepusa), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Marques de Griñon, Region: Dominio de Valdepusa, Style1: Red Blend - Central Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Central Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Aromas of cabbage, tomato leaf and green berry fruits tell you all you need to know. The wine is green but thick, with an unctuous meeting of sweet and underripe flavors as well as a gooey mouthfeel. Just one of a million weak wines from the high plains of Spain., Designation: Quixote Merlot-Tempranillo-Petit Verdot, Points: 81.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Pago Casa del Blanco 2005 Quixote Merlot-Tempranillo-Petit Verdot Red (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Pago Casa del Blanco, Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Style1: Red Blend - Central Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Central Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: From Spain's broiling Extremadura region, this Merlot-based rosé has a funky nose and mushy, leafy flavors. The finish lacks zest., Designation: Merlot, Points: 80.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Viña Santa Marina 2012 Merlot Rosado (Extremadura), Variety: Rosado, Winery: Viña Santa Marina, Region: Extremadura, Style1: Rosado - Central Spain, Style2: Rosado - Central Spain, Style3: Rosado - Spain Country: Spain, Description: A ripe and spicy blend of Tempranillo, Cabernet and Merlot from Somontano, an improving region near the Pyrenees. Licorice and spicy oak scents accent the nose, while the palate pulses with raspberry, currant and barrel-based vanilla. Shows good drive before finishing mildly drying and resiny., Designation: Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Olvena 2004 Tempranillo-Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot Red (Somontano), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Olvena, Region: Somontano, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: The average American wine drinker is probably not interested in a three-grape white blend from hot and dry Extremadura, Spain, but in case you are, this wine is neutral on the nose and lean on the palate. Flavors of green apple, pineapple and lemon are scouring and seem designed for fried seafood., Designation: Alicena, Points: 82.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Viña Santa Marina 2005 Alicena White (Extremadura), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Viña Santa Marina, Region: Extremadura, Style1: White Blend - Central Spain, Style2: White Blend - Central Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Have you ever tried varietal Baboso Negro from the island of Tenerife? Give it a shot and you'll likely be impressed, as I was. Cherry and plum aromas are in the red zone, while this wine feels crisp and fresh, with edge. Salty raspberry and plum flavors end with racy snap. This is a versatile and elegant food wine; drink through 2020., Designation: Los Pasitos, Points: 92.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Spanish Islands, Title: Suertes del Marqués 2015 Los Pasitos Babosa Negro, Variety: Babosa Negro, Winery: Suertes del Marqués, Region: Spanish Islands, Style1: Babosa Negro - Spanish Islands, Style2: Babosa Negro - Spanish Islands, Style3: Babosa Negro - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Tempranillo and Cabernet Franc aren't often thrown together, but here the marriage works. The nose offers herbal, leafy aromas from the CF, while berry fruit and oak carry the rest of the show. The palate is slightly crisp and racy, but its lightweight character is welcome. This is yet another well-made, interesting wine from one of our favorite obscure Spanish labels., Designation: Abadal, Points: 88.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Masies d'Avinyo 2004 Abadal Red (Pla de Bages), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Masies d'Avinyo, Region: Pla de Bages, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Big, chunky and dark on the nose, but smells monotone except for a floral hint. The palate shows nice body, saturation and grabby tannins to go with oak-infused flavors of black plum, cola and spice. Savory and rooty on the finish. A good restaurant wine, either by the glass or bottle., Designation: Finca La Cuesta, Points: 88.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Luna Beberide 2008 Finca La Cuesta Red (Bierzo), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Luna Beberide, Region: Bierzo, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Appealing bright citrus and slate flavors ride a round yet faintly spritzy mouthfeel in this lively white from Spain's northeast. The flavors and textures show some depth and positive tension. Best for current drinking, it closes bright and dry, with good length. Best Buy. —M.M., Designation: Classico, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Marqués de Alella 2000 Classico White (Alella), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Marqués de Alella, Region: Alella, Style1: White Blend - Catalonia, Style2: White Blend - Catalonia, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: A mature, more traditional Spanish wine that's ready to drink. The nose mixes tomato leaf, mint and maturing berry aromas, while the starchy, grabby palate shows aging raspberry and strawberry fruit with ample leather and dryness. Caramel, vanilla and toast notes grace the finish., Designation: Reserva, Points: 87.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Viña Albali 2004 Reserva Tempranillo (Valdepeñas), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Viña Albali, Region: Valdepeñas, Style1: Tempranillo - Central Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Central Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: Spain, Description: A clean, light wine with cherry and cinnamon notes on the nose and in the mouth. This isn't heavy or deep, but tasty, and evenly textured. Elegant herb and mineral shadings show on the close of this attractive easy drinker. Would do well with a very light chill. —M.M., Designation: Tinto, Points: 85.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Viña Collado 1999 Tinto Red (Campo de Borja), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Viña Collado, Region: Campo de Borja, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: This funky white from the island of Mallorca is 50% Premsal and 50% Callet, and if you've never heard of those grapes you're not alone. The nose is a bit harsh and strange, while the palate is on the flat side. Flavors of ham, pithy citrus and nectarine finish jumbled. This is more of a unique oddity than great white wine., Designation: Quíbia Falanis, Points: 86.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Spanish Islands, Title: Ànima Negra 2013 Quíbia Falanis White (Vi de la Terra Mallorca), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Ànima Negra, Region: Vi de la Terra Mallorca, Style1: White Blend - Spanish Islands, Style2: White Blend - Spanish Islands, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Spain, Description: This medium-to full-bodied red from Spain's southeast sports a potent, inviting nose. Black plum, soy, leather and oak merge in an appealing, inky opening. The black cherry flavors are quite dry, but also rich and palate-coating. Finishes with substantial tannins. The wine should drink even better in one or two years, but should pair well with hearty fare even now. Best Buy. —M.M., Designation: Cosecha, Points: 87.0, Price: 7.0, Province: Levante, Title: Mayoral 2000 Cosecha Red (Jumilla), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Mayoral, Region: Jumilla, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Levante, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Levante, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain"

column1: Recommend a wine with hints of floral.,"
column3: Description
column9: Food Pairing

column2: Bastianich 2005 Plus Tocai Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli)
column3: Floral wine with notes of jasmine and honeysuckle, sweet fragrances of candied fruit and caramel. Sweet and thick in the mouth but well-dosed acidity keeps it from being cloying.
column9: Honey glazed ham or lobster

column3: Hints of rosewater and Turkish Delight waft from the glass. Citric freshness with a bit of warmth that intensifies the floral peach notes. Very aromatic and varietally true, with a tropical finish of passion fruit.
Floral aromas of white spring flowers partner hints of pear and stone fruit. The juicy palate offers white peach, apple and green melon alongside a mineral note and fresh acidity.

A floral wine, full of ripe black-cherry fruit and with a firm structure that sustains the wine. This cru wine is rich, still developing, still with enough tannins and acidity to allow it to age further.

A very flowery interpretation with gardenia, freesia and carnations on the nose that carry over to the palate where they merge with fresh orange peel. Exceptionally pretty nose and the crisp, linear finish make for a nice overall package.
column9: Flounder
column10: ,Country: Italy, Description: This floral wine is bursting with notes of jasmine and honeysuckle backed by sweet fragrances of candied fruit and caramel. The wine is sweet and thick in the mouth but the well-dosed acidity keeps it from being cloying or too fat. It would pair well with slightly sweet foods such as honey glazed ham or lobster., Designation: Plus, Points: 91.0, Price: 75.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Bastianich 2005 Plus Tocai Friulano (Colli Orientali del Friuli), Variety: Tocai Friulano, Winery: Bastianich, Region: Colli Orientali del Friuli, Style1: Tocai Friulano - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Tocai Friulano - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Tocai Friulano - Italy Country: France, Description: Hints of rosewater and Turkish Delight waft from the glass. It's very aromatic and varietally true, with a tropical finish of passion fruit., Designation: Classic, Points: 90.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Hugel 2014 Classic Gewurztraminer (Alsace), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Hugel, Region: Alsace, Style1: Gewürztraminer - Alsace, Style2: Gewürztraminer - Alsace, Style3: Gewürztraminer - France Country: Italy, Description: Floral aromas of white spring flowers partner hints of pear and stone fruit. This cru wine is rich, still developing, still with enough tannins and acidity to allow it to age further. Drink this attractive wine from mid-2017., Designation: Flower Label, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Georges Duboeuf 2015 Flower Label  (Fleurie), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Georges Duboeuf, Region: Fleurie, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: France, Description: A very flowery interpretation with gardenia, freesia and carnations on the nose that carry over to the palate where they merge with fresh orange peel. An opulent texture helps carry the floral, appley, grapefruity flavors into the finish., Designation: Secco, Points: 92.0, Price: 16.0, Province: California, Title: Uvaggio 2015 Secco Moscato (Lodi), Variety: Moscato, Winery: Uvaggio, Region: Lodi, Style1: Moscato - California, Style2: Moscato - Lodi, Style3: Moscato - Lodi Country: US, Description: Hints of tropical fresh fuit and flowers lends an exotic touch to this pretty wine, and on the palate, it offers balanced elements of crisp fruit and spicy oak. Not terribly complex but a friendly food wine., Designation: Unoaked, Points: 85.0, Price: 13.0, Province: New York, Title: Heron Hill 2006 Unoaked Chardonnay (New York), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Heron Hill, Region: New York, Style1: Chardonnay - New York, Style2: Chardonnay - New York, Style3: Chardonnay - New York Country: France, Description: Floral and aromatic, this is a ripe wine with delicious, intense acidity as well as a touch of honey. Rich peach and pear come through strongly. It's a refreshing, juicy wine that is developing quickly. Drink from 2016., Designation: Les Vaucoupins Premier Cru, Points: 93.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Laroche 2012 Les Vaucoupins Premier Cru  (Chablis), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Laroche, Region: Chablis, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: Very subtle hints of jasmine and ripe Valencia orange skin gently perfume this soft, subtle, ethereal wine. Gentle sweetness adds to the charm and creates a dreamy mirage of fruit and scent—what lightness of touch. This wine is best savored slowly so every shade of fruit and blossom is encountered and enjoyed., Designation: Cuvée Laurence, Points: 94.0, Price: 48.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Weinbach 2014 Cuvée Laurence Gewurztraminer (Alsace), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Domaine Weinbach, Region: Alsace, Style1: Gewürztraminer - Alsace, Style2: Gewürztraminer - Alsace, Style3: Gewürztraminer - France Country: Italy, Description: Put your nose to the glass and you will be rewarded with extreme floral fragrances that suggest naturally aromatic grapes are used over a Chard base. Ultimately, this is a very feminine, lady-like wine busting with white flowers and naturally sweet aromas., Designation: Beyond the Clouds, Points: 90.0, Price: 36.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Elena Walch 2004 Beyond the Clouds White (Alto Adige), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Elena Walch, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: A blend of Petit Manseng and Muscat, this wine is overtly floral and fruity. Sweet lily and white rose aromas pervade an exotic palate of lychee and orange oil. While easy to enjoy on its own, this would make a fun pairing with Thai curries., Designation: Block Eleven, Points: 86.0, Price: 27.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Early Mountain 2014 Block Eleven White (Virginia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Early Mountain, Region: Virginia, Style1: White Blend - Virginia, Style2: White Blend - Virginia, Style3: White Blend - Virginia Country: US, Description: A pretty, floral wine, bright with melon and honey, straightforwardly lean and ready to drink at your next picnic, hike or ski trip, a great value for a solidly well-made wine with texture to pair with charcuterie, falafel or spiced chickpeas., Designation: Dry, Points: 87.0, Price: 11.0, Province: California, Title: Blue Plate 2012 Dry Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: Blue Plate, Region: Clarksburg, Style1: Chenin Blanc - California, Style2: Chenin Blanc - Clarksburg, Style3: Chenin Blanc - Clarksburg Country: US, Description: Expressively aromatic, this is sourced from the Lawrence Vineyards on the Royal Slope. It bursts from the glass with scents of body powder, lilacs and lemon oil. It gracefully weaves those accents into a rich body with floral, citrus and tree fruit flavors, rounded off with just a hint of residual sugar. Still medium dry, this is a versatile wine to sip and enjoy solo or with light picnic foods., Designation: The Gnome, Points: 91.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Washington, Title: Finn Hill 2013 The Gnome Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Finn Hill, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: South Africa, Description: Floral tones of peony, honeysuckle and verbena are upfront on the nose of this pretty white wine, with core fruit tones of pink apple and sweet citrus. The palate is bright and clean, with easygoing fruit flavors and superb acidic lift that cumulates in an immensely refreshing close. Drink now., Designation: Collection, Points: 88.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Swartland, Title: Riebeek Cellars 2016 Collection Chenin Blanc (Swartland), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: Riebeek Cellars, Region: Swartland, Style1: Chenin Blanc - Swartland, Style2: Chenin Blanc - Swartland, Style3: Chenin Blanc - South Africa"

column1: I prefer dry winesany recommendations for both red and white?,"
column3: Description

column2: Greater Purpose NV White Label Red (Dry Creek Valley)
column3: A nonvintage red with juicy flavors of blackberries and pepper, and some extra layers of depth.
A dry white with a surprising intensity of stone fruit flavor that remains through the finish.

column2: Luko 2005 White Hawk Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
column3: A first-rate dry red wine of great substance and authority with full-bodied blackberry flavors and hints of violets, tobacco, pepper and cocoa.
A dry white offering sweet hay, apple and vanilla aromas and flavors.

column2: Château de Gaudou 2012 Blanc de Noir Malbec (Vin de France)
column3: A dry white wine, made from red Malbec grapes, intensely aromatic with quince, almond and lychee notes.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Made from an unknown blend of grapes, this nonvintage red is good, dry and versatile. It has juicy flavors of blackberries and pepper, with some extra layers of depth that make it a good value for a restaurant by-the-glass wine., Designation: White Label, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Greater Purpose NV White Label Red (Dry Creek Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Greater Purpose, Region: Dry Creek Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Dry Creek Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Dry Creek Valley Country: US, Description: While the nose is demure, with just a touch of rose petal remniscent of Gewürztraminer, this dry white gains body and power on the palate. There's a surprising intensity of stone fruit flavor that remains through the finish., Designation: Dry, Points: 86.0, Price: 15.0, Province: New York, Title: Knapp 2013 Dry Gewurztraminer (Cayuga Lake), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Knapp, Region: Cayuga Lake, Style1: Gewürztraminer - New York, Style2: Gewürztraminer - New York, Style3: Gewürztraminer - New York Country: US, Description: Expensive, but worth it. Absolutely a first-rate dry red wine of great substance and authority. Shows full-bodied blackberry flavors with a meaty, leathery edge and hints of violets, tobacco, pepper and cocoa. Such is the tannic structure that the wine should develop through 2012., Designation: White Hawk Vineyard, Points: 93.0, Price: 52.0, Province: California, Title: Luko 2005 White Hawk Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Luko, Region: Santa Barbara, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - Santa Barbara, Style3: Syrah - Santa Barbara Country: Spain, Description: Round and even, this dry white from the well-known Rioja producer offers sweet hay, apple and vanilla aromas and flavors. Nicely composed, this has decent balance and a smooth, if modest finish. Best to drink now, and a good bar or party pour. Best Buy. —M.M., Designation: Blanco, Points: 85.0, Price: 7.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Marqués de Cáceres 2000 Blanco White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Marqués de Cáceres, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: France, Description: This dry white wine, made from red Malbec grapes is intensely aromatic with quince, almond and lychee notes. It's a fascinating combination that has produced a rare style of wine. Although it is dry, its perfumed character brings out ripeness on the palate., Designation: Blanc de Noir, Points: 90.0, Price: 16.0, Province: France Other, Title: Château de Gaudou 2012 Blanc de Noir Malbec (Vin de France), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Château de Gaudou, Region: Vin de France, Style1: Malbec - France Other, Style2: Malbec - France Other, Style3: Malbec - France Country: US, Description: I like this wine mainly for its dryness and crispness. It tastes balanced and wholesome, the way a white wine should be. It's not a heavy-hitter, but pleases for its spicy fruit, toffee and floral flavors., Designation: Dry, Points: 86.0, Price: 16.0, Province: California, Title: Radog 2006 Dry Gewürztraminer (Monterey County), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Radog, Region: Monterey, Style1: Gewürztraminer - California, Style2: Gewürztraminer - Monterey, Style3: Gewürztraminer - Monterey Country: Hungary, Description: This dry white has apricot, peach and white floral scents and lemon curd and orange zest flavors. It's well balanced, with a creamy finish., Designation: Somlói, Points: 90.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Hungary, Title: Apátsági 2013 Somlói Hárslevelü (Hungary), Variety: Hárslevelü, Winery: Apátsági, Region: Hungary, Style1: Hárslevelü - Hungary, Style2: Hárslevelü - Hungary, Style3: Hárslevelü - Hungary Country: Italy, Description: This dry white wine opens with aromas of acacia flower, honey and stone fruit. The lack of sweetness holds back some of the aromatic intensity, and the wine is easy, fresh and zesty on the finish. Pair it with fried cocktail shrimp., Designation: Terra di Vulcano Dry, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Bisceglia 2011 Terra di Vulcano Dry Moscato (Basilicata), Variety: Moscato, Winery: Bisceglia, Region: Basilicata, Style1: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style2: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style3: Moscato - Italy Country: US, Description: Truly dry, with barely perceptible 6g/L of residual sugar, this is intensely aromatic. A strong and lingering impression of talcum powder dominates. It's a potent, powerful, penetrating wine, true to variety, but a bit of a challenge with food., Designation: Dry, Points: 90.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Airlie 2014 Dry Gewürztraminer (Willamette Valley), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Airlie, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Gewürztraminer - Oregon, Style2: Gewürztraminer - Willamette Valley, Style3: Gewürztraminer - Willamette Valley Country: France, Description: Rather stalky, this dry wine has a sense of extraction in the form of bitterness. The wine's red fruits are behind this dryness, demanding at least another 2–3 years., Designation: Clos du Pressoir, Points: 84.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Joseph Mellot 2012 Clos du Pressoir  (Menetou-Salon), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Joseph Mellot, Region: Menetou-Salon, Style1: Pinot Noir - Loire Valley, Style2: Pinot Noir - Loire Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: Portugal, Description: Mature, definitely dry in character, with attractive wood acidity. Dark gold in color, it has just enough sweetness, but the style is certainly a sipping Port, not a mixer, giving an intriguing finishing austerity., Designation: Dry White, Points: 91.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Port, Title: Wiese & Krohn NV Dry White  (Port), Variety: Port, Winery: Wiese & Krohn, Region: Port, Style1: Port - Port, Style2: Port - Port, Style3: Port - Portugal Country: Greece, Description: A spicy, floral nose leads this fresh white from Mantinia. Balanced with fruity pear and lemon flavors, it's a good everyday white with a glamorous edge., Designation: Dry, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Mantinia, Title: Cavino 2012 Dry Moschofilero (Mantinia), Variety: Moschofilero, Winery: Cavino, Region: Mantinia, Style1: Moschofilero - Mantinia, Style2: Moschofilero - Mantinia, Style3: Moschofilero - Greece Country: Greece, Description: This rounded white starts with aromas of lemon peel, orange jam, spice and flowers, followed by appealing flavors of citrus and white fruit. It has body and structure, and will temper spicy food well: think Indian, Szechuan., Designation: Dry White, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Peloponnese, Title: My Big Fat Greek Wine 2012 Dry White Moschofilero (Peloponnese), Variety: Moschofilero, Winery: My Big Fat Greek Wine, Region: Peloponnese, Style1: Moschofilero - Peloponnese, Style2: Moschofilero - Peloponnese, Style3: Moschofilero - Greece Country: US, Description: Whiffs of bramble meld into raspberry and white-cherry flavors in this dry white wine made from red Pinot Noir grapes. It's brisk in acidity and spry in mouthfeel but finishes with a luscious cling of ripe red-berry flavor., Designation: White Pinot Noir, Points: 89.0, Price: 19.0, Province: New York, Title: Anthony Nappa 2016 White Pinot Noir Rosé (New York), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Anthony Nappa, Region: New York, Style1: Rosé - New York, Style2: Rosé - New York, Style3: Rosé - New York Country: Germany, Description: Dusty mineral tones outshine slightly demure apple and pear flavors in this dry, delicately concentrated white. Crisp acidity leads a brisk but pristine finish. Drink now through 2018., Designation: Trocken, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Rheinhessen, Title: Weinreich 2014 Trocken Grauburgunder (Rheinhessen), Variety: Grauburgunder, Winery: Weinreich, Region: Rheinhessen, Style1: Grauburgunder - Rheinhessen, Style2: Grauburgunder - Rheinhessen, Style3: Grauburgunder - Germany"

column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: Put your nose to the glass and you will be rewarded with extreme floral fragrances that suggest naturally aromatic grapes are used over a Chard base. Sweet lily and white rose aromas pervade an exotic palate of lychee and orange oil. While easy to enjoy on its own, this would make a fun pairing with Thai curries., Designation: Block Eleven, Points: 86.0, Price: 27.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Early Mountain 2014 Block Eleven White (Virginia), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Early Mountain, Region: Virginia, Style1: White Blend - Virginia, Style2: White Blend - Virginia, Style3: White Blend - Virginia Country: Italy, Description: Made with biodynamically grown Moscato grapes, this fragrant white wine opens with honey, white flower and stone fruit aromas. The mouthfeel is creamy and rich, with a touch of sweetness on the finish., Designation: Jalal, Points: 87.0, Price: 42.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Cefalicchio 2011 Jalal Moscato (Puglia), Variety: Moscato, Winery: Cefalicchio, Region: Puglia, Style1: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style2: Moscato - Southern Italy, Style3: Moscato - Italy Country: US, Description: Floral, citrus aromas, honeylike flavors and an unctuous texture make this white Rhône-style blend almost a dessert in a glass—without being sweet. The wine is full bodied, mouthfilling, complex and gushing with great pastry-like flavors., Designation: L'Ingenue, Points: 92.0, Price: 32.0, Province: California, Title: Elyse 2013 L'Ingenue White (Sierra Foothills), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Elyse, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Sierra Foothills, Style3: White Blend - Sierra Foothills Country: Greece, Description: Expressive aromas of candied pineapple, apricot, tropical fruit and citrus are followed by rounded floral and fruit flavors on the tongue. A nice spicy lift keeps the wine aloft. Pair with salted nuts, cheeses., Designation: White Sweet Wine, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Muscat of Patras, Title: Achaia Clauss NV White Sweet Wine  (Muscat of Patras), Variety: Muscat, Winery: Achaia Clauss, Region: Muscat of Patras, Style1: Muscat - Muscat of Patras, Style2: Muscat - Muscat of Patras, Style3: Muscat - Greece Country: Spain, Description: Floral aromas and tropical scents are a touch heavy and oily. This blend of Viura and Chardonnay is citrusy in the mouth, with little variation on that theme. Tangerine, orange and tart nectarine flavors finish bright and juicy., Designation: Estate Bottled Viura-Chardonnay, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Ochoa 2013 Estate Bottled Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Ochoa, Region: Navarra, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Canada, Description: A floral perfume combines with notes of smoke, sweet pineapple and candle wax on the nose and palate of this deep gold Vidal Blanc icewine. Vibrant acidity and a hint of bitter tangerine rind on the long, long finish add complexity and structure., Designation: Icewine, Points: 90.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Ontario, Title: Pillitteri 2008 Icewine Vidal Blanc (Niagara Peninsula), Variety: Vidal Blanc, Winery: Pillitteri, Region: Niagara Peninsula, Style1: Vidal Blanc - Ontario, Style2: Vidal Blanc - Ontario, Style3: Vidal Blanc - Canada Country: Italy, Description: Floral and mineral tones emerge from the nose of this white wine from Sicily. Executed in an easy and fresh style, this crisp—and slightly sweet—wine would pair with tuna salad and fried calamari., Designation: Herea, Points: 85.0, Price: unknown, Province: Sicily & Sardinia, Title: Avide 2008 Herea Insolia (Sicilia), Variety: Insolia, Winery: Avide, Region: Sicilia, Style1: Insolia - Sicily & Sardinia, Style2: Insolia - Sicily & Sardinia, Style3: Insolia - Italy Country: US, Description: Just a hint of sweetness can be found in a bouquet of honey-dusted flower. Pretty in on the palate, with citrus and apricot notes, this shows floral accents that are somewhat reminiscent of Gewürztraminer., Designation: No 9, Points: 90.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Washington, Title: Swiftwater Cellars 2011 No 9 Riesling (Yakima Valley), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Swiftwater Cellars, Region: Yakima Valley, Style1: Riesling - Washington, Style2: Riesling - Washington, Style3: Riesling - Washington Country: Italy, Description: Floral aromas of white spring flowers partner hints of pear and stone fruit. The juicy palate offers white peach, apple and green melon alongside a mineral note and fresh acidity., Designation: Castello, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Cantina del Castello 2013 Castello  (Soave Classico), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Cantina del Castello, Region: Soave Classico, Style1: White Blend - Veneto, Style2: White Blend - Veneto, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: This off-dry blend of Riesling, Chenin Blanc, Pinot Gris and Muscat shows the last grape first and foremost. The Muscat shines and shimmers with scents of orange blossoms and sweet, lively fruit. The wine is aromatic as promised, delicate and tilting toward the floral, though with good, solid fruit structure., Designation: Aromatic Blend, Points: 89.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Washington, Title: Eufloria 2013 Aromatic Blend White (Washington), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Eufloria, Region: Washington, Style1: White Blend - Washington, Style2: White Blend - Washington, Style3: White Blend - Washington Country: Italy, Description: Floral aromas of wisteria and jasmine mingle with ripe orchard fruit. On the palate, bright acidity lifts white peach, ripe pear and candied lemon drop. A silky mousse adds softness., Designation: Extra Dry, Points: 87.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Spagnol NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco Treviso), Variety: Glera, Winery: Spagnol, Region: Prosecco Treviso, Style1: Glera - Veneto, Style2: Glera - Veneto, Style3: Glera - Italy Country: Israel, Description: This is a superb value white that's versatile and perfect for company. Fresh white florals, Asian pear and a touch of pineapple acidity dominate, with softly prickling acidity dancing on your tongue through the close. Light weight but mouthwatering and easy to drink., Designation: Yasmin Kosher White, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Shomron, Title: Recanati 2009 Yasmin Kosher White White (Shomron), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Recanati, Region: Shomron, Style1: White Blend - Shomron, Style2: White Blend - Shomron, Style3: White Blend - Israel"

column1: Looking for a wine that is single-vineyard.,"
column3: Description
A blend of six separate blocks, combining savory herb flavors with ripe Bing cherry fruit.

column2: Viento 2006 Allegre Vineyard Verona White White
column3: A blend of Pinot Gris, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc Musque, harmonious with crisp citrus and tart pear fruit.
Dry and high in acidity, with cherry, tobacco and tar flavors.

column2: Domaine des Varoilles 2010 Clos du Meix des Ouches
column3: Firmly structured and full of perfumed fruit with a smoky, toasty character.

column2: Alta Vista 2010 Temis Single Vineyard Malbec
column3: Soft, deep, alluring nose with plum, berry, minerality and a hint of rubber and bacon.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: This single vineyard wine is a blend of six separate blocks, each planted to a different clone. It deftly combines savory herb flavors with ripe Bing cherry fruit. The tannins are polished, textured and balanced, leading into a long finish that leaves a final impression of composted earth., Designation: Shea Vineyard, Points: 94.0, Price: 62.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Bergström 2015 Shea Vineyard Pinot Noir, Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Bergström, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: US, Description: This single-vineyard blend includes Pinot Gris, Chardonnay and Sauvignon Blanc Musque, from a one-acre site in the Columbia Gorge AVA. It's labeled as a field blend, which suggests that the grapes were co-fermented; the results are harmonious and quite appealing. The mix of crisp citrus and tart pear fruit is set against flinty acids that set up the taste buds for chèvre or light seafood., Designation: Allegre Vineyard Verona White, Points: 89.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Viento 2006 Allegre Vineyard Verona White White (Columbia Gorge (OR)), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Viento, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: White Blend - Oregon, Style2: White Blend - Oregon Other, Style3: White Blend - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: This a single-vineyard wine is dry and high in acidity, with cherry, tobacco and tar flavors, and has a rustic mouthfeel. Think of it as American Chianti, and drink with roasted meats and hearty pasta dishes., Designation: Matagrano, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Lava Cap 2005 Matagrano Sangiovese (El Dorado), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Lava Cap, Region: El Dorado, Style1: Sangiovese - California, Style2: Sangiovese - El Dorado, Style3: Sangiovese - El Dorado Country: US, Description: This single-vineyard wine offers high-toned citrus, almond and vanilla bean flavors. Fresh and fruity, it's light  bodied yet doesn't skimp on flavor or texture, finishing on a tart note of lemon pith., Designation: Morgaen Lee Vineyard, Points: 90.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Conclusion 2015 Morgaen Lee Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Conclusion, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Napa Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Napa Valley Country: France, Description: A single-vineyard wine, this is firmly structured and full of perfumed fruit. New wood aging gives the red berry fruit a smoky, toasty character. It's a rich, concentrated selection to age for five years or more., Designation: Clos du Meix des Ouches, Points: 90.0, Price: 130.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine des Varoilles 2010 Clos du Meix des Ouches  (Gevrey-Chambertin), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Domaine des Varoilles, Region: Gevrey-Chambertin, Style1: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style2: Pinot Noir - Burgundy, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: Argentina, Description: The Alta Vista single-vineyard wines are among the best in Argentina. This offers a soft, deep, alluring nose with plum, berry, minerality and a hint of rubber and bacon. It's rich, pure and a bit jammy in feel, with saturated blueberry, blackberry, molasses and caramel flavors. A cuddly, long finish confirms this Malbec's outstanding status. Drink through 2018., Designation: Temis Single Vineyard, Points: 94.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Alta Vista 2010 Temis Single Vineyard Malbec (Mendoza), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Alta Vista, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: US, Description: Though single vineyard wines can be impressive, there are times when they'd be better as components in a blend. This is the case here. Just on the edge of sour, the very tart grapey flavors seem overtaken by acidity, without compensating depth or complexity., Designation: Fairsing Vineyard, Points: 87.0, Price: 39.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Swick 2014 Fairsing Vineyard Pinot Noir, Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Swick, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: Italy, Description: This single-vineyard bottling begins with aromas of nearly overripe plum and black berries accompanied by whiffs of farmyard and wet soil.
