The palate loses this rustic note and delivers juicy red cherry layered with vanilla, espresso and toasted oak. It's a bit shy on freshness and finishes on a sweet note but it's still very enjoyable thanks to succulent primary fruit flavors., Designation: Vigna La Casina, Points: 89.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Tuscany, Title: Casina di Cornia 2008 Vigna La Casina  (Chianti Classico), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Casina di Cornia, Region: Chianti Classico, Style1: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style2: Sangiovese - Tuscany, Style3: Sangiovese - Italy Country: US, Description: A single-vineyard wine from Oregon can be a component rather than a complete wine, but here it is an absolute joy. Fragrant and complex, this offers pleasures for both nose and palate, with scents of leaf and spice and herb, leading into a surprisingly dense and textural blend of wild berry, rhubarb, melon and mixed tropical fruits. Fascinating and long, this is a fine example of Oregon Pinot at its most elegant and fascinating., Designation: Corral Creek Vineyard, Points: 92.0, Price: 44.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Chehalem 2005 Corral Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Chehalem, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: US, Description: Held back longer than most Chardonnays, this single-vineyard wine is beginning to pick up bottle complexity. It's a connoisseur's wine, not dazzlingly rich and sweet, but dry, acidic and minerally, with lemon and orange citrus fruit flavors. You have to appreciate subtlety to like this artisanal wine. Should evolve in interesting ways over the next six years., Designation: Sonoma Stage Vineyard, Points: 91.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Peters Family 2007 Sonoma Stage Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Peters Family, Region: Sonoma Coast, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Sonoma Coast, Style3: Chardonnay - Sonoma Coast Country: US, Description: The producer's Russian River Valley fruit comes from the Winside Vineyard, planted long ago by Anne Moller-Racke and Joe Nugent. It astounds in this must-have wine, complex and ridiculously velvety in texture. Pepper, clove and cardamom ride huge waves of baked fruit and mocha, with the structure to age through at least 2026, but why wait when it's so delicious now?, Designation: Single Vineyard, Points: 95.0, Price: 72.0, Province: California, Title: Donum 2013 Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Donum, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley Country: Greece, Description: This single-vineyard Agiorgitiko has an earthy olive nose and smooth, integrated flavors of red berry, herbs and spice. Soft but structured tannins and a spin of spice on the finish recommend it for heartier dishes, but it's good enough to savor on its own. Elegant, but with some muscle., Designation: Old Vines Single Vineyard, Points: 88.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Nemea, Title: Papaioannou 2003 Old Vines Single Vineyard Agiorgitiko (Nemea), Variety: Agiorgitiko, Winery: Papaioannou, Region: Nemea, Style1: Agiorgitiko - Nemea, Style2: Agiorgitiko - Nemea, Style3: Agiorgitiko - Greece Country: US, Description: Winemaker Isabelle Meunier (ex-Evening Land) has carefully selected a handful of sites for her first release of single-vineyard wines under this new label. This is perhaps the most elegant, with exceptional texture, color and overall finesse. Fruits are delicate and detailed, showing watermelon, salmonberry, strawberry and a bit of spice. The 30% new French oak aging adds a gentle kiss of cocoa. Drink now to 2030 and beyond., Designation: Tualatin Estate, Points: 92.0, Price: 65.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Lavinea 2014 Tualatin Estate Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Lavinea, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: US, Description: This single-vineyard selection from the Jackson Family's Santa Maria Valley winery kicks off with scents ranging from red, blistered tomato to pomegranate reduction and mole sauce. On the palate, flavors vary from sweeter berry to tart cherry, with a savory, roasted pork element rounding out the wine., Designation: Julia's Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled, Points: 91.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Cambria 2012 Julia's Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Cambria, Region: Santa Maria Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Santa Maria Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Santa Maria Valley Country: US, Description: This winery expertly differentiates its single-vineyard bottlings, here exploring the warmer, riper side of the grape, but with style and grace. Aromas of vanilla, sea-salt caramel, macadamia nut and hazelnut lead into a palate where lightly buttered yellow apples meet with jasmine tea, honeysuckle and a light touch of marzipan., Designation: Sierra Mar Vineyard, Points: 94.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Bernardus 2014 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Bernardus, Region: Santa Lucia Highlands, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Santa Lucia Highlands, Style3: Chardonnay - Santa Lucia Highlands"

column1: Suggest a wine from a winery known for its historic practices.,"
column3: Description

column2: Jean-Luc Baldès 2006 Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine Malbec (Cahors)
column3: A medieval method of making Cahors, known as the black wine, with flavors of stewed prunes allied to intense, dry tannins. Red berries add freshness, but this is more jelly, cooked fruits and darkness.

column2: Dão Sul 2012 Casa de Santar Red (Dão)
column3: A structured, mineral, dark in character and firm in tannins wine from one of the oldest estates in the Dão region. Rich black fruits are waiting to burst out, bringing with them ripeness and balanced acidity.

column2: Sanctuary 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
column3: A wine that shows bright strawberry and raspberry with touch of savory wood smoke as well as hibiscus-laced pastry and a pinch of thyme. Earthy sagebrush and wild herb flavors frame the palate, where cooked cherries and cranberries are spiced by cardamom and dried ginger spice.
A wine that evokes the storied traditions of Piemontese winemaking. Exhibits bright berry aromas with raw tones of raspberries and white cherries.

A dry well-balanced Zin from a vineyard originally planted in 1869. Medium bodied, nicely structured with firm tannins and has aromatic complexity from cedar, tobacco and cardamom notes, plus delicious just-ripe cherry flavors.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Winemaker Dennis Martin puts grape grower Stephen Miller's signature on this wine, a nod to the importance of this historic vineyard. The wine shows bright strawberry and raspberry with touch of savory wood smoke as well as hibiscus-laced pastry and a pinch of thyme. Earthy sagebrush and wild herb flavors frame the palate, where cooked cherries and cranberries are spiced by cardamom and dried ginger spice., Designation: Bien Nacido Vineyard, Points: 93.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Sanctuary 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Sanctuary, Region: Santa Maria Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Santa Maria Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Santa Maria Valley Country: Portugal, Description: The historic Santar estate is one of the oldest in the Dão region. The estate wine is structured, mineral, dark in character and firm in tannins. At the same time, rich black fruits are waiting to burst out, bringing with them ripeness and balanced acidity. It's a serious wine for aging; drink from 2018., Designation: Casa de Santar, Points: 90.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Dão, Title: Dão Sul 2012 Casa de Santar Red (Dão), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Dão Sul, Region: Dão, Style1: Portuguese Red - Dão, Style2: Portuguese Red - Dão, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: Earthy aromas of juniper and forest floor give depth to the rusty cherry, tart cranberry, dried hibiscus and pepper-dust scents on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. Soft in structure at first, it then delivers a firmer tannic edge in the midpalate, all the while delivering vivacious red fruit and pine-forest flavors. It will age very well., Designation: Sanford & Benedict Vineyard, Points: 92.0, Price: 70.0, Province: California, Title: Sanford 2014 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Sanford, Region: Sta. Rita Hills, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Sta. Rita Hills, Style3: Pinot Noir - Sta. Rita Hills Country: Italy, Description: Tradizione, as the name suggests, does evoke the storied traditions of Piemontese winemaking. Aged in Slavonian oak casks (instead of French barrique) the wine exhibits bright berry aromas with raw tones of raspberries and white cherries., Designation: Tradizione, Points: 87.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: Tre Donne 2006 Tradizione  (Barbera d'Alba), Variety: Barbera, Winery: Tre Donne, Region: Barbera d'Alba, Style1: Barbera - Piedmont, Style2: Barbera - Piedmont, Style3: Barbera - Italy Country: US, Description: The color—a rather light garnet going to brownish—suggests an older wine or one made with rustic methods, and the flavors travel the same path. An earthy quality shades modest cherry flavors, while hints of clove and cinnamon add complexity., Designation: Estate, Points: 83.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Toulouse 2011 Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Toulouse, Region: Anderson Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Anderson Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Anderson Valley Country: Portugal, Description: The historic vineyard of Casa de Santar in the heart of the Dão region has produced a dense and powerful offering, with rich tannins and black fruits. Its intense, solid blackberry and spice flavors are followed by acidity, contributing complexity. Age for at least four years., Designation: Casa de Santar Reserva, Points: 93.0, Price: 27.0, Province: Dão, Title: Dão Sul 2008 Casa de Santar Reserva Red (Dão), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Dão Sul, Region: Dão, Style1: Portuguese Red - Dão, Style2: Portuguese Red - Dão, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: US, Description: The historic Pritchard Hill producer swings for the fences with this Cab, intense in black cherry, blackberry and cedar. Hard to penetrate on first try, it demands cellaring to soften its wall of hearty tannins, the merest hint of chocolate-coffee begging to break out. Lushly powerful and complex, it can be enjoyed through 2027., Designation: Signature, Points: 91.0, Price: 56.0, Province: California, Title: Chappellet 2012 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Chappellet, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley Country: Argentina, Description: A rich yellow color and intensely woody aromas of sawmill smoke and barrel spice lead to a fleshy, full and oily palate. This wine tastes heavily of oak and related resin. The fruit character is not a big factor on either the palate or the finish., Designation: Alta Historic Rows, Points: 88.0, Price: 33.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Bodega Catena Zapata 2015 Alta Historic Rows Chardonnay (Mendoza), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Bodega Catena Zapata, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Chardonnay - Mendoza Province, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendoza Province, Style3: Chardonnay - Argentina Country: France, Description: By heating part of the must before vinification, Jean-Luc Baldès has revived the medieval way of making Cahors, when it was know as the black wine. It gives, literally, black colored wine, with flavors of stewed prunes allied to intense, dry tannins. Red berries add freshness, but this is more jelly, cooked fruits and darkness., Designation: Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine, Points: 94.0, Price: unknown, Province: Southwest France, Title: Jean-Luc Baldès 2006 Clos Triguedina The New Black Wine Malbec (Cahors), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Jean-Luc Baldès, Region: Cahors, Style1: Malbec - Southwest France, Style2: Malbec - Southwest France, Style3: Malbec - France Country: US, Description: This is a great example of a dry well-balanced Zin to drink with dinner rather than as a sweet dessert. It's also a taste of history, coming from a vineyard originally planted in 1869. It's medium bodied, nicely structured with firm tannins and has aromatic complexity from cedar, tobacco and cardamom notes, plus delicious just-ripe cherry flavors., Designation: Vineyard 1869, Points: 93.0, Price: 48.0, Province: California, Title: Scott Harvey 2014 Vineyard 1869 Zinfandel (Amador County), Variety: Zinfandel, Winery: Scott Harvey, Region: Amador, Style1: Zinfandel - California, Style2: Zinfandel - Amador, Style3: Zinfandel - Amador Country: US, Description: There's something old-fashioned about this wine, in its strong, edgy tannins and rustic mouthfeel. Yet it's high and hot in alcohol, with extracted, jammy cherry and raisin flavors. Doesn't seem to be an ager, so drink now., Designation: Argos Hill, Points: 85.0, Price: 44.0, Province: California, Title: Dutch Henry Winery 2005 Argos Hill Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Dutch Henry Winery, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: France, Description: In Cahors Tradition means a wine that doesn't go into barrels for aging. That keeps the fruit vibrant and crisp, as it is here. The wine is ripe, full in the mouth with fruit tannins and black-currant acidity. It is a year away from maturity, so drink from 2017., Designation: Tradition, Points: 88.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Château Eugénie 2014 Tradition Malbec-Merlot (Cahors), Variety: Malbec-Merlot, Winery: Château Eugénie, Region: Cahors, Style1: Malbec-Merlot - Southwest France, Style2: Malbec-Merlot - Southwest France, Style3: Malbec-Merlot - France Country: Italy, Description: Packaged in a beautifully unique glass bottle, this collector's wine from southern Italy offers balance, intensity and cleanly etched aromas of black fruit, resin, cola, rum cake, dried violets and tobacco. The finish is elegant, polished and lingers long on the palate thanks to the drying tannins., Designation: Naturalis Historia, Points: 92.0, Price: unknown, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Mastroberardino 2005 Naturalis Historia  (Taurasi), Variety: Aglianico, Winery: Mastroberardino, Region: Taurasi, Style1: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style2: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style3: Aglianico - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: From vineyards owned by the Van Zeller family in the narrow valley of the Torto River, this serious powerful wine is a mere baby. It was produced in open-stone fermenters with traditional foot treading and that gives the wine its extra opulence and richness. Tannins and immense black fruit are still developing. Save this bottle until 2020., Designation: CV Curriculum Vitae, Points: 95.0, Price: 101.0, Province: Douro, Title: Quinta Vale Dona Maria 2013 CV Curriculum Vitae Red (Douro), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Quinta Vale Dona Maria, Region: Douro, Style1: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style2: Portuguese Red - Douro, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: France, Description: Not just old vines, but ancient vines, this is a juicy, concentrated and ripe wine. It is sufficiently rich and textured to need some aging to bring out the full fruits even more. Drink from 2014., Designation: Anciennes Vignes, Points: 89.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Patient Cottat 2012 Anciennes Vignes  (Menetou-Salon), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Patient Cottat, Region: Menetou-Salon, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France"

column1: I'm interested in a wine from the Champagne region.,"
column3: Description
A taut, mineral wine with a dominance of Chardonnay. Crisp citrus and a very textured feel. Worth aging for 3–4 years.
An impressive blend of three vintages with both crisp fruit and maturity from bottle aging. Ripe with sliced apple fruit and plenty of citrus.
A 50-50 blend of Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay. Rich, with good spice and flavor concentration. Dry and crisp, with ripe grapes, acidity and citrus flavors.

column2: Charles Orban NV Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Champagne)
column3: Made entirely from red grapes, this wine has good richness, acidity, and flavors of red plums and berries.

column2: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne)
column3: A crisp, tight, mineral character balanced by the crisp apple flavor and fresh acidity. Quite ready to drink.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: A taut, mineral wine with a domiNAce of Chardonnay to give the crispest citrus and a very textured feel. Definitely dry, the wine, not from a classic vintage year, seems still young and all fruit, so it would be worth aging for 3–4 years., Designation: Millésime Brut, Points: 90.0, Price: 51.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Charles Ellner 2001 Millésime Brut  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Charles Ellner, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: A blend of three vintages, this impressive wine from the southern Champagne vineyards of the Aube has both crisp fruit and maturity from bottle aging. It's ripe with sliced apple fruit and plenty of citrus. Drink now., Designation: Esprit Grand Cru, Points: 93.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Grand Cru  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Baron-Fuenté, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: A 50-50 blend of Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay from the Marne Valley gives this wood-aged wine richness, with good spice and flavor concentration. Dry and crisp, it benefits from the fine vintage to highlight ripe grapes with acidity and citrus flavors. The wine is ready to drink., Designation: Sublimité 50/50, Points: 92.0, Price: 95.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Dom Caudron 2008 Sublimité 50/50  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Dom Caudron, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: This small producer in the Marne Valley boasts 15 acres of vines. This Blanc de Noirs, made entirely from red grapes, has the good richness, allied with acidity, that turns it into an excellent food wine. Flavors of red plums and berries are boosted with toastiness., Designation: Blanc de Noirs Brut, Points: 87.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Charles Orban NV Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Charles Orban, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: Grapes from Grand Cru vineyards on the Montagne de Reims and Côte des Blancs go into this elegant wine. A crisp, tight, mineral character is balanced by the crisp apple flavor and fresh acidity. This bottling has some age so is quite ready to drink., Designation: Esprit Grand Cru Brut, Points: 92.0, Price: 100.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Baron-Fuenté NV Esprit Grand Cru Brut  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Baron-Fuenté, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: From vines on the Montagne de Reims, this Chardonnay-dominated Champagne has a ripe texture that contrasts with the mineral character of the Côte des Blancs across the valley. That gives a rich, apple- and white fruit-inflected flavor to this attractive nonvintage cuvée. Drink now., Designation: Brut, Points: 89.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Jacques Picard NV Brut  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Jacques Picard, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: A blend of Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier, this is a rich Champagne. It has layers of red currant fruits and intense acidity. There is some toast coming through as this wine has aged., Designation: Fleur Noir Blanc de Noirs Brut, Points: 89.0, Price: 59.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Beaumont des Crayères 2003 Fleur Noir Blanc de Noirs Brut  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Beaumont des Crayères, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: The wine in this 100% Pinot Noir comes from one of the top villages in the Montagne de Reims. It is rich, structured and with a youthful character despite its nine years . It has berry and rich plum fruits as well as a dry core of acidity. Drink this ageworthy Champagne from 2019., Designation: RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Noirs Grand Cru Brut, Points: 93.0, Price: 75.0, Province: Champagne, Title: G. H. Mumm 2008 RSRV Maison Mumm Blanc de Noirs Grand Cru Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: G. H. Mumm, Region: Champagne, Style1: Pinot Noir - Champagne, Style2: Pinot Noir - Champagne, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: France, Description: With the dominance of Pinot Noir in the Aube region, it is no surprise to find a vintage Champagne that is 100% from that grape. With a round character from the Pinot, as well as a hot vintage, this is a full-bodied wine with vibrant fruit and lively acidity. Drink now., Designation: Blanc de Noirs Millésime Brut, Points: 91.0, Price: 100.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Jean Laurent 2003 Blanc de Noirs Millésime Brut Pinot Noir (Champagne), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Jean Laurent, Region: Champagne, Style1: Pinot Noir - Champagne, Style2: Pinot Noir - Champagne, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: France, Description: Produced in the Aube region, this ripe full wine is rich and generous. With apple and pear fruitiness and a smooth creamy mousse, the wine has just the right amount of bottle aging. Drink now., Designation: L'Eloquente Brut, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Jean de la Fontaine NV L'Eloquente Brut  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Jean de la Fontaine, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: Tight, textured wine with delicious green apple and mineral character. The wine has some softness, but is more dominated by a fine steel core of acidity. It could age well., Designation: Millésime Brut, Points: 90.0, Price: 59.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Philippe Prié 2002 Millésime Brut  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Philippe Prié, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: Named after the daughter of the house, this wine comes from old Chardonnay vines on the Montagne de Reims. The palate is full of apple and citrus flavors, along with a rich apricot note. It has weight and richness to balance intense minerality. A deliciously full wine, it is ready to drink now but will continue to improve through 2022., Designation: Marie-Amélie Blanc de Blancs Fleur de Vigne Brut, Points: 93.0, Price: unknown, Province: Champagne, Title: Henriet-Bazin 2008 Marie-Amélie Blanc de Blancs Fleur de Vigne Brut Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Henriet-Bazin, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: A rich Champagne produced from Montagne de Reims Pinot Noir vineyards, this is full and textured, hinting at red currants as well as tight citrus acidity. It is full of fruitiness, a ripe wine that is very drinkable now., Designation: Extra Brut Premier Cru Blanc de Noirs, Points: 90.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Lombard et Cie NV Extra Brut Premier Cru Blanc de Noirs Pinot Noir (Champagne), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Lombard et Cie, Region: Champagne, Style1: Pinot Noir - Champagne, Style2: Pinot Noir - Champagne, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: France, Description: This is a ripe and creamy wine from the great 2008 vintage. Tight acidity and lively citrus are balanced by a more serious richness and texture. The wine, bringing all three of the main Champagne grapes together, is still maturing. Wait until 2018., Designation: Vintage Brut, Points: 93.0, Price: 60.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Pannier 2008 Vintage Brut  (Champagne), Variety: Champagne Blend, Winery: Pannier, Region: Champagne, Style1: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style2: Champagne Blend - Champagne, Style3: Champagne Blend - France Country: France, Description: A ripe and opulent Champagne with intense white and yellow fruit flavors. The wine is full bodied, with just a touch of toast to show approaching maturity. This is a wonderfully open and generous wine., Designation: Les Chétillons Blanc de Blancs, Points: 93.0, Price: unknown, Province: Champagne, Title: Pierre Péters 2005 Les Chétillons Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Pierre Péters, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France"

column1: Can you suggest a wine from Australia?,"
column3: Description
Subtly smoky, hints of lime and vanilla, plump and slightly creamy in texture, finishes with crisp, acidic verve.
Medium- to full-bodied Shiraz with a blend of cherry and plum flavors, savory elements of mocha and roasted meat.

column2: D'Arenberg 2009 The Money Spider Roussanne (McLaren Vale)
column3: Modest aromas of struck flint and pear, flavors are reminiscent of buttery, honeyed pears, yet stay tart from start to finish.
An appealing, well-crafted wine that combines leather, cherry and dried herbs in a somewhat lean, crisp style.
Very dry Riesling, with strong lime and a fresh herbal flavors, finishes medium-long with grapefruit and putty flavors.
column9: ,Country: Australia, Description: It's a shame only the equivalent of one barrel of this wine was exported to the U.S., as it means only a handful of people here will get to experience it. It's perhaps the closest thing to great white Burgundy to come from Australia; subtly smoky at first, like grilled white peaches, adding hints of lime and vanilla on the palate. It's plump and slightly creamy in texture, but finishes with crisp, acidic verve. Drink now–2025., Designation: Kevin John, Points: 94.0, Price: 109.0, Province: Western Australia, Title: Cullen 2013 Kevin John Chardonnay (Margaret River), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Cullen, Region: Margaret River, Style1: Chardonnay - Western Australia, Style2: Chardonnay - Western Australia, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: This South Eastern Australia Chard packs quite a punch for the price. The nose is fresh but subtle, with hints of hand soap and cut apples. There's a luxurious quality to the palate that melds well with flavors of almond and pear and carries over to the silky, medium finish. Winds up on a note of tropical fruit. Drink now through 2011., Designation: Estate Range, Points: 86.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Australia Other, Title: Beelgara 2008 Estate Range Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Beelgara, Region: South Eastern Australia, Style1: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style2: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Representative of the solid values that may be found from Australia for about $20, this medium- to full-bodied Shiraz offers a blend of cherry and plum flavors, with savory elements of mocha and roasted meat. It's slightly dusty on the finish, making it food-friendly, ending with hints of cocoa and coffee. Drink now–2018., Designation: Catapult, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Wirra Wirra 2012 Catapult Shiraz (McLaren Vale), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Wirra Wirra, Region: McLaren Vale, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Hints of lemon curd and crème brûlée join peach and citrus, finishing with a surprising degree of elegance. Drink up., Designation: Stamp of Australia, Points: 85.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Australia Other, Title: Hardys 2014 Stamp of Australia Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Hardys, Region: South Eastern Australia, Style1: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style2: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Round and lush, with boldly oaky notes of caramelized nuts and vanilla accenting tropical fruit. Drink now., Designation: Reserve, Points: 87.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Australia Other, Title: Yellow Tail 2009 Reserve Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Yellow Tail, Region: South Eastern Australia, Style1: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style2: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Slightly smoky grilled-toast aromas lead into a plump medium-bodied wine filled with flavors of yellow plum, tangerine and lime. It's not particularly zesty or linear in a true cool-climate fashion, but steers clear of ripe tropical fruit, ending on a gentle note of citrus pith. Drink now., Designation: Cool Climate, Points: 87.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Australia Other, Title: McWilliam's 2014 Cool Climate Chardonnay (Australia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: McWilliam's, Region: Australia, Style1: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style2: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Deep golden straw in color, with modest aromas of struck flint and pear. The flavors are reminiscent of buttery, honeyed pears, yet stay tart from start to finish. Perplexing., Designation: The Money Spider, Points: 83.0, Price: 25.0, Province: South Australia, Title: D'Arenberg 2009 The Money Spider Roussanne (McLaren Vale), Variety: Roussanne, Winery: D'Arenberg, Region: McLaren Vale, Style1: Roussanne - South Australia, Style2: Roussanne - South Australia, Style3: Roussanne - Australia Country: Australia, Description: One of Australia's most expensive and sought-after Cabernet blends, Mount Mary's Quintet has failed to impress more than one American critic. It's an appealing, well-crafted wine that combines leather, cherry and dried herbs in a somewhat lean, crisp style that delivers a long, mineral-and-cedar finish., Designation: Quintet, Points: 89.0, Price: 145.0, Province: Victoria, Title: Mount Mary 2004 Quintet Red (Yarra Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Mount Mary, Region: Yarra Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Victoria, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Victoria, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Fits the big-production Aussie recipe to a T, blending tropical fruit, vanilla, apple and citrus flavors. It's just a little lighter than expected and finishes short., Designation: Diamond Label, Points: 84.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Australia Other, Title: Rosemount 2001 Diamond Label Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Rosemount, Region: South Eastern Australia, Style1: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style2: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Deceptively silky and elegant in texture, so much so that its power is easy to overlook. Cassis and tobacco flavors are typical, framed by touches of brown sugar, while the finish turns a bit lean and herbal, with tea-like tannins. 70% Cab Sauvignon, 25% Cab Franc, 5% Merlot., Designation: Gaia, Points: 90.0, Price: 52.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Grosset 2004 Gaia Red (Clare Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Grosset, Region: Clare Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Australia, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Australia, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Australia Country: Australia, Description: An honest and very ripe take on Australian Chardonnay, with opulent notes of fig, pineapple and guava underscored by crisp lemon and a faint spritz that refresh the palate. The short-to-medium finish turns a bit soft. Quite likable on the whole. Try with lobster., Designation: Unwooded, Points: 85.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Western Australia, Title: West Cape Howe 2008 Unwooded Chardonnay (Western Australia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: West Cape Howe, Region: Western Australia, Style1: Chardonnay - Western Australia, Style2: Chardonnay - Western Australia, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: A sleek name and a sleek wine. Vanilla and toffee overflow from the effusive nose while sour candy and plum jam take over on the palate. It's a tad thin in the mouth but finishes on a lovely raspberry note that has just a bit of sticking power. Drink as the Australians do, with Christmas dinner. Sparkling Shiraz may not be something you pour every day, but this is one worth reaching for. It delivers lots of upfront berry fruit and lashings of dark chocolate, then finishes relatively dry and clean., Designation: Black Bubbles Sparkling, Points: 86.0, Price: 25.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Shingleback NV Black Bubbles Sparkling Shiraz (McLaren Vale), Variety: Shiraz, Winery: Shingleback, Region: McLaren Vale, Style1: Shiraz - South Australia, Style2: Shiraz - South Australia, Style3: Shiraz - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Whether you ask me, God, or the lamp post, anyone who's ever had Australian Riesling will count this among the country's best versions of the variety. On the nose, it yields a little sweetness, plus some grapefruit and passion fruit; after a few minutes in the glass, the passion fruit aromas hold on and are joined by kiwi and other fresh tropical fruit. It's a very dry Riesling, with strong lime and a fresh herbal (perhaps cilantro?) flavors, which makes the mineral foundation seem that much drier and racier. Finishes medium-long with grapefruit and putty flavors. An excellent food wine…or an excellent  last meal in itself., Designation: Polish Hill, Points: 91.0, Price: 30.0, Province: South Australia, Title: Grosset 2002 Polish Hill Riesling (Clare Valley), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Grosset, Region: Clare Valley, Style1: Riesling - South Australia, Style2: Riesling - South Australia, Style3: Riesling - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Muted on the nose, with flavors of apple and white gumdrops, and finishing with hints of butter and anise., Designation: Peace Family Vineyard, Points: 81.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Australia Other, Title: Andrew Peace 2006 Peace Family Vineyard Chardonnay (South Eastern Australia), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Andrew Peace, Region: South Eastern Australia, Style1: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style2: Chardonnay - Australia Other, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia Country: Australia, Description: Focused in the mouth with just a touch of creaminess, the Logan offers pear and nutmeg flavors, and a hint of green apple on the finish. It's not a mouthfilling, overly flashy wine, but this could be a good thing if you're pouring it with dinner. Try it with your first-course seafood dish., Designation: Reserve, Points: 86.0, Price: 21.0, Province: New South Wales, Title: Logan Australia 1999 Reserve Chardonnay (Orange), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Logan Australia, Region: Orange, Style1: Chardonnay - New South Wales, Style2: Chardonnay - New South Wales, Style3: Chardonnay - Australia"

column1: I'm interested in a wine from the Bordeaux region.,"
column3: Description

column2: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Carrelet d'Estuaire Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé)
column3: Bright red fruits give it a crisp character, packed with acidity and lively fruitiness. Great summer apéritif wine.
A very dry, firm wine, with some chocolate extract flavors and signs of wood aging, balanced by stalky black currant fruits.
A solid wine with firm tannins, this has structure as well as black-currant acidity. Potential to be a ripe fruity wine from early 2018.
A wine that is friendly, accessible, without losing the essential dry tannins and fresh black currant flavors typical of the region.

column2: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Murets de Mez  (Bordeaux)
column3: An exceptional value for a Bordeaux, this is ripe, full and fruity. Smoky tannins and juicy black currant flavors are bright and generous.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: Pay attention to the Tutiac winemakers north of Bordeaux, who have produced another good wine. Bright red fruits give it a crisp character, packed with acidity and lively fruitiness. It's a great summer apéritif wine. Drink now., Designation: Carrelet d'Estuaire, Points: 87.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Vignerons de Tutiac 2016 Carrelet d'Estuaire Rosé (Bordeaux Rosé), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Vignerons de Tutiac, Region: Bordeaux Rosé, Style1: Rosé - Bordeaux, Style2: Rosé - Bordeaux, Style3: Rosé - France Country: France, Description: A very dry, firm wine, with some chocolate extract flavors and signs of wood aging, both balanced by stalky black currant fruits. It is hard at present, so give it until 2014., Designation: Grande Réserve, Points: 86.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château le Breton 2012 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château le Breton, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: A solid wine with firm tannins, this has structure as well as black-currant acidity. It still has a dry core although this will certainly soften over the next few months. It has the potential to be a ripe fruity wine from early 2018., Designation: Bordeaux By Boyd-Cantenac, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Maison Bouey 2015 Bordeaux By Boyd-Cantenac  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Maison Bouey, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: A wine that aims to bring out the casual side of Bordeaux, this is friendly, accessible, without losing the essential dry tannins and fresh black currant flavors typical of the region. If only all branded Bordeaux was like this., Designation: Jacques Sans Souci, Points: 88.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Barrière Frères 2006 Jacques Sans Souci  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Barrière Frères, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: An exceptional value for a Bordeaux, this is ripe, full and fruity. Smoky tannins and juicy black currant flavors are bright and generous. It will be ready to drink from 2016., Designation: Murets de Mez, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Cave du Marmandais 2014 Murets de Mez  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Cave du Marmandais, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: Dry and serious, this firm wine is classic Bordeaux. It has weight, a core of tannins and black currant fruitiness that needs time to fully integrate with the dense structure. Give this exemplary wine another five years., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 91.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Landat 2011 Vieilles Vignes  (Haut-Médoc), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Landat, Region: Haut-Médoc, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: Calling a wine romantic is perhaps a new approach for Bordeaux. The wine itself is ripe and jammy, with wood tannins that will be softer in a year. Drink from 2016., Designation: Romantique, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur 2012 Romantique  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Les Vignerons Réunis de Monségur, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: A wine that offers plenty of the charm of Margaux, with its soft tannins, layers of chocolate, smooth texture and juicy fruit. The wood at this stage is prominent, and needs to settle down., Designation: Thomas Barton Réserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Barton & Guestier 2007 Thomas Barton Réserve  (Margaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Barton & Guestier, Region: Margaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: This Bordeaux-style wine is ripe and rich, balance between dusty tannins and stalky red fruits. Acidity and an attractive generous texture give it shape. It is ready to drink., Designation: Domaine de Brazalem, Points: 85.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Vignerons de Buzet 2011 Domaine de Brazalem Red (Buzet), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Vignerons de Buzet, Region: Buzet, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Southwest France, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Southwest France, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: Despite coming from a universally hailed vintage, this generic Bordeaux is still weedy, herbal and lean. But it also has decent cassis and cherry fruit, some tasty vanilla and cinnamon notes from oak aging, and a tart, dry finish. It's light, but it hasn't been dumbed down for the mass market., Designation: Rouge, Points: 85.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Malesan 2000 Rouge  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Malesan, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: Red currant and red berry fruits show strongly in this wine from Virginie Aubrion's biodynamic vineyards. The tannins are strong, although leaving space for the fruitiness. It needs to develop, with good acidity likely to come through. Drink from 2016., Designation: Cuvée Prestige, Points: 85.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château de Piote 2013 Cuvée Prestige  (Bordeaux Supérieur), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château de Piote, Region: Bordeaux Supérieur, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: Rich, wood-aged wine that shows ripe blackberry juice flavors to balance the firm tannins. It has good depth, structure and weight, a ripe and good value Bordeaux., Designation: Vieilles VIgnes, Points: 86.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Saintongey 2010 Vieilles VIgnes  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Saintongey, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: This is the blended Bordeaux from Calvet, one of the oldest wine names in the city. It's full and ripe, a rounded wine that has good berry fruits as well as a drier, firmer core. At the end, a more smoky character appears., Designation: Réserve, Points: 86.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Calvet 2010 Réserve  (Bordeaux), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Calvet, Region: Bordeaux, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: The wine has some extraction that leaves a bitter edge. That needs to blow off to allow the underlying ripe blackberry fruit to come through. So wait until 2018., Designation: Grande Réserve, Points: 87.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Labatut 2015 Grande Réserve  (Bordeaux Supérieur), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Labatut, Region: Bordeaux Supérieur, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: One of a range of wines produced by the Bordeaux-based Despagne family, this is a blend of Bordeaux grape varieties. It's attractive and fruity, with crisp red currant notes and a refreshing layer of acidity. Drink now., Designation: Le Mythe d'Amphorie, Points: 87.0, Price: 20.0, Province: France Other, Title: Vignobles Despagne 2016 Le Mythe d'Amphorie Rosé (Vin de France), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Vignobles Despagne, Region: Vin de France, Style1: Rosé - France Other, Style2: Rosé - France Other, Style3: Rosé - France"

column1: What would be a good wine for a dinner party?,"
column3: Description
A fine wine for dinner parties and important family reunions, this bright Barolo exudes elegance and finesse thanks to its delicate aromas of blue flower, dried lavender, cassis and forest berry.

column2: Domaine Schoffit 2014 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace)
column3: Green pear and soft citrus are the chief charms of this wine. The palate is clean, dry and easy to drink.
For the price, this is a great wine for a party or an everyday dinner. It's soft, easy to drink and rich enough in cherry, berry and oak flavors to satisfy Cabernet lovers.
Good color, and the kind of flavor that many countries would kill for in so inexpensive a wine. It's ripely fruity, with firm tannins and dry acidity.
Bounteous fruit flavors need a little air to wake up but soon you'll have a party in your glass of ripe yellow plums, freshly cut apples, pears and melons.
column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: A fine wine for dinner parties and important family reunions, this bright Barolo exudes elegance and finesse thanks to its delicate aromas of blue flower, dried lavender, cassis and forest berry. The wine is sheer and smooth with taut firmness on the close., Designation: Vigna Lazzairasco, Points: 92.0, Price: 44.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: Guido Porro 2007 Vigna Lazzairasco  (Barolo), Variety: Nebbiolo, Winery: Guido Porro, Region: Barolo, Style1: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style2: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style3: Nebbiolo - Italy Country: France, Description: Green pear and soft citrus are the chief charms of this wine. The palate is clean, dry and easy to drink. It's a good all-rounder for a party., Designation: Vieilles Vignes, Points: 87.0, Price: 21.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Schoffit 2014 Vieilles Vignes Pinot Auxerrois (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Auxerrois, Winery: Domaine Schoffit, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Auxerrois - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Auxerrois - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Auxerrois - France Country: US, Description: For the price, this is a great wine for a party or an everyday dinner. It's soft, easy to drink and rich enough in cherry, berry and oak flavors to satisfy Cabernet lovers. And it's easy to find, with 10,000 cases produced., Designation: Reserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 11.0, Province: California, Title: Dante 2010 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Dante, Region: California, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - California Country: US, Description: Good color, and the kind of flavor that many countries would kill for in so inexpensive a wine. It's ripely fruity, with firm tannins and dry acidity. Well-rounded and supple, this is an excellent value in an elegant dinner wine. —S.H., Designation: Valley Oaks, Points: 86.0, Price: 9.0, Province: California, Title: Fetzer 1999 Valley Oaks Syrah (California), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Fetzer, Region: California, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - California, Style3: Syrah - California Country: France, Description: An attractive wine. The Chardonnay is fresh, lightly mineral, with flavors of red apples, lemon zest and crisp acidity. A great party wine., Designation: Cuvée Réservée Brut, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: France Other, Title: Barton & Guestier NV Cuvée Réservée Brut Chardonnay (Vin Mousseux), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Barton & Guestier, Region: Vin Mousseux, Style1: Chardonnay - France Other, Style2: Chardonnay - France Other, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: US, Description: This blend of 35% Merlot, 35% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Petite Sirah is actually a party of three, but the results are solid. Chocolate, black cherries, scarlet rose buds and toasted oak pop on the nose. The smooth and dense palate shows boysenberry, black pepper and a chalky tannic structure., Designation: Party of Four, Points: 90.0, Price: 45.0, Province: California, Title: HammerSky 2013 Party of Four Red (Paso Robles), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: HammerSky, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles Country: France, Description: The nose gives little away but the palate holds red, rounded fruit diffused by frothy, lively fizz. The foamy bubbles spell exuberance and easy-drinking enjoyment. Dry, light and rounded, this is a perfect party wine in a most appealing shade of coppery pink., Designation: Rosé, Points: 89.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Ruhlmann NV Rosé Sparkling (Crémant d'Alsace), Variety: Sparkling Blend, Winery: Ruhlmann, Region: Crémant d'Alsace, Style1: Sparkling Blend - Alsace, Style2: Sparkling Blend - Alsace, Style3: Sparkling Blend - France Country: US, Description: Jolly Rancher-red in color, there's high-toned grapefruit and watermelon in this Rosé. Layers of tropical juiciness on the back of the tongue and a nice finish make this a refreshing wine before, during or after dinner., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 87.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Festival and Feast 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Festival and Feast, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Sonoma, Style3: Pinot Noir - Sonoma Country: US, Description: Way too sweet and soft to qualify as a dry table wine. Okay for big parties where everyone's drinking happily from paper cups., Designation: Split Oak Estates, Points: 81.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: Morro Bay 2009 Split Oak Estates Cabernet Sauvignon (California), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Morro Bay, Region: California, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - California Country: France, Description: Bounteous fruit flavors need a little air to wake up but soon you'll have a party in your glass of ripe yellow plums, freshly cut apples, pears and melons. This is easy and very fruit-driven, balanced, light and just the ticket for a party in the sunshine., Designation: Tradition, Points: 89.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Alsace, Title: W. Gisselbrecht 2015 Tradition Pinot Blanc (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Blanc, Winery: W. Gisselbrecht, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Blanc - France Country: US, Description: Soft and fruity, this easy-drinking Syrah has pleasant, jammy flavors of raspberries, blackberries, cola, bacon and peppery spices. It's a nice, full-bodied red wine to drink now with party food., Designation: Tribute Series, Points: 85.0, Price: 27.0, Province: California, Title: Ben Hogan 2008 Tribute Series Syrah (Paso Robles), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Ben Hogan, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Syrah - California, Style2: Syrah - Paso Robles, Style3: Syrah - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: This blend of 60% Petit Verdot, 15% Malbec, 15% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon offers a grape-driven nose, boosted by dried black cherry, licorice and baking spice, more playful than brooding. Bright flavors of blackberry and red cherry make for a juicy, tangy wine with decent tannic structure., Designation: Party of Four, Points: 88.0, Price: 49.0, Province: California, Title: HammerSky 2012 Party of Four Red (Paso Robles), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: HammerSky, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: This hearty blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Malbec and Petit Verdot is a great go-to wine for a crowd. Cabernet leads the way with cedar, cranberry and tobacco notes, clipped by sizable tannin. As it opens, layers of dense raspberry and vanilla flavors unfurl., Designation: Mountain Cuvée, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Gundlach Bundschu 2014 Mountain Cuvée Red (Sonoma County), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Gundlach Bundschu, Region: Sonoma, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Sonoma Country: US, Description: This winery produces luxuriously rich wines, and this blend of 47% Merlot, 30% Petit Verdot, 12% Malbec and 11% Cabernet Sauvignon fits right in. Aromas suggest vanilla-cherry cream, fresh cracked dark chocolate, mulberry extract and root beer. Cola, blackberries and woody herbs show once sipped., Designation: Party of Four, Points: 88.0, Price: 59.0, Province: California, Title: HammerSky 2010 Party of Four Red (Paso Robles), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: HammerSky, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: Red Blend - Paso Robles Country: US, Description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Syrah offers appealing, fruit-forward aromas of plum and blackberry. The flavors are direct and fruit filled, providing a lot of enjoyment., Designation: Chicken Dinner, Points: 89.0, Price: 18.0, Province: America, Title: Huston 2015 Chicken Dinner Red (America), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Huston, Region: America, Style1: Red Blend - America, Style2: Red Blend - America, Style3: Red Blend - America"

column1: Are there any white wines known for their mineral or flinty characteristics?,"
column3: Description

column2: Wente 2013 Louis Mel Sauvignon Blanc (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley)
column3: Flinty, mineral-like aromas and flavors lend a complex personality to this compelling, medium-bodied wine. The palate is crisp, dry and citrus-driven.
Touches of flint play subtly on this elegantly restrained wine. A central seam of fresh, mineral acidity also provides an extended finish.

column2: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2016 Vers Cras (Pouilly-Fuissé)
column3: This wine is tight and flinty. Crisp lemon and apple flavors are textured with a steely character that needs time to broaden out.

column2: Cooper-Garrod 2013 Gravel Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
column3: Very much done in a mineral-driven Chablis style, this interesting bottling shows a tremendous amount of flint, crushed rock and struck match on the nose, alongside dried apple and yellow-grapefruit skin.

column2: Château Musar 2005 Gaston Hochar White (Bekaa Valley)
column3: There are dark veins of smoke and flint that highlight the rippling minerality in this fascinating Lebanese white. It's made in a deliberately oxididative style, and it offers a slight baked-apple flavor that slowly opens to reveal fresh citrus and honeysuckle notes.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Flinty, mineral-like aromas and flavors lend a complex personality to this compelling, medium-bodied wine. The palate is crisp, dry and citrus-driven, inviting another sip and begging for some fresh-shucked oysters., Designation: Louis Mel, Points: 90.0, Price: 15.0, Province: California, Title: Wente 2013 Louis Mel Sauvignon Blanc (San Francisco Bay-Livermore Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Wente, Region: Livermore Valley-San Francisco Bay, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Livermore Valley-San Francisco Bay, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Livermore Valley-San Francisco Bay Country: Austria, Description: Touches of flint play subtly on this elegantly restrained wine. A central seam of fresh, mineral acidity also provides an extended finish. This strikes great harmony between a rounded but defined body, streamlined acidity and a mineral background., Designation: Jakobi, Points: 90.0, Price: unknown, Province: Südsteiermark, Title: Gross 2013 Jakobi Sauvignon Blanc (Südsteiermark), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Gross, Region: Südsteiermark, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Südsteiermark, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Südsteiermark, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Austria Country: France, Description: 88-90 A definite mineral character here, with a wine that boasts a taut structure, pushing beyond the metallic edge of the fruit., Designation: Barrel sample, Points: 89.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Romer 2010 Barrel sample  (Sauternes), Variety: Bordeaux-style White Blend, Winery: Château Romer, Region: Sauternes, Style1: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style White Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style White Blend - France Country: France, Description: This wine is tight and flinty. Crisp lemon and apple flavors are textured with a steely character that needs time to broaden out. Drink this mineral wine from 2019., Designation: Vers Cras, Points: 88.0, Price: 28.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud 2016 Vers Cras  (Pouilly-Fuissé), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Pascal et Mireille Renaud, Region: Pouilly-Fuissé, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: The name, referring to the flinty soil of the vineyard, says it all. It is a mineral wine that tastes of stony soil, flint and chalk. It has a great core of hardened steel, very firm, surrounded by intense green fruits, filled with apple juice and grapefruit flavors. For aging over 2–3 years., Designation: Les Chailloux, Points: 93.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Domaine Fouassier 2008 Les Chailloux  (Sancerre), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Domaine Fouassier, Region: Sancerre, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France Country: US, Description: Very much done in a mineral-driven Chablis style, this interesting bottling shows a tremendous amount of flint, crushed rock and struck match on the nose, alongside dried apple and yellow-grapefruit skin. Briny oyster shells and sandstone combine with a touch of smoke on the palate. Serve with shellfish., Designation: Gravel Ridge Vineyard, Points: 90.0, Price: 30.0, Province: California, Title: Cooper-Garrod 2013 Gravel Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Cooper-Garrod, Region: Santa Cruz Mountains, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Santa Cruz Mountains, Style3: Chardonnay - Santa Cruz Mountains Country: Lebanon, Description: There are dark veins of smoke and flint that highlight the rippling minerality in this fascinating Lebanese white. It's made in a deliberately oxididative style, and it offers a slight baked-apple flavor that slowly opens to reveal fresh citrus and honeysuckle notes. It's not for everyone, but it's a fascinating wine to enjoy over a long meal., Designation: Gaston Hochar, Points: 87.0, Price: 41.0, Province: Bekaa Valley, Title: Château Musar 2005 Gaston Hochar White (Bekaa Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Château Musar, Region: Bekaa Valley, Style1: White Blend - Bekaa Valley, Style2: White Blend - Bekaa Valley, Style3: White Blend - Lebanon Country: France, Description: From flinty soil, this wine shows a strongly mineral character and even a smoky edge. It is structured and tight, ripe with yellow fruits as well as citrus. A complex wine, it's impressive and ready to age a few months. Drink from 2017., Designation: Terre de Silex, Points: 91.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Clement et Florian Berthier 2014 Terre de Silex Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Clement et Florian Berthier, Region: Coteaux du Giennois, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France Country: France, Description: The flint and sand soil of this vineyard brings out the minerally, steely character of this taut, tight wine. While it is herbaceous and flavors of pineapple and white fruit, the structure dominates. Give this impressive wine another year or two., Designation: La Chapelle des Augustins, Points: 92.0, Price: 32.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Henri Bourgeois 2010 La Chapelle des Augustins  (Sancerre), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Henri Bourgeois, Region: Sancerre, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France Country: France, Description: Some flinty notes precede earthier, ripe apple notes that also spread across the palate. There is a textured mouthfeel, while a clean seam of lemon crispness counters the earthy fruit. Texture and freshness linger pleasantly., Designation: Rosenberg, Points: 89.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Barmès-Buecher 2014 Rosenberg Pinot Blanc (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Blanc, Winery: Domaine Barmès-Buecher, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Blanc - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Blanc - France Country: France, Description: The flint soil of the vineyard shows in the steely, mineral character of this wine. It is all about structure at this stage, subduing the citrus fruits that are developing. It will fill out over the next few months, so drink from late 2016., Designation: Fernand & Sons, Points: 85.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Thibault 2014 Fernand & Sons Sauvignon Blanc (Coteaux du Giennois), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Thibault, Region: Coteaux du Giennois, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France Country: US, Description: From a site tucked within the eastern hills of the appellation, this is a 100% varietal expression, dark hay in color, sparkling in minerality and sporting a gravelly edge. Stainless steel and one neutral French oak barrel helped ferment and age. Flinty, it shines in lime, peach and pear., Designation: Somerston Vineyard, Points: 92.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Kale 2016 Somerston Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Napa Valley), Variety: Grenache Blanc, Winery: Kale, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Grenache Blanc - California, Style2: Grenache Blanc - Napa Valley, Style3: Grenache Blanc - Napa Valley Country: France, Description: With its highly mineral aroma, this is almost like smelling chalk. It's an austere wine, with high acidity, crystal clear on the palate, full of grapefruit flavors and flint texture. Age this wine at least 4 years., Designation: Blanc de Blancs, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Delamotte NV Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Delamotte, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: US, Description: Flinty and austere, this is an elegant white wine crafted from 100% Musque clone, dancing in pear and grapefruit. The layered texture impressively stands out, riding the wave between creamy and lemony crisp with precision, opening the door for the wine to finish refreshingly., Designation: Samantha's, Points: 92.0, Price: 30.0, Province: California, Title: Lancaster 2013 Samantha's Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Lancaster, Region: Alexander Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Alexander Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Alexander Valley Country: France, Description: Grown on flinty soil, this strongly mineral-driven wine is structured, tense with acidity and white stone-fruit flavors. The initial crispness opens out into a concentrated, textured wine that will need to age further. Drink from late 2017., Designation: Cuvée Silex, Points: 91.0, Price: 38.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: Fournier Père et Fils 2014 Cuvée Silex  (Sancerre), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Fournier Père et Fils, Region: Sancerre, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Loire Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - France"

column1: I'm looking for a white wine that's crisp and has a green apple taste. Any ideas?,"
column3: Description

column2: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo)
column3: A crisp and fresh wine with citrus and green apple fruits. Light, fragrant and ready to drink with bright final acidity.

column2: Bolney Wine Estate 2010 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (England)
column3: Lively, crisp apple notes on the nose with brisk green apple and citrus notes on the palate.
Crisp green-apple aromas, vanilla and soda cracker. The palate is crisp with flavors of apple, saline and minerality.
Fresh and tangy, with citrus aromas, green apple flavors and a nicely tart finish.
A wine that is all about crispness, with its green apple slices, pink grapefruit and lime flavors.
column9: ,Country: Portugal, Description: This crisp and fresh wine suggests citrus and green apple fruits. It is light, fragrant and ready to drink with its bright final acidity., Designation: Terra de Lobos Branco, Points: 84.0, Price: unknown, Province: Tejo, Title: Quinta do Casal Branco 2013 Terra de Lobos Branco White (Tejo), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Quinta do Casal Branco, Region: Tejo, Style1: Portuguese White - Tejo, Style2: Portuguese White - Tejo, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: England, Description: Lively, crisp apple notes on the nose immediately signal freshness. The palate follows with equally brisk green apple and citrus notes, mellowed fittingly with a very fine, soft and creamy mousse. This is lithe, dew-fresh and of great purity. It conjures up visions of clear brooks, green meadows and budding elderflower. The crisp green-apple notes echo long and make for a totally refreshing, brisk finish., Designation: Blanc de Blancs, Points: 91.0, Price: 52.0, Province: England, Title: Bolney Wine Estate 2010 Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (England), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Bolney Wine Estate, Region: England, Style1: Chardonnay - England, Style2: Chardonnay - England, Style3: Chardonnay - England Country: Spain, Description: At its peak now, so you may actually want to wait for the release of the 2010. If not, this wine delivers crisp green-apple aromas, vanilla and soda cracker. The palate is crisp but not assaulting like a splash of battery acid, and the flavors of apple, saline and minerality are true to Txakoli. Finishes like zesty apple cider; drink immediately., Designation: Getaria, Points: 88.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Txomín Etxaníz 2009 Getaria White (Getariako Txakolina), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Txomín Etxaníz, Region: Getariako Txakolina, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Fresh and tangy, with little or no oak influence, this refreshing, crisp white wine will be very versatile with or without food. It has citrus aromas, green apple flavors and a nicely tart finish., Designation: The Beachhouse, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: California, Title: Douglas Green 2013 The Beachhouse Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Douglas Green, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California Country: Portugal, Description: A wine that is all about crispness, with its green apple slices, pink grapefruit and lime flavors. The sweet acidity gives it shape., Designation: Portada, Points: 84.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Estremadura, Title: DFJ Vinhos 2007 Portada White (Estremadura), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: DFJ Vinhos, Region: Estremadura, Style1: Portuguese White - Estremadura, Style2: Portuguese White - Estremadura, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: Crisp lemon and green apple flavors shine through this lively, fruity wine. It has a cool character, tangy fruitiness and a touch of pepper. The wine is made to drink in its youth and is ready now., Designation: Maria Papoila, Points: 89.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: Wines & Winemakers 2015 Maria Papoila White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Wines & Winemakers, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: A crisp and grassy wine, this is fresh and full of green fruit notes. It is ready to drink now, with grapefruit, gooseberry and crisp apple flavors., Designation: Lab Branco, Points: 84.0, Price: unknown, Province: Lisboa, Title: Casa Santos Lima 2014 Lab Branco White (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Casa Santos Lima, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese White - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: A crisp, off-dry Vinho Verde with a good prickle on the tongue. Flavors of lemon and green apple are well balanced in this ready-to-drink summer wine. Screwcap., Designation: Estreia, Points: 83.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: Viniverde 2011 Estreia White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Viniverde, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: Crisp and delicious, this elegant wine delivers aromas and flavors of green apple, crushed stone, ripe pear and a hint of pastry cream. Bright acidity lifts the creamy flavors while a tangerine note gives it a clean mouthwatering finish., Designation: Schulthauser, Points: 92.0, Price: 26.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano 2015 Schulthauser Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige), Variety: Pinot Bianco, Winery: Cantina Produttori San Michele Appiano, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Pinot Bianco - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Pinot Bianco - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Pinot Bianco - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: A fine, crisp wine, with delicious green apple flavors and a tang of lime, a touch of yeast, and a dry, fresh aftertaste. There's a delicious bite to this fragrant wine., Designation: Solar de Serrade, Points: 87.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: Quinta de Serrade 2006 Solar de Serrade Alvarinho (Vinho Verde), Variety: Alvarinho, Winery: Quinta de Serrade, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Alvarinho - Vinho Verde, Style2: Alvarinho - Vinho Verde, Style3: Alvarinho - Portugal Country: US, Description: Crisp green apple, lime and vanilla wafer mingle on the palate of this 100% Chardonnay, méthode champenoise sparkler from the Bazzano Vineyard. It drips with minerality, lively and tangy with a medium to light body that picks up depth and breadth on the finish., Designation: Blanc de Blanc, Points: 91.0, Price: 40.0, Province: California, Title: Paradise Ridge 2012 Blanc de Blanc Chardonnay (Russian River Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Paradise Ridge, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley Country: France, Description: This finely balanced wine is both crisp and packed with fruit. Its mineral texture is balanced by the sliced green apple and lively acidity. With its lightly toasty aroma, it is ready to drink., Designation: Appogia Blanc de Blancs Brut, Points: 91.0, Price: 62.0, Province: Champagne, Title: Faniel et Fils NV Appogia Blanc de Blancs Brut Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Faniel et Fils, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: France, Description: A fine, mineral-textured wine, crisp with lemon juice acidity and well integrated with green apple flavors. It has developed attractively, with weight in the right places., Designation: Brut Blanc de Blancs, Points: 89.0, Price: 75.0, Province: Champagne, Title: De Venoge 2000 Brut Blanc de Blancs Chardonnay (Champagne), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: De Venoge, Region: Champagne, Style1: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style2: Chardonnay - Champagne, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Italy, Description: Crisp and refreshing aromas suggest white wildflower and pear. The bright, easygoing palate delivers crunchy green apple, nectarine zest and a light almond note alongside vibrant acidity., Designation: Villa Bianchi, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Umani Ronchi 2012 Villa Bianchi  (Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico), Variety: Verdicchio, Winery: Umani Ronchi, Region: Verdicchio dei Castelli di Jesi Classico, Style1: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style2: Verdicchio - Central Italy, Style3: Verdicchio - Italy Country: US, Description: Aromas like crisp green apples and flavors of ripe white peaches combine in this fresh-tasting and medium-bodied wine. The texture is lively but smooth around the edges, and the wine is very appetizing., Designation: Glass Falls, Points: 88.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Montevina 2014 Glass Falls Pinot Grigio (California), Variety: Pinot Grigio, Winery: Montevina, Region: California, Style1: Pinot Grigio - California, Style2: Pinot Grigio - California, Style3: Pinot Grigio - California"

column1: Looking for a wine that is aged in oak barrels.,"
column3: Description
A ripe, smoothly textured wine with cherry fruits and a smoky character.
A soft and fruity wine with juicy red cherry and red-berry fruits.
A spicy wine, rich and full with blackberry flavors.
A wine with bold spice and dried berry aromas, with lingering accents of leather and pipe tobacco.

column2: Ogier 2013 Héritages Elevé en Foudres de Chêne Red (Côtes du Rhône)
column3: A wine that is meaty and savory on the nose, with herb-garrigue flavors and superripe cherry fruit.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: A step up from Sélection in the Moulin-à-Vent range from Duboeuf, this wine has been aged in oak for six months. The result is a ripe, smoothly textured wine, its cherry fruits offering an attractive smoky character. It could do with a year, even two, for aging., Designation: Oak-Aged, Points: 89.0, Price: unknown, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Georges Duboeuf 2011 Oak-Aged  (Moulin-à-Vent), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Georges Duboeuf, Region: Moulin-à-Vent, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: France, Description: Aged in large oak barrels, the wine is soft and fruity. It has juicy red cherry and red-berry fruits that give the wine a crisp, bright and lively character. The wood aging and the tannins fill the wine out bringing spice and a touch of vanilla. At the end, it is acidity that promises some aging. Drink from late 2017., Designation: Cuvée Tradition, Points: 89.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Château de Juliénas 2014 Cuvée Tradition  (Juliénas), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Château de Juliénas, Region: Juliénas, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: France, Description: 91–93. Barrel sample. This spicy wine, aged in new wood, is rich and full with blackberry flavors. It's opulent in texture with layers of new oak that reverberate through the wine., Designation: Barrel Sample, Points: 92.0, Price: unknown, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château Grand Mayne 2012 Barrel Sample  (Saint-Émilion), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château Grand Mayne, Region: Saint-Émilion, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: Italy, Description: Aged in large oak casks, this wine shows bold spice and dried berry aromas, with lingering accents of leather and pipe tobacco. The tight tannins give the wine structure and staying power., Designation: Gricos, Points: 87.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Lucania 2010 Gricos  (Aglianico del Vulture), Variety: Aglianico, Winery: Lucania, Region: Aglianico del Vulture, Style1: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style2: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style3: Aglianico - Italy Country: France, Description: This is aged in oak, but the vessels are large casks, or foudres, so the impact isn't that noticeable. The wine is meaty and savory on the nose, but the palate shows more herb-garrigue flavors and superripe cherry fruit. Drink now–2017., Designation: Héritages Elevé en Foudres de Chêne, Points: 89.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Ogier 2013 Héritages Elevé en Foudres de Chêne Red (Côtes du Rhône), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Ogier, Region: Côtes du Rhône, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: US, Description: The bottle states upfront that the wine is barrel fermented and aged though it's easy to figure out by the aromas of vanilla, sawdust and singed popcorn that define the nose. Some pineapple and malted milk tones peek through on the palate but the fruit is thoroughly trumped by the oak on the finish. Drink up., Designation: French Oak, Points: 85.0, Price: 20.0, Province: New York, Title: Casa Larga 2007 French Oak Chardonnay (Finger Lakes), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Casa Larga, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Chardonnay - New York, Style2: Chardonnay - New York, Style3: Chardonnay - New York Country: Moldova, Description: This wine from Southern Moldova is aged six months in oak barrels, which give it a creamy texture.
