There are aromas of apple and orange flowers, and flavors of lemon pith and Granny Smith apple juice., Designation: Via Etulia Reserve, Points: 86.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Moldova, Title: Bostavan 2014 Via Etulia Reserve Chardonnay (Moldova), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Bostavan, Region: Moldova, Style1: Chardonnay - Moldova, Style2: Chardonnay - Moldova, Style3: Chardonnay - Moldova Country: Spain, Description: If oaky whites are your thing, this barrel-aged Viura is a good choice. Waxy, floral aromas of gardenia, lilly, cured ham and resiny oak play against white-fruit scents. The palate is not blowsy or resiny, while woody flavors of spice and white pepper accent core flavors of peach and baked apple., Designation: Vetiver Vendimia, Points: 88.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas Ontañón 2012 Vetiver Vendimia Viura (Rioja), Variety: Viura, Winery: Bodegas Ontañón, Region: Rioja, Style1: Viura - Northern Spain, Style2: Viura - Northern Spain, Style3: Viura - Spain Country: Italy, Description: This Barbera d'Alba is aged 15 months in oak and boasts well-defined notes of exotic spice, cigar box and shades of sweet vanilla. You'll find the fruit in the mouth, especially on the plum-driven finish. Overall, the use of wood helps shape an attractive, well-structured wine., Designation: Croere, Points: 89.0, Price: unknown, Province: Piedmont, Title: Terre da Vino 2003 Croere  (Barbera d'Alba Superiore), Variety: Barbera, Winery: Terre da Vino, Region: Barbera d'Alba Superiore, Style1: Barbera - Piedmont, Style2: Barbera - Piedmont, Style3: Barbera - Italy Country: France, Description: Some oak aging shows in the smoothness of the wine, which has good concentration as well as young fruitiness. It is tangy with a mineral texture and richness that come from the lees aging in barrel. The wine should mature a little longer, so drink from 2017., Designation: Les Vieilles Vignes, Points: 88.0, Price: unknown, Province: Burgundy, Title: Domaine Pascal Bouchard 2014 Les Vieilles Vignes  (Chablis), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Domaine Pascal Bouchard, Region: Chablis, Style1: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style2: Chardonnay - Burgundy, Style3: Chardonnay - France Country: Portugal, Description: The oak aging is what makes this wine. It brings out the black fruits and juicy acidity as well as adding toast and vanilla flavors. The result is a wine that is smooth, balanced, full of fruit and ready to drink., Designation: Tarambola, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Lisboa, Title: Casa Santos Lima 2015 Tarambola Red (Lisboa), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Casa Santos Lima, Region: Lisboa, Style1: Portuguese Red - Lisboa, Style2: Portuguese Red - Lisboa, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Italy, Description: Aged in large oak casks, this shows natural intensity and purity that is evident its quality of fruit and elegant nature. Aromas include ginger, forest berry, white truffle and cola. The tannins are fine and silky., Designation: Vigneto Boscareto, Points: 91.0, Price: 75.0, Province: Piedmont, Title: Beni di Batasiolo 2006 Vigneto Boscareto  (Barolo), Variety: Nebbiolo, Winery: Beni di Batasiolo, Region: Barolo, Style1: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style2: Nebbiolo - Piedmont, Style3: Nebbiolo - Italy Country: US, Description: Oak barrel aging dominates,bringing buttered toast and caramel flavors. Underneath all that is a dry, tartly acidic wine, with complex tropical fruit, citrus and herb flavors. It might develop bottle complexity over the year four to five years. You can drink it now, but not too cold., Designation: Hudson Vineyard, Points: 89.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Failla 2012 Hudson Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Failla, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Napa Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Napa Valley Country: Spain, Description: Dusty aromas of red cherry are muddled by oaky notes of plastic and latex. A jumpy, bright palate is rudimentary, as are lightly spiced plum and raspberry flavors. A fresh, dry, basic finish seems appropriate., Designation: Oak Aged, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Central Spain, Title: Mureda 2012 Oak Aged Syrah (Vino de la Tierra de Castilla), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Mureda, Region: Vino de la Tierra de Castilla, Style1: Syrah - Central Spain, Style2: Syrah - Central Spain, Style3: Syrah - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Crystal-clear aromas of green apples and minerals come with a slight dash of oak. This is barrel-fermented Viura (with 10% Malvasia), but there's nothing woody or overtly barrel-dominated about the wine, which is tight and citric on the tongue, with tangerine, green apple and nectarine flavors that finish racy and tart., Designation: Barrel Fermented, Points: 89.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Muga 2013 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Muga, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain"

column1: Suggest a wine from a winery known for its small-batch practices.,"
column3: Description

column2: Buck Shack 2014 Small Batch Red (Lake County)
column3: An easygoing but richly flavored wine with light toast and spice aromas and somewhat sweet jammy flavors.

column2: King Family 2015 Small Batch Series Highland Orchard Petit Manseng (Monticello)
column3: An expressive wine with tiers of aromas and flavors like dried apricot, chamomile, tangerine peel, marmalade, marzipan and ginger.

column2: La Pitchoune 2013 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
column3: A balanced wine with creamy texture against crisp apple and guava.
A concentrated and lengthy wine with nuances of black cherry, leather saddle and crushed rock.

column2: Love & Squalor 2014 Sunny Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
column3: A crisp and focused wine with light cherry fruit and ample flavors of tea, herb and leaf.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: This is an easygoing but richly flavored wine that starts with light toast and spice aromas preceding somewhat sweet jammy flavors, a soft texture and medium body. Petite Sirah, Zinfandel, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon formed the blend., Designation: Small Batch, Points: 87.0, Price: 30.0, Province: California, Title: Buck Shack 2014 Small Batch Red (Lake County), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Buck Shack, Region: Lake, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Lake, Style3: Red Blend - Lake Country: US, Description: Tiers of aromas and flavors in this expressive wine reveal themselves like a Matryoshka doll. Wafts of dried apricot and chamomile open into tangerine peel and marmalade, then finally marzipan and ginger come forth on the nose. Concentrated flavors mimic the aromas and introduce fresh vanilla bean and hay. Racy acidity thrills, while two years in neutral French oak keeps the wine round and full-bodied. The finish is long and compelling., Designation: Small Batch Series Highland Orchard, Points: 89.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Virginia, Title: King Family 2015 Small Batch Series Highland Orchard Petit Manseng (Monticello), Variety: Petit Manseng, Winery: King Family, Region: Monticello, Style1: Petit Manseng - Virginia, Style2: Petit Manseng - Virginia, Style3: Petit Manseng - Virginia Country: US, Description: From a tremendous vineyard location known for its meticulous farming, this wine was made in small quantities. It exemplifies balance, pitting creamy, voluptuous texture against crisp apple and guava, the acidity never ceding entirely to the oak., Designation: Pratt Vineyard, Points: 90.0, Price: 68.0, Province: California, Title: La Pitchoune 2013 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: La Pitchoune, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Robert Mondavi winemaker Genevieve Janssens makes this wine, a small-production solo project that's worth seeking. The 83% Cabernet Sauvignon is sourced from Hendry Ranch and the 17% Cabernet Franc from Detert East Vineyard, a stone's throw from To Kalon. Impressively concentrated and lengthy, within a wealth of power, it is nuanced in black cherry, leather saddle and crushed rock, with the scent of violet never far behind., Designation: Limited Edition, Points: 96.0, Price: 155.0, Province: California, Title: Portfolio 2013 Limited Edition Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Portfolio, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Small production (one barrel!) single-vineyard Pinots are challenging, as there is no wiggle room via blending. This comes out crisp and focused, with light cherry fruit and ample flavors of tea, herb and leaf., Designation: Sunny Mountain Vineyard, Points: 89.0, Price: 52.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Love & Squalor 2014 Sunny Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Love & Squalor, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: US, Description: Nicely balanced, full of tasty fruit flavors, and accented by light vanilla and nutmeg, this is a seamless wine that has lots of appeal. At this reasonable price, it will make a great go-to choice—the kind to stock by the case., Designation: Small Lot Blend, Points: 90.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: Parducci 2014 Small Lot Blend Chardonnay (Mendocino County), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Parducci, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Mendocino, Style3: Chardonnay - Mendocino Country: US, Description: Martini goes big with this flashy, splashy, small-production Cabernet. Made in the modern cult style, it's soft as velvet, with ultrarefined tannins and a brisk hit of acidity for balance, plus flavors of blackberries, black currants and dark chocolate. Really pleasurable now, and it should reward up to 10 years in the cellar., Designation: Lot No. 1, Points: 94.0, Price: 145.0, Province: California, Title: Louis M. Martini 2009 Lot No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Louis M. Martini, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Quietly fruity and rather soft-textured, this wine smells lightly herbal and tastes dry. Light honeydew flavors give a little extra interest., Designation: Small Lot, Points: 85.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Parducci, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Mendocino, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Mendocino Country: US, Description: This wine is crisp, floral and pretty in every way. It's classically structured and graceful, with tart apple notes and stony acidity. It allows the fruit to speak softly and subtly, its lower ripeness detracting from niether flavor nor complexity., Designation: TBH Vineyard, Points: 94.0, Price: 72.0, Province: California, Title: Small Vines 2014 TBH Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Small Vines, Region: Sonoma Coast, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Sonoma Coast, Style3: Chardonnay - Sonoma Coast Country: US, Description: This small production blend of 90% Viognier and 10% Sauvignon Blanc leads with fragrant, inviting floral qualities and well-defined layers of peach and apricot fruit. Generous fruit flavors linger on the finish., Designation: Small Lot Blend, Points: 90.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Parducci 2013 Small Lot Blend Petite Sirah (Mendocino County), Variety: Petite Sirah, Winery: Parducci, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Petite Sirah - California, Style2: Petite Sirah - Mendocino, Style3: Petite Sirah - Mendocino Country: US, Description: Made in small amounts, this floral, tangy and richly textured white wine offers a depth of honey and caramel that overpowers the prettier, more mineral-driven aspects lurking in the underbelly of body. Youthful, it should come around., Designation: Leveroni Vineyards, Points: 90.0, Price: 42.0, Province: California, Title: Jeff Gordon 2014 Leveroni Vineyards Chardonnay (Carneros), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Jeff Gordon, Region: Carneros, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Carneros, Style3: Chardonnay - Carneros Country: US, Description: Earthy, velvety and spicy, this is lean and balanced in acidity with a meatiness to the midpalate and finish. Cellar through 2022., Designation: Private Stock 16 Rows, Points: 94.0, Price: 150.0, Province: California, Title: Vine Cliff 2012 Private Stock 16 Rows Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Vine Cliff, Region: Oakville, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Oakville, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Oakville"

column9: ,Country: Israel, Description: The mouthfeel of this wine is beautiful, with a velvety texture and dusty tannins, and the lingering, coffee-infused finish seals the experience nicely. The blend holds Grenache, Mourvèdre and Syrah., Designation: L'Autre, Points: 92.0, Price: 30.0, Province: California, Title: Terre Rouge 2012 L'Autre Red (Sierra Foothills), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Terre Rouge, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Sierra Foothills, Style3: Red Blend - Sierra Foothills Country: US, Description: Very rich and smooth in texture, like pure velvet, this Bordeaux-style blend has lots of tannins that are soft, ripe and easy. column1: What's a good full-bodied white wine that's not overly oaked?,"

column2: Brander 2011 Cuvée Nicolas Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
column3: A rich, nuanced white wine with complex layers of citrus and tropical fruits, buttercream, vanilla and toast.

Despite its unoaked nature, this wine reveals elements of baked and dried fruit, and an unexpected voluptuousness of full-bodied richness.

column2: Hearst Ranch 2009 Three Sisters Cuvée White (Paso Robles)
column3: A wine for those who want something drier and crisper than the typically overoaked white Rhône blend. It's smooth, silky and earthy, with just a touch of orange and sandalwood.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: This white will appeal greatly to those who prefer stainless-steel treatment, with its tangle of sour apple, sharp acidity and full but not heavy texture. It gets better in the glass, softening that sharpness and tang, opening up to elements of melon and lime., Designation: Unoaked, Points: 90.0, Price: 39.0, Province: California, Title: Williams Selyem 2014 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Williams Selyem, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Touches of ginger and orange zest lighten up the ample fruit flavors of this well-balanced value-priced wine. It has good acidity to match the ripeness of the Anjou pear and white peach flavors., Designation: Lightly Oaked, Points: 87.0, Price: 8.0, Province: California, Title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California Country: Spain, Description: If oaky whites are your thing, this barrel-aged Viura is a good choice. Waxy, floral aromas of gardenia, lilly, cured ham and resiny oak play against white-fruit scents. The palate is not blowsy or resiny, while woody flavors of spice and white pepper accent core flavors of peach and baked apple., Designation: Vetiver Vendimia, Points: 88.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas Ontañón 2012 Vetiver Vendimia Viura (Rioja), Variety: Viura, Winery: Bodegas Ontañón, Region: Rioja, Style1: Viura - Northern Spain, Style2: Viura - Northern Spain, Style3: Viura - Spain Country: Spain, Description: Clean lines and fresh, oak-tinged aromas is what this Viura (with 10% Malvasia) is all about. The nose starts with lemon, green apple and a spot of vanilla, while the juicy palate brings bright white fruits, toasty oak and smoke. Not overly complex but not rudimentary or dull. A nice food wine and probably the best barrel-fermented white from Muga we've tried., Designation: Barrel Fermented, Points: 89.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Muga 2009 Barrel Fermented White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Muga, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Brander's Sauvignon Blancs are so rich in their own right, they don't even need oak. But when you take a good one, as this is, and add some new French barrels, it becomes even richer. Blended with 35% Semillon, this wine has serious weight and texture, with complex layers of citrus and tropical fruits, buttercream, vanilla and toast. It's a very nuanced white wine, so do not drink it too cold., Designation: Cuvée Nicolas, Points: 92.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Brander 2011 Cuvée Nicolas Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley), Variety: Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Brander, Region: Santa Ynez Valley, Style1: Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc - Santa Ynez Valley, Style3: Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc - Santa Ynez Valley Country: US, Description: This chewy, tangy white wine is an engaging blend of 42% Viognier, 33% Marsanne, 23% Roussanne and a splash of Grenache Blanc. Fresh flavors of citrus, apples and pineapple abound. If you're looking for an unoaked alternative to Chardonnay, this is a good option., Designation: Pistoleta, Points: 89.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Quady North 2015 Pistoleta White (Rogue Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Quady North, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: White Blend - Oregon, Style2: White Blend - Oregon Other, Style3: White Blend - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: A full-bodied white blend composed largely of Chardonnay with smaller percentages of Gewürztraminer, Sauvignon Blanc, Orange Muscat, Viognier, Pinot Blanc, Sémillon and Muscat Canelli. The aromas and flavors lean tropical, ensconced in crisp vanilla and lemon-lime. A versatile wine for a myriad of foods. Rich seafood dishes will work particularly well., Designation: The Whip, Points: 88.0, Price: 21.0, Province: California, Title: Murrieta's Well 2012 The Whip White (Livermore Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Murrieta's Well, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Livermore Valley, Style3: White Blend - Livermore Valley Country: Israel, Description: A fresh and easy-drinking white made from Sauvignon Blanc and Chardonnay, the Blanc boasts scents of soft talcum powder, pink peony and orange blossom against a gooseberry and white strawberry fruit backbone. Zippy and prickly in the mouth with a mouthwatering, grassy finish., Designation: Unoaked Blanc, Points: 86.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Judean Hills, Title: Flam 2010 Unoaked Blanc White (Judean Hills), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Flam, Region: Judean Hills, Style1: White Blend - Judean Hills, Style2: White Blend - Judean Hills, Style3: White Blend - Israel Country: US, Description: Despite its unoaked nature, this wine reveals elements of baked and dried fruit, and an unexpected voluptuousness of full-bodied richness. Pear, apple and lemon interplay on the palate, while tangy acidity provides a satisfying end note., Designation: Unoaked, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Pellegrini 2013 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Pellegrini, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Russian River Valley Country: Spain, Description: The winery has dialed back the time in oak for its barrel-fermented Viura to two months from five or six, and it's a decidedly less oaky wine than in years prior. Now it shows a controlled lees character along with lemon and apple flavors. Limited in what it offers, but made well., Designation: Blanco Fermentado en Barrica, Points: 85.0, Price: 8.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Marqués de Cáceres 2006 Blanco Fermentado en Barrica White (Rioja), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Marqués de Cáceres, Region: Rioja, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Tastes as sweet as Lifesaver lemon and pineapple candy, with low acidity., Designation: Lightly Oaked, Points: 81.0, Price: 8.0, Province: California, Title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2007 Lightly Oaked Chardonnay (California), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi, Region: California, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - California, Style3: Chardonnay - California Country: US, Description: this full-bodied white wine stresses complexity, weight and viscosity. It smells like blanched almonds and candle wax, and tastes rich, almost heavy., Designation: Vino Bianco, Points: 85.0, Price: 21.0, Province: California, Title: Naggiar 2014 Vino Bianco White (Sierra Foothills), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Naggiar, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Sierra Foothills, Style3: White Blend - Sierra Foothills Country: US, Description: This is one of those wines that could be anything from Chardonnay to Pinot Grigio or Sauvignon Blanc. It doesn't really matter, because it's pleasant and easy to drink, with sweet flavors of tangerines and vanilla., Designation: Oak Free, Points: 86.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Daniel Gehrs 2010 Oak Free Chardonnay (Central Coast), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Daniel Gehrs, Region: Central Coast, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Central Coast, Style3: Chardonnay - Central Coast Country: US, Description: A wine for those who want something drier and crisper than the typically overoaked white Rhône blend. It's smooth, silky and earthy, with just a touch of orange and sandalwood. A very nice, elegant and versatile wine., Designation: Three Sisters Cuvée, Points: 90.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Hearst Ranch 2009 Three Sisters Cuvée White (Paso Robles), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Hearst Ranch, Region: Paso Robles, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Paso Robles, Style3: White Blend - Paso Robles Country: Portugal, Description: Full-bodied, soft wine, with pleasant, open flavors of melon, lime and ripe white figs. There is sweetness, emphasizing the softness of the wine. Pleasant and drinkable now., Designation: Alvarinho-Chardonnay, Points: 84.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Estremadura, Title: DFJ Vinhos 2008 Alvarinho-Chardonnay White (Estremadura), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: DFJ Vinhos, Region: Estremadura, Style1: Portuguese White - Estremadura, Style2: Portuguese White - Estremadura, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal"
