column10: ,Country: US, Description: Here's a big, bold, lip-smacking Zin from Napa Valley. It shows ripe berry, cola, pepper, licorice and cocoa flavors, and is full-bodied and drily tannic. Great with pizza, enchiladas or Swedish meatballs., Designation: Old Vine, Points: 86.0, Price: 14.0, Province: California, Title: Screw Kappa Napa 2006 Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley), Variety: Zinfandel, Winery: Screw Kappa Napa, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Zinfandel - California, Style2: Zinfandel - Napa Valley, Style3: Zinfandel - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: From the cooler Oak Knoll region of southern Napa, a wine with berry-cherry flavors and silky tannins. Yet it feels coarse and heavy, with a density and dullness Pinot Noir should not have. Suggests once again the unsuitability of Napa Valley for Pinot Noir., Designation: Rodgers Vineyard, Points: 84.0, Price: 26.0, Province: California, Title: Cenay 2001 Rodgers Vineyard Pinot Noir (Napa Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Cenay, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Napa Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Dark, rich mountain blueberry and blackberry form the core of this classically delicious Napa Valley wine from an estate vineyard. Velvety dark chocolate melts over integrated tannins and a medium-strength body, the finish lengthy, dusty and well-structured. Age through 2020–2022., Designation: Cloudy's Vineyard, Points: 93.0, Price: 125.0, Province: California, Title: Janzen 2012 Cloudy's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Janzen, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: A beautiful wine that shows how Napa Valley is right up there with the best of California's Sauvignon Blancs. Dry and crisp, it was made in the interesting way of combining stainless steel and oak for textural complexity. The citrus, lemongrass, fig and pepper flavors have a touch of buttercream and smoke in the finish., Designation: Highlander, Points: 91.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Crauford 2007 Highlander Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Crauford, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Napa Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Made from a mix of vineyards across the Napa Valley, this pays tribute to the early days of grape growing in the region and is a wine equally worthy of recognition. Exhibiting dark cherry stone and wild strawberry aromas, the palate is complex, tannic and round, a subtle suggestion of smoke on the finish balanced by bright acidity., Designation: Founding Farmers, Points: 91.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Robert Biale 2012 Founding Farmers Zinfandel (Napa Valley), Variety: Zinfandel, Winery: Robert Biale, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Zinfandel - California, Style2: Zinfandel - Napa Valley, Style3: Zinfandel - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Soft, light in body and easy to drink, this Sangiovese, from the Napa estate vineyard, is delicious in raspberry, red currant, licorice, bacon and spice flavors. It's somewhat ephemeral, an instantly pleasant wine to drink especially with cured meats, olives, hard cheeses., Designation: Estate, Points: 87.0, Price: 28.0, Province: California, Title: Benessere 2007 Estate Sangiovese (Napa Valley), Variety: Sangiovese, Winery: Benessere, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Sangiovese - California, Style2: Sangiovese - Napa Valley, Style3: Sangiovese - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Quite a good Napa Valley Cabernet, with a complex tannin structure and tiers of blackberry, black currant, orange zest, Provençal herb, violet and anise flavors, and a touch of raisins on the finish. Don't be alarmed by the sediment it's already throwing in the glass. Feels somewhat sharp, which lowers the point score., Designation: Cuvée Venus, Points: 88.0, Price: 48.0, Province: California, Title: Narsai David 2005 Cuvée Venus Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Narsai David, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Shows all the hallmarks of a modern Napa wine of high quality. Although it's quite dry, it's rich in crushed ripe blackberries, in good alignment with smoky new oak. The tannins are smooth and complex, the acidity just fine. Really a lovely bottle of red wine, although a touch of superripeness may limit ageability., Designation: Reserve Cuvée, Points: 91.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Clone 7 2008 Reserve Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Clone 7, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: From the southern end of the Napa Valley, where temperatures tend to be cool, this wine is surprisingly intense in tannin and a deep taste of coffee, rounded out by spicy red plum and strawberry. The acidity holds tight through the finish, making this a friendly food wine., Designation: Estate Grown, Points: 87.0, Price: 42.0, Province: California, Title: Grgich Hills 2010 Estate Grown Merlot (Napa Valley), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Grgich Hills, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Merlot - California, Style2: Merlot - Napa Valley, Style3: Merlot - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Organically farmed grapes from an estate vineyard comprise this 100% varietal wine, another unusual offering from the Napa Valley. Dry, as advertised, it's fruity and medium bodied, with a taste of waxy apricot and melon., Designation: Old Vines Dry, Points: 88.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Casa Nuestra 2014 Old Vines Dry Chenin Blanc (St. Helena), Variety: Chenin Blanc, Winery: Casa Nuestra, Region: St. Helena, Style1: Chenin Blanc - California, Style2: Chenin Blanc - St. Helena, Style3: Chenin Blanc - St. Helena Country: US, Description: Juicy tobacco, clove and black currant accent plush layers of integrated oak and rounded, persistent tannin in this Bordeaux-style blend. Full bodied and quite ripe, it's a nice showcase for Napa Valley fruit., Designation: No. 254, Points: 91.0, Price: 65.0, Province: California, Title: Louis M. Martini 2013 No. 254 Meritage (Napa Valley), Variety: Meritage, Winery: Louis M. Martini, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Meritage - California, Style2: Meritage - Napa Valley, Style3: Meritage - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: From the Napa side of Carneros, this beautiful wine begins with very forward aromas of cola, black raspberry, black cherry, tomato, mushroom, earth, vanilla, spice and smoky oak. Very fruity and lush in the mouth, with soft tannins. It’s rich and opulent, offering wave after wave of different sensations that are endlessly fascinating. The finish is fruity and long. Fabulous wine; enjoy it now, or age it., Designation: Lee Vyd, Points: 94.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Acacia 1997 Lee Vyd Pinot Noir (Napa Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Acacia, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Napa Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: A very nice wine, showcasing the Napa style of lush, plush opulence. It's softly tannic, with ripe blackberry, raspberry, mocha and cedar flavors. Not an ager—drink by 2015., Designation: Double Lariat, Points: 89.0, Price: 45.0, Province: California, Title: Jamieson Ranch 2011 Double Lariat Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Jamieson Ranch, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: A lovely wine, soft and supple, with a superb tannin structure framing the most interesting and delicious flavors. Blackberries, blueberries, red and black currants, anise and cedar notes all come together in balanced harmony, leading to a long, dry finish. Not an ager, but an elegant Napa Valley wine to drink now and over the next few years., Designation: Family Reserve Generations Estate, Points: 92.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Charles Krug 2010 Family Reserve Generations Estate Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Charles Krug, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: Young and still intensely oaked, this wine holds undeniable promise in its fleshy, viscous and smooth layers of stone fruit and guava—an untrammeled expression of the Napa Valley's ability for generosity and structure. The finish is bittersweet in Meyer lemon., Designation: Limited Release, Points: 90.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Black Stallion 2013 Limited Release Chardonnay (Napa Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Black Stallion, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Napa Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Napa Valley"

column1: Recommend a wine with hints of cherry.,"
column3: Description
Aromatic tart cherry with astonishing purity, concentrated and rich texture.

column2: Pascal Aufranc 2012 Les Cerisiers Vieilles Vignes (Juliénas)
column3: Cherry aroma with spice, juicy, forward fruity character, tang of acidity and soft tannins.
Soft, juicy wine with warm, red cherry flavors.
Light and subtle, offers tart cherry fruit with hints of mushroom.
Cherry flavors with tannins and structure that allow the fruit to develop slowly.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: Faint hints of aromatic tart cherry try to burst through the closed nose. The fruit is present on the fresh palate with astonishing purity. There is real concentration and a richer, almost plush texture at the core despite the svelte nature of this wine. A real triumph that expresses pure aromatic red cherry with real elegance. This has beauty, charm, length and authenticity., Designation: Rahn, Points: 92.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Domaine Pfister 2013 Rahn Pinot Noir (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Domaine Pfister, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Noir - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Noir - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: France, Description: A slightly confected cherry note on the nose is balanced by hints of crushed stone in this medium-bodied rosé. On the palate, cherries blend with citrus and peppery spice, then finish with mouthwatering flavors and refreshing acidity. Drink now., Designation: Cuvée Royale, Points: 90.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Rhône Valley, Title: Les Vignerons de Tavel 2016 Cuvée Royale  (Tavel), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Les Vignerons de Tavel, Region: Tavel, Style1: Rosé - Rhône Valley, Style2: Rosé - Rhône Valley, Style3: Rosé - France Country: France, Description: This wine's name translates to “cherry,” and cherries are in its aroma along with spice. The palate shows a juicy, forward fruity character, a tang of acidity and soft tannins. It's a fine wine, but not for long-term aging so drink now and over the next few months., Designation: Les Cerisiers Vieilles  Vignes, Points: 89.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Pascal Aufranc 2012 Les Cerisiers Vieilles  Vignes  (Juliénas), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Pascal Aufranc, Region: Juliénas, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: US, Description: Front-loaded with cherries, watermelons and pomegranates, with hints of violets, vanilla and spices, this is one of the richer, more full-bodied blush wines out there. Great picnic or beach wine., Designation: Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of Syrah, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: Gustafson Family 2012 Heritage Tree Vineyard Estate Rosé of Syrah Rosé (Dry Creek Valley), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Gustafson Family, Region: Dry Creek Valley, Style1: Rosé - California, Style2: Rosé - Dry Creek Valley, Style3: Rosé - Dry Creek Valley Country: US, Description: Cherries and strawberries abound in this elegant wine. Old-vine fruit was fermented and briefly aged in neutral barrels that somehow lend a subtle hint of apple-pie spices to the wine. A perfect late summer sipper., Designation: Rosé of, Points: 90.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Oregon, Title: The Eyrie Vineyards 2013 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: The Eyrie Vineyards, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: Germany, Description: Hints of umami richness lend savoriness to primary red-cherry and cranberry flavors on this nuanced wine. Supple like silk yet refreshingly mineral, it finishes crisp and clean with lingering wet-granite notes., Designation: Sommerhalde Erste Lage R GG, Points: 90.0, Price: 103.0, Province: Baden, Title: Bernhard Huber 2011 Sommerhalde Erste Lage R GG Spätburgunder (Baden), Variety: Spätburgunder, Winery: Bernhard Huber, Region: Baden, Style1: Spätburgunder - Baden, Style2: Spätburgunder - Baden, Style3: Spätburgunder - Germany Country: US, Description: Hints of spice and leather add a savory tone to red cherry and plum flavors in this bold but elegantly structured red wine. The palate is juicy with fruit, but accented with a spray of green herbs and brisk acidity that lend freshness., Designation: Jubilant Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 45.0, Province: New York, Title: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Jamesport, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: France, Description: Ripe and round, this soft, juicy wine shows just a hint of a more serious tannic structure. It has plenty of acidity to go with its warm, red cherry flavors. Drink now, or better from 2015., Designation: Domaine de la Conseillère, Points: 88.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Vincent 2012 Domaine de la Conseillère  (Juliénas), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Vincent, Region: Juliénas, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: US, Description: Light and subtle, this offers tart cherry fruit with hints of mushroom. The texture and definition somewhat compensate for the overall lightness and lack of depth. It's a graceful, elegant wine best enjoyed young., Designation: Emery, Points: 88.0, Price: 48.0, Province: Oregon, Title: WillaKenzie Estate 2013 Emery Pinot Noir, Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: WillaKenzie Estate, Region: Willamette Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Willamette Valley Country: France, Description: Lightly tannic, this wine is about red cherry and blueberry fruits, along with hints of banana. Fresh and fruity, it offers a balance of acidity and tannins at the end. Drink now., Designation: Grande QV, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Burgundy, Title: Vignerons de Bel Air 2013 Grande QV  (Coteaux Bourguignons), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Vignerons de Bel Air, Region: Coteaux Bourguignons, Style1: Gamay - Burgundy, Style2: Gamay - Burgundy, Style3: Gamay - France Country: France, Description: This wine is all about fresh cherries with only the lightest structure. It would be delicious drunk lightly chilled on a summer day., Designation: Cuvée Rochebonne, Points: 84.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Trenel Fils 2014 Cuvée Rochebonne  (Beaujolais), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Trenel Fils, Region: Beaujolais, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: France, Description: Cherry trees surround the vineyard and it is easy to find those fruit flavors in this wine. Other strong elements are the tannins and structure that allow the fruit to develop slowly. Acidity, black cherries and a layer of spice all go with the dry core. Drink from 2017., Designation: Les Cerisiers, Points: 90.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Beaujolais, Title: Pascal Aufranc 2014 Les Cerisiers  (Juliénas), Variety: Gamay, Winery: Pascal Aufranc, Region: Juliénas, Style1: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style2: Gamay - Beaujolais, Style3: Gamay - France Country: US, Description: Notes of fresh cherry and raspberry are peppered with hints of tomato leaf and bramble on this savory wine. It's full bodied on the palate, but touches of cranberry give it a brisk, refreshing feel. It finishes with soft, yet slightly astringent tannins., Designation: Reserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 30.0, Province: New York, Title: Lakewood 2010 Reserve Pinot Noir (Finger Lakes), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Lakewood, Region: Finger Lakes, Style1: Pinot Noir - New York, Style2: Pinot Noir - New York, Style3: Pinot Noir - New York Country: US, Description: Light, tart cherry fruit beckons for further exploration. The ripeness is there, and the wine comes across as clean and elegant in its modest proportions. As it breathes open there is a slight hint of volatility which, for most tasters, will be a plus., Designation: Holstein Vineyard, Points: 89.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Purple Hands 2013 Holstein Vineyard Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Purple Hands, Region: Dundee Hills, Style1: Pinot Noir - Oregon, Style2: Pinot Noir - Dundee Hills, Style3: Pinot Noir - Dundee Hills Country: Spain, Description: Fiery berry and cherry aromas emerge with a hint of milk chocolate. This wine feels high in acidity, with raspberry, tart red plum and spice flavors that finish with citrusy snap and grittiness., Designation: Bordón Reserva, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Bodegas Franco-Españolas 2007 Bordón Reserva  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo Blend, Winery: Bodegas Franco-Españolas, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo Blend - Spain"

column1: I'm interested in trying a red wine with a subtle herbal or floral aroma. Any ideas?,"
column3: Description
Floral red-berry aromas with a note of wet clay and dried herbs. Wide on the palate with herbal plum, blueberry and peppery flavors.

column2: Seven Hills 2005 Pentad Red Wine Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
column3: Subtle and soft, this aromatic Bordeaux blend is laced with herb and exotic and savory spices, woven through tight fruit flavors of blueberry and musky grape.
Herbal, floral, soupy berry aromas. This feels chunky and a bit heavy, with cool flavors of blueberry that are green at the core.

column2: Domaine du Grand Cros 2004 Jules Réserve Red (Côtes de Provence)
column3: Aromatic, herbal wine, with evocative lavender, a core of dry tannins, fresh red plum juice fruit and flavors of wild thyme.
With very herbal aromas, this wood-aged red has a green quality that detracts from the riper red fruit flavors.
column9: ,Country: Argentina, Description: Floral red-berry aromas come with a note of wet clay and also a dusting of dried herbs. Wide on the palate, this rubs up against your cheeks. Herbal plum, blueberry and peppery flavors finish with ripeness and freshness. Drink through 2019., Designation: Reserve, Points: 90.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Mi Terruño 2013 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Mendoza), Variety: Cabernet Franc, Winery: Mi Terruño, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Cabernet Franc - Mendoza Province, Style2: Cabernet Franc - Mendoza Province, Style3: Cabernet Franc - Argentina Country: US, Description: Subtle and soft, this aromatic Bordeaux blend (54% Cab Sauvignon, 9% Carmenère, 9% Merlot, 10% Malbec, 18% Petit Verdot) is laced with herb and exotic and savory spices, woven through tight fruit flavors of blueberry and musky grape. This is a delicate, evocative and challenging wine that rewards your attention. Fascinating and complex, it needs time to breathe and good glassware to really open up., Designation: Pentad Red Wine, Points: 91.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Washington, Title: Seven Hills 2005 Pentad Red Wine Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA)), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Seven Hills, Region: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: Chile, Description: Herbal, floral, soupy berry aromas are unfocused, unfamiliar and scattered. This feels chunky and a bit heavy, with cool flavors of blueberry that are green at the core. Olive, toast and herbal berry flavors are found on an unstructured, chubby finish., Designation: Clava Reserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Rapel Valley, Title: Quintay 2014 Clava Reserve Carmenère (Rapel Valley), Variety: Carmenère, Winery: Quintay, Region: Rapel Valley, Style1: Carmenère - Rapel Valley, Style2: Carmenère - Rapel Valley, Style3: Carmenère - Chile Country: France, Description: Aromatic, herbal wine, with evocative lavender, a core of dry tannins, fresh red plum juice fruit and flavors of wild thyme. The six years' aging has given the wine just the right amount of maturity to drink now., Designation: Jules Réserve, Points: 89.0, Price: 18.0, Province: Provence, Title: Domaine du Grand Cros 2004 Jules Réserve Red (Côtes de Provence), Variety: Rhône-style Red Blend, Winery: Domaine du Grand Cros, Region: Côtes de Provence, Style1: Rhône-style Red Blend - Provence, Style2: Rhône-style Red Blend - Provence, Style3: Rhône-style Red Blend - France Country: France, Description: With very herbal aromas, this wood-aged red has a green quality that detracts from the riper red fruit flavors. Acidity and firm tannins do add structure. It needs time to fully integrate, so drink from 2015., Designation: Tentation Rouge, Points: 88.0, Price: 35.0, Province: Loire Valley, Title: François Millet 2011 Tentation Rouge  (Sancerre), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: François Millet, Region: Sancerre, Style1: Pinot Noir - Loire Valley, Style2: Pinot Noir - Loire Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: Argentina, Description: Floral blue-fruit aromas suggest juniper and moss. This feels heavy and low on acidity. Crazy, unique flavors of tea, prune, pepper and hoisin sauce finish minty, mossy and herbal, while the lasting feel is grapy., Designation: RD, Points: 86.0, Price: 45.0, Province: Other, Title: Bodega Tacuil 2011 RD Red (Salta), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Bodega Tacuil, Region: Salta, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Other, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Other, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Argentina Country: US, Description: Green herb, flower, citrus and pencil lead aromas are followed by sweet plum flavors with lemony accents. Lightly grainy tannins round it out., Designation: Majestic, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Washington, Title: Diversion 2014 Majestic Red (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Diversion, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: The aromas begin with a pretty violet character, around plum and smoke. Flavors are tightly wound and balanced, with sharp acids. This slowly opens over many hours of breathing time to unveil smooth, soft fruit, light herbs, pretty floral highlights and great texture., Designation: Pentad, Points: 93.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Washington, Title: Seven Hills 2007 Pentad Red (Walla Walla Valley (WA)), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Seven Hills, Region: Walla Walla Valley (WA), Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: Chile, Description: Herbal berry aromas are earthy and leafy. This is 50% Syrah, 30% Carmenère and the rest Petit Verdot and Cab Franc. In the mouth, this feels pulpy but dry. Leafy herbal plum and olive flavors finish firm but with continuous herbal flavors., Designation: 1234 Reserva, Points: 87.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Colchagua Valley, Title: Siegel 2015 1234 Reserva Red (Colchagua Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Siegel, Region: Colchagua Valley, Style1: Red Blend - Colchagua Valley, Style2: Red Blend - Colchagua Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Chile Country: Chile, Description: Staunch herbal aromas of tobacco, olive, rubber, vanilla, cedar and wild berry are 100% Chilean. This Carmenère-led blend feels fleshy but alert, with tomato-based acidity. Saucy, herbal, tomatoey plum and red-currant flavors finish herbal and briny, with snappy tartaric acidity., Designation: Mixtura, Points: 88.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Maule Valley, Title: Viña Casas Patronales 2010 Mixtura Red (Maule Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Viña Casas Patronales, Region: Maule Valley, Style1: Red Blend - Maule Valley, Style2: Red Blend - Maule Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Chile Country: US, Description: This wine has potent berry, funky earth and herb aromas. Its fruity-floral flavors are tinged with a balsamic nip and a tart, rather tannic mouthfeel. To taste a little pioneering in terms of wine style, don't be alarmed at the sediment in the bottle., Designation: Jambalaia Rouge, Points: 84.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: La Clarine Farm 2014 Jambalaia Rouge Red (Sierra Foothills), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: La Clarine Farm, Region: Sierra Foothills, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Sierra Foothills, Style3: Red Blend - Sierra Foothills Country: Chile, Description: Herbal, leathery aromas give way to a pretty strong blast of green that infiltrates the wine. Alongside the herbal, green core character is spiced chocolate, dark berry fruit and blazing acidity. This is full, saturated and masculine, with raking tannins. Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot., Designation: VSC, Points: 88.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Maipo Valley, Title: Santa Carolina 2008 VSC Red (Maipo Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Santa Carolina, Region: Maipo Valley, Style1: Red Blend - Maipo Valley, Style2: Red Blend - Maipo Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Chile Country: Chile, Description: Minty plum and berry aromas are herbal but ripe, with a note of chocolate and black tea. This is lush and layered, with top-end mouthfeel and herbal, floral flavors of berry fruits and plum. A smooth, herbal tasting finish is the finale to a well-made, flavorful wine., Designation: Single Vineyard, Points: 90.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Colchagua Valley, Title: Siegel 2012 Single Vineyard Carmenère (Colchagua Valley), Variety: Carmenère, Winery: Siegel, Region: Colchagua Valley, Style1: Carmenère - Colchagua Valley, Style2: Carmenère - Colchagua Valley, Style3: Carmenère - Chile Country: Argentina, Description: Red plum, tomato and brambly herbal aromas set up a snappy, astringent palate with strained raspberry, spice and herbal flavors. Very dry and acidic as it transitions to the finish. An herbal, sharp-edged red., Designation: Tinto Fundación, Points: 83.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Notro 2010 Tinto Fundación Red (Mendoza), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Notro, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style2: Red Blend - Mendoza Province, Style3: Red Blend - Argentina Country: South Africa, Description: Herbal notes mingle with aromas of kirsch, violet, tobacco and tanned hide. Sweet spice and pepper unfold on the palate, integrating seamlessly with the black fruit flavors. The structure is firm but not too tough or unapproachable now, with medium acidity and a long, lingering finish., Designation: Philosophers' Stone, Points: 90.0, Price: 24.0, Province: Stellenbosch, Title: Camberley 2008 Philosophers' Stone Red (Stellenbosch), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Camberley, Region: Stellenbosch, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Stellenbosch, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - South Africa"

column1: What would be a good wine for a summer afternoon?,"
column3: Description

column2: Santa Margherita NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore)
column3: Tight expression of Prosecco with easy aromas of peach and citrus and a playful touch of sweetness.

column2: Bianca Vigna NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene)
column3: Frothy cream sets the stage for fragrant aromas of peach, citrus, white flower and mineral.

column2: Terredora 2009 Loggia della Serra  (Greco di Tufo)
column3: Luminous Greco offers aromas of pear and peach with a crisp, lemony finish.
Fresh and crisp with ripe apple and citrus fruits.

column2: Wolff 2014 White Wolff White (San Luis Obispo County)
column3: Chamomile, poached Asian pear, white peach and light honey aromas.
column9: ,Country: Italy, Description: Santa Margherita of Pinot Grigio fame brings us this tight expression of Prosecco with easy aromas of peach and citrus and a playful touch of sweetness on the close. This is a perfect wine to drink with friends on a lazy summer afternoon., Designation: Brut, Points: 87.0, Price: 19.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Santa Margherita NV Brut  (Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore), Variety: Glera, Winery: Santa Margherita, Region: Conegliano Valdobbiadene Prosecco Superiore, Style1: Glera - Veneto, Style2: Glera - Veneto, Style3: Glera - Italy Country: Italy, Description: Frothy cream sets the stage and acts as a nice backdrop to fragrant aromas of peach, citrus, white flower and mineral. This is a clean and fresh bubbly to drink on hot summer afternoons. It has an easy, no-fuss mouthfeel but ends with a much-needed blast of citrus zest., Designation: Extra Dry, Points: 87.0, Price: 24.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Bianca Vigna NV Extra Dry  (Prosecco di Valdobbiadene), Variety: Prosecco, Winery: Bianca Vigna, Region: Prosecco di Valdobbiadene, Style1: Prosecco - Veneto, Style2: Prosecco - Veneto, Style3: Prosecco - Italy Country: Italy, Description: If you're itching to spend an afternoon sipping a cool Italian white by the pool or on your back porch with friends, here is your wine. Southern Italy's answer to quality Pinot Grigio, this luminous Greco offers aromas of pear and peach with a crisp, lemony finish., Designation: Loggia della Serra, Points: 87.0, Price: unknown, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Terredora 2009 Loggia della Serra  (Greco di Tufo), Variety: Greco, Winery: Terredora, Region: Greco di Tufo, Style1: Greco - Southern Italy, Style2: Greco - Southern Italy, Style3: Greco - Italy Country: Portugal, Description: Pato Frio—cold duck—suggests this a summer picnic wine. It certainly has the freshness and crisp elegance. But it also some weight, ripe apple and citrus fruits and a texture that suggests it could age a few months longer., Designation: Pato Frio, Points: 87.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Alentejo, Title: Ribafreixo 2012 Pato Frio Antão Vaz (Alentejo), Variety: Antão Vaz, Winery: Ribafreixo, Region: Alentejo, Style1: Antão Vaz - Alentejo, Style2: Antão Vaz - Alentejo, Style3: Antão Vaz - Portugal Country: US, Description: This blend of 42% Viognier, 42% Roussanne, 8% Sémillon and 8% Riesling from Edna Valley and Paso Robles would be great to sip on the porch during a sunny afternoon. Chamomile, poached Asian pear, white peach and light honey aromas show on the nose. The palate tightens up a bit, with hints of honey, pear and baked apple set against a pithy structure., Designation: White Wolff, Points: 90.0, Price: 22.0, Province: California, Title: Wolff 2014 White Wolff White (San Luis Obispo County), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Wolff, Region: San Luis Obispo, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - San Luis Obispo, Style3: White Blend - San Luis Obispo Country: US, Description: Bone dry, wonderfully fresh and loaded with strawberry and watermelon flavors, hepped up with lightly peppery spice. In short, a perfect summer sipper, chilled and drunk with picnic foods, preferably outdoors., Designation: Chukar Ridge Vineyard Sangiovese, Points: 86.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Viento 2009 Chukar Ridge Vineyard Sangiovese Rosé (Columbia Valley (OR)), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Viento, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Rosé - Oregon, Style2: Rosé - Oregon Other, Style3: Rosé - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: Bright and tart, almost sour. This is the style of rosé you want on a hot summer day. Chill it well down and drink it like a stainless-fermented white wine. The alcohol is barely over 12%––it won't hurt!, Designation: Sangiovese, Points: 85.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Washington, Title: Waterbrook 2010 Sangiovese Rosé (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Waterbrook, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Rosé - Washington, Style2: Rosé - Washington, Style3: Rosé - Washington Country: US, Description: Zippy flavors of melon and new-mowed grass, nicely integrated and loaded with the sort of spicy herbs that might have come fresh from the garden. Note the relatively low alcohol, making this a perfect summer sipping wine., Designation: Oriana, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Washington, Title: Brian Carter Cellars 2009 Oriana White (Yakima Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Brian Carter Cellars, Region: Yakima Valley, Style1: White Blend - Washington, Style2: White Blend - Washington, Style3: White Blend - Washington Country: Portugal, Description: A deliciously fresh and soft young wine, it is just off dry: really more light and crisp. Lemon and tight citrus flavors are lifted by a prickle on the tongue. This is a perfect summer drink., Designation: Blue, Points: 85.0, Price: 13.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: Quintas de Melgaço 2015 Blue White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Quintas de Melgaço, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: A full, ripe vanilla- and strawberry-flavored wine that hits the spot for the summer, with an emphasis on dryness, but with a soft, fruity, food-friendly aftertaste., Designation: Conde de Vimioso Vinho Rosé, Points: 84.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Ribatejano, Title: Falua 2007 Conde de Vimioso Vinho Rosé Red (Ribatejano), Variety: Portuguese Red, Winery: Falua, Region: Ribatejano, Style1: Portuguese Red - Ribatejano, Style2: Portuguese Red - Ribatejano, Style3: Portuguese Red - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: The perfect summer apéritif, this light, fresh, crisp wine tastes just drier than previous vintages, allowing the apple and lemon fruits to shine even more. It has a tight, taut aftertaste, leaving the mouth clean and refreshed. Screwcap., Designation: Twin Vines, Points: 85.0, Price: 9.0, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: José Maria da Fonseca 2008 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: José Maria da Fonseca, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: France, Description: The strains of a certain song about summer wine just seem to pop up as you smell this fruity fizz. This is a generously fruited, berry-tastic wine whose flavors are accentuated by a generous dosage and freely foaming effervescence. This embodies the ease and joy of summer. Drink soon and enjoy., Designation: Brut Rosé, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Charles Sparr NV Brut Rosé Pinot Noir (Alsace), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Charles Sparr, Region: Alsace, Style1: Pinot Noir - Alsace, Style2: Pinot Noir - Alsace, Style3: Pinot Noir - France Country: US, Description: This tropical mélange of fruit and blossoms lives up to its equally ebullient packaging. While deft in body, it bounds from the glass with floral perfume and juicy watermelon and cherry flavors. It's zesty and bold yet spry and fresh—an aptly named accompaniment to summer., Designation: Summer in a Bottle, Points: 90.0, Price: 24.0, Province: New York, Title: Wölffer 2016 Summer in a Bottle Rosé (Long Island), Variety: Rosé, Winery: Wölffer, Region: Long Island, Style1: Rosé - New York, Style2: Rosé - New York, Style3: Rosé - New York Country: Portugal, Description: This is a fine, simple wine for this summer. With acidity, fresh apple and pear flavors, it's attractive and aromatic., Designation: Dona Helena Colheita, Points: 85.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Península de Setúbal, Title: Wines & Winemakers 2013 Dona Helena Colheita White (Península de Setúbal), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: Wines & Winemakers, Region: Península de Setúbal, Style1: Portuguese White - Península de Setúbal, Style2: Portuguese White - Península de Setúbal, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal Country: Portugal, Description: With a distinct pop of gas as it is opened, this light, fruity and lightly sweet wine is a classic summer refresher. Citrus and green apple fruits abound. Screwcap., Designation: Twin Vines, Points: 86.0, Price: unknown, Province: Vinho Verde, Title: José Maria da Fonseca 2011 Twin Vines White (Vinho Verde), Variety: Portuguese White, Winery: José Maria da Fonseca, Region: Vinho Verde, Style1: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style2: Portuguese White - Vinho Verde, Style3: Portuguese White - Portugal"

column1: What's a good medium-bodied red wine with earthy undertones?,"
column3: Description

column2: Uptick Vineyards 2011 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
column3: Medium-bodied wine with subtle and savory herb notes, light fruit characteristics and bold spice elements.

column2: LangeTwins 2014 Red Tail Vineyard Nero d'Avola (Lodi)
column3: Medium-bodied wine with attractive earth and sage aromas and cherry flavors with mineral and leather accents.

column2: Famille Perrin 2014 L'Oustalet Red (Vin de France)
column3: Medium-bodied blend with earthy notes of bay leaf and black olive on the palate.
Medium-bodied wine with savory and leathery smell, and tastes like raspberries and blackberries.

column2: Rimauresq 2006 Cru Classé Red (Côtes de Provence)
column3: Medium-weight blend with earthy raspberry and cherry fruit flavors.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Unctuous and earthy, this medium-bodied wine is more about subtle and savory herb notes than deep fruit. With its light fruit characteristics and bold spice elements, it will make a versatile choice for the table., Designation: Estate, Points: 86.0, Price: 49.0, Province: California, Title: Uptick Vineyards 2011 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Uptick Vineyards, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: Beautifully smooth, this medium-bodied and easy-drinking wine seems to melt in the mouth. Black cherry, blueberry and light smoky aromas segue to more cherry and chocolate flavors on the palate, where the texture is soft and appealing. It's a harmonious blend of Zinfandel, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah., Designation: Cracked Earth, Points: 88.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: Montevina 2014 Cracked Earth Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Montevina, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: This medium-bodied wine is worth exploring. It's made from a grape variety popular in Italy and has attractive earth and sage aromas and cherry flavors liberally sprinkled with mineral and leather accents. A light coating of tannins boosts the mouthfeel., Designation: Red Tail Vineyard, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: California, Title: LangeTwins 2014 Red Tail Vineyard Nero d'Avola (Lodi), Variety: Nero d'Avola, Winery: LangeTwins, Region: Lodi, Style1: Nero d'Avola - California, Style2: Nero d'Avola - Lodi, Style3: Nero d'Avola - Lodi Country: France, Description: Made from certified organic grapes, this is a medium-bodied blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Merlot. Bay leaf and black olive aromas add earthy notes on the palate, giving this ripe, chocolaty wine an anchor in the south of France. Drink now., Designation: L'Oustalet, Points: 87.0, Price: 10.0, Province: France Other, Title: Famille Perrin 2014 L'Oustalet Red (Vin de France), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Famille Perrin, Region: Vin de France, Style1: Red Blend - France Other, Style2: Red Blend - France Other, Style3: Red Blend - France Country: US, Description: A hint of earthiness accents this medium-bodied, moderately tannic and berry-flavored wine. It smells savory and leathery, and tastes like raspberries and blackberries., Designation: Conjugation, Points: 87.0, Price: 39.0, Province: California, Title: Fenestra 2010 Conjugation Red (Livermore Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Fenestra, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Livermore Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Livermore Valley Country: France, Description: Raspberry and earth tones open this medium-weight Provence blend. There's cherry fruit and a moderate level of complexity on the palate but also a slightly funky note in the background. Tannins are forceful but polite; try with pork roast., Designation: Cru Classé, Points: 86.0, Price: 23.0, Province: Provence, Title: Rimauresq 2006 Cru Classé Red (Côtes de Provence), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Rimauresq, Region: Côtes de Provence, Style1: Red Blend - Provence, Style2: Red Blend - Provence, Style3: Red Blend - France Country: US, Description: This creamy and delicious blend of 80% Petite Sirah, 10% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre truly outperforms all its parts. It offers high tones of red fruit, earthy licorice and tamed tobacco. Medium in body with well-behaved tannins, it has a dusty finish that's very appealing., Designation: 47.5 Degree, Points: 89.0, Price: 35.0, Province: California, Title: Borra 2011 47.5 Degree Red (Lodi), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Borra, Region: Lodi, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Lodi, Style3: Red Blend - Lodi Country: US, Description: Gritty and dry, this rustic blend of Zin, Syrah and Cabernet has earthy flavors of cherries and spices. It's a fine everyday red to drink with everything from pasta or cold cuts to pizza and burgers., Designation: Presents Rosso, Points: 84.0, Price: 10.0, Province: California, Title: Francis Ford Coppola 2007 Presents Rosso Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Francis Ford Coppola, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: Need a recommendation for a good house wine? This medium-bodied red has moderate fruit flavors, good structure from acidity and tannins, and a nice feeling of completeness. It is a catch-all blend of Zinfandel, Pinot Noir and four other grape varieties., Designation: Navarrouge, Points: 86.0, Price: 16.0, Province: California, Title: Navarro 2013 Navarrouge Red (Mendocino), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Navarro, Region: Mendocino, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Mendocino, Style3: Red Blend - Mendocino Country: Spain, Description: Earthy, raisiny aromas fold in Priorat's patented schist on a ripe bouquet. This is jammy and a bit overdone with respect to mouthfeel. Earthy, dense flavors of raisin, cassis and licorice finish more weighty than bright. Drink now., Designation: Món Clàssic, Points: 89.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Francesc Sanchez Bas 2010 Món Clàssic Red (Priorat), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Francesc Sanchez Bas, Region: Priorat, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Chile, Description: Earthy red-fruit aromas come with hints of olive, herbs and spice. The mouthfeel on this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cab Franc and Carmenère is racy and layered. Flavors of herbal berry and spice finish long. Drink through 2018., Designation: Millantu, Points: 90.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Maipo Valley, Title: Santa Alicia 2012 Millantu Red (Maipo Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Santa Alicia, Region: Maipo Valley, Style1: Red Blend - Maipo Valley, Style2: Red Blend - Maipo Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Chile Country: Argentina, Description: Earthy and meaty, with aromas of dark cherry, plum and a whiff of volatility. Once things settle, it evolves into a full and flowing, semigeneric red with earnest grape and blackberry flavors along with cola. While it's hard to peg this as varietal Syrah, it's well made, balanced and full. Good for folks who like full-bodied wines., Designation: Alberto Furque, Points: 88.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Bodega Aconquija 2005 Alberto Furque Syrah (Uco Valley), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Bodega Aconquija, Region: Uco Valley, Style1: Syrah - Mendoza Province, Style2: Syrah - Mendoza Province, Style3: Syrah - Argentina Country: Chile, Description: The briary red-berry and plum aromas are earthy and rubbery. This is medium in body and a bit heavy, with just-adequate acidity and solid flavors of plum, berry and resiny oak. The finish is oaky and medicinal tasting., Designation: Reserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 15.0, Province: Curicó Valley, Title: Cuevas del Sur 2010 Reserve Merlot (Curicó Valley), Variety: Merlot, Winery: Cuevas del Sur, Region: Curicó Valley, Style1: Merlot - Curicó Valley, Style2: Merlot - Curicó Valley, Style3: Merlot - Chile Country: US, Description: A rich, earthy blend of half Barbera, half Zinfandel that tastes light at first, earthy with raspberry and cherry tones. On the finish, it gets darker, its spicy, dark fruit tones memorably bound in a wall of leather and tobacco., Designation: Il Segreto Red Wine, Points: 88.0, Price: 24.0, Province: California, Title: Rodrigue Molyneaux 2009 Il Segreto Red Wine Red (Livermore Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Rodrigue Molyneaux, Region: Livermore Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Livermore Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Livermore Valley Country: US, Description: Super earthy, this wine shows pomegranate, rhubarb and a touch of smoke, the aromas perfumed in rose petal. Medium bodied, it's balanced and elegant, with a streak of natural, lifted acidity., Designation: Charisma, Points: 91.0, Price: 60.0, Province: California, Title: Levendi 2014 Charisma Pinot Noir (Napa Valley), Variety: Pinot Noir, Winery: Levendi, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Pinot Noir - California, Style2: Pinot Noir - Napa Valley, Style3: Pinot Noir - Napa Valley"

column1: Can you suggest a white wine that's light-bodied and has a subtle floral aroma?,"
column3: Description
A lovely and light aroma of faint honeysuckle with pear and wet earth notes.
Light and floral, with fresh apricot and honey on the palate.
A light-bodied casual wine with subdued aromas of white flower and orchard fruit.

column2: Bodkin NV Cuvée Agincourt Blanc de Blanc Brut Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
column3: Floral and spicy aromas with a fine-beaded texture.
Light and flowery, with apple aromas.
column9: ,Country: France, Description: A lovely and light aroma of faint honeysuckle rises enticingly from the glass. The spiciness and florality of that same blossom also appear on the palate where they are joined by pear and wet earth notes. This is light and just a little fruity but with ample freshness—an easy but subtle and refreshing classic Alsace blend., Designation: Gentil Réserve, Points: 89.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Alsace, Title: Willm 2015 Gentil Réserve White (Alsace), Variety: Alsace white blend, Winery: Willm, Region: Alsace, Style1: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style2: Alsace white blend - Alsace, Style3: Alsace white blend - France Country: US, Description: Light and floral, this subtle dessert wine is made from Scheurebe grapes, more often found in Austria than California. It provides this wine with fresh apricot and honey on the palate, lingering yet low enough in alcohol and power to be enjoyed as either apéritif or digestif, its sweetness greatly restrained., Designation: Eisrébe, Points: 94.0, Price: 50.0, Province: California, Title: Joseph Phelps 2013 Eisrébe White (Napa Valley), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Joseph Phelps, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: White Blend - Napa Valley Country: Italy, Description: Here's a light-bodied casual wine that has subdued aromas suggesting white flower, orchard fruit and a hint of almond. You can find traces of the nose on the extremely simple diluted palate., Designation: Singan, Points: 84.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Veneto, Title: Adalia 2015 Singan  (Soave), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Adalia, Region: Soave, Style1: White Blend - Veneto, Style2: White Blend - Veneto, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Floral and spicy aromas like lychee and rose petal give an exotic twist to this unusual light-bodied wine made from Sauvignon Blanc. It tastes quite dry, with a fine-beaded texture as well as ample acidity to buoy the wine's fruity and floral characteristics., Designation: Cuvée Agincourt Blanc de Blanc Brut, Points: 89.0, Price: 23.0, Province: California, Title: Bodkin NV Cuvée Agincourt Blanc de Blanc Brut Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Bodkin, Region: Lake, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - California, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Lake, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Lake Country: Spain, Description: Light and flowery, with apple aromas. The body and palate are lean and a little stripped, but the apple flavors are clean and quaffable. This is like a waif model, or maybe a scarecrow. It is good on the surface but has very little meat on the bones., Designation: Viura-Chardonnay, Points: 84.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: No Time 2007 Viura-Chardonnay White (Navarra), Variety: White Blend, Winery: No Time, Region: Navarra, Style1: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: White Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: White Blend - Spain Country: Italy, Description: You'll love the delicate floral fragrances of this feminine, cool-climate northern Italian white. Acacia, jasmine and honeysuckle play a leading role with a supporting cast of stone fruit and pear. In the mouth, it's not particularly intense or thick., Designation: Toretta Classico, Points: 86.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Girlan 2006 Toretta Classico White (Alto Adige), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Girlan, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style2: White Blend - Northeastern Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Woody in aroma, this is an exceptionally light-bodied, floral and herbal white, marked most by its high-pitched acidity that threatens to veer into extreme territory. Instead, beeswax and white peach figure into the mix, finishing in a refreshing twist of lemon., Designation: Kobler Family Vineyards, Points: 89.0, Price: 36.0, Province: California, Title: Kobler 2014 Kobler Family Vineyards Viognier (Russian River Valley), Variety: Viognier, Winery: Kobler, Region: Russian River Valley, Style1: Viognier - California, Style2: Viognier - Russian River Valley, Style3: Viognier - Russian River Valley Country: US, Description: This wine is light in body, fruity and floral in flavor and smooth on the palate. Blended from seven varietals, it has peach and jasmine aromas, very generous fruit flavors that flirt with sweetness and a lush mouthfeel., Designation: Crisp White Winemaker's Blend, Points: 86.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: Seven Daughters 2015 Crisp White Winemaker's Blend White (California), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Seven Daughters, Region: California, Style1: White Blend - California, Style2: White Blend - California, Style3: White Blend - California Country: Italy, Description: Aromas recall white flower and stone fruit. The simple, light-bodied palate offers green apple and a light citrus note., Designation: Il Bianco di Ciccio, Points: 85.0, Price: 16.0, Province: Central Italy, Title: Cantina Zaccagnini 2014 Il Bianco di Ciccio Trebbiano (Abruzzo), Variety: Trebbiano, Winery: Cantina Zaccagnini, Region: Abruzzo, Style1: Trebbiano - Central Italy, Style2: Trebbiano - Central Italy, Style3: Trebbiano - Italy Country: Spain, Description: Very pale in color, this widely available Spanish white opens with a melon-lime and slightly floral bouquet. Citrus accents appear on the light- to medium-weight palate, but the floral note turns faintly candied, too. Finishes a bit short, with a little bite. Drink now. —M.M., Designation: Viña Sol, Points: 83.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Torres 2000 Viña Sol Paralleda (Penedès), Variety: Paralleda, Winery: Torres, Region: Penedès, Style1: Paralleda - Catalonia, Style2: Paralleda - Catalonia, Style3: Paralleda - Spain Country: Italy, Description: Fragrant and floral, this white blend of Trebbiano, Pecorino and Passerina from the Marche offers stone fruit, green melon and honeysuckle. The wine has a clean and refreshing quality that promises an easy pairing with spicy Asian foods., Designation: Villa Aurato Prandone, Points: 86.0, Price: unknown, Province: Central Italy, Title: Il Conte 2007 Villa Aurato Prandone White (Falerio dei Colli Ascolani), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Il Conte, Region: Falerio dei Colli Ascolani, Style1: White Blend - Central Italy, Style2: White Blend - Central Italy, Style3: White Blend - Italy Country: US, Description: Light in color, this affordable white is floral on the nose, with just a touch of reduction and heady smoky oak. Simply executed, it offers generous flavors of apple, pear and peach., Designation: Estate Grown, Points: 84.0, Price: 13.0, Province: California, Title: Cline 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Cline, Region: Sonoma Coast, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Sonoma Coast, Style3: Chardonnay - Sonoma Coast Country: US, Description: Exuberant rose, lychee and orange blossom perfume abounds on the nose of this light-bodied white blend. Just a shade off dry on the palate, its sun-kissed peach and citrus flavors are plush and concentrated. Zesty acidity and a crush of minerals revitalize the finish., Designation: Summer in a Bottle, Points: 89.0, Price: 24.0, Province: New York, Title: Wölffer 2016 Summer in a Bottle White (Long Island), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Wölffer, Region: Long Island, Style1: White Blend - New York, Style2: White Blend - New York, Style3: White Blend - New York Country: Italy, Description: Pretty golden hues set the tone and segue into floral aromas of acacia and honey. There are some soapy, Moscato-like qualities to this aromatic white and its floral fragrances transfer to the mouth where there's a smooth, creamy texture., Designation: Aimé, Points: 87.0, Price: 22.0, Province: Northeastern Italy, Title: Girlan 2006 Aimé Gewürztraminer (Alto Adige), Variety: Gewürztraminer, Winery: Girlan, Region: Alto Adige, Style1: Gewürztraminer - Northeastern Italy, Style2: Gewürztraminer - Northeastern Italy, Style3: Gewürztraminer - Italy Country: Israel, Description: This is a superb value white that's versatile and perfect for company. Fresh white florals, Asian pear and a touch of pineapple acidity dominate, with softly prickling acidity dancing on your tongue through the close. Light weight but mouthwatering and easy to drink., Designation: Yasmin Kosher White, Points: 86.0, Price: 11.0, Province: Shomron, Title: Recanati 2009 Yasmin Kosher White White (Shomron), Variety: White Blend, Winery: Recanati, Region: Shomron, Style1: White Blend - Shomron, Style2: White Blend - Shomron, Style3: White Blend - Israel"

column1: Looking for a wine that is limited edition.,"
column3: Description

column2: Sweet Cheeks 2014 Limited Edition Winemaker Series Syrah (Applegate Valley)
column3: Dense raspberry and black cherry with streaks of dark chocolate and espresso.
Concentrated and lengthy, nuanced in black cherry, leather saddle and crushed rock.

column2: Príncipe de Viana 2013 Edición Limitada Red (Navarra)
column3: Aromas of cherry, plum, forest floor and tobacco with lightly spiced currant and red-plum flavors.

column2: Canoe Ridge 2014 Limited Edition The Benches Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills)
column3: Aromas of spice, macerated cherry, vanilla and blackberry with jammy, sweet-seeming fruit flavors.

column2: Season 2014 Limited Edition Series Grenache (Southern Oregon)
column3: Aromatic fruity wine with a tart mix of plums and cherries.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: An excellent effort, this deserves its “limited” designation, and not just because it's a three-barrel selection. Dense raspberry and black cherry anchor a substantial wine with plenty of well-ripened tannins. Spending 22 months in one-quarter new French oak adds streaks of dark chocolate and espresso. The acid-tannin balance is spot-on., Designation: Limited Edition Winemaker Series, Points: 90.0, Price: 63.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Sweet Cheeks 2014 Limited Edition Winemaker Series Syrah (Applegate Valley), Variety: Syrah, Winery: Sweet Cheeks, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Syrah - Oregon, Style2: Syrah - Oregon Other, Style3: Syrah - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: Robert Mondavi winemaker Genevieve Janssens makes this wine, a small-production solo project that's worth seeking. The 83% Cabernet Sauvignon is sourced from Hendry Ranch and the 17% Cabernet Franc from Detert East Vineyard, a stone's throw from To Kalon. Impressively concentrated and lengthy, within a wealth of power, it is nuanced in black cherry, leather saddle and crushed rock, with the scent of violet never far behind., Designation: Limited Edition, Points: 96.0, Price: 155.0, Province: California, Title: Portfolio 2013 Limited Edition Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Portfolio, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: Spain, Description: Aromas of cherry, plum, forest floor and tobacco feed into a clampy palate with fresh acidity. Lightly spiced currant and red-plum flavors are limited in scope but nice, while this tastes herbal and feels tight and racy on the finish., Designation: Edición Limitada, Points: 90.0, Price: 25.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Príncipe de Viana 2013 Edición Limitada Red (Navarra), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Príncipe de Viana, Region: Navarra, Style1: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style2: Red Blend - Northern Spain, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: Aromas of spice, macerated cherry, vanilla and blackberry lead to jammy, sweet-seeming fruit flavors. It provides easy-drinking appeal, with grainy tannins backing it all up., Designation: Limited Edition The Benches Vineyard, Points: 87.0, Price: 42.0, Province: Washington, Title: Canoe Ridge 2014 Limited Edition The Benches Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Horse Heaven Hills), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Canoe Ridge, Region: Horse Heaven Hills, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Washington Country: US, Description: A rich plummy shade carries you into an aromatic fruity wine with a tart mix of plums and cherries. It's just this side of candied, and there's an intriguing suggestion of peppermint. All in all it's quite tasty, clean and ready for immediate enjoyment., Designation: Limited Edition Series, Points: 89.0, Price: 38.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Season 2014 Limited Edition Series Grenache (Southern Oregon), Variety: Grenache, Winery: Season, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Grenache - Oregon, Style2: Grenache - Oregon Other, Style3: Grenache - Oregon Other Country: Spain, Description: Coarse on the nose, this has scratchy aromas of unripe red fruit, green herb and grass. It feels forward but choppy, with zesty acidity pushing its familiar flavors of red fruit and herb. A bit stalky and leathery on the finish, it ends with a vanilla streak., Designation: Limited Edition, Points: 86.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Northern Spain, Title: Ramón Bilbao 2009 Limited Edition  (Rioja), Variety: Tempranillo, Winery: Ramón Bilbao, Region: Rioja, Style1: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style2: Tempranillo - Northern Spain, Style3: Tempranillo - Spain Country: Argentina, Description: Slightly herbal plum and berry aromas come with a pinch of spice and meatiness. Feels medium-bodied and crisp, with juicy red-fruit flavors of plum, tomato and raspberry. Dries out on the finish, where it becomes more herbal and roasted., Designation: Limited Edition Reserve, Points: 85.0, Price: 10.0, Province: Mendoza Province, Title: Espuela del Gaucho 2010 Limited Edition Reserve Malbec (Mendoza), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Espuela del Gaucho, Region: Mendoza, Style1: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style2: Malbec - Mendoza Province, Style3: Malbec - Argentina Country: US, Description: If the staunchly herbal and green-bean scents and flavors often found with this grape are your cup of tea, this will prove enjoyable. It's smooth and not overly tannic, with those intense green-bean aromatics and a taste of tomato., Designation: Limited Edition Series, Points: 85.0, Price: 38.0, Province: Oregon, Title: Season 2013 Limited Edition Series Carmenère (Southern Oregon), Variety: Carmenère, Winery: Season, Region: Oregon Other, Style1: Carmenère - Oregon, Style2: Carmenère - Oregon Other, Style3: Carmenère - Oregon Other Country: US, Description: A youthful wine still pushing out its elbows, this displays fullness and concentration at its core, an intensity of oaked spice that provides warmth on the palate. Pear, lime and lemongrass dot the landscape of complex flavor., Designation: Limited Edition, Points: 90.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Once and It's Gone 2015 Limited Edition Chardonnay (Dry Creek Valley), Variety: Chardonnay, Winery: Once and It's Gone, Region: Dry Creek Valley, Style1: Chardonnay - California, Style2: Chardonnay - Dry Creek Valley, Style3: Chardonnay - Dry Creek Valley Country: Chile, Description: The nose on this wine is fresh but nothing unusual or exciting. In the mouth, it's racy, with acidity and flavors of green veggies, citrus fruits and pith. Things turn more pithy and mildly bitter on the finish, where tarragon and rosemary accents take over., Designation: Limited Edition, Points: 87.0, Price: 17.0, Province: Casablanca Valley, Title: Rios de Chile 2011 Limited Edition Sauvignon Blanc (Casablanca Valley), Variety: Sauvignon Blanc, Winery: Rios de Chile, Region: Casablanca Valley, Style1: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style2: Sauvignon Blanc - Casablanca Valley, Style3: Sauvignon Blanc - Chile Country: US, Description: This has good, clean, ripe fruit with some mass and muscle, and the flavors go deep rather than broad. Berry, currant and cherry are in the mix, with polished tannins and finishing threads of coffee and chocolate. Nothing shy here, but delicious., Designation: Limited Edition Red Wine, Points: 90.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Washington, Title: Page Cellars 2004 Limited Edition Red Wine Red (Red Mountain), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Page Cellars, Region: Red Mountain, Style1: Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Red Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: This is a tiny-production blend of 82% Cabernet Sauvignon and 18% Cabernet Franc, the latter sourced from Detert East Vineyard along the Oakville bench, the former from Hendry Ranch in western Napa. Made by Genevieve Janssens, it has an old-world soul with plenty of California complexity, balanced in woody notes of coconut flake and black cherry, the tannins are fine-grained and integrated. A simply gorgeous wine., Designation: Limited Edition, Points: 95.0, Price: 140.0, Province: California, Title: Portfolio 2011 Limited Edition Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Portfolio, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Red Blend - Napa Valley Country: US, Description: This has aromas of yellow peach and butter. Straightforward flavors faintly resemble peach, with more of the buttery richness that seems unusual for this variety. It's a good, basic, full-bodied white wine., Designation: Limited Edition, Points: 84.0, Price: 18.0, Province: California, Title: Chacewater 2013 Limited Edition Riesling (Lake County), Variety: Riesling, Winery: Chacewater, Region: Lake, Style1: Riesling - California, Style2: Riesling - Lake, Style3: Riesling - Lake Country: US, Description: Tart in acidity and tight in tannins, this is a hard, dry Cabernet. It has black currant and dark chocolate flavors, accented with new oak. Not likely to improve, so drink up., Designation: Premium Limited Edition, Points: 85.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: Publix 2008 Premium Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District), Variety: Cabernet Sauvignon, Winery: Publix, Region: Spring Mountain District, Style1: Cabernet Sauvignon - California, Style2: Cabernet Sauvignon - Spring Mountain District, Style3: Cabernet Sauvignon - Spring Mountain District Country: US, Description: This is the personal project of Robert Mondavi's longtime winemaker, Genevieve Janssens, and her husband, Luc. Production is only 250 cases. The blend is of the two Cabs, Sauvignon and Franc. The quality of the tannins is perfect, and so is the effortless way the wine has absorbed 100% new French oak without the wood sticking out. My only criticism, and it's a big one, is excessive ripeness that makes it Port-like. The alcohol is 15.5%., Designation: Limited Edition, Points: 87.0, Price: 125.0, Province: California, Title: Portfolio 2005 Limited Edition Red (Napa Valley), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Portfolio, Region: Napa Valley, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - California, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Napa Valley"

column1: Can you suggest a red wine that's bold but not overly tannic?,"
column3: Description

column2: Fetzer NV Anthony's Hill Dark Bold Red (California)
column3: A well-balanced, medium-bodied wine with notes of raspberries, rhubarb, and red cherries.
A full-bodied, grown-up wine with dark-red color, black-cherry and wild-berry aromas, and ample fruit flavors.

column2: Château de Lisennes 2011 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur)
column3: A bold, fruity wine with red berries and ripe cherry flavors, soft tannins and great acidity.

column2: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island)
column3: A bold but elegantly structured red wine with hints of spice and leather, red cherry and plum flavors.
A big, bold and fruity wine with deliciously ripe black fruits and a smooth, just tannic texture.
column9: ,Country: US, Description: Not quite as bold as its name suggests, this wine is well-balanced and fun to sip. Fruity and medium-bodied, it smells like raspberries and rhubarb, tastes like red cherries and feels nicely full on the palate, bolstered by a hearty dose of fine tannins., Designation: Anthony's Hill Dark Bold, Points: 86.0, Price: 12.0, Province: California, Title: Fetzer NV Anthony's Hill Dark Bold Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Fetzer, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: US, Description: Bold, well structured and nicely dry, this wine has plenty of dark-red color, appetizing black-cherry and wild-berry aromas, and ample but not overripe fruit flavors. A full-bodied, grown-up kind of wine, it doesn't overdo anything and will be great at the dinner table., Designation: Proprietary, Points: 90.0, Price: 25.0, Province: California, Title: SOLID 2012 Proprietary Red (California), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: SOLID, Region: California, Style1: Red Blend - California, Style2: Red Blend - California, Style3: Red Blend - California Country: France, Description: This bold, fruity wine is all red berries and ripe cherry flavors. It has good juiciness, soft tannins and it will be ready to drink soon. A bright wine, with great acidity at the end., Designation: Cuvée Tradition, Points: 88.0, Price: 14.0, Province: Bordeaux, Title: Château de Lisennes 2011 Cuvée Tradition  (Bordeaux Supérieur), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Château de Lisennes, Region: Bordeaux Supérieur, Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Bordeaux, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - France Country: US, Description: Hints of spice and leather add a savory tone to red cherry and plum flavors in this bold but elegantly structured red wine. The palate is juicy with fruit, but accented with a spray of green herbs and brisk acidity that lend freshness., Designation: Jubilant Reserve, Points: 88.0, Price: 45.0, Province: New York, Title: Jamesport 2007 Jubilant Reserve Red (North Fork of Long Island), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Jamesport, Region: North Fork of Long Island, Style1: Red Blend - New York, Style2: Red Blend - New York, Style3: Red Blend - New York Country: France, Description: Big, bold and fruity wine, boasting deliciously ripe black fruits and a smooth, just tannic texture. All fruit, this is the perfect barbecue wine: rich, open and generous. Drink now and until 2016., Designation: Gouleyant, Points: 85.0, Price: 12.0, Province: Southwest France, Title: Georges Vigouroux 2012 Gouleyant Malbec (Cahors), Variety: Malbec, Winery: Georges Vigouroux, Region: Cahors, Style1: Malbec - Southwest France, Style2: Malbec - Southwest France, Style3: Malbec - France Country: Spain, Description: Raisiny, inky aromas are ripe but not overly sophisticated. On the palate, grabby tannins are drawing and heavy. Flavors of raisin and prune carry over from the nose, while the finish is chewy, jammy, raisiny and offers a licorice/anise note., Designation: Junior, Points: 88.0, Price: 20.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Tossals 2012 Junior Red (Montsant), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tossals, Region: Montsant, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: Italy, Description: You can't go wrong with a beautifully bold and structured red wine like this. Meant for cold winter nights and hearty meat dishes, this elegant Taurasi opens with luscious dark fruit, prune, spice and tobacco notes. The wine's texture is fine and silky, with polished, dusty tannins., Designation: Riserva, Points: 91.0, Price: 55.0, Province: Southern Italy, Title: Di Meo 2004 Riserva  (Taurasi), Variety: Aglianico, Winery: Di Meo, Region: Taurasi, Style1: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style2: Aglianico - Southern Italy, Style3: Aglianico - Italy Country: US, Description: This wine is mostly Cabernet Sauvignon (83%), with the balance smidgens of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Merlot. The aromas bring notes of barrel spice, vanilla, herb, cherry and red and black fruit. The flavors are full and bold, with burly but not unyielding tannins giving support. Put it up against a juicy steak or give it some time in the cellar., Designation: Legit, Points: 91.0, Price: 30.0, Province: Washington, Title: Two Vintners 2014 Legit Red (Columbia Valley (WA)), Variety: Bordeaux-style Red Blend, Winery: Two Vintners, Region: Columbia Valley (WA), Style1: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington, Style2: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington, Style3: Bordeaux-style Red Blend - Washington Country: US, Description: As the name suggests, this blend of Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon does taste big and bold, but it also tastes hot and lopsided. It has a Port-like consistency, with notes of charred sesame seed, chocolate and dark cherry that lack precision., Designation: Whitie's D9 A Big Bold, Points: 83.0, Price: 50.0, Province: Virginia, Title: Tarara 2010 Whitie's D9 A Big Bold Red (Virginia), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Tarara, Region: Virginia, Style1: Red Blend - Virginia, Style2: Red Blend - Virginia, Style3: Red Blend - Virginia Country: Spain, Description: Bold cherry, cassis and plum aromas are forward, lively and a touch aggressive. In the mouth, this shows lots of life and generous fruit supported by clamp-down tannins. Earthy, loamy flavors of plum and berry finish warm, earthy and long. Overall, this is more steady, balanced and solid than flashy. Drink through 2017., Designation: Les Terrasses, Points: 90.0, Price: 40.0, Province: Catalonia, Title: Alvaro Palacios 2012 Les Terrasses Red (Priorat), Variety: Red Blend, Winery: Alvaro Palacios, Region: Priorat, Style1: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style2: Red Blend - Catalonia, Style3: Red Blend - Spain Country: US, Description: From a tiny winery in Lake County, over Mount St. Helena from Napa Valley, comes this mouthfilling, bold and fruit-packed red blend. It tastes rich and ripe, with deep plum and boysenberry and light herbal flavors. Medium to full-bodied and smooth-textured, it is structured with enough tannin for good balance.
